050857.description: Ubiquitous in Medieval kitchens, the almond-based beverage served as a trusty substitute for animal milks, as it was easier to keep fresh, suitable for religious fast days and promised plentiful proteins and natural fats (in fact, they'd even churn butter out of the nutty, milk-like liquid). Much has changed since the Middle Ages - refrigerators exist and pasteurization of milks is standard practice - but almond beverage remains a steadfast dairy substitute. We've carried two almond beverages in our dairy case that have proven exceptionally popular - original (sweetened) & vanilla. Adding an Non- Dairy Almond Beverage seemed appropriately Medieval. We work with a family-owned company, who've been crafting quality beverages for 40 years and use only the finest, carefully selected, California-grown almonds. The almonds are first soaked and then finely ground, before being blended with water, until a creamy, milk-like consistency is obtained. Strained to remove any skin or almond pieces, it's a smooth, rich- tasting beverage that carries a hint of the nuts' natural sweetness with less than 1 gram of sugar per serving. Dairy free, soy free & gluten free, this vegan beverage is exceptionally versatile. Pour it over cereal, mix it in pancakes, add it to smoothies, use it to make cream sauces & dressings or go Medieval - make some butter. Trader Joe's Unsweetened Almond Beverage is a true classic, especially at our great price of $2.99 for each half gallon.
050857.name: Beverage Almond Unsweetened Original Half Gallon
050857.title: Almondmilk Non-Dairy Beverage Original

074710.description: It would be difficult to overstate how far vegan alternatives to dairy have come in just a few short years. For instance, it wasn't too long ago that the idea of a totally dairy-and-lactose-free whipping cream was either entirely out of the question, or came with considerable compromise-perhaps it would have the right flavor, but wasn't quite whippable, perhaps it had the right consistency, but the taste was all wrong. Not so today. In fact, today, you can pick up a carton of Trader Joe's Vegan Heavy Whipping Cream Alternative with absolute confidence that it will taste, feel, and, crucially, whip, just like its dairy-based counterpart. As with its plant-derived predecessors Trader Joe's Vegan Cream Cheese Alternative [sku 70942] and Trader Joe's Vegan Buttery Spread [sku 71782], the secret behind this Vegan Heavy Whipping Cream Alternative lies largely in the ingenuity of its recipe. Our supplier, an expert in non-dairy staples based in Germany, employs a carefully balanced mix of vegetable-based oils, starches, and proteins to provide just the right consistency and rich, creamy flavor to make this a direct, one-to-one replacement for dairy-based whipping cream. As such, we can whole-heartedly recommend it as an ingredient in soups, sauces, and desserts, as a mix-in for coffee, tea, or cocoa, and, when whipped until light and fluffy, a topping for milkshakes, mousses, or sweet breakfast treats. Vegan Heavy Whipping Cream Alternative
074710.name: Cream Heavy Plant Based Vegan
074710.title: Vegan Heavy Whipping Cream Alternative

075054.description: With their mild flavor and creamy consistency, oat-based beverages continue to be among our most popular plant-based potables. So much so, in fact, that we decided the time was right to expand on the smooth, easy- going flavor of our Non-Dairy Oat Beverage [sku 65333] with a vanilla-tinged variant. Made for us by the same supplier as our original version, Trader Joe's Unsweetened Vanilla Non-Dairy Oat Beverage differs from its predecessor in two crucial ways: first, of course, is the light touch of vanilla that's present in every sip. Second, instead of fully hydrolyzing the starches in the oats into sugar, our supplier only lets them break down partially, resulting in a drink that's not only free of added sugar, but in fact contains a total zero grams of sugar per serving. Oat-standing! Ideal for mixing into smoothies, pouring over breakfast cereals, or creating a super oat-powered batch of overnight oats, our vegan, gluten free Unsweetened Vanilla Non-Dairy Oat Beverage's silky texture and delicate vanilla notes are especially suited for sweeter endeavors. We recommend adding a splash to your morning coffee, tea, or cold brew for a little extra body. And if you're simply looking for something smooth and satisfying, but never overly sweet, a tall glass of ice-cold Unsweetend Vanilla Oat Beverage is always a great idea. Unsweetened Vanilla Non-Dairy Oat Beverage
075054.name: Beverage Unsweetened Vanilla Oat Half Gallon
075054.title: Non-Dairy Oat Beverage Unsweetened Vanilla

094740.description: ¿ Smooth and creamy, our Almondmilk is an excellent alternative to dairy milk in everything from breakfast cereal to baked goods. It's free of dairy and soy and fortified with calcium and vitamins A, D & E. Almonds have long been associated with good luck. We'll drink to that! We're selling each half gallon flavor of fresh Almondmilk for only $2.99!
094740.name: Beverage Almond Original Half Gallon
094740.title: Milk Half Gal Almond Orginal - Nfl - (Jasper Products, Llc)

094741.description: ¿ Smooth and creamy, our Almondmilk is an excellent alternative to dairy milk in everything from breakfast cereal to baked goods. It's free of dairy and soy and fortified with calcium and vitamins A, D & E. Almonds have long been associated with good luck. We'll drink to that! We're selling each half gallon flavor of fresh Almondmilk for only $2.99!
094741.name: Beverage Almond Unsweetened Vanilla Half Gallon
094741.title: Milk Half Gal Almond Unsweet Vanilla - Nfl - (Jasper Products, Llc)

000132.description: Sometimes the best things are the simplest things. This is true for food, too. Trader Joe's Harvest Whole Wheat Bread is as simple as it is wholesome, delicious, and versatile. Our Harvest Whole Wheat Bread is made from whole grain wheat, thus it brings all the benefits of whole grains, including three grams of fiber and five grams of protein per slice. It has a smooth, whole-wheat aroma and flavor with just a hint of honey-sweetness. Use a couple slices to make a classic turkey or tuna sandwich. Or, spread some Trader Joe's Almond Butter [sku 056995] and Organic Concord Grape Jelly [sku 095224] on a slice and fold it in half for a quick AB&J. If you're feeling extra fancy, you might even try a PBLT (Pork Belly [sku 51460], lettuce, and tomato). There's really no limit to what you can put on (or between) slices Trader Joe's Harvest Whole Wheat Bread. It also makes for some wonderful toast, if you're looking for a new breakfast staple. We're offering Trader Joe's Harvest Whole Wheat Bread at the everyday price of $1.69*. Simple. Find it on our bakery racks. (*$1.99 in our Colorado stores.) 08.22. 16
000132.name: Harvest Whole Wheat Bread

000152.description: Toast sounds simple, and in a way, it is simple. But, when you consider that the source of good toast is really good bread, it suddenly sounds not so simple after all. After testing a wide variety of contenders, we've come to the unanimous decision that the very best bread for toast-making is sourdough. And because toast requires slices of bread, our conclusion also included the rationale that sliced Sourdough is the most practical Sourdough for this particular endeavor. And thus, Trader Joe's Sourdough Bread tops our list of "Best Breads for Toast" for this and every year. Our Sourdough Bread is made exclusively for us, and will be slightly different depending on where in Trader Joe's country you pick up your loaf - the flavor of Sourdough depends largely on the "starter," which is a living culture that lends the bread its signature sour profile. Because every starter is different, every bakery produces a slightly different flavor profile. If you visit a Trader Joe's in Tennessee, your Sliced Sourdough toast will be just a bit different from the Sourdough toast you make with the Sourdough you buy in San Francisco. What they all have in common is their excellence - especially when toasted. So slather on some butter, a bit of jam, or make a PB&J on Sourdough toast. You may even take that toasting to a higher level, and make a scrumptious grilled cheese¿ on Sourdough. Toast away. You'll be glad you did. We're selling each 24-ounce loaf of Trader Joe's Sourdough Bread for $2.99, every day. You'll find it on our bakery racks.
000152.name: Sourdough Bread

006640.description: In Italy and other parts of the world more broadly, the phrase "bread sticks" is typically understood to mean grissini, thin, crispy batons of bread, baked until they're dry and cracker-like. In North America, however, bread sticks are almost their diametic opposite: wide, soft, and often accentuated with savory seasonings and cheese. Trader Joe's Garlic & Cheese Bread Sticks are firmly of the North American kind, meaning they have a luxuriously soft texture, with garlic, other aromatic spices, and a blend of four cheeses baked right in. Don't get us wrong: grissini have their place (we've sold them before and almost certainly will again!) but when you want something soft, savory, and cheesy, these Bread Sticks are hard to beat. A consummate companion to pizza, pasta, soups, and salads, Trader Joe's Garlic & Cheese Bread Sticks are delicious right out of the package, but even more so when heated up in an oven for a few minutes right before serving. Each batch is made with a mix of grated Parmesan, Romano, mozzarella and Cheddar, ensuring that each bite is satisfyingly cheesy. In addition to their use as a side, they also make a great appetizer when served with warm marinara for dipping-a little like straightened out garlic knots, if you will. Garlic & Cheese Bread Sticks
006640.name: Garlic & Cheese Breadsticks
006640.title: Garlic And Cheese Bread Sticks

014589.description: There are few ways to earn instant popularity around the office as effective as showing up to work with an armful of bagels. Bagels are the universal, Good morning; we're glad you're here. And when the bagel that kickstarts your day just happens to be a really good bagel, well, even better-you'll be glad you're there, too. Bagel Josef 's Plain Bagels are really good bagels, made for us using quality ingredients and without the use of artificial preservatives or dough conditioners. The secret to their bagel excellency is their baking process. First, the dough is proofed in high humidity and then set out to slowly ferment, which brings out all of the dough's delicious, subtle flavors. Next, the bagels are kettle-boiled-fully submerged in boiling water to lock in that chewy center and create that perfect "skin." Finally, they're off to the hearth tunnel oven to be baked until they've acquired that perfect, golden-brown bagel crust. Toast your Bagel, slather it with Cream Cheese [sku 12491], and top it with Smoked Salmon [sku 13059] and Capers [sku 24654]. Make a pizza bagel by spreading it with Pizza Sauce [sku 37333] and sprinkling it with Shredded Mozzarella [sku 81085], and baking it in the oven at 350° for about 10 minutes. Your Bagel is a blank canvas; let your carbohydrate-saturated imagination run wild. You'll find Bagel Josef 's Plain Bagels in our bakery section, and we're selling each 18-ounce bag of six Bagels for $2.29 in our Northern California and Texas stores and $1.99 in our Southern California Stores. Be a mensch and buy a bunch! We've shopped around, and we know you won't find a price this low at your local bagel shop.
014589.name: Plain Bagels

014614.description: Pita Bread dates back to about 4000 B.C., and its longevity is no surprise. After all, you can make a sandwich out of just about anything with a pita-in fact, if you know the secret of the pockets, every piece of pita can make two good-sized sandwiches! The secret to making this edible pocket lies in the baking: the bread is baked at very high temperatures, creating the "puff " that eventually makes a pocket. Pockets are always useful, but they're especially wonderful when you can fill them with your favorite foods. Put a few pieces of Falafel [sku 93935] and some Tzaziki Sauce [sku 24883] sauce in the pocket and you've got yourself a delicious Middle Eastern meal. If you're in the mood for a salad but don't have time to sit and eat, why not take your salad and put it inside a pita? Of course, there's no rule about taking advantage of the pocket-you can just as easily use the Pita as a wrap to make everything from gyros (thanks, Gyro Slices [sku 55277]) to an international take on a burrito. We have Pita Bread made fresh and delivered to our stores throughout the week. Each 10-ounce package of kosher certified Trader Joe's White Pita Bread contains four individual pitas (that's eight pockets!) and can be yours for $1.39, every day.
014614.name: Pita Bread Original Pockets

014622.description: At first glance, Trader Joe's British Style Crumpets might appear to be some version of an "English muffin." While both breads began as "griddle cakes" in early Anglo-Saxon households-where bread ovens weren't an option-they do have some fundamental differences. English muffins, like our Classic English Muffins [sku 14626], are typically a little more firm. They're also meant to be split before toasting. On the other hand, British Style Crumpets are meant to be toasted whole. Our Crumpets still have "nooks" to catch melted butter or preserves (or whatever you choose to top them with)-it's just that, unlike English muffins, the sponge-like holes extend to their exterior. This makes for a wonderfully soft & chewy eating experience. It's almost like enjoying a small, extra-thick pancake. (Which suggests that perhaps some TJ's 100% Pure Vermonth Grade A Dark Amber Maple Syrup [sku 95221] might be in order!) We're selling each 11-ounce package of six Trader Joe's British Style Crumpets for $2.99. You'll find them on the bread racks in our bakery section.
014622.name: British Style Crumpets

014626.description: Don't order an English Muffin in England, as you will likely get a funny look: Like the "French" in "French fries," the "English" in "English muffin" is just an American moniker, mostly assigned to distinguish the bearer of said moniker from traditional, American-style muffins. (You know, the kind that come sitting in little paper wrappers¿and are often quite sweet.) Trader Joe's English Muffins are not sweet muffins-if anything, they're a bit savory. Technically speaking, they're slightly spongy (picture a sourdough-like texture), puck-shaped pieces of bread, horizontally bisected into two, equal, circular halves. Each Muffin has a toothsome exterior (more of a "skin" than a "crust," though), and an interior filled with plenty of¿well, least we infringe upon on any trademarks, we'll say they're filled with plenty of "pockets & crevices." Yes, that's it. Pockets & crevices¿ Point is, our new, kaizen-ed English Muffins are hearty and delicious-perfect for toasting and slathering with butter, cream cheese, peanut butter, etc. or for using as the base of a breakfast sandwich. You'll find 12-ounce packages of six Trader Joe's English Muffins in our bakery section, available for $1.79 each, everyday.
014626.name: Plain English Muffins
014626.title: Classic English Muffins

014627.description: If you ever order an English Muffin in England, you'll likely get a funny look: Like the "French" in "French fries," the "English" in "English muffin" is just an American moniker, mostly assigned to distinguish the bearer of said moniker from traditional, American-style muffins. (You know, the kind that come sitting in little paper wrappers¿and are often quite sweet.) Trader Joe's Whole Wheat English Muffins are not sweet muffins-if anything, they're a bit savory. Technically speaking, they're soft, slightly spongy (picture a sourdough-like texture), puck-shaped pieces of bread, horizontally bisected into two, equal, circular halves. Each Muffin has a toothsome exterior (more of a "skin" than a "crust," though), and an interior filled with plenty of¿well, least we infringe upon on any trademarks, we'll say they're filled with plenty of "pockets & crevices." Yes, that's it. Pockets & crevices¿ All of which is to say, our new, kaizen-ed English Muffins are hearty and delicious-perfect for toasting and slathering with butter, cream cheese, peanut butter, etc. or for using as the base of a breakfast sandwich. Whole Wheat English Muffins
014627.name: Whole Wheat English Muffins

019755.description: When one has burgers, one must have buns. Trader Joe's has buns aplenty. Try the Whole Wheat Hamburger Buns you'll find in our bakery section. They're good-sized buns made with stone ground whole wheat flour, and wow, do they deliver the ideal soft bun texture. Soft and fluffy, with just the right amount of chew: you wouldn't want any other bun to support your hamburger bun filling of choice. Hamburgers are the typical use for a hamburger bun, but why stop there? Turkey burgers, Wine Country Chicken Salad [sku 57010], egg salad, sloppy joes, Jackfruit [sku 58772], grilled Chicken Breasts [sku 74036]¿ their uses know no known bounds. And don't forget the condiments¿a burger bun's favorite companion. How will you use them? We're selling packages of eight Whole Wheat Burger Buns for $1.99 every day. Grab a bag of buns and get grillin' today (or cooking, or baking, or however you're planning on prepping this future meal that includes hamburger buns¿).
019755.name: Whole Wheat Hamburger Buns Topped With Sesame Seeds

034765.description: As "traders on the culinary seas," we're well known for our great selection of unique and exotic products from around the world. But if you ask a regular Trader Joe's customer, they'll tell you that we're also the spot for high- quality, affordable basics. Like our new, sliced Organic Soft White Bread. We've certainly carried loaves of certified organic, sliced sandwich bread before, but we think this loaf is truly superior. Made with organic wheat flour, Trader Joe's Organic Soft White Bread is a hearty, classic, thick- sliced loaf. It's wholesome. It's versatile. And it's delicious. Use a couple of slices to make a classic turkey or tuna sandwich. Or, spread some Trader Joe's Almond Butter [sku 056995] and Organic Concord Grape Jelly [sku 095224] on a slice and fold it in half for a quick AB&J. It also makes for some wonderful breakfast toast-just pop it in the toaster and slather it with TJ's Cultured Butter [sku 53720] and your favorite preserves. In the name of fantastic, everyday value, we're offering each 24-ounce loaf of Trader Joe's Organic White Bread for $2.99. You'll find them on our bread racks.
034765.name: Organic Soft White Bread

054225.description: We carry fresh pizza dough in our refrigerators (Garlic & Herb [SKU 92337], Whole Wheat [SKU 92336], and Plain [SKU 92334]) for those who want to proof, roll out, top and bake homemade pizza. For those with less ambition (and/or less time), we also sell pre-baked crusts in our refrigerators and freezers that can simply be topped and popped into the oven. But, for those who want a ready-to-top crust from our bakery shelves, look no further than Trader Giotto's Pizza Crust. The base of this Crust is unbleached enriched flour made from wheat & malted barley. What makes this flour particularly suited to pizza crust is the fact that it's been refined to what the Italian pizzaiolos call '00' flour. This ultra-refined flour has a powdery-soft consistency that helps create a light, crisp exterior that's tender to the bite. Olive oil in the dough contributes authentic flavor, as does our supplier's natural fermentation process, yielding that yeasty "bite" pizza-lovers crave. Of course, you can further customize the flavor with whatever toppings you wish. First, brush both sides of the Crust with oil, then add Pizza Sauce [SKU 54874] and Shredded Mozzarella [SKU 81085], and build from there! Heat for 5-12 minutes in the oven or on the grill (times vary based on method), and you've got piping hot, pizza at home! Each 15-ounce package containing two Trader Giotto's Pizza Crusts is $3.49. Find them on our bakery shelves. 09.03. 18
054225.name: Pizza Crust 2 Per Package

054288.description: Bread and breakfast-two things that go together like toast and jam, pancakes and syrup, English muffins and eggs. That is, unless you ask someone who's gluten intolerant. Such ones can't as easily enjoy the breakfast-bread connection. Being the sincere people-pleasers that we are, we've been carrying Udi's Gluten Free Bagels for the last several years, at the request of our customers with gluten sensitivities. Udi's was the best gluten-free bagel that they (and we) had tried¿ until now¿ Introducing Trader Joe's Gluten Free Bagels. In addition to being free of gluten, these bagels are also dairy-, soy-, and nut-free. We also make them without using artificial flavors, or synthetic colors. Instead of wheat flour, our Gluten Free Bagels are made with ingredients that include brown rice flour, and sorghum flour (a grass, cultivated as a grain). These substitute flours yield a bagel that can bring a sunrise-smile to anybody's breakfast face. But, they're not just for breakfast. In fact, they're so good, we would encourage you to enjoy them any time you would enjoy a "regular" bagel. Trader Joe's Gluten Free Bagels are the perfect example of our approach to providing real value: Whenever we have the opportunity to offer a better product at a better price, we will. In this case, you get a fourteen-ounce bag of four better Gluten Free Bagels for the better price of just $4.49. Find them everyday on our bakery shelves. 4.13.1 5
054288.name: Gluten Free Plain Bagels

054291.description: Several years ago, we began offering Udi's gluten free breads in response to many customer requests. It was obvious from the beginning why they were asking for it-Udi's line of gluten free breads tasted closer to "regular" bread than anything else we tried¿ until now¿ Introducing Trader Joe's Gluten Free Whole Grain Bread. In several ways, our new bread is very similar to Udi's Whole Grain Bread. Both are dairy-, soy-, nut-, and gluten-free. Both are made using no artificial flavors and no synthetic colors. Both are made with brown rice flour and teff (a grass cultivated for grain). But, our new Gluten Free Whole Grain Bread offers even more. Along with the brown rice flour and whole grain teff, our bread also made with whole grain amaranth, whole grain sorghum (also in the grass family, and cultivated for grain), potato flour, and flaxseed meal. These ingredients help give our bread a better texture and flavor than Udi's (according to our official taste-testers). Also, slice for slice, Trader Joe's Gluten Free Whole Grain Bread is lower in fat, with fewer calories. And like its predecessor, our bread is still cholesterol-free, and with zero saturated fat and zero trans fat. When it comes to actually eating it, we wouldn't hesitate to use it for any "regular" bread occasion. Toast it. Grill it for French toast or a toasted cheese sandwich. Use it fresh out of the bag for a cold sandwich. You could even blend it to make your own breadcrumbs! Our approach to providing our customers with real value is pretty simple: Whenever we can offer a better product at a better price, we will. Trader Joe's Gluten Whole Grain Bread is a perfect example of this philosophy in action. This bread is better, and it is, indeed, offered at a better price-each twelve-ounce sliced loaf is just $4.49. 4.13.1 5
054291.name: Trader Joe'S Gluten Free Whole Grain Bread

054292.description: Several years ago, we began offering Udi's gluten free breads in response to many customer requests. It was obvious from the beginning why they were asking for it-Udi's line of gluten free breads tasted closer to "regular" bread than anything else we tried¿ until now¿ Introducing Trader Joe's Gluten Free White Sandwich Bread. In several ways, our new bread is very similar to Udi's Gluten Free White Sandwich Bread. Both are dairy-, soy-, nut-, and gluten-free. Both are made using no artificial flavors and no synthetic colors. Both are made with brown rice flour. But, our new Gluten Free White Sandwich Bread offers even more. Along with the brown rice flour, our bread also made with sorghum (in the grass family, cultivated for grain), and potato flour. These ingredients help give our bread a better texture and flavor than Udi's (according to our official taste-testers). Also, slice for slice, Trader Joe's Gluten Free White Sandwich Bread is lower in fat, with fewer calories. And like its predecessor, our bread is still cholesterol-free, and with zero saturated fat and zero trans fat. When it comes to actually eating it, we wouldn't hesitate to use it for any "regular" bread occasion. Toast it. Grill it for French toast or a toasted cheese sandwich. Use it fresh out of the bag for a cold sandwich. You could even blend it to make your own breadcrumbs! Our approach to providing our customers with real value is pretty simple: Whenever we can offer a better product at a better price, we will. Trader Joe's Gluten Free White Sandwich Bread is a perfect example of this philosophy in action. This bread is better, and it is, indeed, offered at a better price-each twelve-ounce sliced loaf is just $4.49. 4.13.1 5
054292.name: Gluten Free White Bread
054292.title: Gluten Free White Sandwich Bread

055476.description: As a snack, a simple slice of Cinnamon Raisin Bread approaches perfection. The sweet raisins and aromatic cinnamon make it seem like a special baked treat, one that's elevated even further by a simple warm up in the toaster. And yet, it's just a bit of bread-not a donut or a slice of cake-so it never quite corsses the line into "dessert" territory! We want all our customers to have the Cinnamon Raisin Bread experience, and that's why we're bringing Trader Joe's Gluten Free Cinnamon Raisin Bread back to our bakery shelves. Reformulated with a new recipe that no longer includes eggs (which means it's now also vegan!), this hearty loaf smells and tastes just like classic Cinnamon Raisin Bread-because it is! All we've done is replaced the wheat flour with a combination of brown rice flour and tapioca flour. Husked brown rice is finely ground and used as the primary substitute for wheat flour. The tapioca flour-derived from the root of the cassava plant from South America-helps provide some of the crispness and chew that's often missing in other gluten free breads. This bread is great for breakfast, toasted with a spread of butter (or a bit of Trader Joe's Vegan Buttery Spread [sku 71782], to keep it totally vegan). Of course, it's also great with a variety of fruit or nut spreads, or try it egg-battered and pan-fried for a delicious French toast. Gluten Free Cinnamon Raisin Bread
055476.name: Gluten Free Cinn Raisin Bread
055476.title: Gluten Free Cinnamon Raisin Bread

056718.description: "Take also unto thee Wheat, and Barley, and beans, and lentils, and millet, and Spelt, and put them in one vessel, and make bread of it..." Ezekiel 4:9 As they say, bread is the Staff of Life because nearly all cultures have used this basic food to support life for millennia. Bursting with nutrients, this unique Biblical bread blend harvests benefits far greater than we typically receive from our breads, pastas, and cereals. Food for Life's Sprouted Grain Sesame Ezekiel Bread's portfolio includes being a source of complete protein (contains all nine essential amino acids and tosses in nine more!), a fabulous source of fiber (especially with the added toasted sesame seeds), increased digestion, increased absorption of minerals, and high in vitamins C, B2, B5, and B6. Our suppliers begin each batch with freshly sprouted organic grains, use no flour, cut out refined sugars, and finish it off using a slow baking process that maintains the natural fiber and preserves the sprouted grain benefits. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Sprouted Grain Sesame Ezekiel Bread
056718.name: Ezekiel Sprouted Sesame Bread

056719.description: "Take also unto thee Wheat, and Barley, and beans, and lentils, and millet, and Spelt, and put them in one vessel, and make bread of it..." Ezekiel 4:9 As they say, bread is the Staff of Life because nearly all cultures have used this basic food to support life for millennia. Bursting with nutrients, this unique Biblical bread blend harvests benefits far greater than we typically receive from our breads, pastas, and cereals. Food for Life's Sprouted Whole Grain Ezekiel Bread's portfolio includes being a source of complete protein (contains all nine essential amino acids and tosses in nine more!), a fabulous source of fiber, increased digestion, increased absorption of minerals, and high in vitamins C, B2, B5, and B6. Our suppliers begin each batch with freshly sprouted organic grains, use no flour, cut out refined sugars, and finish it off using a slow baking process to maintain the natural fiber and preserves the sprouted grain benefits. Consider our bakery shelves stocked daily with this sprouted grain goodie for $3.99*. Get your hands on a holy loaf of Sprouted Whole Grain Ezekiel Bread today! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Sprouted Whole Grain Ezekiel Bread
056719.name: Ezekiel Sprt Whole Grain Bread

057438.description: Contrary to its name, "pumpernickel" has no relation to the five-cent coin. But it is an incredibly tasty variety of bread. We assure you, Trader Joe's Dark Pumpernickel Tuscan Pane is no nickel-and-dime bread. It's actually a momentous everyday product just waiting to be embraced-and eaten-by you. Pumpernickel rye bread originated in Westphalin, Germany. Since making its way around the world, pumpernickel bread has won acclaim for its slight sweetness and heavier, denser texture. For our Dark Pumpernickel Tuscan Pane, our supplier uses a 100% rye starter with course ground rye and wheat flours. The dough is hand shaped by expert bread-shapers, and then baked on a stone hearth to produce a perfectly chewy interior and crisp exterior. Slices of our Dark Pumpernickel Tuscan Pane shine in just about any culinary creation you can dream up. It's great for making that Reuben sandwich you've been craving-pumpernickel, after all, was thought to be the original bread used for the famous sandwich. Or, throw some avocado and Havarti Cheese Slices [sku 78745] on a few slices for a tasty vegetarian lunch option. Any way you slice it-or, prepare it, since this bread comes sliced-this chewy, flavorful bread will not disappoint. The value won't disappoint, either. For just $2.99, pick up a 27-ounce sliced loaf of Trader Joe's Dark Pumpernickel Tuscan Pane. That's only 60 nickels! Hurry to a Trader Joe's near you.
057438.name: Dark Pumpernickel Tuscan Bread
057438.title: Dark Pumpernickel Tuscan Pane

057959.description: Bread. Even though modern diet culture tells us to fear it, bread is a scrumptiously inevitable household staple. Why shouldn't it be? It's delicious, filling, and in many cases, quite nutritious-and if you're a fan of all things delicious, filling, and nutritious, you might want to head to your local Trader Joe's, because we've got a new bread on the scene: Trader Joe's Organic Seeded Bread. Made with organic wheat and whole wheat flour and sweetened with a touch of organic sugar cane molasses, Trader Joe's Organic Seeded Bread is soft, chewy, and ever-so-slightly sweet. Loaded with organic sunflower, flax, poppy, and sesame seeds, it's also as hearty as can be, with a perfectly toothsome, seedy texture. Use it for all of your sandwich-making needs, or toast and slather it with TJ's Cultured Salted Butter [sku 53720] and TJ's Raspberry Preserves [sku 87805]-it'll be a symphony of seeds! We're selling each 16-ounce loaf of Trader Joe's Organic Seeded Bread for $3.49. You'll find it on the bread racks in our East Coast stores.
057959.name: Organic Seeded Bread

058641.description: If you visit Hawaii, locals will tell you that there is more to the term "aloha" than a simple hello or goodbye. Aloha refers to an overflowing spirit of love-a way of life, if you will. Similarly, if you visit Trader Joe's, Crew Members will tell you that there is more to our Sweet Pull-Apart Aloha Rolls than a simple mixture of flour, sugar, water, and yeast. Calling these Rolls "a way of life" might be a stretch-but calling them special, delicious, and/or inspired seems wholly appropriate. Trader Joe's Sweet Pull-Apart Aloha Rolls are light, fluffy, and perfect for sopping up all the leftover gravy goodness on your Thanksgiving plate. They're also ideal for party sandwiches and sliders-just pull them apart (they come "attached" in a 3-roll by 4-roll rectangle), split them in half and pile on your filling of choice. Heck, we've even used these Rolls as sweet-but-not-too-sweet ice cream sandwich "buns." Let your bread basket overflow! You can't go wrong when you invite the spirit of aloha to the table. You also can't go wrong with our price-we're selling each 12-ounce package of a dozen, delicious Aloha Rolls for $2.99. You'll find them in our bakery section. 10.30. 17
058641.name: Sweet Pull Apart Rolls
058641.title: Sweet Pull Apart Aloha Rolls

060500.description: As "traders on the culinary seas," we're well known for our great selection of unique and exotic products from around the world. But if you ask a regular Trader Joe's customer, they'll tell you that we're also the spot for high- quality, affordable basics. Like our new, sliced White Bread. We've certainly carried loaves of conventional, sliced sandwich bread before, but we think this loaf is truly superior. Made with unbleached flour, Trader Joe's White Bread is a soft, straightforward, fluffy-yet-substantial loaf, sliced into 22 one-ounce slices. It's versatile. And it's delicious. Use a couple of slices to make a classic turkey or tuna sandwich. Or, spread some Trader Joe's Almond Butter [sku 056995] and Organic Concord Grape Jelly [sku 095224] on a slice and fold it in half for a quick AB&J. It also makes for some wonderful breakfast toast-just pop it in the toaster and slather it with TJ's Cultured Butter [sku 53720] and your favorite preserves. In the name of fantastic, everyday value, we're offering each 22-ounce loaf of Trader Joe's White Bread for $1.79. You'll find them on our bread racks.
060500.name: Sliced White Bread
060500.title: White Sliced Bread

061610.description: .While we seriously doubt we'll need to twist your arm to convince you to try Trader Joe's Hand Twisted Cinnamon Sugar Bread, we're going to tout its tastiness anyway, because-truthfully-we're twitterpated! Our Cinnamon Sugar Bread is fluffy-yet-dense, sweet-but-not-too-sweet, and smoothly & superbly cinnamony. (The cinnamon flavor runs high, but since our supplier uses korintje cinnamon, it's a bit less "nippy" than other cinnamon varietals.) And here's the plot twist: each loaf is actually made up of three separate pieces of dough, rolled in cinnamon & sugar, then Hand Twisted together. It's terrific toasted and, boy, does it make a fine French toast... and we've purposefully left it unsliced, so you can slice the bread to fit the breakfast! (Or lunch, snack, etc., etc.) Hand Twisted Cinnamon Sugar Bread
061610.name: Bread Hand Twisted Cinnamon Sugar
061610.title: Hand Twisted Cinnamon Sugar Bread

061611.description: They're known by many names, across the land: subs, submarine sandwiches, heroes, hoagies, grinders -but they've all got a few things in common. First, an often impressive amount of towering toppings and zesty condiments. Second, and most importantly, they're all served on a gloriously elongated, toasty, delicious Roll. If the clothes make the person, the Roll makes the Sandwich. And now, no matter what you call it in your neck of the woods, our newest bakery item will be a worthy vessel to make your next Submarine Sandwich positively ship-shape. Say "ahoy!" to Trader Joe's Submarine Sandwich Rolls. Made in a traditional baguette pan to give it its distinctive shape, and hand-scored by expert bakers, each Submarine Sandwich Roll is baked with structure in mind. Even under immense pressure from piles of Uncured Black Forest Ham [sku 86863], Oven Roasted Turkey Breast [sku 81594], or Uncured Applewood Smoke Salami [sku 59152] (or all three!), these Rolls retain a soft, pleasant crumb texture, and a mild, just-baked taste that accomodates condiments wonderfully. And if that weren't enough, they're a bargain at $2.99* for every 12-ounce, four-Roll bag. Scope out your neighborhood Trader Joe's bakery section for Submarine Sandwich Rolls today! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Submarine Sandwich Rolls
061611.name: Rolls Submarine Sandwich
061611.title: Submarine Sandwich Rolls - Note To Design: "Rolls" Is The Statement Of Identity. It Must Be Bold, Prominent And At Least Half The Height Of The Largest Type Size Used On The Pdp.

061752.description: Ever since we introduced it in 2016, our Sliced French Brioche [sku 56582] has been flying off our bakery shelves. And it's no wonder-brioche is delicious. It's rich, fluffy, and slightly sweet. It's also highly versatile, lending itself to both sweet and savory applications. One of our favorite applications? Burgers on Brioche Buns! Trader Joe's Brioche Buns are made for us by bakers who really know their brioche. Eggy, extra moist, and free from artificial preservatives, they're the perfect base for your burger or support for your sandwich. Load up your Buns with TJ's beef, veggie, chicken, or turkey burgers (we've got 'em all.) Pile them high with TJ's Pulled Pork [sku 93602], TJ's Egg Salad [sku 57824], or TJ's Wine Country Chicken Salad [sku 57010]. Or toast them, butter them with TJ's Cultured Butter [sku 53720], and slather them with TJ's Raspberry Preserves [sku 87805]. Told you Brioche was versatile¿ We're selling each 9.45-ounce package of four Brioche Buns for $3.99, every day-a not-so-fancy price for one classy bag o' Buns. You'll find them in our bakery section. 06.25. 18
061752.name: Brioche Buns 4 Pk

062023.description: At Trader Joe's, we fancy ourselves "traders on the culinary seas." What does that mean, exactly? Well, for starters it means that our Buyers really do travel the world in search of products that excite, delight, and inspire. (Yes, it's a great gig.) Sometimes, they set sail with a particular product in mind; other times, they head out in search of sheer inspiration. Here, it was a bit of both-while our Buyer didn't head to France this time to specifically develop a private label Chocolate Chip Pain Au Lait, she had been inspired on previous visits to find a vendor to produce an authentic Pain Au Lait worthy of our bakery racks. "Worthy" is the key word here, though, and we were pleased as pain to introduce our plain Pain Au Lait [sku 60336] last fall. Now, with the help of that same French supplier and their time-honored family recipe, we're here to sweeten the deal, with Trader Joe's Chocolate Chip Pain Au Lait. It's that same heavenly Trader Joe's Pain Au Lait, but with rich, dark chocolate chips throughout. Pain Au Lait translates directly to "Milk Bread," a humble name for these slightly sweet, elegant, brioche-like rolls. Moist, eggy, sweet, and straightforward, they pair beautifully with butter and jam-we recommend TJ's French Cultured Butter [sku 53720] and TJ's Raspberry Preserves [sku 87805]-and are perfect for dunking in coffee, tea, or hot chocolate. They make a lovely breakfast (pain au chocolat is the breakfast of choice for many French children), a sweetly satisfying snack, or a decadent dessert. (Try warming and enjoying alongside a scoop of TJ's Organic Vanilla Fudge Chip Ice Cream [sku 56415]-you won't regret it!) But, heck, for $2.99 per 9.9-ounce bag (8 rolls per bag), you can afford to add a Pain Au Lait to each and every meal... No need to travel to Paris for this Pain-you'll find this typically-only-available-in-specialty-bakeries Chocolate Chip Pain Au Lait in the bakery section at your neighborhood Trader Joe's. 12.20. 18
062023.name: French Pain Au Lait Choc Chip Bread
062023.title: Chocolate Chip Pain Au Lait

062144.description: TJ's Gluten-Free Hamburger Buns are made by a family-owned and operated bakery in a dedicated gluten- free facility using a blend of whole grain sorghum and brown rice flours. In addition to providing an impres- sive two grams of fiber and five grams of protein per serving, this mix keeps the buns airy and tender, just like their classic, non-gluten-free counterparts. In fact, we specifically chose this bun to appeal to non-gluten-free customers just as much as the gluten-free crowd, because when it comes to burgers, you shouldn't have to compromise. We recommend lightly warming these buns in a toaster or on the grills, then loading up with a fresh patty made from our Organic Grass Fed Beef [sku 92558], a slice of Organic New Zealand Cheddar [sku 56942], and pile high with tomato slices, grilled onions, and your favorite condiments for one unbelievable hamburger - that just happens to be gluten-free, too. We're selling each 11.08-ounce package of Trader Joe's Gluten Free Hamburger Buns for $3.99. 05.21. 18
062144.name: Hamburger Buns Gluten Free
062144.title: Gluten Free Hamburger Buns

062146.description: TJ's Gluten-Free Multigrain Bread is made for us by a family-owned and operated bakery in a dedicated gluten-free facility using a special blend of brown rice, whole grain sorghum, amaranth, millet, and teff flours- as well as sprouted millet, brown rice, and oats. In addition to providing an impressive two grams of fiber and three grams of protein per two-slice serving, this mix makes the bread soft and flavorful, instead of tough or grainy. In fact, we specifically chose this bread to appeal to non-gluten-free customers just as much as the gluten-free crowd. Because when it comes to bread, you shouldn't have to compromise. We recommend toasting a few slices until nicely browned, then piling them high with your favorite deli meat and condiments, with a crisp Organic Kosher Dill Pickle Spear [sku 54867]. Or, take advantage of this bread's hearty nature and combine Crunchy Salted Almond Butter [sku 52293] with Fresh Raspberry Preserves [sku 87805] for an uncommonly delicious PB&J-that just happens to be gluten-free, too! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Gluten Free Multigrain Bread with Sprouted Ancient Grains
062146.name: Multigrain Bread Gluten Free
062146.title: Gluten Free Multigrain Bread

062988.description: Tortillas aren't just a staple of Central American cuisine, they're one of the foundational foods of human cuisine in general. Archaeological evidence suggests that the indigenous peoples of Mesoamerica were making tortillas from corn as far back as 12,000 years ago, which means that tortillas are older than wine, leavened bread, and the domestication of the chicken. And now, doing our small part to further the epic legacy of the tortilla, we present Trader Joe's Organic Mini Flour Tortillas. Made with organic wheat ¿ our, these Mini Tortillas are practically tailor-made for making tacos. At just under ¿ ve inches in diameter, they o¿ er just the right amount of real estate to hold an expertly cra¿ able combination of beans, cheese, veggies, and protein. Of course, size isn't their sole virture, they're also charmingly so¿ and pliable in texture, and have a great, toasty ¿ avor that nicely complements spicier fare. Keep an eye out for 8.47-ounce packages of Organic Mini Flour Tortillas, each containing twelve Mini Tortillas, in your neighborhood Trader Joe's bakery section, every day. Organic Mini Flour Tortillas
062988.name: Tortillas Mini Flour Organic
062988.title: Organic Mini Flour Tortillas

063164.description: Ah, the march of progress. Since we first started carrying gluten-free bread, those many years ago, remarkable advances have been made in the field of gluten-free baked goods: softer consistencies, more open-crumbed tex- tures, and even improved flavors from alternative grains. As these gluten-free breakthroughs have taken place, we've kept apace, offering the best options available to our customers as soon as we could find them. And now, we're proud to say we're staying on the cutting edge with Trader Joe's Gluten-Free Everything Bagels. Trader Joe's Gluten-Free Everything Bagels are made for us in a dedicated gluten-free facility, using a special blend of brown rice flour, potato flour, tapioca starch, and potato starch-plus a bit of garlic, sea salt, expeller pressed canola oil, and cane sugar. Once baked, they're rolled in a blend of sesame seeds, poppy seeds, and bits of dehydrated onion-now that's Everything. In addition to providing an impressive-for-a-bagel four grams of protein per serving, this special blend of gluten free flours and starches makes these bagels soft and chewy, rather than gritty and grainy. In fact, we specifically chose these bagels to appeal to non-gluten-free customers just as much as the gluten-free crowd. Because when it comes to carbs, you shouldn't have to compromise. We recommend toasting at once! Enjoy it plain, buttered, or with a bit of cream cheese. We're selling 14-ounce bags of four Trader Joe's Gluten Free Blueberry Bagels for $4.49 each. Be a mensch and buy a bunch! You'll find them on our bread racks. 10.1.1 8
063164.name: Bagels Gluten Free Almost Everything
063164.title: Gluten Free Almost Everything Bagels

064220.description: As "traders on the culinary seas," we're well known for our great selection of unique and exotic products from around the world. But if you ask a regular Trader Joe's customer, they'll tell you that we're also the spot for high- quality, affordable basics. Like our new, sliced Whole Wheat Bread. We've certainly carried loaves of conventional, sliced sandwich bread before, but we think this loaf is truly superior. Made with whole wheat flour and cracked whole wheat, Trader Joe's Whole Wheat Bread is a soft, moist, and straightforward loaf, sliced into 22 one-ounce slices. It's wholesome. It's versatile. And it's delicious. Use a couple of slices to make a classic turkey or tuna sandwich. Or, spread some Trader Joe's Almond Butter [sku 056995] and Organic Concord Grape Jelly [sku 095224] on a slice and fold it in half for a quick AB&J. It also makes for some wonderful breakfast toast-just pop it in the toaster and slather it with TJ's Cultured Butter [sku 53720] and your favorite preserves. In the name of fantastic, everyday value, we're offering each 22-ounce loaf of Trader Joe's Whole Wheat Bread for $1.79. You'll find them on our bread racks.
064220.name: Sliced Whole Wheat Bread
064220.title: Whole Wheat Sliced Bread

064224.description: Since the best bread for toasting is sourdough (subjective, we know!), and since the most practical bread for toasting is sliced, we nominate Trader Joe's Sourdough Sliced Bread to top the list of "Best Breads for Toast." Here are a few more reasons... This particular Sourdough Sliced Bread is made exclusively for us. The flavor of a sourdough depends largely on its "starter," which is a living culture that lends the bread its signature sour profile. Our bakery partner uses just three ingredients in their starter: enriched flour, water, and salt. Once the starter is mixed with a bit of oil and vital wheat gluten (which help with texture), the dough is shaped into loaves and left to ferment for a whopping 20 hours before baking. The result is a loaf imbued with plenty of sourdough flavor, perfect for toast and sandwiches. (Especially hot sandwiches-this bread makes for a killer grilled cheese...) We're selling each 24-ounce loaf of Trader Joe's Sourdough Sliced Bread for $2.99*, every day. You'll find it on our bakery racks. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Sourdough Sliced Bread
064224.name: Bread Sourdough Long Sliced
064224.title: Sourdough Sliced Bread

065782.description: If this new version of Trader Joe's Tuscan Pane [sku 59133] only had something on it, we would have called it "Something Tuscan Pane." But, no. It's got Everything. And by Everything, we mean sesame seeds, poppy seeds, dried onion, dried garlic, and salt. That's all the same seasonings you'll find in our Trader Joe's Everything but the Bagel Seasoning Blend [sku 59137]... except black sesame seeds. (Well, you can't have everything. And by everything in this case, we mean 'all the stuff.') What you can have is a 27-ounce, golden, savory, sliced loaf of Trader Joe's Everything Tuscan Pane for $2.99. This particular Everything is more than enough. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Everything Tuscan Pane
065782.name: Bread Tuscan Pane Everything
065782.title: Everything Tuscan Pane A Stone Hearth Oven Baked Bread Topped With Everything Seasoning

066433.description: Soft, buttery, and with a shiny, golden-brown crust, brioche is one of those breads that, by its very nature, adds a little touch of elegance to whatever it's served with. As proven by our beloved Brioche Buns [sku 61752], the sweet, luxuriously-textured profile of brioche is remarkably well-suited to complementing the constituent ingredients of a hamburger, which got us thinking: couldn't that principle be applied to hot dogs, as well? And thus, Trader Joe's Brioche Hot Dog Buns came to be. Combining all the fluffiness and mild sweetness of brioche with all the form and function of a hot dog bun means taking hot dogs to the next level. Imagine surrounding a plump, pan-fried Organic Uncured Grass Fed Beef Hot Dog [sku 76253] with pillowy brioche, the softness of the bread contrasting with the snap and dense texture of the hot dog...Mmm. But one need not limit their imaginations to just hot dogs - these Buns also work wonders for fried fish, hot chicken, egg salad, or lobster rolls. Frankly, anything grilled, crispy, creamy, or somewhere in between will find a happy home inside Trader Joe's Brioche Hot Dog Buns. Brioche Hot Dog Buns
066433.name: Brioche Hot Dog Buns

067172.description: Trader Joe's Organic Super Bread is definitely super for all the amazing inclusions you'll find in every bite! The base includes organic whole wheat flour, organic rye flour, organic rolled oats, and organic millet. This multigrain mix makes a hearty, moist crumb that sets the stage for a whole host of seedy, fruity stars. There are three kinds of seeds: organic pumpkin seeds, organic flax seeds, and organic sunflower seeds. This vegan bread also contains organic carrots, organic dried apple, and organic dried banana! A bread this super-interesting is wonderful when simply toasted and buttered, but it's also versatile enough to work for sandwiches or with sweet spreads. Find Trader Joe's Organic Super Bread on our bakery shelves in all our stores except those on the West Coast served by the Fontana and Stockton warehouses. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Super Bread
067172.name: Bread Super Organic
067172.title: Organic Super Bread With Pumpkin Seeds, Flax Seeds, Sunflower Seeds, Carrots, Dried Apples And Sesame Seeds.

068660.description: Bread. Even though modern diet culture tells us to fear it, bread is a scrumptiously inevitable household staple. And why shouldn't it be? It's delicious, filling, and in many cases, quite nutritious. If you're a fan of all things delicious, filling, and nutritious, you might want to head to your local Trader Joe's, because we've got a bread you won't want to miss: Trader Joe's Organic Sprouted Wheat Multigrain Bread. Each loaf of TJ's Organic Sprouted Wheat Multigrain Bread is made with organic sprouted wheat berries, plus organic sprouted millet, cracked wheat, rolled oats, sunflower seeds, flax seeds, & corn meal-so its flavor is good & hearty. Its multigrain goodness will serve you well, whether you use it for breakfast avocado toast or midday PB&J. We're selling each 24 ounce, certified-organic loaf for $3.99,* every day. You'll find it on our bread racks. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Sprouted Wheat Multigrain Bread
068660.name: Bread Multigrain Sprouted Wheat Organic
068660.title: Organic Sprouted Multigrain Bread

068885.description: If you are not that carb savvy, you might think 9g of carbohydrates in one serving of Trader Joe's Carb Savvy Tortillas is not that impressive. In fact, for someone watching their carbs, it's excellent! Carb Savvy Tortillas contain less overall carbs than regular tortillas, and the carbs they do contain are mostly from dietary fiber. Accordingly, these reduced-carb tortillas are an excellent source of dietary fiber, providing 6g per tortilla. That's 21% of your daily recommended value of fiber! Enjoy them just as you would less-carb-savvy tortillas. Their smaller size is great for quesadillas, jumbo tacos, or even just for snacking. Find them every day on our bread shelves. Carb Savvy Tortillas made with Whole Wheat
068885.name: Tortillas Flour Carb Savvy
068885.title: Carb Savvy Tortillas Made With Whole Wheat

070453.description: Don't order an English Muffin in England, as you will likely get a funny look: Like the "French" in "French fries," the "English" in "English muffin" is just an American moniker, mostly assigned to distinguish the bearer of said moniker from traditional, American-style muffins. (You know, the sweet, cake-like ones famously peddled in nursery rhymes by the Muffin Man¿ do you know him?) Trader Joe's Gluten Free English Muffins are not sweet muffins-if anything, they're a bit savory. Technically speaking, they're slightly spongy (picture a sourdough-like texture), puck-shaped pieces of bread, horizontally bisected into two, equal, circular halves. And, being that they're gluten free, they're made from a blend of rice flour, tapioca starch, and chickpea flour rather than the regular, wheat-based stuff. Each Muffin has a toothsome exterior (more of a "skin" than a "crust," though), and an interior filled with plenty of...well, lest we infringe upon on any trademarks, we'll say they're filled with plenty of "pockets & crevices." Yes, that's it. Pockets & crevices... *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Gluten Free English Muffins
070453.name: Gluten Free English Muffin 4 Pk
070453.title: Gluten Free English Muffins

074781.description: We're not the types to say this kind of thing cavalierly, so believe us when we say that we may have found the greatest thing since sliced bread: Trader Joe's Sliced Cinnamon Raisin Bread! Made for us by a trusted bakery partner, each loaf contains a sweet, faintly spicy swirl of cinnamon sugar, and is studded with juicy, ever-so- slightly tart raisins throughout. Once baked, our supplier cuts the loaf into thin, easy-to-portion slices that can be enjoyed for their super soft texture as-is, right out of the package, or toasted until they're lightly browned and satisfyingly crisp. Sweet, cinnamon-y, and punctuated with occasional pops of flavor from the rich, juicy raisins, Trader Joe's Sliced Cinnamon Raisin Bread is sure to bring a bravura performance to the breakfast table. It serves excellently as a simple slice of toast, with a bit of butter or your favorite non-dairy spread. It's great for making thin and crisp slices of French toast that pair especially well with warm Maple Syrup [sku 04892] and Organic Powdered Sugar [sku 59227]. And for an intriguing mix of savory and sweet, try it as a sandwich bread with bacon, a fried egg, and a crispy Hashbrown [sku 94769] patty. Sliced Cinnamon Raisin Bread
074781.name: Bread Cinnamon Raisin Sliced

092172.description: Cinnamon Raisin Bagels Cinnamon Raisin Bagels are one of the top bagel flavors in supermarkets. Ours are all natural, with no dough conditioners, and good cinnamon flavor, with moist plump raisins throughout. Great as an on-the-go breakfast, slathered with cream cheese or butter, toasted or not! Also good as a sandwich "roll", for deli turkey or ham, maybe with a chutney spread. Opens for 1st orders on October 8, 2012.
092172.name: Cinnamon Raisin Bagels

092267.description: These Bagels are everything! And by that, we mean Trader Joe's Everything Bagels are really excellent bagels, made for us by skilled bagel bakers using only quality ingredients. Of course, the secret to their bagel excellency rests firmly in the baking process and the attention to detail in every step. Since we use local bakeries, this baking process varies from region to region-nevertheless, you'll find every iteration to be wonderfully doughy inside, with a good chew on the outside. These Bagels are also Everything because they're topped with traditional Everything seasonings, including sesame seeds, poppy seeds, garlic, onion, and salt. This means they are great when simply toasted with butter or cream cheese. But don't be afraid to add to 'the Everything'¿ Make an Everything Bagel pizza. Top with some Smoked Salmon [sku 13059]. You can even add Everything But the Bagel Seasoning [sku 59137]¿ so meta. You'll find Trader Joe's Everything Bagels in our bakery section; we're selling each 18-ounce bag of six for $1.99 to $2.69 (varies regionally)*. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Everything Bagels
092267.name: Everything Bagels

092427.description: To paraphrase Annie Get Your Gun, anything bread can do, naan can do¿ differently. Not better, per se, but with a uniquely enjoyable flair. Naan is a traditional East Indian flat bread-typically baked in a Tandoor oven-that's as versatile as it is delicious, and Trader Joe's Tandoori Garlic Naan boasts manifold merits. Originally only available to stores served by our Daytona warehouse, this version is so superior that we decided to bring it in to stores served by our Irving and Minooka warehouses, too. It gets its satisfyingly dense doughy-ness from unbleached wheat flour. Its soft-yet-sturdy texture, circular shape, and distinct garlicky-ness (yes, that's a word...) lend to mul- tiple methods of enjoyment. Warm and serve with butter, use in lieu of utensils for scooping food and soaking up sauces-it's great with Indian-style curries, Italian-style fare, and hearty soups and stews-or layer with your favorite meats, cheeses or vegetables to create impressive sandwiches. We're selling each 18-ounce package (4 naan per package) of Tandoori Garlic Naan for $2.99. You'll find it on our fresh bakery racks. To paraphrase Annie Get Your Gun again, you can't get a man with a naan (but you can pick up your food)¿
092427.name: Flatbread Indian Style Garlic
092427.title: Garlic Indian Style Flatbread

092457.description: Trader Joe's Plain Tandoori Nann Trader Joe's Masala Tandoori Naan Naan - pronouonced nahn - is a traditional East Indian flat bread. Our naan is made in a tandoor oven, baked until golden brown and the bubbles pop the outer surface. It's exclusively made for Trader Joe's. Versatile and flavourful - warm and serve with butter or use it to sop up your favorite Indian cuisine. Make a toasted ham and cheese sandwich or grill it Panini style. We're selling each 18 oz package of Trader Joe's Plain Tandoori Naan ad Trader Joe's Masala Tandoori Naan for just $3.49. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin02/13/2008 page 33 of 35 Confidential
092457.name: Flatbread Indian Style
092457.title: Traditional Indian Style Flatbread

092652.description: At Trader Joe's, we have all kinds of ways to spice up your taco night, including our classic Taco Seasoning Mix [sku 93089], Chunky Garlic & Jalapeño Hot Sauce [sku 74550], and our extra ¿ ery Habanero Hot Sauce [sku 96159]. For those looking to turn up the heat even higher, we also have Trader Joe's Habanero Lime Flour Tortillas. Cra¿ ed for us by a family-owned tortilla maker who's been in the business for close to four decades, they put ground habanero peppers and lime juice solids directly into the dough before cooking, so that every bite has a complementary combo of citrusy tartness and habanero heat. While Trader Joe's Habanero Lime Flour Tortillas are an excellent choice for tacos (and, we ¿ nd, seafood tacos in particular), that's hardly where we'd stop. ¿ ey're also excellent for ¿ ery, at-home fajitas, red-hot veggie wraps, and volcanic quesadillas with Organic Pepper Jack [sku 60519] or Cheddar Cheese with Scotch Bonnet Chili and Red Peppers [sku 72426] (or both!). And for a ¿ aming hot ¿ auta, we recommend rolling one up with our Traditional Carnitas [sku 77697], deep-frying until crispy, and dipping it in our Extra Hot Habanero Ghost Pepper Salsa [sku 59417]. Habanero Lime Flour Tortillas
092652.name: Habanero Lime Tortillas
092652.title: Trader Joe'S Habanero Lime Flour Tortillas Medium Hot With A Hint Of Lime

093074.name: Handmade Whole Wheat Tortillas
093074.title: Trader Joe'S Whole Wheat Flour Tortillas

093459.description: Trader Joe's Soft Multigrain Rustico Bread is a "must try." You could say it's the best thing since sliced bread. In fact, it is sliced bread. It also happens to be one of the best-tasting sliced breads we've encountered in all of our bread-eating adventures. Our Soft Multigrain Rustico Bread is packed with a grainy mix of flax, sesame, sunflower seeds and rolled oats, plus a hint of molasses for extra flavor. Each loaf is hand-shaped and then baked on the hearth for a rustic look and a well-rounded flavor. Rustico Bread is dense with flavor and a good source of fiber (4 grams per slice), and each slice contains just 80 calories. We like this bread for a sandwich, toasted for breakfast, or with dinner. Any way you slice it (oh, actually, it's already sliced!), we think you'll like it, too. We're selling each 22 ounce loaf-with about 22 slices per loaf- for $2.99. You'll find it in our bakery section.
093459.name: Soft Multigrain Rustico Bread A Soft, Rustic Sandwich Bread With Rolled Oats, Molasses, Flax Seeds, Sesame Seeds And Sunflower Seeds

093916.description: Trader Joe's Multigrain Slims Trader Joe's Multigrain Slims are kind of like a cross between bread and a burger bun, slim in stature and huge in taste. We make these with wholesome grains and seeds - thus, the "multigrain" moniker - and they're an excellent source of fiber, with five grams in each serving (one 2-piece "roll"). But wait, there's more (no, really, there is). Each Multigrain Slim has only 100 calories and a single gram of fat. These little buns are slim and sturdy - we like them best when toasted or lightly grilled. Use them in place of a big bun for your burger, or for any kind of sandwich. We are selling each 12 oz package of Trader Joe's Multigrain Slims for just $2.49. These are open for ordering Monday, March 7, 2011. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin03/02/2011 page 35 of 42 Confidential
093916.name: Multigrain Slims
093916.title: Whole Wheat Slims

095317.description: Trader Joe's Classic Hamburger Buns Our Classic Hamburger Buns are reminiscent of that true diner experience - oversized buns for hefty burgers and all the toppings - soft dough that is slightly sweet, golden brown on the outside and topped with sesame seeds. We are selling each 12 oz Trader Joe's Classic Hamburger Buns for just $2.29. These are available to order on Monday, April 25, 2011.
095317.name: Classic Hamburger Buns

095823.description: The simple fact that we've named these tortillas "de mi Abuela," which translates to "from my Grandmother," should indicate to you that we're not messing around here. After all, this is Grandma we're talking about. She's special. And we would only use her name for really special tortillas. (To be clear, Grandma is not making these tortillas for us; she's far too busy taking hip-hop classes and learning to make sushi at the rec center.) Trader Joe's Corn & Wheat Tortillas de mi Abuela are soft, easy-to-roll, homemade-style tortillas that represent the best tortilla-making traditions, with a distinctly Trader Joe's twist. They're crafted with a unique blend of corn and wheat that gives them their soft, pliable texture and their uniquely rich flavor profile. They're low in fat, and every serving is packed with whole grains. Use them to make soft tacos and quesadillas, or to wrap sandwiches filled with whatever suits your mood. We're selling each 11.57-ounce package of eight Corn & Wheat Tortillas de mi Abuela for $1.99, a price that suits our mood, every day. You'll find them in our bakery section.
095823.name: Corn & Wheat Abuela Tortillas
095823.title: De Mi Abuela My Grandmother'S Corn & Wheat Tortillas

098214.description: Hot Dog Buns We listened when you told us that the Whole Wheat buns were great, but you'd really like a traditional white hot dog bun for those customers who prefer that. And for kids, the white hot dog bun rules! So, for the grilling/BBQ season, we are introducing a classic hot dog buns, top sliced. We're selling each 12 oz package of eight Trader Joe's Hot Dog Buns for $1.99. Opens for 1st orders June 18, 2012.
098214.name: Hot Dog Buns 8 Buns

098713.description: Trader Joe's Multigrain Fiber Bread is a "must try." You could say it's the best thing since sliced bread. In fact, it is sliced bread. It also happens to be one of the best-tasting sliced breads we've encountered in all of our bread- eating adventures... and we've had our fair share of bread-eating adventures. Our Multigrain Fiber Bread is made for us with whole wheat flour and a mix of other whole grains-like wheat berries, millet, organic barley flakes, organic corn grits, pumpkin seeds, flax seeds, etc. It's dense but moist, hearty yet soft, and sweetened with just a touch of honey and brown sugar. As the name implies, Multigrain Fiber Bread is an excellent source of fiber, boasting five grams per slice. It also happens to have three grams of protein per 90-calorie slice-so if you're using it to make a traditional sandwich, you're getting a six grams of protein from your bread alone! Trader Joe's Multigrain Fiber Bread is suitable for sandwiches of all styles and tip-top for toast of all types. Any way you slice it (actually, it's already sliced!), you're bound to enjoy it. We're selling each 24-ounce loaf for $2.99. You'll find it in our bakery section.
098713.name: Multigrain Fiber Bread
098713.title: Fiber Multigrain Bread

198214.description: Humphrey Bogart once declared, "A hot dog at the ballpark is better than a steak at the Ritz." While we love a good steak as much as the next Joe, we must admit that, especially come summer time, we're inclined to agree. And luckily for you and for hot dogs everywhere, we've got Trader Joe's Hot Dog Buns. Our Hot Dog Buns are good-sized buns made with unbleached wheat flour, and, boy, do they deliver. Soft and fluffy with just the right amount of chew, and made with a split top for a classic, ballpark feel, you wouldn't want any other bun to support your dog. And while a dog (think Uncured Organic Grass Fed Beef Hot Dogs [sku 89703], for example) might be the most logical Hot Dog Bun occupant, why stop there? Your favorite TJ's sausage, some homemade crab or egg salad-heck, you can stuff 'em with anything! And since they're made in a slightly larger size than a typical bun, you have all the more room to add in the fixings, like Fire Roasted Bell Pepper & Onions [sku 99437], Sauerkraut [sku 53094[, or Hot & Sweet Jalapeños [sku 56688]. Hot Dog Buns
198214.name: Buns Hot Dog White

061463.description: What on this beautiful, green Earth is more exciting than produce bags, hmm?! If your answer is, "Gee, just about anything, Trader Joe's," then, well... (a) you're wrong, and (b) very funny, smart aleck. Because there is something on this beautiful green Earth that's more exciting than produce bags-and that's the arrival of our new, fully Compostable Produce Bags! First introduced to stores served by our Lacey warehouse in December, these new Produce Bags are the biggest thing to happen to loose produce since, well, loose produce. They're soft, thin, and fluffy (feel them-we're not kidding), and they make the perfect repository for a fistful of plums or an armful of potatoes-whatever is on the menu. Made of Mater-Bi®, a patented bioplastic made from corn and other renewable agricultural resources, these will full biodegrade within 180 days, and they're suitable for municipal and home compost operations. Each roll of Compostable Produce Bags will fit perfectly in your store's existing produce bag brackets, so there is no need for extra hardware. Simply open up the Store Portal and order away! There are 36 rolls per case and 2,664 Bags per roll, which is a grand total of 95,904 opportunities (per case) to be just a bit kinder to the environment. Exciting stuff, indeed.
061463.name: Produce Bags 14" X 18" Compostable

066784.name: Bag Tj Flowers Compostable 1000 Per Case

035784.description: There is plenty of folklore and legend associated with the madeleine. Some say that these soft, cake-like cookie were first baked in Lorraine, France and named after a central character in the region's history. Others allege that they were named after the French woman who first discovered them on a pilgrimage to Compostela, Spain. Regardless of where they came from, we know this much is true: the popularity of the classic madeleine endures. And as soon as you sink your teeth into a Trader Joe's Madeleine Cookie, you'll understand why. Trader Joe's Madeleine Cookies are made for us by a Northern California bakery that has specialized in baking madeleines for over 40 years, using just four ingredients-sugar, butter, eggs, and natural flavors. Per tradition, our Madeleines are soft, moist, buttery, and cake-like. Also per tradition, they're baked in scalloped molds, giving them that distinctive, fancy shell shape that makes a Madeleine and Madeleine. Enjoy a Trader Joe's Madeleine Cookie or two anytime you're craving a bit of sweetness. They pair beautifully with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, and they also compliment a strong cup of TJ's Earl Grey de la Creme Tea [sku 59213] or TJ's French Roast Coffee [sku 93048]. We're selling each 3.6-ounce, six-cookie sleeve of Madeleines for $2.99, every day. They're fancy Cookies at a not-so-fancy price, and you'll find them in our bakery section. 02.26. 18
035784.name: Madeleines
035784.title: Madeleine Cookies

052812.description: Chocolate Brooklyn Babka is a sweet, swirly brioche-meets-cake loaf rooted in Eastern European Jewish traditions. In both Polish and Yiddish, "babka" is the diminutive of "baba," meaning "grandmother." And the character of this sweet, fluffy, chocolate-laden cake lives up to its namesake-welcoming you with open arms and old-world charm, just as your baba would. Trader Joe's Chocolate Brooklyn Babka is made for us by a small, kosher bakery in-where else?-Brooklyn, New York that literally grew out of their grandmother's kitchen. Following time-honored recipes and baking methods, they make a real babka's Babka. It doesn't get much better. Crafted from scratch in small batches, the sweet yeast dough is spread with a rich chocolate filling and twisted by hand before it goes into a high loaf pan to be proofed and baked. The rich veins of chocolate reveal themselves as swirls when the Babka is sliced. Beautiful. Delicious! For those Seinfeldians in the crowd, you know that a Babka will make you a "hero" at a dinner party. For those who never watched the sitcom, take our word for it-it's a sensational dessert, fully of dessert heroism. Of course, if you want to champion breakfast, it's a sure thing, too. Great with a cup of coffee or a glass of chilled milk, served warm or at room temperature, "You can't beat a Babka!" And you can't beat our price on Babkas, either. We're selling each 18-ounce, kosher-certified Chocolate Brooklyn Babka for $4.99. Find it with our other fresh-baked breads and cakes! Detail of a Babka Slice
052812.name: Chocolate Babka
052812.title: Chocolate Brooklyn Babka

053842.description: Cake is too often relegated to special occasions. That's partially because it takes too much time and effort to bake one for 'no particular reason.' Of course, premade cakes are always an option, but what's typically available for purchase is either too fancy (and expensive) for everyday enjoyment, or just poor quality. Trader Joe's Chantilly Cream Vanilla Bean Mini Sheet Cake is the yummy solution for people who crave quality cake-even when it's nobody's birthday. This cake is "Mini"-about 6 servings. It's a single layer of moist, flavorful cake made with buttermilk, cream, & ground vanilla beans for extra richness. A delicious Vanilla Bean buttercream icing (made with butter, cream, and cream cheese) is generously spread on top, adding a decadent touch to this simple cake. Our Mini Sheet Cake is casual and small enough that your family can enjoy it as a special treat anytime. It's also fancy and big enough to serve at an intimate dinner party. (And, you can always add candles and an icing-message on top for a mini- birthday celebration.) No need to refrigerate-the re-closeable, clear-top lid helps to keep it fresh for up to six days. So, don't wait until it's someone's birthday before you enjoy your next slice of cake. Each 18-ounce Trader Joe's Chantilly Cream Vanilla Bean Mini Sheet Cake is just $4.49-the perfect price and the perfect size to justify a celebration everyday! You'll find it on our bakery tables.
053842.name: Chantilly Cream Vanilla Bean Mini Sheet Cake

053843.description: Cake is too often relegated to special occasions. That's partially because it takes too much time and effort to bake one for 'no particular reason.' Of course, premade cakes are always an option, but what's typically available for purchase is either too fancy (and expensive) for everyday enjoyment, or just poor quality. Trader Joe's Dark Chocolate Ganache Mini Sheet Cake is the yummy solution for people who crave quality cake-even when it's nobody's birthday. This cake is "Mini"-about 6 servings. It's a single layer of moist, flavorful chocolate cake made with buttermilk for extra richness. A delicious Dark Chocolate Ganache icing (made with butter, cream, & cream cheese) is generously spread on top, adding a decadent touch to this simple cake. Our Mini Sheet Cake is casual and small enough that your family can enjoy it as a special treat anytime. It's also fancy and big enough to serve at an intimate dinner party. (And, you can always add candles and an icing-message on top for a mini-birthday celebration.) No need to refrigerate-the re-closeable, clear-top lid helps to keep it fresh for up to six days. So, don't wait until it's someone's birthday before you enjoy your next slice of cake. Each 18-ounce Trader Joe's Dark Chocolate Ganache Mini Sheet Cake is just $4.49-the perfect price and the perfect size to justify a celebration everyday! You'll find it on our bakery tables.
053843.name: Chocolate Mini Sheet Cake
053843.title: Dark Chocolate Ganache Mini Sheet Cake

054233.description: Gluten-free cake is hard to find. Tasty gluten free cake is even harder to find. How about a gluten free cupcake? Or, even more elusive, a gluten free mini cupcake? Probably impossible. As you know, though, we scoff at the impossible here at Trader Joe's. Introducing: Trader Joe's Gluten Free Mini Cupcakes, now easily found in our bakery section. We set out to make a cupcake that was both miniature and gluten free, giving it the advantage of not one but two adjectives over the ordinary cupcake. Originally, these were going to be called "Gluten Free Buttercream- Frosted Chocolate and Vanilla Two-Bite Cupcakes," but that was a bit of a mouthful - and you'll need your mouth free to enjoy these yummy cakes. Tasty, tiny, toothsome treats like these are just what the doctor ordered (well, maybe not...). Our Mini Cupcakes are made with rice flour, making them gluten free and just as irresistibly delicious as any of their wheat-flour counterparts. We've included six chocolate and six vanilla cupcakes, topped with corresponding chocolate or vanilla velvety buttercream frosting. You might find that one two-bite cupcake leaves you wanting another two-bite cupcake. Lucky for you, each 12-ounce package of Trader Joe's Gluten Free Mini Cupcakes comes with twelve Cupcakes - and for the extraordinary price of $3.99, you can enjoy all twelve. You'll find them on our bakery tables.
054233.name: Cupcakes Gluten Free Chocolate & Vanilla Mini
054233.title: Gluten Free Mini Cupcakes

056724.description: If there's one thing we could use a little more of these days, it's unity. From worldy matters to deciding what to eat for dinner (Trader Joe's being the obvious answer for that one), we could all use a little more togetherness. Thankfully, our product developers have reached a consensus and decided the best way to bring a little agreement among us all is... drum roll... cookies! Trader Joe's Half Moon Cookies, to be specific. The POTUS had the right idea when at a bakery he was visiting back in 2008 he personally dubbed a batch of half moon cookies "unity cookies." Such presidential action serves to confirm our theory: Nothing brings more harmony than people sharing sweet, circular snacks. (That may be a tad hyperbolic, but really, who doesn't love cookies?!) With Trader Joe's Half Moon Cookies, we all get to experience unity, firsthand. Each moist, cake-like vanilla cookie agrees wonderfully with the smooth, chocolate and vanilla icings that share its cookie-top. The half- moon visual suggests a yin-yang oneness, as does the alluring, vanilla-cocoa aroma. Our supplier in Brooklyn, New York must have wanted as many people as possible to share in these wonderfully handcrafted cookies, since they're certified kosher (pareve) and low in sodium (30mg per cookie). Even the cookies themselves are pros when it comes to co-operation: Our Half Moon Cookies pair naturally with coffee, tea, milk... And as one final act of solidarity, Trader Joe's has declared that this 10-ounce package of ten cookies will sell for just $2.99. And that's in hopes that everyone will enjoy them together! 08.29. 16
056724.name: Half Moon Cookies
056724.title: Trader Joe'S Half Moons

057051.description: Mini Orange Cranberry Tea Scones Scones originated in Scotland, as a quick bread (not containing yeast, and leavened with baking powder). The first known mention of the word dates back to 1513, so scones have been around for a long, long time. Our new mini orange cranberry scones come nice and rounded and have that classic scone texture: Moist, slightly crumbly and buttery. The combination of orange zest, orange oil and orange juice, along with the dried cranberries and buttermilk, adds wonderful flavor. Great toasted (or not!) with whipped cream, butter, or your favorite preserve. (Note: These scones replace existing Cranberry Orange Scones, SKU 94202.) We're selling each 12 oz package of six Trader Joe's Mini Orange Cranberry Tea Scones for $3.99.
057051.name: Mini Orange Cranberry Scones
057051.title: Pastry Scone Mini Orange Cranberry

060957.description: Trader Joe's Raspberry Stars are actually already a famous TJ's product, but you probably know them under their other stage name: Raspberry Hearts [sku 58408]. Yes, for a very brief time during the season of love (a.k.a. Valentine's Day), we offer Raspberry Hearts, shaped like hearts and filled with thick, sweet raspberry jam. They're such a hit during this short time that we wanted to bring them back during another time of year when sweet, seasonally-appropriate cookies were popular. And now here they are. The sugar cookie dough used to make these Stars is based on the famous Linzertorte from Linz, Austria. It's rolled and, during this time of year, cut into fabulous stars. Because two star cookies are better than one, we then take two of these stars and unite them together using a sweet, seedless raspberry jam made from Meeker raspberries.
