Very similar to brown sugar, it is sweet with slight caramel overtones. Long a traditional sweetener used throughout much of Asia, Coconut Sugar is becoming quite popular in the United States. It is made from the coconut palm, and all things coconut continue to be hot. Moreover, it is considered to be a more desirable alternative to refined or chemically synthesized sweetener alternatives, in part, because it is purported to retain some nutrients and to be lower on the Glycemic Index. These claims may have some appeal, but the fact is - it's sugar with a nice caramelized flavor. It is delightful for baking, makes a perfect topping for oatmeal or fresh-cut fruit, and adds tickle-your-tounge dimension to an array of dishes, beverages or sauces. Made from organically grown coconut palms in Indonesia, our Organic Coconut Sugar is as sweet as can be, especially at our price of $3.99 for each 16 ounce bag.
096071.name: Org Coconut Sugar

097210.description: Inside the resealable zipper pouch you'll find only one ingredient - Fair Trade Turbinado Raw Cane Sugar. Grown on sugar plantations by our suppliers, the sugar cane is cut by hand, then delivered to the mill where the juice is simply crushed from the cane. The evaporation process produces perfect sugar crystals, retaining some of the original molasses, giving its subtle caramel flavor and light, golden-brown color. Turbinado sugar is also known as Raw Sugar because it's minimally processed (this is the raw-est form of cane sugar you'll get - completely raw cane sugar is not suitable for consumption). This Cane Sugar can be easily substitutable for brown sugar. Make a cinnamon streusel with 2 tablespoon of TJ's Turbinado Sugar and 2 teaspoons of TJ's Ground Cinnamon [sku 46156] in the middle of Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix [sku 80958] for cakes or cupcakes. Start with a cup of TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar [sku 59227] and your choice of milk, keep adding 1 tablespoon until your desired thickness of frosting, sprinkle with chopped pecans if you desire a bit of a sweet n' salty crunch. You'll even love it as a body, foot, or face exfoliant that you can scrub, rinse and repeat! It smells delightful and works wonders. Still need further convincing? It's vegan, kosher certified, Fair Trade, and it's a tremendous value for Trader Joe's Turbinado Raw Cane Sugar at $3.49* for a two-pound resealable bag. You'll find it in our grocery aisle. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Fair Trade Turbinado Raw Cane Sugar
097210.name: Turbinado Raw Cane Sugar

098333.description: More substantial than a chocolate chip cookie, and decidedly more savory than their cocoa-infused successor, the brownie, blondies have carved out a niche all their own in the pantheon of handheld baked goods. And in the pantheon of Trader Joe's baking mixes, we've carved out a niche for blondies in the form of Trader Joe's Blondie Bar Baking Mix, to take you from dreaming of these tantalizing treats to eating them in just under 40 minutes. Picture this: a marvelously convenient Mix, including baking basics (namely, unbleached wheat flour, sugar, brown sugar, salt, and baking soda) punctuated with semisweet chocolate chips and the masterful addition of molasses powder. Combined with an egg and a stick of melted butter, the resulting Bars bake up crisp on top with a delightfully chewy center, replete with notes of butterscotch and vanilla. Enjoy them alone, alongside an ice-cold glass of milk, or as the base of a luxuriously layered Peanut Butter & Banana Blondie Bar (see traderjoes.com for the recipe!). One way or another, you're sure to experience dessert rapture in every Blondie Bar bite. Blondie Bar Baking Mix
098333.name: Blondie Bar Baking Mix

055923.description: Sometimes, you just want a hamburger. Fast-food is the quickest, easiest solution, but most people want more than just a good-tasting burger; they also want to know exactly what's in the meat (besides meat), and under what conditions it was prepared. Both of these questions aren't easily answered by just cruising through the drive-thru. As is so often the case, Trader Joe's offers a better solution for the quick-burger-fix: 80% Lean/20% Fat - Ground Beef Patties. Though it doesn't take a star-studded Michelin chef to form ground beef into patties, it's definitely a time-saver to open up a fresh package of our all-Beef Patties and slap them directly on your grill or fry-pan. As for what goes in them, it's simple: 100% Ground Beef that is 80% Lean and 20% Fat. We've discovered this is just the right ratio to produce a juicy, flavorful burger. Each package is approximately one pound and contains four pre-formed Beef Patties (about four ounces each). Warm up a cast-iron frying pan over medium heat with a pad of butter in the center. When the butter melts, briefly toast four TJ's Honey Wheat Hamburger Buns [sku 30321] and set aside. Add more butter, and sprinkle your Patties with salt and pepper before placing in the hot pan-if there's no sizzle, turn up the heat! About three minutes per side should get you to about medium-rare. That's six minutes per burger, and about ten minutes total for a super-fast, family meal! We've been selling Trader Joe's 80% Lean/20% Fat - Ground Beef Patties since the fall on the Coasts. Now, we're going national, making them available to the rest of the country for the same economical price of $4.99 per pound. 04.04. 16
055923.name: Ground Beef Hamburger Patties 80/20
055923.title: Ground Beef Patties 80/20

056216.description: Though we're very proud of what we offer in our stores, we believe there's always room to improve. We listen to customer feedback and spend lots of time assessing (and re-assessing!) the quality of our products through regular tastings. And even when there's no beef about it, it's not rare for us to designate an item for further de- velopment. Speaking of rare beefs, we've taken a recent opportunity to improve all of the Steak we stock in our fresh meat case. With our focus on taste, quality, and consistency-we've updated the variety of grades and specific cuts we offer. We now provide nine Steaks (reduced from thirteen), presented in three tiers: Ungraded Steaks, Choice Grade Steaks, and All Natural No Antibiotics Ever Choice Grade Steaks. Trader Joe's Choice Premium Angus Beef Filet Mignon Steak is one of four cuts we offer on the Choice Grade tier-the grade just below USDA Prime (usually found only in fine restaurants). Mignon means "cute" in French, implying the dainty and tender nature of this cut. Coming from a non-weight bearing muscle on the animal, the filet has significantly less connective tissue, making it the most tender and arguably most desirable Steak. It's also very lean-with minimal fat marbling-presenting a moderate flavor given to preparations including wrapping in bacon or plating with a rich sauce. However you choose to enjoy it, we know you'll find the quality of Trader Joe's Choice Premium Angus Beef Filet Mignon Steak hard to beat-especially at our price of $21.99 per pound. 12.04. 16
056216.name: Prem Choice Angus Filet Mignon
056216.title: Usda Choice Premium Angus Beef Filet Mignon Steak

Trader Joe's Choice Premium Angus Beef Rib Eye Steak is one of four cuts we offer on the Choice Grade tier-the grade just below USDA Prime (usually found only in fine restaurants). A Rib Eye is a rib steak with the bone removed. Coming from the rib cage area, it's a muscle that's only lightly worked, making it one of the more tender steaks available. And as the "eye" (center of the rib steak), it's also the most flavorful part. Our Choice Angus Beef Rib Eye is rich with fat marbling that not only allows it to maintain its tenderness during almost any kind of cooking, it also helps provide beefy, melt-in-your-mouth flavor. However you choose to enjoy it, we know you'll find the quality of Trader Joe's Choice Premium Angus Beef Rib Eye Steak hard to beat-especially at our price of $16.99 per pound ($15.99 in Texas). 12.04. 16

What makes Trader Joe's All Natural New York Strip extra special is that in addition to meeting the USDA's requirements for "All Natural" meat (minimally processed with no artificial ingredients), our Angus have never received antibiotics, or additional hormones, ever! Trader Joe's All Natural USDA Choice Premium Angus Beef New York Strip Steak will probably be one of the most attribute-rich (not to mention, tasty) pieces of meat you'll ever enjoy. All those attributes combined with our $17.99 per pound price surely make this a value hard to beat! 12.04. 16

058258.description: For some time now, we've been working on revamping our fresh meats section. We started by offering Beef Filet Mignon Steaks [sku 56226] and USDA Choice Premium Angus Beef Filet Mignon Steaks [sku 56216] in stores at the beginning of the year. Now, we've got something even more exceptionally rare: Trader Joe's USDA Choice Angus Center Cut Filet Mignon Steaks. Two small words make all the difference here: Center Cut. While we already offer a Choice Grade filet mignon, this Steak takes it up one more notch. Coming from the tenderloin of Angus cattle, these Center Cut Filet Mi- gnons are thick and more uniform in size, allowing for consistent cooking of the tender, buttery beef. Our sup- plier hand-trims these filets for consistency in size, quality, and color. And yet another rare attribute? The USDA Choice Grade: it's just one notch below USDA Prime Grade, which is usually only available in fine restaurants. How's that for a quality cut? Because the tenderloin cut comes from a muscle that does very little work, the meat produced has less connec- tive tissue and is therefore the most tender, lean cut of beef. Prepare our Center Cut Filets by wrapping in bacon or plating with a rich sauce to add a punch of flavor to an otherwise moderately flavored-yet tender-filet. For the incredibly rare price of $22.99 per pound, there's not much at stake here, aside from a satiating dinner. Pick up a package of USDA Choice Angus Center Cut Filet Mignon Steaks at your local Trader Joe's today. 08.201 6
058258.name: Prem Center Cut Filet Mignon
058258.title: Center Cut Filet Mignon Steak

060981.description: Picture the scene: it's time for a big holiday meal. The table is set, family and friends fill the seats around it, and the food is ready. But what is that food that everyone's so excited to dig into? We're guessing the star of the meal is Trader Joe's Choice Premium Angus Beef Boneless Rib Roast, because if anything is worthy of being the holiday meal centerpiece, it is this. So, what makes our Rib Roast so incredibly special? Where to begin¿ Rib roasts come from the primal rib section-the same section ribeye steaks are cut from. We've sourced roasts only from Angus cattle raised in the U.S. and fed all-vegetarian diets. What's more? These roasts also fall into the upper two-thirds of the Choice grading scale, meaning it's got more marbling and just a notch below USDA Prime. Only about one in fifty steaks meet this strict specification. There's a fat cap on each roast, giving it su- preme melt-in-your-mouth flavor. The entire boneless roast is wrapped in netting to keep it from expanding during the roasting process, leaving you with a tasty, roast-shaped roast. For such a delicious dinner centerpiece, our Rib Roast is quite easy to prepare. For the ideal roast, you'll want to have a meat thermometer and a roasting rack. Simply rub the roast with olive oil, salt, and pepper and follow the roasting directions on the package for the perfect holiday delicacy. One more thing that makes Trader Joe's Choice Premium Angus Beef Boneless Rib Roast exceptional: the value. We're selling this only-for-the-holidays Roast for $11.99 per pound-the same price as the bone-in roast we sold last year. A more-than-worthy holiday meal superstar. 12.04. 17
060981.name: Prem Choice Bnls Rib Roast
060981.title: Usda Choice Premium Angus Beef Boneless Prime Rib Roast

062030.description: If there's any truth to the old adage that you are what you eat, then it stands to reason that you should probably pay attention to what your food eats, too. That's the philosophy behind grass-fed beef, the increasingly popular category of meat from cows raised on diets of grass, alfalfa, and other foraged plants, which the cows naturally graze on in open pastures. The resulting beef, like our Trader Joe's Grass Fed Organic Top Sirloin Beef Steak, tends to be leaner, more savory, and, as grass fed beef fans tend to describe it, just plain "meatier" in taste. Of course, the ranchers who produce our Grass Fed Organic Top Sirloin take things one step further-in ad- dition to raising their cattle on an exclusively foraged diet, they also adhere to strict USDA organic guidelines, meaning the cattle are never given hormones or antibiotics, and the pastures they feed from are grown entirely without GMOs or chemical pesticides. That's right: These cows don't just eat grass, they eat organic grass. How's that for watching for your diet? So the question arises: how best to prepare such a carefully cultivated cut of meat? We recommend keeping it simple-some light seasoning, a quick sear in the pan over low heat and about 10 minutes in an oven pre-heated to 350°F will do nicely. Or, if you're feeling more adventurous, let your sirloin marinate in a mix of Soy Sauce [sku 26426], Toasted Sesame Oil [sku 24827], Organic Brown Sugar [76513], and Simpler Times Lager [92188] overnight, then cook over a hot grill for five to six minutes per side, or until a meat thermometer reads 145°F. If you are what you eat, does eating a perfectly seared Grass Fed Organic Top Sirloin Beef Steak make you grass-fed, too? That's for the philosophers to decide. In the meantime, we're selling each 6 oz. steak for $7.49, every day. You'll find them in our refrigerated meat case. 07.09. 18
062030.name: Org Grassfed Top Sirloin
062030.title: Grass Fed Organic Top Sirloin Beef Steak No Antibiotics, No Added Hormones

071476.description: Among the benefits of traveling the world in search of deliciousness is realizing that some of the best tasting foods have some of the most interesting names. To wit: gyoza, baklava and gazpacho. Another of our perennial favorites? Bool Kogi. Traditionally served in Korean barbeque restaurants (and often translated as one word, bulgogi), Bool Kogi is what Koreans call sweet, sesame-soy-garlic marinated boneless beef ribs. The literal translation of Bool Kogi is "fire meat." This is likely a reference to the flame used in cooking the meat. It could also refer to the spicy sauces that often accompany it. There's even a chance it's an allusion to an actual fire, but we've looked into this, and it doesn't appear to be the case. In any event, to enjoy it at home, just fire up your grill or broiler and cook the meat very quickly over high heat. Serve inside fresh lettuce leaves, with (or without) a spicy sauce like TJ's Sriracha Sauce [sku 50828], for a quick, flavorful, lettuce taco-style meal that will certainly have you and your guests fired up. Bool Kogi is flavorful enough that you can serve it with no sauce at all. Slice it up for salads or sandwiches, or make it the center of attention at dinner any night of the week. Bool Kogi from Trader Joe's comes in random-weight, vacuum-sealed packages for $9.99 per pound, a price that has us all fired up and ready to grill!
071476.name: Beef Bool Kogi (12/Pk)
071476.title: Meat Beef Conv Bool Kogi

072321.description: So many meat preparations major on the savory-salty side. Of course, there's nothing wrong with that! However, there are times when something a little sweeter hits the meat spot. Trader Joe's Sesame Teriyaki Beef Skirt Steak delivers, when that's what you're craving. Inside the package is a cut of USDA Choice Angus beef that becomes very tender when cooked. It's marinating in a Sesame Teriyaki sauce, which includes soy sauce, honey, and sesame seeds. The flavor will appeal to those who love the sweet, soy & sesame flavor of classic teriyaki. Grill it over high heat to create a coveted char. Or slice it thinly and stir fry on the stovetop with your favorite veggies. Either way, Trader Joe's Sesame Teriyaki Beef Skirt Steak will become a new favorite, not only for its flavor profile, but also for its ease of preparation. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Sesame Teriyaki Beef Skirt Steak
072321.name: Beef Cab Teriyaki Skirt
072321.title: Sesame Teriyaki Beef Skirt Steak

079580.description: One of the great joys of the warmer months is grilling your own burgers at home. Trader Joe's has always been an enthusiastic supporter of home-grillers, with our top-quality ground beef options, such as 85/15 Organic Grass Fed Ground Beef [sku 92558], and 80/20 Ground Beef Patties [sku 55923]. For those looking for a ready- for-the-grill burger with a uniquely flavorful twist, you'll want to try Trader Joe's Angus C.B.P. Ground Beef 1/3 lb. Patties. This is a Ground blend of three different whole-muscle cuts of Angus beef. Angus refers to the more muscular Aberdeen Angus cattle breed, which yields meat with plenty of fat marbling. This marbling translates into juicy, tender meat. More specifically, this C.B.P. blend incorporates Angus cuts from the shoulder (Chuck), chest (Brisket), and rump (Picanha). The Brisket (20% of the blend) and Picanha (5%) each contribute amazingly rich flavor, with their slightly fattier composition, while the leaner and more conventional ground Chuck (75%) brings additional 'beefiness' and balance. All of this amounts to a Ground Beef blend that is about 75% lean/25% fat-ideal for quick, hot grilling. And the substantial size of these pre-portioned 1/3 lb. Patties allows them to remain tender & juicy, even when cooked over the flames. The resulting bigger burgers will also easily fill TJ's Brioche Buns [sku 61752] to satisfy even the hungriest BBQ-goers-but only for a limited time. Find 21.3-ounce (1 lb. 5.3 oz.) packages of four Trader Joe's Angus C.B.P. Ground Beef Patties in our refrigerators, while the summer grilling season lasts. Angus C.B.P. Ground Beef 1/3 lb Patties
079580.name: Angus Beef C.B.P. Blend Hamburger Patties
079580.title: Angus Chuck, Brisket & Sirloin Beef Patties

079720.description: When you read the words "juicy burger," turkey is not likely the first meat that comes to mind-but what if it was? Our product developer set out to answer this very question while working to create summertime stars for grilling season (May to September, to be precise), and much to our tasting panel's delight, he emerged victorious from the test kitchen with Trader Joe's Caramelized Onion & Bell Pepper Turkey Patties. Made with 100% thigh meat, these grill-ready Turkey Patties are unbelievably-dare we say impossibly-juicy. The Caramelized Onion brings plenty of umami to the table, while the vegetal sweetness of the Bell Pepper deftly complements the savory Turkey in each tender bite. Thanks to their fuss-free prep and quick-cooking nature, you'll have more time to ponder your preferred burger accoutrements (Brioche Bun [sku 61752]? Sliced Swiss Cheese [sku 73333]? Aioli Garlic Mustard Sauce [sku 27677]? Yes, yes, and oh, yes!), as well as more time to bask in the glow of a relaxing summer's evening. For a limited time, you'll find this incredibly priced, grilling season must-have in the refrigerators at your neighborhood Trader Joe's. Caramelized Onion & Bell Pepper Turkey Patties
079720.name: Turkey Burger Patties Onion
079720.title: Caramelized Onion & Bell Pepper Turkey Patties

081909.description: Trader Joe's Carne Asada Auténtica, a must-have for any summer soirée, is made with impeccably trimmed, hand-butterflied beef sirloin, so it cooks in mere minutes over a very hot grill or in a very hot pan. (Tip: Using high heat seals in the flavors of the meat and the citrus-y, ever-so-slightly spicy marinade.) The authentically flavored marinade is made just for us-we worked with one of our longtime suppliers to create this very traditional, northern-Mexico-inspired blend of citrus & spice-it elevates mere meat to something really special. Carne Asada is a natural for tacos, burritos, or fajitas and can also hold its own center-of-the-plate, along with all the traditional accompaniments of Mexican cuisine (we're thinking sour cream, guacamole, cilantro...). Or add grilled peppers and onions and some mild cheese, then fork it on a hearty, sliced roll to make a cheese steak sandwich with a distinctive personality. We're selling Trader Joe's Carne Asada Auténtica in random weight packages for $8.49 a pound in East Coast stores and $8.99 a pound in Southeast and Midwest stores. You'll find it in our fresh meat cases.
081909.name: Carne Asada Autentica

090570.name: Santa Maria Tri Tip
090570.title: All Natural Santa Maria Brand Boneless Beef Tri Tip Roast

091871.description: At Trader Joe's, beef with an "All Natural" designation goes beyond the definition set out by the USDA. It comes from cattle that are raised without the use of antibiotics, synthetic hormones, or other growth stimulants-ever. And by "ever," we mean "never." The cattle are fed a 100% vegetarian diet, resulting in well-marbled meat that's tender and flavorful. Trader Joe's All Natural Stew Meat is well-trimmed beef, cut into chunks that are the ideal size for soups, stews, stroganoff, or even a super chunky chili. Add to your slow cooker or pressure cooker with a little imagination, and you can make a memorable meal with memorably minimal effort. Our price of $8.49 a pound is a tremendous value for meat meeting our definition of all natural.
091871.name: No Antibiotics Ever Beef Stew Meat (12/Pk)
091871.title: Meat Beef Nat Stew Meat Lean

092558.description: Trader Joe's Organic 85/15 Ground Beef comes from organically raised cattle that are never given antibiotics or artificial growth hormones. The cattle are 100% grass fed, grazing on wide-open pastures-their diet of natural grasses and vegetation contributes to full-flavored, well-marbled beef that's rich in healthful Omega-3 fatty acids. Raising cattle organically, on grass, is a significantly more expensive endeavor than raising them via conventional methods. If you've ever wondered why organic, grass-fed meat is more costly than conventional beef, this is why-it requires more space, more time, and more labor. At Trader Joe's, we work diligently to ensure that though the price may be higher, it represents excellent value. With that in mind, our Organic Grass Fed Ground Beef is $6.99 for a one pound package, which is a terrific value for organic, grass fed ground beef, a price that's 50¢-a-pound less than our price last year. 85/15 refers to the ratio of lean to fat, meaning that this Organic Ground Beef is 85% lean. We've found that this ratio makes brilliant burgers; so when the urge strikes to fire up that grill, make this your go-to Ground Beef. You'll find it in our fresh meat case.
092558.name: Beef Organic Grass Fed Ground 85/15 (24/Pk)
092558.title: Organic Ground Beef 85/15

094785.description: We've offered kosher beef options in our stores for quite some time, but until now, those offerings were certified kosher by Triangle K. Triangle K is certainly a respected certifiying agency, but customers who keep strictly kosher are often more comfortable with products that have been certified by the Orthodox Union (O.U.) instead. On top of being regarded as one of the most trusted (if not the most trusted) certifying agencies in the world, the O.U. has given this Teva¿ Beef one of the most trusted levels of kosher certification in the world: Glatt kosher. Technically, "Glatt" is Yiddish for "smooth," and in the context of kashrut (Jewish law), it means that the lungs of the animal were smooth, without any adhesions. Colloquially, Glatt kosher means more or less "extra kosher," and is known to signify the highest quality and consistency. Teva¿ Glatt Kosher Angus Beef Ribeye Steak has earned its desgination; it's a well-marbled, boneless, rib cut of Beef from strictly Angus cattle that are never given growth hormones or treated with antibiotics. It's full-flavored, clean-tasting, and boldly beefy. Season and marinate, then pan-fry or grill as you please. We're selling random weight trays of Teva¿ Glatt Kosher Angus Beef Ribeye Steak for $15.49 (in West Coast & Texas stores) and $16.99 (in East Coast stores) every day. You'll find them in our fresh meat and seafood cases.
094785.name: Teva Glatt Kosher Rib Eye Steak (12/Pk)
094785.title: Meat Beef Kosher Glatt Rib Eye Boneless -Teva 12/Cs

094786.description: We've offered kosher beef options in our stores for quite some time, but until now, those offerings were certified kosher by Triangle K. Triangle K is certainly a respected certifiying agency, but customers who keep strictly kosher are often more comfortable with products that have been certified by the Orthodox Union (O.U.) instead. On top of being regarded as one of the most trusted (if not the most trusted) certifying agencies in the world, the O.U. has given this Teva¿ Beef one of the most trusted levels of kosher certification in the world: Glatt kosher. Technically, "Glatt" is Yiddish for "smooth," and in the context of kashrut (Jewish law), it means that the lungs of the animal were smooth, without any adhesions. Colloquially, Glatt kosher means more or less "extra kosher," and is known to signify the highest quality and consistency. Teva¿ Glatt Kosher Angus Beef for Stew Meat has earned its desgination; it's chuck Beef from strictly Angus cattle that are never given growth hormones or treated with antibiotics. It's full-flavored, clean-tasting, and boldly beefy, plus it's perfectly cut into manageable, stew & stir-fry-sized pieces. We're selling random weight trays of Teva¿ Glatt Kosher Angus Beef for Stew Meat for $9.99 per pound, every day. You'll find it in our fresh meat and seafood cases.
094786.name: Teva Glatt Kosher Stew Meat
094786.title: Meat Beef Kosher Glatt Stew/Stir Fry-Teva 12/Cs

094787.description: We've offered kosher beef options in our stores for quite some time, but until now, those offerings were certified kosher by Triangle K. Triangle K is certainly a respected certifiying agency, but customers who keep strictly kosher are often more comfortable with products that have been certified by the Orthodox Union (O.U.) instead. On top of being regarded as one of the most trusted (if not the most trusted) certifying agencies in the world, the O.U. has given this Teva¿ Beef one of the most trusted levels of kosher certification in the world: Glatt kosher. Technically, "Glatt" is Yiddish for "smooth," and in the context of kashrut (Jewish law), it means that the lungs of the animal were smooth, without any adhesions. Colloquially, Glatt kosher means more or less "extra kosher," and is known to signify the highest quality and consistency. Teva¿ Glatt Kosher Angus Ground Beef has earned its desgination; it's well-marbled, 85% lean/15% fat Ground Beef from strictly Angus cattle that are never given growth hormones or treated with antibiotics. It's full-flavored, clean-tasting, and boldly beefy. It makes brilliant burgers, and it's perfect for tacos, scrambles, sloppy joe's, meat marinara sauces, and more. We're selling one-pound trays of Teva¿ Glatt Kosher Angus Ground Beef for $8.49, every day. You'll find it in our fresh meat and seafood cases.
094787.name: Teva Glatt Kosher Ground 85/15
094787.title: Meat Beef Kosher Glatt Ground 85/15-Teva 12/Cs

036593.description: We like to live by the ancient proverb "you can never have too many chocolate chips in a chocolate chip cookie" and so we grabbed a crispy sugar cookie base and plopped as many chocolate chips as could possibly fit, tossed a pound of 'em in a tub and called it a day. Trader Joe's Way More Chocolate Chips Cookies are here for all of us who can never get enough of anything good. While our shoppers adore Trader Joe's Crispy Crunchy Chocolate Chip Cookies [sku 10727], we knew there was a crowd who would love the addition of more of the good stuff. Those buttery, vanilla-y, and of course chocolatey little chips exchange a little of the crunch you get from our chocolate chip cookies for a smooth, more extravagantly filled crispy cookie. Sold in 16-ounce tubs every day for $4.49*, we feel Trader Joe's Way More Chocolate Chips Cookies come in a container asking to be held in one hand and scooped in with the other. But if you don't want the cookies - or yourself - to be lonely, share with a friend and pair with a long, tall glass of milk; ice cream; or dish up and serve with tea, coffee, and a side of conversation. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Way More Chocolate Chips Cookies
036593.name: Choc Chip Way More

040978.description: Having a wonderfully warm cup of coffee or hot chocolate is a treat in its own, we 100% agree. But for some reason, we couldn't just leave it at that; we had to find a best buddy for your lonely beverage. And on that day, Trader Joe's Chocolatey Coated Chocolate Chip Dunkers were born and we will never look back. Devised with double the chocolate for milk-dunking fun in mind- might we suggest to try with chocolate milk for an extremely chocolatey treat! A flawlessly engineered oblong shape designed to dunk with ease. Crispy, crunchy, and firm so they maintain structural integrity even after being submerged in your dipping drink of choice. Trader Joe's Chocolatey Coated Chocolate Chip Dunkers are truly the ideal snack when a glass of milk or mug of coffee alone won't cut it. A tub of these will work wonders whether appropriately stored by your packs of hot cocoa mix at home in the pantry or in the breakroom at work beside that fancy new coffee machine that you can't quite work yet! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Chocolatey Coated Chocolate Chip Dunkers
040978.name: Dunkers Choc Chip Coated
040978.title: Chocolatey Coated Chocolate Chip Cookie Dunkers

063717.description: We're proud to think this addition to our array of Trader Joe's Dunkers makes our shoppers take one bite and think, "mmm, just like a cookie grandma would make during the holidays!" With wholesome oatmeal flavor and chewy bits of cranberry finding themselves in the mix, Trader Joe's Oatmeal Cranberry Dunkers bring a hearty cookie creation to your favorite local grocer. Trader Joe's Oatmeal Cranberry Dunkers are crisp, crunchy, and firm cookies that hold their shape even after being dunked in the hottest mug of coffee or the coolest bath of milk! They taste like a snow day spent indoors being whisked around by the swirling scent of cinnamon, vanilla, and pleasantly tart cranberries. The creamy white fudge icing drizzle is like something you'd find in a bakery, lending the flawless amount of sweetness to top off the Oatmeal Cranberry Dunkers. And with their genius dunkable oblong mechanical engineering at play, Trader Joe's Oatmeal Cranberry Dunkers will keep your fingers dry throughout the duration of your snacking. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Oatmeal Cranberry Dunkers
063717.name: Dunkers Oatmeal Cranberry
063717.title: Oatmeal Cranberry Dunkers Cookies With White Fudge Drizzle

067004.description: While these traditional Belgian cookies are made with a simple shopping list of ingredients, we've taken care of the shopping, baking, and packaging before you even step foot in the store! So just go ahead and cross those baking ingredients off of your list and grab a box of Trader Joe's Belgian Butter Waffle Cookies instead. Each all-butter wafer is baked to a crispy golden brown that creates a straightforward, delicious waffle cookie ready to enjoy at any time. The flavor is somewhere between a freshly baked waffle cone and shortbread cookie and is as simple as cookies come, but oh, so delicious. Super buttery, with the ideal amount of sweetness, these Belgian Butter Waffle Cookies are more versatile than you may expect. Whether you are looking for an authentic European snack to accompany a cup of tea or a mug of coffee, a companion for ice cream, or a counterpart to cheese, cured meats, and peppers, Trader Joe's Belgian Butter Waffle Cookies have a place in your shopping cart, your pantry, and your tummy. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Belgian Butter Waffle Cookies
067004.name: Belgian Butter Waffle Cookies

067005.description: While these traditional Belgian cookies are made with a simple shopping list of ingredients, we've taken care of the shopping, baking, and packaging before you even step foot in the store! So just go ahead and cross those baking ingredients off of your list and grab a box of Trader Joe's Belgian Butter Almond Thins instead. Each all-butter biscuit is baked to a crispy golden brown that creates a straightforward, delicately crispy almond thin ready to enjoy at any time. The flavor is somewhere between a freshly baked biscuit and almond shortbread cookie and is as simple as cookies come, but oh, so delicious. Super buttery, with the ideal amount of sweetness, these Belgian Butter Almond Thins are more versatile than you may expect. Whether you are looking for an authentic European snack to accompany a cup of tea or a mug of coffee, a companion for ice cream, or a counterpart to cheese, cured meats, and peppers, Trader Joe's Belgian Butter Almond Thins have a place in your shopping cart, your pantry, and your tummy. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Belgian Butter Almond Thins
067005.name: Belgian Butter Almond Thins

097232.description: The inspiration for these captivating cookies came from traditional Italian biscotti and a more modern take on granola bars. What we created from that inspiration unintentionally became an early trend setter in the "breakfast cookie" category. If you haven't yet partaken in Trader Joe's Five Seed Almond Bars, you definitely should, whether it's for breakfast, lunch, a snack, dinner, or even a dessert course with a glass of red wine. Five Seed Almond Bars do indeed boast five seeds - flax, sesame, poppy, sunflower, and pumpkin - and almonds, yet their name doesn't tell their whole story. Their recipe also includes flour and an assortment of flavorful ingredients like oats, brown & white sugar, eggs, honey, and the almonds are seasoned with cinnamon, cloves, and vanilla. Baked to a consistency that's ideally situated between chewy and crunchy, they taste wholesome, like you baked them yourself. And they are wholesome, real food. With 53mg of EPA & DHA Omega-3's, if you're going to do the cookies for breakfast thing, Five Seed Almond Bars are smart choices. With coffee or tea, crumbled into yogurt with fresh berries, or handheld, while you're busy doing all the other things you need to do in the morning. We're selling each eight ounce bag of eight Five Seed Almond Bars for $3.99*. You'll find them with the cookies, of course. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Five Seed Almond Bars
097232.name: Five Seed Almond Bars

099165.description: How could Trader Joe's call their cookie collection complete without a fun take on this Italian classic cookie? Soft to the bite, beautifully cocoa-brown to the eye, and delicious to the taste buds, Trader Joe's Soft Bite Mini Chocolate Hazelnut Biscotti cookies are a delight for all senses. The modern Italian word biscotto (singular of biscotti) comes from the medieval Latin word biscoctus, meaning "twice-cooked". A process that was used to serve the purpose of drying and preserving foods to be stored and remain fresh for long periods of time. Which is a perfectly subtle distillation of the baking process our Biscottis undergo. Each Trader Joe's Soft Bite Mini Chocolate Hazelnut Biscotti is mixed by hand in small batches using real butter, eggs, and hazelnuts throughout the process. Following this, the dough is then twice baked as per traditional biscotti baking methods. It is first baked in a loaf and then cut to bake these cut "slices" a second time for that final biscotti texture. However unlike a traditional biscotti, our Soft Bite Mini Chocolate Hazelnut Biscotti cookies are made to have a more delicate texture - almost a cross between a crispy biscotto cookie and a sugar cookie. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing.
099165.name: Biscotti Mini Choc Hazelnut
099165.title: Soft Bite Mini Chocolate Hazelnut Biscotti

004062.description: Admist the pastoral splendor and rolling, verdant hills of the New Zealand countryside, you'll find countless dairy farms covering the land. On these farms, grass-fed cows produce remarkably rich, deliciously creamy milk. On one such farm in particular, the master cheesemakers use this milk to craft a soft, easy-eating Cheddar, then age it for six to twelve months to give it a nice sharp note and full-flavored profile. And after all that, they ship it off to us, where it becomes Trader Joe's New Zealand Grass Fed Sharp Cheddar. With its mild, creamy base, punctuated nutty notes, and hint of cultured butter, this New Zealand Cheddar is quite versatile for a white Cheddar. It slices nicely for inclusion in sandwiches and burgers, it melts wonderfully for queso dips or cheesy potato soups, and postively wows when shredded and served over a fresh plate of Handsome Cut Fries [sku 96143]. And if that weren't enough, it fares just as well on a cheese plate, especially when paired with some fruit-forward or spicy red wine and a bit of dried fruit. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. New Zealand Grass Fed Sharp Cheddar
004062.name: Sharp New Zealand Cheddar
004062.title: New Zealand Sharp Cheddar Cheese

009327.description: If you find yourself wanting to dip your spoon into a stick of butter for a taste, but you feel as if this would be deemed culturally inappropriate, we have an alternative that should deliver a similar (actually better!) eating experience, without running contrary to contemporary culinary mores. That alternative is Belletoile Triple Cream and dipping a spoon into this will not only be culturally acceptable, but maybe even have a hint of class. Belletoile Triple Cream is produced in the Lorraine region of France and has similar qualities to the bries we all know and love. But what sets Belletoile Triple Cream apart from other soft-ripened cheeses like traditional brie and camembert is the addition of extra cream before the production process. This gives Belletoile its superiorly creamy and mellow mouthfeel. Of course, this additional cream and milk also comes from cows that have never been given rBST hormones. The milk is pasteurized, and to it is added the butterfat-rich cream. The fresh curds are then aged briefly; soft-ripened to develop a bloomy-white, edible rind. You get a cheese that is creamy and decadent with a rich, buttery quality-perfect as an appetizer or dessert. Serve it with fresh or dried fruit, nuts, crusty bread, or crisp crackers. The crisp acidity of a sparkling wine is the perfect complement to every slice of Belletoile Triple Cream. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Belletoile Triple Cream Cheese
009327.name: Belletoile Triple Cream Brie
009327.title: Cut Brie Triple Cream "Belletoile" (Bulk 00515)

009330.description: 'Cheddaring' noun: the stage of Cheddar cheese manufacturing where the curd is cut into small pieces to aid in draining the whey before the curds are stacked and turned. Originating in the English village of Cheddar, this process has been bringing us tangy flavored, firm cheese for nearly a thousand years! It may not be no one thousand years, but Cabot has been supplying us with Extra Sharp Cheddar Cheese for decades, and that's a great start. Every block of Cabot Extra Sharp Cheddar Cheese has its beginnings coming from Cabot's cooperative of family farmers that they've used since 1919. With that Extra Sharp designation, you better believe this Cheddar Cheese has the deep tangy flavors and crumble, hardened texture you'd expect from a cheddar aged from one and a half to two years. Its creamy, rich, and packs a citrusy tang; full-bodied flavor with an "East Coast" extra sharp bite. And with a B Corporation certification, each cut of Cabot Extra Sharp Cheddar Cheese is held to social sustainability, environmental performance, accountability, and transparency standards. So feel good about Cabot brand cheeses not only because of their dedication to the cheese making process and edible outcome, but their business operations, as well. There's no incorrect way to enjoy an Extra Sharp Cheddar Cheese that's this good! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Cabot Extra Sharp Cheddar Cheese
009330.name: Cabot Extra Sharp Cheddar

009356.description: In our famously well-stocked cheese cases, Trader Joe's had to make room for everyone's favorite Danish table cheese, of course. We've been carrying Creamy Danish Havarti Cheese for decades because we believe the semi-soft texture and fresh, buttery flavors are a great representation of the hall(den)mark Danish cheese. The story of Danish Havarti is one of a noble 1800s exploit where a farmer based just north of Copenhagen traveled around the European continent in search for knowledge about cheesemaking. When she returned from her travels in 1852, she developed the technique to make the uniquely Danish Harvati Cheese. While this technique yielded a semi-firm cheese dotted with small holes, it is a bit different than what's modernly made as "flødehavarti" or "cream Havarti". Trader Joe's Creamy Danish Havarti Cheese is made using pasteurized milk that allows whey proteins to stick around that would otherwise be eliminated while processing the curd, giving it a signature creamy texture and taste. Ripened very little, cream Havarti Cheese has a mellow, buttery aroma, much like that of Swiss cheese, and a sweet, creamy, paste with mild saltiness and nutty notes. While we're touting the lovely simplicity of our traditional Creamy Danish Havarti Cheese, it is a variety of cheese often adorned with added flavors such as dill (like our Havarti Cheese with Dill [sku 72490]), garlic, cranberries, jalapeños, you name it! It has an accessible flavor that works wonderfully as the main attraction, but is equally tasty when taking a backseat to bolder flavors. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Creamy Danish Havarti Cheese
009356.name: Denmark Havarti

009359.description: Jack. A lovely name. Whether it's Niklaus, Nicholson, or Monterey, you can always count on Jack to excel, to surprise, and most importantly, to delight. Trader Joe's Jalapeno Monterey Jack Cheese takes this delight and introduces a new dimension of flavor, witih the simple (yet brilliant!) addition of red and green jalapeño peppers. Our supplier crafts this award-winning cheese with milk from cows raised in Wisconsin and not treated with rBST. The peppers are added during the cheesemaking process; by the time the cheese is aged (a minimum of 30 days) and ready to enjoy, the jalapeño flavors are so harmoniously incorporated into the cheese, you'll find yourself wondering how the cheese could have existed without the peppers (of course it can, and it does, quite deliciously). This Jalapeno Jack delivers just the right amount of heat, without being an overtly spicy cheese. It's terrific shredded into quesadillas or burritos, memorable on a cheese plate, a natural in caseroles, and positively dreamy - and creamy -in mac & cheese. We're offering random weight wedges in our cheese case, every day. Jalapeno Monterey Jack Cheese
009359.name: Jalapeno Monterey Jack

009363.description: With a history dating back to the 1850s, Jarlsberg Cheese has been around long enough to be pretty much perfected by now. At least when we have a nibble, we can't imagine many things better on this planet. The eponymous county of Jarlsberg is just south of Oslo, and it was there that the cheese got its start after its citizens were introduced to Emmental (Swiss) cheeses and cheesemakers tried to replicate the hole-laden delight. Beneath the yellow-orange waxed rind of a wheel of Jarlsberg, filled with holes, is a semi-soft pale interior that is buttery and firm in texture with a mild, nutty flavor. Jarlsberg follows a very similar recipe to that used in days of old which itself is similar to the process for Swiss and Gouda cheeses. A versatile cheese used for both cooking and snacking, its popularity extends far beyond its Scandinavian birthplace. Jarlsberg is the most popular imported cheese in the United States and since 1979, imports have been limited to 15 millions pounds of the good stuff! While that's a ton of cheese (literally 7,500 US tons), we think its doable, and definitely edible, at least by the passion we have for filling our cheese coolers with high quality cheese of all varieties. Stop by your local Trader Joe's and get yourself a ton, or at least a small slice, for $6.99* per pound available each and every day in each and every location. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Jarlsberg Cheese
009363.name: Jarlsberg

009369.description: "The King of Cheeses". A fitting name for the age-old Parmesan Cheese that has been blessing bowls of pasta and charcuterie boards alike for centuries. We offer multiple takes on this royal cheese, but today we're talking about our ten month aged and cut Parmesan Cheese variety. Made to garnish and embellish dishes-a-plenty or serve as a snack and bring that world famous flavor and well-loved piquancy home with you! Like all other cheeses, Parmesan starts its life as a cultured milk mixture that is heated to create a hard, granular cheese. However unlike all others, Parmesan typically includes added salt as a preservative and is aged for at least a few months. We age Trader Joe's Parmesan Cheese for a minimum of ten months to enhance that sharp and strong savory flavor and create the characteristic dry, gritty texture Parmesan is known for. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Parmesan Cheese
009369.name: Domestic Parmesan

009375.description: Two households, both alike in dignity, In fair Monrovia, CA, where we lay our scene - Joe Shakespeare The two aforementioned households are that of the two lovely cheeses, pecorino Romano and Parmesan. These not so star cross'd cheese-lover favorites come together in poetic harmony for each container-full of Trader Joe's Grated Pecorino Romano & Parmesan Blend. We start with the oft grated, hard, and salty Italian cheese, pecorino Romano - literally meaning sheep's cheese of Rome. While this "ewe"phoric ovine cheese is recognized and protected by European law, it doesn't have to be made in Rome; 97% of pecorino Romano is actually made in Sardinia. Then we bring in another Italian, classic - the king of cheeses, some say - Parmesan. Also a hard cheese with a saline slant on the palate, the Parmesan does happen to be more mild and adds a balancing quality to the cheese blend. Spoon our Pecorino Romano & Parmesan Blend atop freshly prepared pastas and pizzas and you'll be saying bon voyage to your tastebuds as they take a flavorful flight to Italy! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Grated Pecorino Romano & Parmesan Cheese Blend
009375.name: Grated Romano Parmesan Blend

009382.description: Expertly crafted in French tradition, Président puts emphasis on a simple recipe with integrity in their process and the utmost of quality in their ingredients. Everything down to the lush landscapes of grass that their dairy cows use to graze is carefully watched to positively affect the quality of their cow's milk. However, this attention to detail results in every wheel of Président Madrigal Cheese becoming a cheese that is refined, indulgent, and an excellent, proprietary take on French Baby Swiss cheese. Crafted in the cheesemaking style of the all-stars of the Alpine, the Swiss, Président Madrigal is a full-fat, semi-hard cheese made from 100% cow's milk in the Loire Valley of central France. Like other baby Swiss style cheeses, every wheel is riddled with "eyes", the holes found throughout Swiss cheese. Each bite of Madrigal Cheese has sweet, nutty, and mellow flavors that melt wonderfully and work with versatility in many scenarios in need of a buttery, cheesy element. Beautiful on a cheese board, but also perfect when grated into sauces, fondue, or grilled sandwiches, Président Madrigal is a baby Swiss style cheese you can try any day with a simple trip to your neighborhood Trader Joe's. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Président Madrigal Cheese
009382.name: Baby Swiss Madrigal
009382.title: Cut Swiss Madrigal Baby - France (Bulk 30642)

012603.description: One of the most recognizable names in cheese, the Dutch Gouda, or "How-da" as the local Dutch call their city, is a cheese named after the city of Gouda in the South Holland region of the Netherlands. To this day, cheesemakers and farmers gather in this city every Thursday morning between 10:00am and 12:30pm from June until August to have their cheese weighed, tested, and priced. Not only is the name recognizable, but the cheese itself accounts for nearly half of the world's cheese consumption! Trader Joe's Dutch Gouda is made from pasteurized cow's milk that is processed in the traditional Gouda style. Cultured milk is curdled, whey is drained, and water added in a process known as washing the curd. This gives the Dutch Gouda its characteristic sweetness as it washes away some of the lactose, resulting in less acid throughout the cheese. Next the cheese moves to its molds which results in the Dutch Gouda's traditional shape and then is dried and given an annatto coating for its yellow hue and to prevent overdrying of the cheese. The red waxed rind of a Gouda indicates a young cheese, like that of Trader Joe's Dutch Gouda. As Gouda is aged, it develops a caramel sweetness, but this young variety has a mild sweetness with a creamy and nutty flavor. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Dutch Gouda Cheese
012603.name: Red Wax Gouda

013006.description: To produce the perfect wheel of Fontina cheese, artisans rely on their expertise and the quality of their milk to get the ideal texture and blend of flavors into the final product. Like many other cheeses, it all begins with milk, curdled in a vat with added cheese cultures and rennet (in this case our supplier uses animal rennet). Then the Fontina is strained through, you guessed it, cheesecloth and placed into wheel-shaped molds to all the paste to set up. After that relatively simple process, we're left with a young Fontina Semi-Soft Cheese ready to be shipped over to our stores and scooped up by our shoppers! And what a tasty, semi-soft cheese it is to scoop up! Like many other cheeses of Italian origins, Fontina has the taste and texture to be enjoyed all on its own, unclouded by additional flavors. It makes for a wonderful slice to be served as a semi-soft cheese on a cheeseboard and with a woodsy, cherry-forward red wine. However, Fontina is particularly delicious when paired with savory foods such as meats, eggs, other cheeses, and pasta. The nutty, somewhat mushroom-like notes in the cheese go great with savory dishes while the cheese itself imparts a soft, creaminess to anything you use it in. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Fontina Semi-Soft Cheese
013006.name: Fontina

014425.description: With Trader Joe's Baby Swiss, it's all about looking into the "eyes" until you find the perfect cut that calls out to you. By "eyes", we of course mean the plethora of small holes found in many Swiss cheese varieties. What makes them so important to our Baby Swiss, however, is that they are distinctively smaller and more densely packed than with traditional Swiss cheese. Because the Baby Swiss hasn't had as much time to age, the holes don't have as much time to get all that large. It's those poppin' Baby Swiss Cheese peepers, the spongier buttery texture, and the superbly pale yellow, almost ivory-cream color that helps define the physical aspects of Baby Swiss vs. traditional. Flavor-wise, the taste is smoother, creamier, and more mild than traditional Swiss. It still has that slight nuttiness and complexity, just less boldly than that of a Swiss that has had time to age. Grab a block of Trader Joe's Baby Swiss, look into those "eyes", and fall in love at first sight - and again at first taste. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Baby Swiss Cheese
014425.name: Baby Swiss

018326.description: We know, we know, cheese has so much lingo to keep up with. But hey, "Pecorino" simply defines Italian cheeses made from 100% sheep's milk and "Romano" just lets the cheese consumer know that the cheese is from Rome. So this oft grated, hard and salty Italian cheese is, in all respects, a sheep's milk cheese from Rome; Trader Joe's Pecorino Romano, ladies and gentlemen. While this "ewe"phoric ovine cheese is recognized and protected by European law, it doesn't have to be made in Rome; 97% of Pecorino Romano is actually made in Sardinia. Of the four Pecorino cheeses that have Protected Designation of Origin certification, Pecorino Romano is the most ancient as well as the most famous outside of its homeland, Italy. Our supplier uses 100% fresh, unpasteurized sheep's milk for each cut of our Pecorino Romano cheese. Each wheel is dry-salted by hand numerous times, resulting in a fabulously salty flavor. Young Pecorino Romano has a soft, rubbery texture and sweet flavor, but gets progressively sharper and smokier with age. Our Pecorino Romano is aged a minimum of five months to still have that sweet, young cheese essence, but stacked with sharp and salty notes. Because of its hard texture and saltiness, this cheese works wonders as a grating cheese over pasta, breads, and casseroles, or possibly paired with a glass of bold Italian wine or a light beer. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Pecorino Romano
018326.name: Cut Pecorino Romano Tj - Italy (81718 Bulk)

021598.description: Trader Joe's Dutch Smoked Cheese all begins with a log of Maasdam cheese, a semi hard Dutch cheese that uses pasteurized cow's milk. It was created in the early 1990s as an alternative to pricier Swiss Emmental cheeses, but don't let that fiscally-inspired backstory make you think this cheese tastes "cheap". Maasdam is a supple, high fat - minimum of 45% fat - cheese that has a similar flavor and textural profile to its Dutch cousin, Gouda. So all of those luxuriously creamy and buttery flavors are abound, but complimented by the addition of woodsy smoking to both the flavor and aroma, reminiscent of a barbecue. Trader Joe's Dutch Smoked Cheese is an incredible value of a uniquely smoky snacking cheese that can also find its way into many of your favorite cheese-needing recipes! It melts that supple, high fat texture with a light sweet and smoky duality to omelettes, mac and cheese, pizzas, pasta dishes, or whatever culinary adventure you embark on. Grab a pre-cut portion of this sweet and smoky goodness at your local Trader Joe's for only $4.99* a pound today! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Dutch Smoked Cheese
021598.name: Dutch Smoked Cheese

025274.description: Experience has taught Kerrygold farmers that what their dairy cows consume has a direct effect on the milk the produce. Accordingly, they lead their cows that eat lush, green, Irish grass all year round. They'll even move the cows from paddock (small, enclosed field) to paddock ensuring they always have access to the most nourishing grass. This intense cow-care results in incomparable Irish milk-which is made into an extraordinary Irish cheese called Dubliner. The pale yellow paste is sweet and nutty, like mature Cheddar-with the piquant bite of aged Parmesan. You can enjoy its flavor crumbled over salads, sliced on crackers, or melted on a sandwich. Kerrygold Dubliner is a world-class cheese, and that's why we've been offering it at Trader Joe's so consistently for so many years! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Kerrygold Dubliner Cheese
025274.name: Cut Dubliner - Ireland (Bulk 24976)

025808.description: When it comes to cheese, we don't just talk the talk. We walk the walk. Or rather, we ride the planes, trains, boats, whatever means of conveyance we can, really, to find amazing cheeses from all over the world. We take our cheeses seriously, and we know our customers do too, so we're willing to trek wherever necessary to find the real deal. We're all familiar with Parmesan cheese, of course, but there's everyday Parmesan cheese, and then there's serious, matured, intensely flavorful Parmesan cheese! Trader Joe's Grana Padano Parmesan fits perfectly in this latter category, being an authentic product of expert cheese makers in northeastern Italy's Po River Valley. They use the same recipe as the 12th-century Cistercian monks that invented Grana Padano-in other words, you can't get more authentic than this. You can taste the centuries of perfection in each bite, too: each wheel of TJ's Grana Padano Parmesan is made with raw milk and aged for at least 18 months, meaning the sweet, savory, and nutty flavors are so profoundly concentrated that they actually manifest in the form of a fine, granular texture throughout the cheese. These granular, crystalized pockets of flavor are, in fact, what the "Grana" in Grana Padano refers to. However you serve Trader Joe's Grana Padano Parmesan, be it shaved over some Arugula Ravioli [sku 94346], mixed in with a plate of Antipasto Mediterranean Vegetables [sku 60537], or simply crumbled with a drizzling of balsamic vinegar, you can know with certainty that you're getting the real thing. And at $10.99 per pound, you can know with certainty that you're getting it for a steal, too.
025808.name: Grana Padano

031883.description: Trader Joe's Triple Cream Soft Ripened Cambozola Blue Cheese may be an obnoxious mouthful to say, but we can promise you that you'll never have enough mouthfuls of this classic German blue cheese varietal. A relatively new-to-the-world example of blue cheese, Cambozola Blue Cheese, or "blue brie" has a smooth, creamy texture with a considerably mild blue cheese flavor profile. Cambozola is a cross between Camembert and Gorgonzola (and generously named after them with Cambozola being a portmanteau of the two). It marries the creaminess of its Penicillium Camemberti focused mother cheese and the blue speckled veins and sharpness of its Penicillium Roqueforti using father, Gorgonzola. This gives it a blend of savory, nutty flavors with hints of sweetness that enhances this marriage of cheeses found in our Cambozola Blue Cheese. It's a wonderful start to get into the world of blue cheese if you're intimidated by the intense aromas and tangy tastes. Enjoy with fruit, honey, or a bottle of chardonnay, but whatever you choose to do, just make sure to get yourself a slice of Trader Joe's Cambozola Blue Cheese today. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Triple Cream Soft Ripened Cambozola Blue Cheese
031883.name: Cut Blue Cambozola - Germany (Bulk 31145)

033331.description: Produced exclusively in Spain's La Mancha region, Manchego is a sheep's milk cheese that's been produced for hundreds of years (Cervantes mentioned it in his Don Quixote), and is still crafted exclusively from the whole milk of the region's Manchega sheep, according to strict, traditional methods. From the six months careful aging to the basket-weave pattern on the cheese's rind to the aromas of flowers, nuts, and lavender, our Manchego is traditional in all ways but one - the price. The price for this very special cheese tends to be very high. But because we sell a great deal of Manchego, we've been able to negotiate a terrific cost from our supplier, which in turn enables us to offer it to you for the excellent value of $9.99 a pound. Don't be fooled by high prices you see elsewhere - their cheese is no better than ours; they just demand a higher price. At our price of $9.99 a pound, you'll pay less than $6 for a random- weight piece of about 9-9.5 ounces - now that's a value! Serve Manchego shaved summertime salads, chunked atop a pasta salad, or really break the mold and melt slices atop a patty of Organic Ground Beef [sku 92558] to create a burger of international renown.
033331.name: Manchego Aged 6 Months

036024.description: When it comes to cheese, we don't just talk the talk. We walk the walk. Or rather, we ride the planes, trains, boats, whatever means of conveyance we can, really, to find amazing cheeses from all over the world. We take our cheeses seriously, and we know our customers do too, so we're willing to trek wherever necessary to find the real deal. In some cases, we literally must go to where the cheese is, if we want that cheese at all. Trader Joe's Comté, for example, is an AOC-protected cheese, meaning that by law, it can only be labeled as Comté if it's made within a specifically designated geographical region, and only if it's produced under certain strict conditions. In order to find a supplier that met these conditions, we ventured to the Jura Mountains in eastern France, near the Swiss border. There we found a third-generation cheese maker whose fromagerie has been in business since 1907. One bite of their Comté, and we knew the journey was worth it. Creamy, nutty, and delightfully fruity in flavor, Trader Joe's Comté is deliciously complex, with fine notes of freshly mown grass and a superb semi-firm mouth feel-due in no small part to it being aged for a minimum of 180 days before being sold. It's elegant enough to be served on its own in a cheeseboard, but truly shines when melted, as in a quiche or soufflé. You could very easily spend upwards of $15 per pound for Comté at any other store, but because we work directly with the supplier, we're able to sell Trader Joe's Comté for the stellar price of $10.99 per pound.
036024.name: Comte

046837.description: Trader Joe's Parmesan Reggiano is the real deal. While you may find similar cheeses produced outside of Italy (and the EU) labeled "Parmesan", these are not the same as authentic Parmigiano Reggiano, which by law may only be made under strict regulations in the regions surrounding Parma and Reggio-Emilia in northern- central Italy. And that's exactly why we source Parmesan Reggiano that is produced by a century-old cheese company in the province of Parma. Raw (unpasteurized) cow's milk is curdled, drained, and packed into round molds reading for aging. The resulting "wheels" are then soaked in high-salinity brine for about 3 weeks, then finally aged for a minimum of 20 months. The finished cheese is dense and hard, with a granular texture and sharp flavor that presents fruity, nutty, savory notes. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Parmesan Reggiano
046837.name: Parmesan Reggiano

050669.description: Our new Trader Joe's mini Basque cheese is made in the Pyrenees Mountains in France using the same techniques that local shepherds used hundreds of years ago. It's made with 100% pure sheep's milk. It has a rich and buttery flavor and a slightly nutty aroma. The flavor is mild, nutty and somewhat fruity. It's a relatively mild sheep's milk cheese, so it's a great one to start with. It's great on a fruit and cheese platter, especially with stone fruit such as peaches, apricots or cherries. Also serve it on French bread with ham and tomato or on a serving board with cured meats, olives and pate. Mini Basque goes well with most red wines including Beaujolais, merlot and viogner.
050669.name: Mini Basque

050673.description: Trader Joe's Manchego Anejo Cheese, the "older brother" of traditional Manchego Cheese. It has a sweeter, yet more crisp and desiccated texture than that of its younger siblings due to the 12 month minimum aging, but still maintains those tangy, nutty flavors that Manchego cheeses are known for. Our Manchego Anejo Cheese is produced in the La Mancha region of Spain, under protected designation of origin guidelines. Additionally, it must be made of sheep's milk, in this case pasteurized, which contains a significantly higher content of fat and solids than cow's milk resulting in supremely buttery and rich cheese. All this sheep-y, cheesy goodness is packed into a unique rind with a traditional herringbone weave pattern pressed upon it. We age Trader Joe's Manchego Anejo Cheese for a minimum of 12 months to ensure a pleasant caramelized flavor that has a sweet, lingering taste hidden under a beautiful butterscotch appearance paired with a drier, crumblier texture than that found in a youthful Manchego cheese. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Manchego Anejo Cheese
050673.name: Manchego Anejo Aged 12 Months

051481.description: This year, we've been chasing down supplies of Goat's Milk Cheddar Cheese. The celebrated cheese that gives those with lactose intolerance a real chance at delicious Cheddar, it is not something we have wanted to be without. After emptying out the vault of a Canadian dairy, we were pleased to forge a new partnership with a famous American Master Cheesemaker, who is handcrafting exceptional Goat's Milk Cheddar in Wisconsin. Made according to traditional, European Cheddaring techniques from the milk of pasture- grazed goats in Wisconsin, this Cheddar is soft and creamy with bright white paste, an approachably mild goat's milk aroma and familiar Cheddar taste. Aged for five months, it is full-flavored and smooth. Really smooth. With mild Cheddar taste. It slices, melts or grates effortlessly, making it perfect for use in grilled sandwiches, pastas, pizzas, quesadillas¿ We also like it paired with apples. Now and into the foreseeable future, this is Trader Joe's Goat's Milk Cheddar, an everyday, exceptional caliber, approachable cheese for $9.99 per pound.
051481.name: Goat Cheddar

052381.description: While in England visiting a farm, famous for their flavored cheese artistry, we were introduced to this Cheddar Cheese with Caramelized Onions. It's crafted for us on an established estate, idyllically situated between the rolling Dorset Downs and the Jurassic Coast-an international world heritage site, lush with pastures. With more than 40 years of traditional cheese making experience, a famed farm on this estate transforms rich, creamy milk from local grazing herds (within a 30 mile radius) into beautiful, full-bodied farmhouse Cheddar. Inspired by a classically British ploughman's lunch pairing (cheese & chutney), these blending artists mix caramelized onion marmalade into the Cheddar, giving it a balanced sweet-savory bite and pleasing onion aroma. It's firm, creamy and adorned throughout with bits of onion. It's memorable! Trader Joe's Cheddar Cheese with Caramelized Onions is excellent served simply-cut and accompanied by crackers or small slices of rustic bread. It also melts exceptionally well, which makes it a fun topping for burgers, grilled cheeses or pizzas. We also enjoy the sweetness it brings to cream sauces. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Cheddar Cheese with Caramelized Onions
052381.name: English Cheddar W Caramelized Onions
052381.title: Cheddar Cheese With Caramelized Onions

055406.description: If you find yourself wanting to dip your spoon into a stick of butter for a taste, but you feel as if this would be deemed culturally inappropriate, we have an alternative that should deliver a similar (actually better!) eating experience, without running contrary to contemporary culinary mores. That alternative is Trader Joe's Triple Creme Brie Cheese. Triple Creme Brie is produced for us in the region known as Île-de-France (the area surrounding Paris)-from whence all true Bries come and have come since around the 8th century, when King Charlemagne claimed Brie as his preferred fromage. Our supplier works in the heart of Brie country where they produce Brie de Meaux, arguably the world's best Brie. Part of what makes Brie de Meaux so fantastique is the luscious local milk they use, bringing a natural sweetness to the cheese. It is this very same high quality milk collected for Brie de Meaux that is used in our Triple Creme Brie. Of course, this milk also comes from cows that have never been given rBST hormones. The milk is pasteurized, and to it is added butterfat-rich cream. The fresh curds are then aged briefly; soft-ripened to develop a bloomy- white, edible rind. You get a cheese that is creamy and decadent with a rich, buttery quality-perfect as an ap- petizer or dessert. Serve it with fresh or dried fruit, nuts, crusty bread, or crisp crackers. The crisp acidity of a sparkling wine is the perfect complement to this extra creamy Brie. Trader Joe's Triple Creme Brie Cheese is one of our everyday cheeses, meaning it's available whenever your craving for buttery cheese comes! We're selling each cut piece (about eight ounces) for $6.99 per pound. 01.28. 16
055406.name: Triple Creme Brie

060517.description: No, this isn't a new appearance in our cheese case. We've carried this exact New Zealand Organic Cheddar Cheese for some time, but it will now be priced per pound-which means we're able to offer it at an even better value than it was before. Before we get into those details, though, let's talk cheese. The lush, green pastures of New Zealand's organic dairy farms are where this Cheddar truly begins. The milk used to produce this distinctive cheese comes from cows raised on family owned dairies and treated to a diet of the abundant organic clover and grasses that blanket the pastures. Moderate temperatures, flowing mountain streams, and abundant rainfall mean there's plenty of grazing to do year-round. Because of this diet, the cows produce incredibly rich and flavorful milk, and that milk, in turn, produces incredibly rich and flavorful cheese. Aged for three to six months, Trader Joe's New Zealand Organic Cheddar has a flavorful, fresh, and creamy profile that makes it a stand-out no matter how you choose to use it. Shred and make nachos with Organic Blue Corn Tortilla Chips [sku 94583], melt onto a burger, make a great mac 'n cheese, cut into cubes and enjoy as a midday snack. Or, our personal favorite: on a grilled cheese with Fig Butter [sku 96478] and arugula. Now, back to that value we mentioned. We're selling this new cut-and-wrapped format of Trader Joe's New Zealand Organic Cheddar Cheese for $7.99 per pound, which means that same eight-ounce piece you'd been buying is now 30¢ less! Cheese and value: two of our favorite things. 04.02. 18
060517.name: Organic New Zealand Cheddar

061822.description: What do the lush countryside of North Holland and the smoldering desert of Hatch Valley, New Mexico have in common? The former is home to the Beemster Cheese Cooperative, producer of some of the best cheeses in the world, while the latter is renowned for its production of the famed Hatch Chile Pepper. They share an intense dedication to their craft, however, and to producing the best products in their field-a dedication that has yielded Beemster Hatch Pepper Gouda, our spotlight cheese for the month of August. Beemster's cows are free ranging and graze in small herds on nutrient-rich polder grasses. This special diet produces sweet, flavorful milk, unlike cows that graze elsewhere, resulting in a superbly creamy, nutty Gouda. The addition of certified Hatch Chiles during production adds green, grassy notes and subtle, peppery heat to balance out the richness of the cheese. It's an unlikely meeting of worlds that produces a very likeable cheese, if we do say so ourselves. Use Beemster Hatch Pepper Gouda wherever you need some kicky flavor and irresistibly creamy texture-we like it in a quesadilla, on a grilled cheese sandwich, or even a charcuterie board, alongside tangy pickles, spicy salami and a crisp pale ale. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Beemster Hatch Pepper Gouda
061822.name: Cut Beemster Hatch Gouda

064553.description: Round up the kids and nannies, its time to try another Trader Joe's cut cheese! And of course by kids and nannies, we mean all of those young goats ripe to milk and use their milk to make some "Gouda"-tasting cheeses! Trader Joe's Goat's Milk Gouda Cheese is just the type of simply good tasting cheese while being complex and interesting enough to appeal to casual cheeseheads and connoisseurs alike. Using pasteurized goat's milk to craft this cut of cheese, we end up with a slightly sweet product like traditional Goudas, but imparted with some tang from the distinct milk. Trader Joe's Goat's Milk Gouda Cheese will surprise your family and friends as a new spin on goat's milk cheeses. Gone are the days of your picky cheese eater pals complaining about a "goaty"-ness found in classic chevre logs with their distinct flavor and minor chalkiness. Our Goat's Milk Gouda has hints of sweet caramel and butterscotch while keeping the tanginess at bay. This pale beauty of a Dutch delicacy is wonderful when used with cheese and wine or beer - try it with a glass of Butter Chardonnay [sku 57419] or a malty ale of your choosing - or melt with some crackers *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Goat's Milk Gouda Cheese
064553.name: Polder Blanc Aged Goat Gouda
064553.title: Cut Gouda Goat Aged Polder Blanc - Holland (Bulk 64551)

064624.description: As kids we're told that rules are for our own good. That's a hard concept for young ones to swallow. Growing older, we learn that though rules may seem restrictive, they often allow for excellent results. In the case of Stilton, it's precisely the strict production requirements that ensure this world-class cheese is always a pleasure to taste-not to mention being easy to swallow. Our White Stilton with Apricots adheres to the same requirements as the famous Blue to earn its "Stilton" designation: It's produced for us in Cropwell Bishop, a village in Nottinghamshire-one of only three English counties approved for Stilton production. It's made only from locally pasteurized cow's milk. It's formed into a cylindrical shape-but not pressed-and its crust is naturally formed. Where this White differs from its Blue cousin is in what's inside. Eschewing the friendly blue-green fungus, our White Stilton contains something that is arguably more palatable: real bits of apricots. Visually, it's stunning. Bits of dried fruit appear throughout - easy compliments to the creamy, crumbly texture of the cheese. The infusion of dried apricot conveys a sweet and fruity taste. Our White Stilton with Apricots is fabulous when crumbled on a salad, or melted on a steak. It presents well on a cheeseboard with walnuts, fresh pears, or other dried fruits. It pairs equally well with a glass of dessert Port, fruity Riesling, spiced Gewürztraminer, or a dry Sauvignon Blanc. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. White Stilton Cheese with Apricots
064624.name: White Stilton With Apricot

066562.description: Are you gaga for gouda? Smitten with Swiss? Crazy for cream cheese? Enchanted by cheddar? Or perhaps even batty for brie? If you identify with one or more (or all!) of the previous statements, the cheese case at your neighborhood Trader Joe's can help. We've got cheeses for shredding, snacking, soirée-ing¿if there's an occasion, we have a stellar cheese to go with it. And just in time for "it's too hot to cook, so cheese board for dinner it is" season, we're excited to reintroduce Supreme Brie to our cheese case. Concerned with rising costs in production as well as the freshness & integrity of their product, the fromage- focused folks behind Supreme Brie sent their French cheesemakers stateside to recreate the cheese's celebrated recipe, and struck milky gold in Lena, Illinois. Using locally-sourced, rBST-free milk, they concocted an irresistibly creamy, buttery, ivory-colored paste, nestled in a white rind, that showcases the classic, rich flavor and slightly mushroom-y aroma so appreciated by brie buffs, and Supreme Brie buffs in particular. When put to the ultimate test (a blind taste test in TJ's test kitchen, of course), the domestically-produced Brie was found to be every bit as rich, creamy, and delicious as its fabriqué en France predecessor. C'est fantastique! Grilled on a panini with thinly sliced apple, baked in the oven with preserves, sliced on a cheese board with prosciutto and fresh grapes¿however you serve it, we're selling random weight wedges of Supreme Brie for the fantastic price of $9.99 per pound-that comes out to about five bucks or so for each creamy wedge. You'll find them in the land of cheese board enchantment (aka the cheese case) at your neighborhood Trader Joe's. 06.03. 19
066562.name: Cut Brie Supreme Domestic

068195.description: Fresh goat cheese is an absolute delight: soft, silky, and tantalizingly tart, it boasts a broad range of culinary applications, both savory and sweet. But when you age goat cheese, something really interesting happens: The texture firms up to a semi-hard, extraordinarily toothsome consistency, and its innate tanginess grows more complex and takes on a riper, nuttier character. Such is the case with Trader Joe's Aged Kaas Goat's Milk Cheese, a Dutch goat cheese that's been aged a minimum of five months to give it a strikingly firm-yet-smooth texture and an artfully developed-yet-still-uniquely-goaty flavor profile. Made for us by a cheese cooperative in the southern Netherlands who specialize exclusively in goat cheese, this Kaas proves that aged goat cheese can be just as versatile as it is fresh. Its natural tanginess and creaminess make it a natural inclusion for cheese plates, as well as melted on sandwiches, shaved over salads, or even paired up with honey and preserves for a captivating sweet-savory treat. Typically, a cheese that demands such dedication and expertise would come with an exorbitant price tag, but at Trader Joe's, you can find our Aged Kaas Goat's Milk Cheese in random-weight pieces for $13.99* per pound. While supplies last, look for it in our cheese case. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Aged Kaas Goat's Milk Cheese
068195.name: Cut Aged Kaas Goat Cheese

072426.description: Famed for their importance in Caribbean cuisine, and named for their physical resemblance to a woolen tam o' shanter cap, Scotch bonnet chilis have a delicate sweetness to them and a remarkable level of heat - a few orders of magnitude hotter than jalapeños, for reference. And as the makers of Trader Joe's Cheddar with Scotch Bonnet Chilis and Red Peppers have found, these qualities make them a natural companion to the inherent nuttiness and crumbly texture of a classic English Cheddar. Using a mix of time-tested cheesemaking techniques and state of the art equipment, they flavor this savory Cheddar with sweet and fiery Scotch bonnet chili relish to great acclaim in supermarkets across the U.K. - and we're proud to say that we're the first to carry it across the pond. A delight for heat-seekers and fromage fans of all stripes, this Cheddar balances its blend of sweet, spicy, and creamy with remarkable grace. It makes a great addition to grilled cheese sandwiches, mac & cheese casseroles, or even a sweet and hot potatoes au gratin. Looking to turn up the heat at your next get-together? Pair this Cheddar up with spicy cold cuts like pepperoni and capicola for a scorching charcuterie plate - just make sure to take the cheese out of the fridge at least 30 minutes before serving for maximum flavor. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Cheddar Cheese with Scotch Bonnet Chili and Red Peppers
072426.name: Cut Cheddar W Scotch Bonnet Chili
072426.title: Cheddar Cheese With Scotch Bonnet Chili Peppers

072490.description: In our famously well-stocked cheese cases, Trader Joe's had to make room for everyone's favorite Danish table cheese, of course.
