So much so, that our "pre-coffee" personas can be sorely lacking-not only in personality, but also in the hand-eye coordination and basic math skills it takes to grind, measure, scoop, and pour. It's a bit of a Catch-22, really¿ we need the coffee to help us make the coffee, but we can't drink the coffee until we make it. It may be a 5.8-ounce box instead of a 26-ounce cylinder, but it's still covered with that familiar blue hue, and the floral design, reminiscent of some turn-of-the-century wall paper in a five-star hotel on the Champs-Élyseés. The coffee inside is the same dark-roasted, 100% Arabica coffee you're used to getting in our stand-by cylin- der. But it's different. It's different because this coffee is sealed into twelve, single-serving cups for use with your Keurig K-Cup® coffee maker. Each individual cup-package is nitrogen flushed and sealed for freshness. Our unique mesh system allows you to see and smell your coffee, the moment that seal is opened. One "cup" yields one regular serving of hot coffee. It's easy. It's fast. It's 100% recyclable. And, the taste? C'est magnifique! You get twelve cups of coffee for $4.99. If our calculations are correct, that's just $0.41 per cup. Find a café, or even a diner, with that price! Even if you do, you'll still be missing the medium body, the rich ebony color, and the sweet-pungent, smoky aroma of Trader Joe's French Roast Coffee. Gift your "pre-coffee" self with a box of these Coffee Cups today. Your "post-coffee" self will thank you. 9.01.1 4
053121.name: French Roast Coffee K Cup
053121.title: French Roast Coffee Cups

054747.description: Seated outdoors at a Parisian cafe, taking in the French capital's views - the Seine, the Champs-Élysées, Notre Dame, or perhaps even the Louvre - surely sounds like a magical escape doesn't it? Well, let me clue you in on a little secret, it's more than just the views that you're drinking in. It's the coffee painting the magical scene. While Trader Joe's Low Acid French Roast whole bean coffee can't seat you at a sidewalk cafe, it can surely fill you with the blissful sensation of enjoying a cup of dark roast coffee in the City of Light. Our Low Acid French Roast Coffee is roasted long and slow to give that ridiculously rich dark color and release all those coffee oils onto the surface of the beans. But prior to this long, slow roast, the beans are treated to a chemical-free, natural steaming process that removes a bit of their acidity, but not their flavor. They are packaged immediately after the steaming and roasting to maintain their dark brown appearance and shimmering oily glow. Rest assured that each canister is flushed with nitrogen to seal in the recently-roasted freshness. Trader Joe's Low Acid French Roast Coffee hits all the boxes of a classic French roast blend. Sweet and smoky flavor? Highly smooth with little acidity? An oily mouthfeel? All check! After just one cup, we know you'll be hooked and saying "Oui oui! Barista pour me another!" *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing.
054747.name: French Roast Low Acid 13 Oz
054747.title: Trader Joe'S French Roast Low Acid

056312.description: When we first introduced our TJ's Cold Brew Concentrate [sku 50759] in 2013, we knew it was going to be a hit, but how big of a hit¿well, even we weren't fully prepared. Since then, the bottled cold brew and cold brew concentrate trend has all but exploded, and ours is the best value on the market-by a long shot. So, when we approached our supplier about introducing a second variety of Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate this year-this time an organic offering-we were thrilled when they agreed. Like it's predecessor, Trader Joe's Organic French Roast Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate is smooth, lush, and low in acid. In fact, because cold brew coffee is never heated, the oils and acids that give coffee its infamous, bitter "bite" don't pass through the brew. The result is a cup of coffee that is almost sweet and contains more than 50% less acid than a hot-brewed cup. Unlike its predecessor, however, our new offering is made only from USDA Organic coffee beans-which our Texas-based supplier treats to a slightly darker, slightly bolder French roast. Combine one part Trader Joe's Organic French Roast Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate with two parts water, milk, or any liquid and serve over ice-and don't limit "milk" to dairy milk, because this stuff blends beautifully with your favorite TJ's non-dairy milk beverages, too. If iced coffee isn't your thing, you can always reconstitute this cold brew with hot water and skip the ice cubes. You'll still have one mighty-fine, smooth-drinking cup of coffee on your hands. Or in your hands. We've yet to see a 32 ounce bottle of organic cold brew coffee concentrate sell for anything less than $12-and most brands retail for closer to $14 a bottle. But we're not "most brands," so we're selling each 32 ounce bottle of Trader Joe's Organic French Roast Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate for $9.99, every day-that's about 83¢ per 12-ounce cup of coffee you make with it. Drink up¿ 04.25. 16
056312.name: Cold Brew Conc Org Frenchroast
056312.title: Trader Joe'S Organic French Roast Cold Brew Concentrate

056332.description: The simple act of brewing a cup of morning coffee can provide a moment of culinary Zen-a quiet and creative start to one's day, before the flurry of mundane and required tasks kick in. But for those in a rush, this kind of ceremonial coffee prep at daybreak is pure fantasy. While Trader Joe's may not be able to guarantee daily moments of peaceful meditation around the coffee pot, we are doing our part to simplify your coffee making process¿ Our whole bean, Joe Medium Roast Coffee [sku 93015] has been a customer favorite since it first arrived, and now, for those seeking to minimize their morning rush, we're introducing Joe Medium Roast Ground Coffee. Joe Medium Roast is that no frills, exceptionally smooth, cup of joe. We heat a blend of 100% Arabica beans from South America to a medium-roast profile-that place where drinkability, smoothness, and enjoyability meet. Then, we grind the beans so you won't have to, just before sealing them into our nitrogen-flushed-for- freshness canister. This means, at home you'll be able to open the top and immediately spoon fresh grounds into your coffeemaker. No noisy grinder disturbing the peace, and much less counter mess. For the perfect cup, we still recommend approximately two tablespoons of ground coffee for each six ounces of cold water. If you already enjoy the whole bean version, and are looking for new ways to simplify your morning routine, switching to Joe Medium Roast Ground Coffee is an easy step in the right direction. And, it's easy on your budget, too, since it comes in the same size canister as the whole-bean version, for exactly the same price. That's $4.99 for 14 ounces. 03.28. 16
056332.name: Joe Coffee Medium Roast Ground
056332.title: Joe Medium Roast Ground Coffee

056333.description: The simple act of brewing a cup of morning coffee can provide a moment of culinary Zen-a quiet and creative start to one's day, before the flurry of mundane and required tasks kick in. But for those in a rush, this kind of ceremonial coffee prep at daybreak is pure fantasy. While Trader Joe's may not be able to guarantee daily moments of peaceful meditation around the coffee pot, we are doing our part to simplify your coffee making process¿ Our whole bean, Joe's Dark Coffee [sku 93936] has been a customer favorite since it first arrived, and now, for those seeking to minimize their morning rush, we're introducing Joe's Dark Ground Coffee. Joe's Dark is a no frills, rich, full-bodied, cup of joe. We heat a blend of 100% Arabica beans from South Amer- ica to a dark-roast profile-that place where drinkability, smoothness, and enjoyability meet. Then, we grind the beans so you won't have to, just before sealing them into our nitrogen-flushed-for-freshness canister. This means, at home you'll be able to open the top and immediately spoon fresh grounds into your coffeemaker. No noisy grinder disturbing the peace, and much less counter mess. For the perfect cup, we still recommend ap- proximately two tablespoons of ground coffee for each six ounces of cold water. If you already enjoy the whole bean version, and are looking for new ways to simplify your morning routine, switching to Joe's Dark Ground Coffee is an easy step in the right direction. And, it's easy on your budget, too, since it comes in the same size canister as the whole bean-version, for exactly the same price. That's $4.99 for 13 ounces. 03.28. 16
056333.name: Joe Coffee Dark Roast Ground
056333.title: Joe'S Dark Ground Coffee

058796.description: For so many, coffee is an essential part of the morning. So much so, that our "pre-coffee" personas can be sorely lacking-not only in personality, but also in the hand-eye coordination and basic math skills it takes to grind, measure, scoop, and pour. It's a bit of a Catch-22, really... we need the coffee to help us make the coffee, but we can't drink the coffee until we make it. Not to worry. We can help you with this one: Fair Trade Organic Co- lombian Coffee Cups to the rescue! Unlike our other single serve coffee offerings, you cannot find this Colombian Coffee's counterpart with our other whole bean coffees. It's uniquely available as twelve, single-serving cups for use with your Keurig K-Cup® coffee maker! Made with 100% Arabica beans, this coffee is medium roast, fair trade, and organic. The ripe cherries are picked by hand and sun-dried to produce a mild, well-balanced cup of coffee. Each individual cup- package is nitrogen flushed and sealed for freshness. Our unique mesh system allows you to see and smell your coffee, the moment that seal is opened. One "cup" yields one regular serving of hot coffee. It's easy. It's fast. It's 100% recyclable. And, the taste? C'est magnifique! You get twelve cups of coffee for $4.99. If our calculations are correct, that's just $0.41 per cup. Find a café, or even a diner, with that price! Even if you do, you'll still be missing the medium body, the rich ebony color, and the sweet-pungent, smoky aroma of Trader Joe's Fair Trade Organic Colombian Coffee Cups. Gift your "pre-coffee" self with a box of these Coffee Cups today. Your "post-coffee" self will thank you. 02.06. 17
058796.name: Fto Colombian Coffee K Cup
058796.title: Fair Trade Organic Colombian Coffee Cups

059553.description: For some time, we've been carrying select coffees in "Cups" that are compatible with Keurig K-Cup® brewing machines, such as our French Roast Coffee Cups [sku 53121]. Expanding our offerings in the pre-measured, machine-brew arena, we're now selling capsules made for use in Nespresso® Original Line coffee makers.* Trader Joe's Ristretto Espresso Capsules contain a custom blend of Arabica & Robusta coffees selected from Brazil, Colombia, Kenya, and Vietnam-and, in case you're wondering, this is no willy-nilly selection of beans. The Brazilian Arabica, for instance, helps deliver excellent body with roasted, nutty-sweetness. Meanwhile, the Vietnamese Robusta beans bring a real punch to the finish. In general, this the whole blend packs a "punch" true to its Italian name. (Ristretto literally means "restricted," referring to the exceptionally strong, concentrated nature of this coffee.) Brewing yields a small cup of deep, dark-brown coffee with a golden crema cap. The aroma is clean, bright and strong. The flavor is full bodied and intense with low acidity, and subtle fruity-nutty notes. If you have a Nespresso® machine, you're going to want to give Trader Joe's Ristretto Espresso Capsules a try- especially because this box of 10 single-serving Capsules is an incredible value, at $3.99. That's just 39¢ a shot! *Not for use with Nespresso® Vertuoline machines. TJ's capsules are not affiliated with nor approved by Société des produits Nestlé, S.A. 05.21. 18
059553.name: Espresso Pods Ristretto
059553.title: Espresso Capsules - Ristretto

060338.description: When it comes to brewing, what's the difference between hot and cold? Yes, temperature, of course, but also bite. Cold brewed coffee is never heated. As a result, the oils and acids that are released commonly with heat don't pass through to the brew. No longer masked by the compounds that give coffee its famous bitter bite, the nuanced lush, fruity flavors of the beans becomes strikingly more perceptible. With more than 50% less acid than a hot brewed cup, cold brew is truly smooth. While we're pro-DIY, the actual percolation and filtration required for a proper cold brew can take some- where between 12-24 hours. Don't know about you, but our cup of coffee can't always wait, so we bottled it! Working with craft coffee roasters in California, we start with the same medium roast, 100% Arabica bean base as our original Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate [sku 50759]. The beans are ground coarsely and specially filtered, then something special happens-natural coconut flavors are added to create a bold, smooth tasting, tropically-inspired brew-namely, Trader Joe's Coconut Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate. Mix one part Coconut Cold Brew Concentrate with two parts water or milk, and pour over ice for a lush, tropical hot weather treat. If you want to keep the coffee as concentrated as possible, you can use it to make coconut coffee ice cubes for your iced coffee. And since it's ideal for adding coffee flavor without the acid bit- terness, it's great for use in baking, marinating, making cocktails or served Affogato-style over ice cream. We're selling 16 fluid ounce bottles (enough for four-12 fluid ounce servings when reconstituted with water, milk, etc) of Trader Joe's Coconut Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate for $4.99. You'll find them near our other shelf stable coffee products, but only during the summer months. 06.26. 17
060338.name: Cold Brew Concentrate Coconut
060338.title: Coconut Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate

062042.description: The simple act of brewing a cup of morning coffee can provide a moment of culinary Zen-a quiet and creative start to one's day, before the flurry of mundane and required tasks kick in. But for those in a rush, this kind of ceremonial coffee prep at daybreak is pure fantasy. While Trader Joe's may not be able to guarantee daily moments of peaceful meditation around the coffee pot, we are doing our part to simplify your coffee making process with our newest addition to our Joe line of coffees, Trader Joe's Joe Light Roast Ground Coffee. It's a full-flavored and easy-going coffee, sold pre-ground to help those seeking to minimize their morning rush. We start with a blend of 100% Arabica beans from Guatemala and Ethiopia and heat them to an ideal light roast profile: pleasantly light brown in color, mellow aromatics, and roast just enough to bring out the full body and fruitiness of the Ethiopian beans without sacrificing the acidity and sweet notes of the Guatemalan. Then, we grind the beans so you won't have to, just before sealing them into our nitrogen-flushed-for-freshness bag. This means, at home you'll be able to open the top and immediately spoon fresh grounds into your coffeemaker. No noisy grinder disturbing the peace, and much less counter mess. For the perfect cup, we still recommend ap- proximately two tablespoons of ground coffee for each six ounces of cold water. All in all, it adds up to a no frills, thoroughly satisfying, easy-to-make cup of joe. And at $3.99 for a 14-ounce bag, it adds up to a pretty great value, too. You'll find Joe Light Roast Ground Coffee in our coffee section, pre- ground and ready to bring a little more peace to your morning grind. 06.25. 18
062042.name: Joe Coffee Light Roast Ground
062042.title: Joe Light Roast Ground Coffee

062369.description: For so many, coffee is an essential part of the morning. Even coffee drinkers who opt for decaf swear by the inherent perking-power of a good cup of Joe. And that's where our new, single-serve Decaf Coffee Cups come in to play-they're here to help perk up and pare down your morning routine. If you already drink Joe's Decaf Coffee [sku 50422], you'll recognize the outward packaging of our Decaf Coffee Cups right away. You may be looking at a box instead of a cannister, but it still features that olive green cityscape, bustling with depictions of Victorian-era coffee enthusiasts. And the coffee inside is the same medium-roasted, water-processed, 100% Arabica Decaf Coffee that you're used to. But it's different. It's different because this coffee is portioned into twelve, convenient, single-serving cups for use with your Keurig® K-Cup® coffee maker. No bean-grinding or complicated breweing here, folks! Each individual cup-package is nitrogen flushed and sealed for freshness, and our unique mesh cup design allows you to see and smell your coffee, from the moment that seal is opened. It's easy. It's fast. And, the taste? Fantastic! One "Cup" yields one regular serving of hot coffee, and there are twelve Cups in each $4.99, 5.08-ounce box- if our calculations are correct, that's about 41¢ per cup! Try finding a café or diner that can offer that price nowadays. Even if you could, you'd miss out on the smooth, bold flavor of Joe's Decaf. Gift your "pre-coffee" self a box of Decaf Coffee Cups today. Your "post-coffee" self will thank you. 06.25. 18
062369.name: Decaf Joes Coffee Medium K Cup
062369.title: Joe'S Decaf Coffee Cups

063482.description: Boy, oh boy, are our customers crazy for cold brew - and why shouldn' t they be? As its name implies, cold brew coffee is brewed with cold water (rather than hot water), so some of the heat-activated oils and acids inherent in the coffee don't pass through to the brew. No longer masked by the compounds that give coffee its famous, bitter bite, the nuanced flavors of the beans become strikingly more perceptible. With around 50% less acid than a hot water-brewed cup of coffee, cold brew is truly smooth, but the brewing process can be a hassle. Luckily, Trader Joe's Cold Brew Coffee Bags make crafting the perfect cold brew an absolute cinch. Picture giant tea bags - only instead of tea, they're filled with 100% Arabica medium-roast coffee, grown in Tanzania at the base Mt. Kilimanjaro. Simply toss two Bags into a pitcher with 7 cups of cold water, let it steep in the fridge overnight (8-12 hours), and say good morning to a bright, smooth glass of Cold Brew, complete with subtle, complex notes of berries and molasses! We're selling each 8.5-ounce resealable bag of four Cold Brew Coffee Bags for $5.99. Two Bags yield seven 8-fl. oz cups of Cold Brew, so if you do the math, that's about 43¢ per ice-cold, refreshing cup! Quite a bargain when you consider that an 8-ounce cup of identically-brewed Cold Brew will set you back at least $2.50 at your local coffee joint. Great coffee at a great price, available only at your neighborhood Trader Joe's. 07.16. 18
063482.name: Cold Brew Coffee Bags Kililmanjaro

063980.description: It's time to wake up and smell the coffee. Literally. We named this particular blend of beans Organic Fair Trade Wake Up Blend Coffee for a reason-several reasons, actually-but perhaps most important is the fact that this is an ideal coffee to greet both your olfactory and gustatory senses first thing in the morning. Wake Up Blend is a mix of organically grown, fair trade certified, 100% Arabica beans from small-scale farms in Mexico, El Salvador, Honduras, and Peru. The farmers who grow these beans are committed to organic and sustainable agricultural practices. They're also committed to cultivating truly excellent coffee beans! These high quality beans are given a medium roast to bring out their best flavors, yielding a smooth, well-balanced cup with bright acidity and just a touch of inherent sweetness. As a bonus, we've also given these beans a medium grind. This means that waking up to the aroma and flavor of Trader Joe's Organic Fair Trade Wake Up Blend is easier than ever! Since 2011, we've offered our Wake Up Blend in whole-bean form [sku 98530]. That large, 28-ounce canister is still available for $14.99. Now, we're also offering this 14-ounce bag of Trader Joe's Organic Fair Trade Wake Up Blend Ground Coffee for $7.49. Find it in our coffee section next to its counterpart.
063980.name: Fto Wake Up Blend Ground 14Oz
063980.title: Organic Fair Trade Wake Up Blend Ground Coffee

067436.description: Cold brew coffee connoisseurs rejoice-Trader Joe's Instant Cold Brew Coffee is back! Our supplier starts with 100% Arabica Coffee beans from India, and processes them using an all-natural, proprietary Cold Brew extraction method that took more than two years to develop. It's truly a unique approach that yields dark, smooth, full-bodied Cold Brew, with a caramel-like aroma and rich, cold-brew coffee taste-in an Instant! For a quick, captivating Cold Brew Coffee, simply add one heaping teaspoon to 12 fluid ounces of cold or hot water, then stir until dissolved. That's it! With the 12-to-24 hours saved by not brewing your own, you'll have more time to ponder all the ways you can enjoy this Cold Brew: add more or less, depending on how strong you prefer your Coffee; serve over ice or sip it hot; serve it black or with a splash of cream; sweeten it, if you're so inclined... Most instant coffee in the market is not cold brewed; if you can find it, it's typically accompanied by a hefty price tag and unreasonable shipping fees. Not so at your neighborhood Trader Joe's! You'll find this Instant-ly appealing value on our coffee shelves, every day. Instant Cold Brew Coffee
067436.name: Instant Cold Brew Coffee

071740.description: There are few things as steadfast, unfailing, and, some might argue, as necessary as a morning cup o' joe. Or, should we say, a morning cup of Joe. Yes, that's more like it. At Trader Joe's, we take coffee quite seriously, which is why we sell such a wide array of the stuff-a panoply of perking agents, if you will. In the last several years, our revolving roster of Trader Joe's Small Lot Coffees has begun to take center stage, and while we love this limited-edition line-up (we wouldn't offer it if we didn't), we're the first to admit that sometimes, it's a no-frills, old-fashioned cup of coffee you crave. For fifteen years and counting, customers have looked to TJ's Medium Roast Joe to provide said cup. In more recent years, however, more and more of you have expresso-ed a desire for an organic version of this time-honored, TJ's classic. Well, dear customers, your wish is our command: introducing Trader Joe's Organic Medium Roast Joe. Yup, it's the same bright, balanced 100% Arabica blend you love, made with organically grown Colombian, Honduran, and Indonesian beans. Sounds like a darn good deal, right? Plus, this Joe comes as Ground Coffee, so there's no noisy coffee grinder disturbing the peace and much less counter mess. Top o' the morning to ya! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Joe Medium Roast Ground Coffee
071740.name: Joe Coffee Organic Med Roast Ground
071740.title: Organic Joe Medium Roast Ground Coffee

073059.description: For so many, coffee is an essential part of the morning. Even coffee drinkers who opt for decaf swear by the inherent perking-power of a good cup of Joe, whether that's first thing in the morning, mid-afternoon, or after dinner alongside dessert. Our house blend decaffeinated coffee, Trader Joe's Joe Medium Roast Decaf, is already available in single- serve cup forms [sku 62369]. Now, we're offering it in Ground form, too! It's the same medium-roasted, water- processed, 100% Arabica Decaf Coffee that you're used to. But different. Because it's ground. No bean-grinding, extra packaging, or complicated brewing here, folks! For the perfect cup, use approximately two tablespoons of ground coffee for each six fluid ounces of cold water. Add your favorite accoutrements and-voila!-morning made. Decaf Joe Medium Roast Ground Coffee
073059.name: Joe Coffee Medium Roast Decaf Ground
073059.title: Decaf Joe Medium Roast Ground Coffee

073407.description: Ethiopia is widely considered the birthplace of coffee. Naturally then, Elias and Sarina would start a coffee company in New York City... after moving there from Ethiopia in 2011. This husband-and-wife team leveraged their experience and connections from their former home to create Buunni Coffee, which they say has "an Ethiopian heart and a global soul." Their Azmari blend is a drinkable representation of this identity. The blend of single-origin, 100% whole Arabica beans, includes the Marcala variety beans from Honduras, and Sidamo and Lima varieties from Ethiopia. Cultivated on smallholder farms and farmers' co-ops, the fragrant beans are processed by hand and medium-roasted to perfection in New Jersey-a nod to the "global soul" part of Buunni. The Latin verve and Ethiopian delicacy combine to create a rich brew that boasts notes of dark chocolate, nougat, and cherry. A hot cup of Buunni Coffee Azmari Blend is a wonderful way to wake up in the morning, and it's just as pleasant as an accompaniment for a sweet dessert. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Buunni Coffee Azmari Blend
073407.name: Coffee Buunni Azmari Blend

074367.description: Trader Joe's Fair Trade Organic Bolivian Blend Coffee has been a customer favorite since it first appeared on our shelves in 2008. The 100% Arabica beans are cultivated by small family farms between the Andes mountains and the Amazon river basin. Governed by sustainable Fair Trade practices, these Bolivian farmers are able to make a living wage as they grow, harvest, and process this premier Coffee. And their Organic farming approach ensures that synthetic fertilizers & other synthetic processing chemicals are left out, which helps protect the environment, while also guarding the natural flavors imparted by this unique soil & climate. And speaking of flavor, such admirable attributes as Fair Trade and Organic wouldn't matter much if the coffee didn't also taste good. In fact, Trader Joe's Organic Bolivian Blend is a truly delicious and supremely balanced brew! The medium-dark roast presents a smooth-textured body, delicate acidity, and sweet notes that are characteristic of caramel. Yum! To get this Coffee into our customers hands (and mugs), we've worked hard to secure a price that is a real value. Though the market retail for fair trade, organic beans is generally higher, by purchasing large amounts-and by switching to a more cost-efficient bag-we've been able to keep our price in a range that makes Trader Joe's Fair Trade Organic Bolivian Blend what we consider to be a fair trade for our customers, too! Fair Trade Organic Bolivian Blend Coffee
074367.name: Fto Bolivian Blend Coffee 12 Oz
074367.title: Fair Trade Organic Bolivian Blend

074368.description: Sometimes you want a big, bold, brash cup of coffee. We have you covered. There are also times when you want a cup of coffee that's a little more on the mellow side, with strong coffee flavor but without the intensity you get from some brews. Trader Joe's Organic Breakfast Blend is the coffee for those occasions. You may have noticed a new look for our Organic Breakfast Blend-rather than a canister, it now comes in a valved bag. In addition to being a more efficient form of packaging, the bag also helps protect your coffee, too: when coffee beans are roasted, they emit a small amount of CO2, and can continue to do so even after being sealed in packaging. This valve lets that CO2 escape, without letting any oxygen in, ensuring that your coffee stays fresh and that the bag doesn't inflate. Ingenious! Other than its new packaging, it's still the same great coffee, still sourced for us from a series of small coffee cooperatives across Latin America, including Southern Mexico, Guatemala, and the Peruvian Andes. Organic, kosher, and fair trade certified, it's a beautifully balanced Blend that's been toasted to a medium roast to create a smooth, mellow, super-drinkable flavor profile. We find that makes it the ideal brew with which to start your day-which is why we call it Breakfast Blend. Try it with your favorite traditional breakfast fare, served black, or, if you'd like an even smoother sip, with a spoonful or two of our Coconut Creamer [sku 52909]. Organic Breakfast Blend Medium Roast Coffee
074368.name: Fto Breakfast Blend Coffee 12 Oz
074368.title: Fair Trade Organic Breakfast Blend

074457.description: One of the more than 13,000 islands that form Indonesia, Sumatra leads the country's coffee production. Divided by the volcanic Barisan mountain range that is greater than 12,400 feet at its peak, the topography and humid climate are well suited for coffee cultivation. Small family farmers grow the 100% Arabica beans for Trader Joe's Fair Trade Organic Sumatra Coffee among fruit trees in the northern region of the island. The beans are picked, washed, and pulped by hand, using the distinctive "wet-hulling" process. This unique production method, known in Indonesia as Giling Basah, contributes to the signature characteristics of Sumatra coffee: full bodied, lower acidity, and bold, earthy flavors. The beans are given a medium-dark roast to accentuate tasting notes of dried fruit and molasses in every sip. Not only can a cup of Trader Joe's Fair Trade Organic Sumatra positively impact the start of your day, because of it's Fair Trade certification, each bag supports small farmers through fair prices. So, go ahead, brew yourself a mug-it works exceptionally well with drip, pour over, French press, and espresso brewing methods. Fair Trade Organic Sumatra Coffee
074457.name: Fto Sumatra Coffee
074457.title: Fair Trade Organic Sumatra Coffee

074552.description: For a good, satisfying cup of coffee with no frills, nothing fancy-just good coffee at a great price-our customers have been reaching for cans of Trader Joe's Joe Medium Roast Whole Bean Coffee for almost two decades. It's a balanced blend of 100% Arabica beans that are roasted to that place where drinkability, smoothness, and enjoyability meet - a medium roast, to be precise. Despite its longtime success on our shelves, we sought to make it even better (Kaizen!) When customers now reach for Joe Medium Roast Whole Bean Coffee, they'll be grabbing a bag, instead! It's the exact same smooth Coffee with smoky, cocoa flavors and light, floral acidity with new and better packaging. Each bag has a discreet "degassing valve" that performs two functions: it allows naturally occurring carbon dioxide to escape the bag without allowing oxygen to enter, and once the coffee is opened, it helps keep the beans fresher even longer. (Plus, it allows you to get a whiff of that invigorating coffee smell.) Kaizen, indeed! Enjoy a cup at home with a stack of Blueberry Waffles [sku 20106]. Or on-the-go with a Chewy Chocolate & Peanut Butter Protein Bar [sku 67385] or paired with a slice of Tiramisu Torte [sku 53005] as an after-dinner treat. Your kitchen table. The office. A to-go cup on the road. It doesn't matter where you are, as long as you have a good cup of Joe. Joe Medium Roast Whole Bean Coffee
074552.name: Joe Coffee Medium Roast 14 Oz

075079.description: If you're a fan of flavored coffee, you know that not all flavored coffees are created equal. Thankfully, the only flavored coffees you'll find at your neighborhood Trader Joe's are those that have been evaluated to meet our exacting standards for a cup of joe-flavored or not-and then naturally flavored in a way that highlights the carefully selected base blend of beans. It's with this in mind that we're thrilled to introduce Trader Joe's Chocolate Hazelnut Ground Coffee to our everyday coffee offerings. Our supplier sources 100% Arabica beans from Cerrado de Minas, one of the most renowned coffee growing regions in Brazil. The small bean size from this region produces a full-bodied, mildly flavored brew with a creamy mouthfeel; once the beans are given a light roast and ground, they provide the ideal backdrop for the infusion of a natural flavor oil imbued with fragrant notes of rich Chocolate and toasted Hazelnut. The result is a delightfully smooth sipping experience with every cup, whether you're in the mood for a welcoming wakeup or warming treat on a chilly afternoon. Sip it straight to let the flavors shine, or add a splash of creamer to further enhance the Coffee's inherent sweetness and velvety mouthfeel. Chocolate Hazelnut Ground Coffee
075079.name: Chocolate Hazelnut Coffee Ground
075079.title: Chocolate Hazelnut Ground Coffee

075122.description: Sourced from Guatemala, Indonesia, Honduras, Mexico, and Peru, Trader Joe's Fairtrade Organic Five Country Blend is a global coffee bean tour in a bag. Each country contributes something unique to this bold, well-balanced, whole bean Blend: the Guatemalan beans offer notes of toasted almonds and chocolate; the Indonesian beans add earthiness and spiciness; the Honduran beans bring depth and body; the Mexican beans supply subtle, fruity undertones; and the Peruvian beans lend a lively, medium acidity. As one of our darkest, richest roasts, it's excellent for making everything from espresso, to pour-over, to French press. Long-time Five Country fans may recall the previous canister of Five Country Espresso Blend [sku 55790] offered on shelves-it had an admittedly limiting moniker, as "Espresso" referenced a single coffee preparation instead of the numerous ways a dark roast coffee can be ground, brewed and enjoyed. Our new Five Country Blend maintains the beloved flavor profile and bean origins of its predecessor, is still Organic and kosher (pareve)-certified, and holds Fairtrade certification, guaranteeing small-scale growers are given a fair price for their harvest. And speaking of a fair price, great news: increased efficiencies with our new supplier (along with the new packaging) mean we get to pass significant savings along to you! Organic Five Country Blend
075122.name: Fto Five Country Blend Coffee
075122.title: Fairtrade Organic Five Country Blend

075416.description: From approachable house coffee and espresso blends to high-quality and rare single origin coffees, Black Acres Roastery seeks to provide a unique coffee experience for all types of coffee drinkers. The Black-owned, Baltimore, MD-based roastery boasts a direct trade partnership with Promotora Café de Altura in Nariño, Colombia, supporting indigenous farmers across the region. This remote area, known for producing particularly pedigreed coffee, is the source of the 100% Arabica beans in each bag of Colombia Aponte Honey Coffee. After harvest, the coffee cherries are Honey-processed, wherein the skins and pulps are removed, but the beans are dried without washing away the sticky outer layer of the fruit. This imparts a subtle sweetness as the beans dry, which Black Acres Roastery further highlights with a dark roast, eliciting notes of caramel and dates. Once brewed, the result is an aromatic, fruit-forward cup with low acidity and hints of baking spices, primed for pairing with a Chocolate Chip Pain au Lait [sku 62023] for breakfast or a few squares of 73% Cacao Organic Dark Chocolate [sku 70561] for an after-dinner treat. Black Acres Roastery Colombia Aponte Honey Coffee
075416.name: Coffee Black Acres Roastery Colombian Roast

077083.description: Those rumors brewing across the land are true: Trader Joe's French Roast has got a brand new bag! Brought to us by a new supplier, whose increased efficiencies (including the change to a bag, rather than a canister) allow us to offer this rich, super dark-roasted whole bean coffee for a signifcantly lower retail, our new French Roast is nothing if not buzz-worthy. It's made with a blend of 100% Arabica beans from Peru and Brazil, which, when made into drip, pour-over, or even cold brew coffee, creates a rich, robust cup with notes of cacao, baking spice, and toasted pecans. So, what precisely makes a coffee blend with Peruvian and Brazilian beans a French Roast? The "French" actually refers to the level of roast, rather than its geographical provenance. While food historians aren't entirely certain when and where the term originated, it's very likely a reference to the fact that, in the 19th century, super dark-roasted coffee was all the rage in French cafés. One sip of our French Roast, and it's easy to see why: in addition to imparting a deep, dark hue to the beans, the extra roasting time also intensifies its sweet, chocolatey aromatics, and heightens the nuttiness and spice on the palate. French Roast Coffee
077083.name: French Roast Coffee 13 Oz
077083.title: French Roast Whole Bean Coffee

077924.description: Situated in the lush, green highlands of West Java, the region of Parahyangan gets its name from an old Sundanese word for "the abode of the gods." Here, sheltered by the shade of the Perhutani forest, several smallholding coffee farmers cultivate some of the richest, most flavorful coffee beans that Indonesia has to offer. Our latest limited-release, small lot coffee, Trader Joe's Java of the Gods, comes to us from a collection of these farmers, and easily lives up to Parahyangan's name-each strong, full-bodied sip is practically divine. Semi-sweet, toasty, and marked with notes of cacao, our Java of the Gods has a substantial mouthfeel and dark, chocolatey profile that's ideal for serving with decadent desserts and all sorts of breakfast dishes, savory and sweet. When paired with a stack of syrupy Belgian Waffles [sku 96967] or toasted, buttered Pancake Bread [sku 63303], for instance, its relatively low acidity and semi-bitter edges (resulting from this Java's deep, dark roast) will cut through the sweetness, providing a captivating complement. When served alongside a savory omelette, breakfast sandwich, or plate of spicy chilaquiles, however, those same qualities will allow the stronger flavors from both the coffee and the food to intermingle and reinforce one another. However you pair this Java of the Gods, or even if you just plan to sip it solo, be sure to pick up a bag before too long, because supplies are decidedly limited. Java of the Gods Small Lot Coffee
077924.name: Coffee Small Lot Java Of The Gods Indonesia
077924.title: Java Of The Gods Small Lot Coffee

078731.description: It turns out that a long drive, a closed truck, and hot weather are the perfect combination for a truly special brew. Enter Trader Joe's Tropical Bahia Brazil Small Lot Coffee! After harvesting, coffee beans need hot, arid weather to thoroughly dry before roasting. The high growing regions of Bahia, Brazil aren't blessed with such conditions, so growers send their beans away to sunnier regions-this journey is where the Tropical Bahia Brazil magic happens. Ripe Arabica coffee beans spend the long drive in a hot, closed truck. These conditions set off a fermentation process that, unlike the controlled and monitored process for most coffee, happens naturally and with minimal interference. Such spontaneity gives Tropical Bahia Brazil its unique character. A medium roast results in a balanced coffee that boasts layered flavors, notes of sweet fruits, and a touch of acidity. Once in our hands, the beans are packed in bags with one-way valves that keep oxygen out-this helps to preserve their singular flavor. Brew hot for an interesting morning cup, pair with fruit pastries like Raspberry Croissant Carré [sku 77043] and Strawberry & Rhubarb Hand Pies [sku 74290], or enjoy over ice with a splash of milk (or a non-dairy alternative) for an afternoon pick-me-up. Tropical Bahia Brazil is part of our Small Lot Coffee program, which means quantities are truly small. Pick up a bag and brew a cup while it's on our shelves! Tropical Bahia Brazil Small Lot Coffee
078731.name: Coffee Small Lot Tropical Bahia Brazil
078731.title: Tropical Bahia Brazil Small Lot Coffee

081741.description: Hailing from the Yirgacheffe region of Ethiopia, Trader Joe's FTO Shade Grown Ethiopian Coffee is a medium dark roast blend straight out of this birthplace of coffee. It is within the forests of the Kaffa region that arabica coffee was first found growing wild. This coffee has got it all - it's USDA organic, shade grown, and fair trade certified which supports fair sale prices given to farmers for the 100% arabica green beans they grow so well. And grown under a canopy of trees, our FTO Shade Grown Ethiopian Coffee is grown nestling itself amongst a diverse habitat in its natural setting as opposed to many modern, sun-tolerant coffee plants that are grown in direct sunlight. All of this comes together in harmony to receive its medium dark roasting to give a rich tasting, medium bodied coffee that takes on a slightly acidic tartness and floral aroma. The beans are then packaged immediately and the canister nitrogen flushed to help ensure the freshest beans are what you smell when you get home and peel back the freshness seal. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Fair Trade Shade Grown Ethiopian Coffee
081741.name: Fto Ethiopian Coffee Shade
081741.title: Organic Fair Trade Shade Grown Ethiopian Coffee

091119.description: Seated outdoors at a Parisian cafe, taking in the French capital's views - the Seine, the Champs-Élysées, Notre Dame, or perhaps even the Louvre - surely sounds like a magical escape doesn't it? Well, let me clue you in on a little secret, it's more than just the views that you're drinking in, it's the coffee painting the magical scene. While Trader Joe's FTO French Roast Decaf whole bean coffee can't seat you at a sidewalk cafe, it can surely fill you with the blissful sensation of enjoying a cup of dark roast coffee in the City of Light. Our FTO French Roast Decaf Coffee is roasted long and slow to give that ridiculously rich dark color and release all those coffee oils onto the surface of the beans. They are packaged immediately after roasting to maintain this dark brown appearance and shimmering oily glow. Trader Joe's FTO French Roast Decaf Coffee hits all the boxes of a classic French roast blend. Sweet and smoky flavor? Highly smooth with little acidity? An oily mouthfeel? All check! Additionally, this Fair Trade Certified coffee directly supports better practices for small farmers through fair prices and environmental stewardship. All of this and after just one cup, we know you'll be hooked and saying "Oui oui! Barista pour me another!" *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Fair Trade Organic French Roast Decaf Coffee
091119.name: Fto French Roast Coffee Decaf
091119.title: Trader Joe'S Fair Trade Organic French Roast Decaf

093048.description: Seated outdoors at a Parisian cafe, taking in the French capital's views - the Seine, the Champs-Élysées, Notre Dame, or perhaps even the Louvre - surely sounds like a magical escape doesn't it? Well, let me clue you in on a little secret, it's more than just the views that you're drinking in, it's the coffee painting the magical scene. While Trader Joe's French Roast Ground Coffee can't seat you at a sidewalk cafe, it can surely fill you with the blissful sensation of enjoying a cup of dark roast coffee in the City of Light. Our French Roast Ground Coffee is roasted long and slow to give that ridiculously rich dark color and release all those coffee oils onto the surface of the beans. They are packaged immediately after roasting to maintain this dark brown appearance and shimmering oily glow. Rest assured that each canister is flushed with nitrogen to seal in the recently- roasted freshness. Trader Joe's French Roast Ground Coffee hits all the boxes of a classic French roast blend. Sweet and smoky flavor? Highly smooth with little acidity? An oily mouthfeel? All check! After just one cup, we know you'll be hooked and saying "Oui oui! Barista pour me another!" *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing.
093048.name: French Roast Coffee Ground
093048.title: French Roast Ground Coffee

093200.description: Coffee isn't just a beverage. It's a fuel, an essential part of one's morning ritual. And while it's nice to be able to revel in that ritual, the reality is that we can't always take the time to slowly brew a cup in quiet contemplation. Sometimes, we just need a cup of coffee, even when we don't have access to a coffee machine. For mornings and moments like that, we have Trader Joe's 100% Colombian Instant Coffee. Ever been curious how Instant Coffee is made? It's less complex than it seems: first, our supplier brews up a big batch of coffee using 100% Colombian coffee beans, then sprays a mist of that coffee into an environment that's been made super hot and super dry. By the time the mist settles onto the ground, the droplets dry into tiny crystals that can then be reconstituted into liquid coffee via the reintroduction of hot water. What that means for you is that each cup of our 100% Colombian Instant Coffee has all the earthiness and invigorating flavor of a pot of drip coffee - because that's precisely what it is! Pleasantly roasted, perfectly mild, and wildly convenient (especially for traveling), Trader Joe's 100% Colombian Instant Coffee is also a genuine everyday value: you can find 3.5-ounce jars at your local Trader Joe's for $3.99*. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. 100% Colombian Instant Coffee
093200.name: Instant Coffee Colombian
093200.title: 100% Colombian Instant Coffee

097203.name: Instant Coffee Packets All Dressed Up With Creamer And Sugar

097761.description: Grown under a shade canopy in the mountainous region of Matagalpa, Nicaragua, these Arabica beans come from a family owned estate that has been growing, harvesting, and roasting coffee for five generations. We've given these beans a dark, smooth roast that's low in acid and rich in flavor. And since it already comes in a fine grind, you can have a shot of espresso or a rich, creamy cup of coffee anytime! We are selling a 14 oz. bag of Trader Joe's Ground Espresso Blend for $7.99.
097761.name: Espresso Ground Shade Grown
097761.title: Shade Grown Espresso Blend

098530.description: It's time to wake up and smell the coffee. Literally. We named this particular blend of beans Organic Fair Trade Wake Up Blend Coffee for a reason - well, several reasons, actually, but most important in this particular sentence is that this is a great coffee to greet both your olfactory and gustatory senses first thing in the morning. Wake Up Blend is a mix of organically grown, fair trade certified, 100% Arabica Beans from small-scale farms in Mexico, El Salvador, Honduras, and Peru. The farmers who grow the beans are committed to organic and sustainable agricultural practices. They're also committed to cultivating truly excellent coffee beans. Here, those high quality beans are given a medium roast that brings out their best flavors and results in a smooth, well-balanced cup with bright acidity and just a touch of inherent sweetness. We like waking up to the aroma and flavor of Trader Joe's Organic Fair Trade Wake Up Blend. We really like the price of $14.99 for this big, 28 ounce can - a price, by the way, that's remained unchanged since 2011! You can make about 105 (standard six ounce) cups of coffee with these beans, making the per-cup cost around 14.3 cents. Wake up and smell the value!
098530.name: Fto Wake Up Blend Coffee
098530.title: Organic Fair Trade Wake Up Blend Coffee

046769.category: Cold Brew and Ready to Drink Coffees
046769.description: Did you know? Both green and black tea are made with leaves that come from the same species of plant , Camellia sinensis. The difference in color and flavor between the two is due to the fact that black tea leaves undergo a withering (accelerated drying) and oxidation (curing in a climate-controlled room) process, whereas green tea leaves do not. Hence, green teas, like our Trader Joe's Unsweetened Green Tea Beverage, have a fresher, more floral, more delicately grassy flavor. And it's exactly that flavor profile that makes our pre-brewed, ready-to-drink Unsweetened Green Tea Beverage so remarkably refreshing. Equally delicious whether it's served hot or chilled, it can be customized with slices of your favorite citrus, muddled with a sprig of mint, or even incorporated into an alluringly aromatic cocktail. We find that its fine, earthy notes are particularly well suited for serving alongside savory pastries, fresh cut melon, and seafood of all kinds. For an extra special treat, try mixing it with our Fresh Squeezed Lemonade [sku 68172] in a 1:1 ratio and enjoying with a rice bowl topped with roasted salmon. Unsweetened Green Tea Beverage
046769.name: Green Tea Unswt 1 Lt
046769.title: Green Tea Unsweetened Beverage

056952.category: Cold Brew and Ready to Drink Coffees
056952.description: Heat can be nice-like on a cold winter's night, or, if you want to cook a steak-but heat can also be damaging, especially when it comes to certain consumables. That's why we've seen the emergence of cold pressed juices, and "raw" honeys. Eliminating heat from the prep process for foods like these not only preserves important nutrients, but also allows the best and truest flavors to shine through. Such is definitely the case with coffee. While we're not concerned with "preserving nutrients" in a coffee drink, flavor is of the utmost importance. Flavor is the "why" behind our new Black Cold Brew Coffee. Our Cold Brew starts with 100% Arabica coffee beans from Central and South America. These beans are roasted (some- times heat is necessary!) before they are coarsely ground and steeped in cold water for hours at a time. During this cold brew process, the beans are never exposed to heat, thus preserving the full, bold flavor of this coffee. This process also affords lower acidity for a less bitter, distinctively smooth, easy drinking beverage. Our Black Cold Brew comes ready-to-drink. Keep the can chilled in the fridge for the next time you're craving quality coffee, or put some on ice in a cooler to take on your picnic or to your next sporting event. You can en- joy it "Black," or you can add your favorite milk, cream, or dairy alternative. It also makes a wonderful affogato when poured over Trader Joe's French Vanilla Ice Cream [sku 78576]. Other ready-to-drink cold brews will cost you upwards of $2.50, but we're selling our eight ounce can of Trader Joe's Black Cold Brew Coffee for $1.79. 10.24. 16
056952.name: Cold Brew Coffee Black
056952.title: Black Cold Brew Coffee 100% Arabica Coffee

056953.category: Cold Brew and Ready to Drink Coffees
056953.description: Heat can be nice-like on a cold winter's night, or, if you want to cook a steak-but heat can also be damaging, especially when it comes to certain consumables. That's why we've seen the emergence of cold pressed juices, and "raw" honeys. Eliminating heat from the prep process for foods like these not only preserves important nutrients, but also allows the best and truest flavors to shine through. Such is definitely the case with coffee. While we're not concerned with "preserving nutrients" in a coffee drink, flavor is of the utmost importance. Flavor is the "why" behind our new French Vanilla Cold Brew Coffee. Like our Black Cold Brew [sku 56952], this one starts with 100% Arabica coffee beans from Central and South America. These beans are roasted (sometimes heat is necessary!) before they are coarsely ground and steeped in cold water for hours at a time. During this cold brew process, the beans are never exposed to heat, thus preserv- ing the full, bold flavor of this coffee. This process also affords lower acidity for a less bitter, distinctively smooth, easy drinking beverage that's enhanced with milk, sugar, and the natural flavor of real vanilla from Madagascar. Our French Vanilla Cold Brew comes ready-to-drink. Keep the can chilled in the fridge for the next time you're craving quality coffee, or put some on ice in a cooler to take on your picnic or to your next sporting event. With the natural vanilla flavor, it's easy to enjoy as-is. Or, you can even make a double-vanilla affogato by pouring it over Trader Joe's French Vanilla Ice Cream [sku 78576]. Other ready-to-drink cold brews will cost you upwards of $2.50, but we're selling our eight ounce can of Trader Joe's French Vanilla Cold Brew Coffee for $1.79. 10.24. 16
056953.name: Cold Brew Coffee Van
056953.title: French Vanilla Naturally Flavored Cold Brew Coffee

057007.category: Cold Brew and Ready to Drink Coffees
057007.description: Once found almost exclusively in Asian supermarkets, unsweetened, premium ready-to-drink teas are definitely seeing a surge in popularity. We wouldn't dream of attaching our name to just any old tea, though, so our Buyer searched high and low for the perfect fit-and she found it in our new unsweetened Golden Oolong Tea. Trader Joe's Golden Oolong Tea boasts a bright, golden flavor profile to match its bright, golden color-and its pleasantly floral finish leaves an almost sweet, slightly toasty taste on the tongue. Stronger than most green tea but more mild than black tea, oolong is known for being exceptionally drinkable. Part of its drinkability stems from how it's processed; oolong tea is made from tea leaves that have only been partially oxidized (ex- posed to oxygen) during processing, whereas black tea is made from leaves that have been left to fully oxidize. The result is so smooth that it shouldn't take you too oolong to down the whole bottle¿ We're selling each 16.9-ounce bottle of Golden Oolong Tea for $1.19, which is almost a whole dollar less than we've seen similar ready-to-drink oolong teas sold for elsewhere. So grab a bottle anytime your day could stand to be infused with brightness-you'll find it in our beverage aisle. 04.03. 17
057007.name: Golden Oolong Tea

062611.category: Cold Brew and Ready to Drink Coffees
062611.description: Cold brew coffee is booming. Accordingly, we've created several options, including: Black [SKU 56952] or Vanilla [SKU 56953] Cold Brew in cans, nitro-infused Organic Cold Brew [SKU 57583] in a glass bottle, Cold Brew Coffee Bags [SKU 63482] (for home brewing), and a line of Cold Brew Concentrates [SKU 50759, etc.]. With all these options, we still noticed a gap-and it's one that Trader Joe's Ready to Drink Cold Brew Coffee fills to the rim. It comes in a large-format bottle (multiple servings), similar to our Concentrates. However, unlike the Concentrates, this bottle's contents require no dilution with water. More precisely, what you'll find inside is small-batch Cold Brew Coffee made using an authentic cold-brew process that includes 100% Arabica beans from Colombia that are air-roasted and ground, then steeped in cold water for at least 12 hours. What it doesn't include is any reconstituted coffee, additives, or preservatives. And, just as the cold-brew-coffee connoisseur would expect, the flavor here is bold & rich, with a smooth body, and significantly less acid than hot-brewed java. With that acid and bitterness out of the way, you can really catch the hints of molasses, and notes of walnut and cocoa offered in this premium brew. Simply chill and pour into your glass (or pour over ice-it's best served cold) to enjoy. We're selling 32-ounce bottles (about 3 servings) of Trader Joe's Ready to Drink Cold Brew Coffee for $4.99. 08.13. 18
062611.name: Coffee Cold Brew Rtd Colombian
062611.title: Ready To Drink Cold Brew Coffee

086923.category: Cold Brew and Ready to Drink Coffees
086923.description: Traditionally a golfer's beverage, a blend of black iced tea & lemonade is a veritable hole-in-one on a hot summer's day, and Trader Joe's Organic Tea & Lemonade -made with organic black tea concentrate, organic lemon juice, organic cane sugar, etc.-is the blend to beat all blends. It'll cool you down when things get heated on the course and give you something to talk about when your pals take the party poolside. (The bottle is peppered with some snappy golf terms & their definitions, like "niblick," "mashie," and "dormie"-learn while you lounge!) We're selling each 64-fluid ounce bottle of Organic Tea & Lemonade for $2.99, plus deposit where required- the same great price it's been since 2008, when today's golfing phenoms were still riding around in golf carts with training wheels. It's just another legendary value you'll find only at your neighborhood Trader Joe's. Look for it in our beverage aisle.
086923.name: Black Tea & Lemade Org 64 Oz
086923.title: Organic Green Tea & Lemonade

097036.category: Cold Brew and Ready to Drink Coffees
097036.name: Green Tea & Lemonade Org 64 Oz
097036.title: Organic Green Tea & Lemonade

052902.description: Juice is fluid fruit. It's veritable veggies. It's all the goodness of fresh-picked produce, pulverized to a pulp and delivered up in a cup with nothing else added¿ at least, that's what juice should be. Trader Joe's Cold Pressed Green Juice is just as it should be. Each 15.2-ounce, 100-calorie bottle contains an impressive one whole pound of spinach and seventeen kale leaves. To these nourishing greens, we add one large apple, a quarter of an English cucumber, one stalk of celery, one lemon, and two "inches" of a ginger root. Then, we "juice" them all all in a slow, hydraulic press for maximum liquid extraction. Once bottled, our juice goes through a cold, water-pressure method called HPP (High Pressure Processing), which guarantees a juice that's safe to drink, without reducing its nutritional benefits or fresh flavor. Now, on to more pressing issues¿ How does it taste? Trader Joe's Cold Pressed Green Juice has a leafy-green aroma and a balanced, fresh-vegetable flavor. The smooth, bright-green liquid finishes with notes of ginger and tart lemon. A subtle sweetness comes from 11 grams of sugar-not one gram of which was added by us. One single question remains: With all the trendy cold pressed juice bars popping up, why choose to buy your juice from Trader Joe's? 15.2 ounces of 100% juice for just $4.99-that's why! You'll be hard-pressed to find a similar Green Juice at such a value anywhere else.
052902.name: Cp Green Juice
052902.title: Cold Pressed Green Juice 100% Fruit And Vegetable Juice Blend Made From Fresh Pressed Produce Including Kale, Spinach, Lemon And Ginger.

052903.description: Juice is fluid fruit. It's veritable veggies. It's all the goodness of fresh-picked produce, pulverized to a pulp and delivered up in a cup with nothing else added¿ at least, that's what juice should be. Trader Joe's Cold Pressed Red Juice IS just as it should be. Each 15.2-ounce, 110-calorie bottle contains an impressive one-and-a-quarter medium beets, half a cucumber (almost), one-and-a-half stalks of celery, one medium apple, two-and-a-quarter carrots, one-third pound of spinach, and two inches of ginger. We "juice" it all in a slow hydraulic press for maximum liquid extraction. Once bottled, our juice goes through a cold, water-pressure method called HPP (High Pressure Processing). This process guarantees a juice that's safe to drink, without reducing its nutritional benefits or fresh flavor. Now, on to more pressing issues¿ How does it taste? Trader Joe's Cold Pressed Red Juice has an earthy beet flavor with a ginger finish. One single question remains: With all the trendy cold pressed juice bars popping up, why choose to buy your juice from Trader Joe's? 15.2 ounces of 100% juice for just $4.99-that's why! You'll be hard-pressed to find a similar Red Juice at such a value anywhere else. 6.23.1 4
052903.name: Cp Red Juice
052903.title: Cold Pressed Red Juice Made From Fresh Pressed Produce Including Beets, Spinach, Ginger And Lemon. 100% Fruit And Vegetable Juice Blend

053989.description: A fixture of the Portland, Oregon coffee scene for nearly 25 years, we'd venture to say that Stumptown Coffee has become one of the foremost authorities on cold brew in the country. Made with as simple a recipe as you'll ever find (just water and coffee-that's it!), their Original Cold Brew Coffee strikes a remarkable balance between complex and smooth, marked by bright notes of juicy orange and bracing cacao. As fervent fans of cold brew, and especially superlatively easy-drinking cold brew, we're excited to announce that you can now find Stumptown Original Cold Brew Coffee, in its signature stubby glass bottle, chilling in the refrigerators of your neighborhood Trader Joe's! Ready to drink, right out of the bottle, Stumptown's Original Cold Brew can be enjoyed totally on its own, or mellowed out even further with your favorite creamer or non-dairy beverage. It pairs beautifully with breakfast and brunch fare, fresh fruit, and pastries of both sweet and savory persuasions. Pick up a bottle or two to keep in your fridge the next time you need a mid-morning pick-me-up, or something cold, refreshing, and caffeinated to take with you on a weekend walk around the neighborhood. Stumptown Original Cold Brew Coffee
053989.name: Coffee Stumptown Cold Brew

057011.description: A long time ago in a land far, far away, chai-as we know and love it-was born. Okay, so we don't technically know when and where the first cup of chai was brewed-but we do know that sometime in the late 19th century, Great Britain was pulling out all the stops in an effort to increase black tea consumption wide and far. Lucky for us, in India, these promotional efforts birthed the ultimate East-meets-West beverage: black tea brewed according to Indian tradition (with plenty of aromatic spices) and served according to British tradition (with plenty of milk and sugar). Hi, chai. Now, over a hundred years later in your neighborhood store, another chai hero is born: Trader Joe's Vanilla Almond Spiced Chai. Like the chai of yesteryear, our Vanilla Almond Spiced Chai strikes the perfect balance between comfortingly sweet and pleasantly spicy. All the usual suspects are present (cinnamon, nutmeg, cardamom, allspice, and black pepper), plus the addition of vanilla extract to tweak the flavor profile-but unlike the chai of yesteryear, this Chai is vegan and contains absolutely no dairy. Instead, the spices are softened by pea protein powder, almond paste, and coconut cream. And this beverage isn't just East-meets-West; boasting 16 grams of protein per bottle, it's also nutrition-meets-indulgence. Down a bottle of Trader Joe's Vanilla Almond Spiced Chai before or after a workout. Mix two parts Chai with one part TJ's Cold Brew Concentrate [sku 50759] for a protein-packed eye-opener. At $2.99 per 16 ounce bottle, Trader Joe's Vanilla Almond Spiced Chai is a steal no matter how you decide to enjoy it-so grab a bottle from your store's refrigerated case today 08.08. 16
057011.name: Protein Almond Chai Smoothie
057011.title: Vanilla Almond Spiced Chai Protein Smoothie

057559.description: At the mention of kombucha, a carefully crafted, health-conscious beverage comes to mind. The people behind Health¿Ade Kombucha take "carefully crafted, health-conscious beverage" and raise it to an even higher level, with their super-diligent approach to kombucha brewing. The husband/wife/best-friend trio from Los Angeles who started Health¿Ade decided early on they were com- mitted to producing "the best tasting and highest quality kombucha you can buy." Their meticulous attention to detail and patient approach to brewing has paid off. Each small batch (only 2.5 gallons!) begins with organic black or green tea, organic evaporated cane juice, and a S.C.O.B.Y. (symbiotic colony of bacteria and yeast). This combination activates natural fermentation as the colony consumes the sugar, producing acids. Unlike other kombuchas, nothing else is added to hasten this fermentation process. As the Health¿Ade folks like to say, "The brew tells us when she's ready." Additionally, the entire fermentation process takes place in glass-unlike other kombuchas that are exposed along the way to leaching from plastic or metal containers. Health¿Ade's Pink Lady Apple is flavored with the juice of cold-pressed Pink Lady apples, added to the fer- mented brew to create a "crisp, elegant, and scrumptious," naturally effervescent beverage. It's never pasteurized (so as not to hinder the probiotics), and it's naturally low in caffeine, sugar, and calories. We're selling 16 fluid-ounce bottles of Health¿Ade Pink Lady Apple Kombucha for $3.99. That's about a dollar less than what you'll pay at other retailers.
057559.name: Kmbcha Pnk Ldy Aple Healthade

061707.description: Let's face it: not all food trends are good food trends. (Remember that one time the whole country swooned over ham aspic-a.k.a. SAVORY HAM JELLO-for, like, an entire decade? Yeah, that happened...) And when it comes to the intersection of food trends and "wellness" trends, forget about it; we've all seen some ridiculous stuff in that realm. (Just say "no" to the cabbage soup diet, people...) But every now and then, when the moon is blue & the stars align, we come across a product like our new Organic No Joke Ginger Juice Shots- a product that's trend-inspired, wellness-conscious, and-above all else-just plain good. It's also a testament to the fact that the quality & variety of our fresh juice offerings now rival what you'd find at a fresh juice shop... at a fraction of the price. These days, it seems like everybody is "juicing." We certainly aren't doctors, so we can't (and won't) comment on any potential health benefits of this trend. We do, however, have some pretty well-trained taste buds, and from where they sit, it's safe to say that not all juices are created equal. In fact, some cold-pressed ginger juices & juice shots (particularly those sold at grocery & convenience stores) taste noticeably watered-down...because they are watered-down. Trader Joe's Organic No Joke Ginger Juice Shots, however, are mixed with a blend of organic coconut water & organic lemon juice, for a total of about three slices' worth of Organic Ginger Juice, ¿ of an organic coconut's worth of organic coconut water, & a wedge's worth of organic lemon juice per shot, to be exact. We also add a sprinkle of organic cayenne pepper to each shot for good measure. Like we said, these Organic Ginger Juice Shots are No Joke¿ We've met fancy folks who spend up to $10 per day on raw, cold-pressed, organic juice blends & juice shots. That's not sustainable for regular Joes like us, so in addition to making sure Trader Joe's Organic Juice Shots are raw, cold-pressed, and organic, we've also made sure they're a value-we're selling each two fluid-ounce Shot for $1.99! Shots, shots, shots, shots, shots, shots, shots¿Everybody! You'll find them in our fresh juice case.
061707.name: Juice Shot Ginger
061707.title: Organic No Joke Ginger Juice Shot

061708.description: Let's face it: not all food trends are good food trends. (Remember that one time the whole country swooned over ham aspic-a.k.a. SAVORY HAM JELLO-for, like, an entire decade? Yeah, that happened...) And when it comes to the intersection of food trends and "wellness" trends, forget about it; we've all seen some ridiculous stuff in that realm. (Just say "no" to the cabbage soup diet, people...) But every now and then, when the moon is blue & the stars align, we come across a product like our new Organic Mighty Turmeric Juice Shots- a product that's trend-conscious, wellness-conscious, and-above all else-just plain good. It's also a testament to the fact that the quality & variety of our fresh juice offerings now rival what you'd find at a fresh juice shop... at a fraction of the price. These days, it seems like everybody is "juicing." We certainly aren't doctors, so we can't (and won't) comment on any potential health benefits of this trend. We do, however, have some pretty well-trained taste buds, and from where they sit, it's safe to say that not all juices are created equal. In fact, some cold-pressed turmeric juices & juice shots (particularly those sold at grocery & convenience stores) taste noticeably watered-down...because they are watered-down. Trader Joe's Organic Mighty Turmeric Juice Shots, however, are mixed with a blend of organic coconut water & organic lemon juice, for a total of about three slices' worth of Organic Turmeric Juice, ¿ of an organic coconut's worth of organic coconut water, & a wedge's worth of organic lemon juice per shot, to be exact. We also add a sprinkle of organic black pepper to each shot for good measure. Like we said, these Organic Turmeric Juice Shots sure are Mighty¿ We've met fancy folks who spend up to $10 per day on raw, cold-pressed, organic juice blends & juice shots. That's not sustainable for regular Joes like us, so in addition to making sure Trader Joe's Organic Juice Shots are raw, cold-pressed, and organic, we've also made sure they're a value-we're selling each two fluid-ounce Shot for $1.99!
