Native to Mexico and Central America, and referred to as "alligator pears" by some earlier in their history, they're technically berries containing a single seed, and classified as flowering plants. Botanical distinctions aside, we find that they're among the more versatile fruits in our produce section, which is among the reasons we proudly carry Trader Joe's Organic Avocados in convenient, four-count, mesh bags. And for our stores serviced out of our Minooka, Hartford, Nazareth, Virginia, and Daytona warehouses, these Organic Avocados are now Totally Ripe! We take the extra step of pre-ripening these Avocados at the distribution center, so that by the time they reach your store, they're ripe and ready to slice and serve, and only a day or so away from being soft and ready to mash for guacamole or avocado toast. Amazing! Organic Avocados (4 Count) [Tolleson, Fontana, Stockton, Lacey, & Irving Stores] Organic Totally Ripe Avocados (4 Count) [Minooka, Hartford, Nazareth, Virginia, & Daytona Stores]
066061.name: Avocado Org Hass - Single 60Ct
066061.title: Avocado Bag Org Hass 4Ct

066072.description: A palette is that thin, flat, roundish piece of wood (with thumb-hole for gripping), dotted with primary hues and smeared with a mingling of pigments-at the ready for the color-loving artist. Over time, this tool becomes art itself, with its blending of colors and build up of impasto strokes. Like the artist's palette (and like our previous Salad Palette with Mango [sku 57190]), Trader Joe's Salad Palette Super Greens also begins with vibrant, separated colors-this time cooler shades: crunchy broccoli with a gradient of green; rustic, earth-toned walnuts; smooth light-green edamame and peas; dark-shaded, trimmed, green beans; all surrounding a bright white feta cheese in the center. You (The Artist) are invited to mix and mingle, turn and toss all these fresh ingredients, until they're an edible work of art, worthy of your personal palate (as in: 'sense of taste'). All these colors rest on a canvas of more "greens"-spinach, kale, and other greens... (exact mix may vary by region and season.) Of course, no work of art is complete without a signature; that's our Avocado Citrus Dressing. Like a well-lit painting on the gallery wall, Trader Joe's Salad Palette Super Greens is something to behold, as it beckons to be consumed. The difference is, once your eyes appreciate this Salad's beauty, you also get to appreciate it from another angle-and that's whatever angle your fork happens to enter your mouth. Each fresh, beautiful, delicious, 10 ounce Salad Palette is $4.99. 05.22. 17
066072.name: A-Pear D'Anjou Red Org Each

071846.description: Blackberries are native to Asia, Europe, North and South America. However, blackberries grown in specific regions are largely derived from species indigenous to that region. Blackberries have been used in Europe for over 2000 years, for eating, medicinal purposes The Tupy variety is a Brazilian-born berry grown in Mexico. Tupy are difficult to grow and yield fewer berries per plant making them even more of a delicacy. These berries are skillfully picked by hand when ripe directly in the field. Blackberries are versatile. They can be eaten out of hand, added to deserts, blended into smoothies and used in cooking. To make purees or sauces, crush your blackberries and strain out the seeds.
071846.name: Blackberries 18Oz

072665.description: ¿ Growing area: Peru, MX, Ecuador, Guatemala, Dominick Republic, Brazil, CA & FL. You will be receiving product from Peru.
072665.name: Mango Each Org

075444.description: The smooth, buttery texture of a ripe avocado is pretty irresistible to us. We think the avocado is one of nature's most perfect foods. Native to Mexico and Central America, and known earlier in their history as alligator pears, they're technically berries containing a single seed, and classified as flowering plants. While most flowering plants are quite lovely to look at, we definitely have a preference for plants we can eat. How to eat them? Oh so many ways. Slice them in half, scoop out the seed, and eat the pulp with a spoon. Stuff each pitted half with tuna or chicken salad. Or crack an egg into each half, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and bake - that's really delicious. Of course, you can go the classic route and mash the Avocado's flesh into a spectacular guacamole - that's really never a bad idea. We've taken the availability of Avocados to new heights with the introduction of Trader Joe's Teeny Tiny Avocados. The name is cute, but not entirely accurate; these emerald-fleshed gems are not that small. They're personal, single-serve, "where have you been all my life"-sized Hass Avocados. Every mesh bag contains six of them, six Avocados of just the right size to slice into your salad or smoosh onto your toast. No waste, no wrapping up the other half for another time and hoping it's still good when you're ready to eat it. Trader Joe's Teeny Tiny Avocados are a dream come true for true avocado aficionados. Of course, you can use the whole bag at once and make guacamole. No one will stop you. We're selling each bag of six Teeny Tiny Avocados for $2.69, a great big value. Look for them in our produce section.
075444.name: Avocado Bag Hass Teeny Tiny 6C
075444.title: Teeny Tiny Avocados

078054.description: Blackberries are native to Asia, Europe, North and South America. However, blackberries grown in specific regions are largely derived from species indigenous to that region. Blackberries have been used in Europe for over 2000 years, for eating, and medicinal purposes. Blackberries are versatile. They can be eaten out of hand, added to deserts, blended into smoothies and used in cooking. To make purees or sauces, crush your blackberries and strain out the seeds.
078054.name: Blackberries 12 Oz

081838.description: Galia means "Wave of God" in Hebrew. One bite and you'll realize why this is the nectar of the gods. A Galia melon is a hybrid of a cantaloupe and honeydew. This variety has a very thin rind with small wrinkled lines crossing around the outer skin. Inside, the bright greenish-cream colored flesh provides the mild taste of a honeydew melon and the sweeter flavor of the cantaloupe. Galia melons are primarily known as a dessert melon. Delicious eaten by itself, or sprinkle some salt, lemon or lime juice to bring out the flavor and sweetness in the melons. They are at their very best when chilled. Galia melons add sweetness to fruit salads and in refreshing drinks, such as fruit punches, margaritas or daiquiris. They pair well with ginger, seafood, mint and soft cheeses.
081838.name: Melon Galia

087414.description: When you name your fruit after a party, you're definitely signaling that you have something special on your hands. Such is the case with the Gala Apple, an aptly named fruit if ever there was one. This Golden Delicious- Kidd's Orange Red hybrid originated in New Zealand in the 1920's - but from September through April, our just-harvested, fresh crop Galas only have to travel from the state of Washington. (They come from Chile and Argentina the rest of the year.) Trader Joe's Gala Apples are heart-shaped fruit with distinctively colored skin - yellow-orange with red striping. They're among the softer-eating apples, yet still crisp, making them good snacks for adults and kids alike. They're excellent for baking (did someone say pie?), delicious in garden salads - they bring with them a sweetness and crunch that's a great companion to greens and such - and pretty near perfect sliced and dipped into your favorite nut butter, cream cheese, or Speculoos [sku 96761]. And, like all apples, Gala Apples are good for you; among other things, you'll get 20% of the daily value of dietary fiber in every apple. So go on, throw a party, and make Galas your guests of honor. We're selling them for 49 cents each, a price that's worth celebrating, too! You'll find them in our fresh produce section.
087414.name: Apple Each Gala

087421.description: The red grapefruit is a large citrus fruit related to the orange, lemon and pomelo. Grapefruits are categorized as white (blond), pink or ruby (red), referring to the inside, pulp color of the fruit. The red variety is seedless making it perfect for sectioning. Grapefruit sections add a tangy spark to green salads. To enjoy a salad with a tropical flair, combine chopped grapefruit pieces, cooked shrimp and avocadoes and serve on a bed of romaine lettuce. Instead of your morning glass of OJ, have a glass of grapefruit juice. Combine diced grapefruit with cilantro and chili peppers to make a unique salsa.
087421.name: Grapefruit Ruby Each

090098.description: Rambu-what?? Yes, Rambutan. If you've never encountered Rambutan, we're here to introduce you. And you'll be glad of it. Rambutan gets its name, fittingly, from the Malay-Indonesian word rambut, meaning "hair"-a reference to its spiky, hairy appearance. And in Vietnam, the fruit is called chôm chôm, meaning "messy hair." What looks like a strange, spiky, otherworldly object is actually a delicious tropical fruit-one that we're pleased to offer for a limited time. One question you might have: "What should I expect when diving into a Rambutan?" Well, the flavor is sweet and similar to that of grapes or lychee. Though they're traditionally enjoyed whole and fresh, their bright fruiti- ness works wonderfully in curries, smoothies, and jams. "But how do I eat such a striking, unique fruit?" Fortunately, there are illustrations on the label showing exactly how you can be on your way to enjoying this sweet fruit. Take one rambutan with both hands and twist the outer skin apart. Separate the skin and peel it away from the whitish, translucent fruit inside. Then, enjoy the fruit and discard the pit inside. We're selling 12-ounce packages of Rambutan for $4.99. As an opportunity buy, they'll only be around for a short amount of time-try some while you can! 06.12. 17
090098.name: R-Rambutan 12 Oz

090316.description: - Trader Joe's organic navel oranges come from groves located in San Joaquin Valley, California which are tended to the finest standards. Picked at optimum harvest point, these are fresh, juicy, and perfect for enjoying a little bit of citrus sunshine especially during the winter months. Enjoy a burst of refreshing citrus on salads, or eaten out of hand.
090316.name: Orange Navel Each

090410.description: - Trader Joe's organic navel oranges come from groves located in San Joaquin Valley, California which are tended to the finest standards. Picked at optimum harvest point, these are fresh, juicy, and perfect for enjoying a little bit of citrus sunshine especially during the winter months. Enjoy a burst of refreshing citrus on salads, or eaten out of hand.
090410.name: Orange Org Navel Each

090428.description: Growing Area: Primarily the Vera Cruz region in Mexico
090428.name: Lime Bag Org 1Lb

090583.description: Mark Twain once famously said that once one has tasted watermelon, one "knows what the angels eat." Over 5,000 years of human cultivation have transformed the watermelon from a hard, bitter fruit to the sweet, juicy, practically angelic melon we enjoy today. In honor of those millenia of agricultural perseverance, we present to you Trader Joe's Fresh Cut Watermelon, a handy pack of conveniently cubed watermelon that makes it even easier to bring to potlucks, use in recipes, or simply enjoy on the go. Sourced from the U.S. and Central America, these Fresh Cut Watermelon Chunks are delightfully sweet and bright, with a satisfyingly snappy texture which provides a refreshing, watery crunch with every bite (far from just a name, watermelons are about 92% water by weight.) Of course, freeing the watermelon from its rind wasn't the only way we've made it easier to enjoy. At $3.49* for a 16-ounce tub, Trader Joe's Fresh Cut Watermelon Chunks are a downright heavenly value, too. You'll find them with our other refrigerated produce. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Fresh Cut Watermelon Chunks
090583.name: R-Cut Fruit Watermelon Chunks 16 Oz

090584.description: Fresh mangoes are such a sweet, natural treat-but sometimes, the somewhat challenging prospect of peeling this pitted, tropical fruit makes us reach for something simpler. Thankfully, Trader Joe's Fresh Cut Mango Chunks are prepared for you, ready to enjoy! We've acquired only the best Mango from around the world (origin and variety is relative to the season we're in). The frui is washed, peeled, pitted, and cut it into large Chunks. Each piece is a little too large to eat in one bite, making it ideal for almost any use, such as chopping into slightly smaller pieces for a fruit salad, or even dicing for a tropical-themed salsa. We're selling each 12-ounce tub of Fresh Cut Mango Chunks for $3.49*, every day. Find it in our refrigerated produce section. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Fresh Cut Mango Chunks
090584.name: R-Cut Fruit Mango Chunks 12 Oz

090916.description: Legend has it that raspberries were a favorite food of the Greek god Zeus, so if you're as big a raspberry fan as we are, you're in good company. Whether you enjoy them in fruit salads, smoothies, sauces or as snacks, you can count on raspberries to be sweet, tart and delicious. Are you one of those people who needs to be convinced to buy naturally sweet, nutritious Raspberries? We're up to the task. Raspberries are a rich source of vitamin C and fiber, and each one cup serving delivers a scant 60 calories. They're at their best when kept dry under refrigeration, and rinsed gently just before using. These plump red orbs are delicious eaten out of hand, and they also make for a stunning fruit tart. We're especially fond of them served on top of a big bowl of French Vanilla Ice Cream [sku 45883]. Driscoll's Raspberries are known for their superior texture and flavor, and right now we're offering a 12-ounce container of Driscoll's Raspberries, grown in Mexico and the coastal regions of Southern and Central California, for the terrific price of $4.99. Look for them in our fresh produce section.
090916.name: R-Raspberries 12 Oz
090916.title: Raspberries 12 Oz..

091079.description: Blueberries are one of only a handful of fruits native to North America. Native Americans recognized wild blueberries for their pleasant flavor but also used them for medicinal purposes and as a coloring agent. Throughout the mid 1900's, domestic blueberry production spread to 13 states, Mexico, and multiple Canadian provinces including Florida, Georgia, and California through selective breeding making the blueberries more tolerant of higher temperatures. The Blue Bell variety hails originally from Australia. It is known for producing large berries with a unique, intensely sweet flavor. If "purple" had a flavor, this would be it. Blueberries are great by themselves but they are also extremely versatile. Use them fresh in salads, oatmeal, or granola. They're also great for cooked applications like muffins, pancakes and desserts. Try freezing them on a cookie sheet and storing for later use in smoothies.
091079.name: Blueberries 18 Oz

091327.description: Watermelons have become such an integral part of the American summertime food scene, it seems that many people have it in their heads that these sweet melons are an American creation. If only we could take credit. Alas, the watermelon appears to have originated in Africa's Kalahari Desert, with ancient hieroglyphics placing the first recorded harvest in Egypt about 5,000 years ago. While we didn't invent watermelons, we sure can enjoy them! Trader Joe's Seedless Watermelons are fresh, ripe and ready for eating! What warm weather get-together would be complete without the decorative and delicious addition of fresh Watermelon? Slice them into wedges or pie-shaped slices; or halve them, hollow out and refill with watermelon balls. Here's a little insider information: the secret to great watermelon is all in the thumping and the scratching. Huh? That's right, thumping and scratching. When you "thump" the melon you should get a hollow sound, and the rind should be dull and easy to "scratch." Also, be sure to find the yellow "field spot," the place where the watermelon rested on the ground, soaking up the sun prior to harvest. Still unsure? At Trader Joe's, we'll be happy to do the thumping and scratching for you. Just ask. Trader Joe's Watermelons are good-sized and at $2.99 each, a heck of a bargain to get your summer off to a sweet start.
091327.name: Melon Watermelon Seedless
091327.title: Seedless Watermelon

091348.name: Figs Fresh Org 1 Lb
091348.title: Figs Fresh Org Black Ca 1 Lb

093562.description: In the dictionary, a gala is defined as, "a festive celebration." In the produce world, a Gala is defined as a dense, sweet, medium-sized apple known for its aromatic, light red and bright yellow skin and juicy white flesh. And it's certainly an apple worth celebrating. Organic Gala Apples can be eaten fresh, included in salads, or used as a cooking apple-and they are par- ticularly suited to making applesauce. Lucky for you, we're selling Organic Gala Apples in a 2 lb. Bag, so you can snag all the apples you'll need to make a small batch of applesauce in one fell swoop. Each 2-pound bag of USDA certified Organic Gala Apples is just $2.99-so grab a bag at your neighborhood Trader Joe's and, if you feel so inclined, get to mashing! You'll find the in our produce section.
093562.name: Apple Bag Org Gala 2 Lb

093872.description: Honeycrisps were initially the offspring of an intentional marriage between the crispy Macoun apple and the sweet Honeygold. They were naturally crossbred in the later part of the last century by apple researchers at the University of Minnesota. Not falling very far from the tree, the Honeycrisp Apple has inherited the sweetness and crispness of its parents, each bite popping with an explosive crunch, giving way to very sweet, slightly tart flesh, which is also quite excellent for pie-making. And here is a fun fact: Honeycrisps contain larger cell structures than other apples, which is how it gets its crispy bite. We're offering our customers Honeycrisp Apples for $1.29* each - you'll find them on our produce tables with our other loose fruit. *Price may vary depending on season & availability; see QIL for current price.
093872.name: Apple Each Honeycrisp
093872.title: Honeycrisp Apples

094466.description: Growing Area: These avocados are from Michoacán, Mexico, which is the world's largest avocado producing region. Mexican avocados peak from November through January and are known for their creamy nutty flavor. Product Info: Hass is the most popular variety, accounting for approximately 95% of the total crop volume. Taste: Smooth and creamy like butter, thick and soft with a little nuttiness. Nutritional Benefits: The fat content in avocados is often considered a negative, but according to the American Heart Association the monounsaturated fat found in avocados is actually beneficial. In a serving, which is one fifth of a medium avocado, there are 50 calories and nearly 20 beneficial nutrients for our bodies. They're also high in fiber and potassium. Ripening an Avocado: The Organic 48cts will be pre-conditioned and should ripen within a few days, however the following info may be helpful for customers: ¿ To ripen an avocado, place the fruit in a plain brown paper bag and store at room temperature 65-75° until ready to eat (usually two to five days). ¿ Including an apple or banana in the bag accelerates the process because these fruits give off ethylene gas, a ripening agent. ¿ Ripe fruit can be refrigerated, but not for more than two or three days. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin10/27/2010 page 58 of 61 Confidential
094466.name: Avocado Org Hass Each

094755.description: ¿ Growing area: Stemilt pears come straight from two of the best pear growing regions in the world - the upper Wenatchee River Valley and Entiat River Valley. Surrounded by alpine mountains, both regions benefit from an arid climate, fertile soil and high-quality air drainage that protects pears during the heat of the summer. The climate combines with years of farming experience to produce large, flavorful pears.
094755.name: Pear Bag Green D'Anjou 5 Lb

094928.description: ¿ Growing area: Chillan & Los Angeles areas of the Bio Bio Region in Chile
094928.name: Blueberries Org 18 Oz

095266.description: Selecting a Cantaloupe to take home can be a tricky task. Its web-like edges must be cream-colored and prominent. That green, bellybutton-like structure that's left behind after the melon is plucked from the vine (a.k.a. the "stem end") should be smooth-avoid "outies" at all costs. Finally, you'll want to make sure your sniffer is in superlative condition, because even with its rind intact, a consumer-ready cantaloupe should have a sweet, musky aroma. Sounds like a lot, doesn't it? We are, of course, quite confident in your Cantaloupe- selection skills, but here's an idea: grab a tub of Trader Joe's Fresh Cut Cantaloupe instead! For folks who don't have the time (or, perhaps, the will) to slice, peel, de-seed, etc., our new & improved Fresh Cut Fruit offerings present an easy alternative. Here, we've sliced fresh, ripe, & juicy Cantaloupe into hearty chunks, so all you have to do is eat them as-is... Or dip them in yogurt, sprinkle them with TJ's Chile Lime Seasoning Blend [sku 56662], serve them alongside a scoop of TJ's Cottage Cheese [sku 06219], etc. And at $3.69* per 16-ounce tub will have you reaching for a few packages of Fresh Cut Cantaloupe to get you through the week. Find them near our other fresh cut fruit and veggies. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Fresh Cut Cantaloupe Chunks
095266.name: R-Cut Fruit Cantaloupe Chunks

095527.description: ¿ Growing area: San Joaquin Valley, CA
095527.name: Grapes Thomcord Seedless 1Lb

095575.description: Pears from Tuscany! Tosca Pears are cross between Coscia (an early season pear that originated in Tuscany), and Williams (better known as the popular Bartlett pear here in the United States). The result is an early-season pear variety with a unique flavor that is extensively grown in Italy. We are offering Organic Tosca Pears that have been organically grown in the upper Wenatchee River Valley of Washington State. They are picked at the optimum point of sweetness and freshness-when they are medium to small sized and sporting greenish-yellow skin with an occasional red blush. Their shape is almost bell-like and their flavor is crisp and sweet with a juicy bite-perfect for baking into a pear tart, or poaching with honey and cinnamon. Of course, they are wonderful chilled and diced or sliced into a tuna or green salad. To bring them to full ripeness, store at room temperature and check them daily by gently pressing the neck of the pear with your thumb. A ripe pear will give slightly to pressure. We're selling three-pound bags of Organic Tosca Pears for $2.99-but only through September. Opportunity Buys are premium quality, limited quantity produce items that stand out among our everyday offer- ings. These items regularly refresh the Produce category and consistently create excitement among our Customers.
095575.name: Pear Bag Org Tosca 3 Lb

095734.description: ¿ Growing area: Stemilt's SweeTango apples are grown primarily in eastern Washington's Columbia Basin region, where long, warm days and cool nights precede harvest. The area is home to plentiful water resources like the Columbia River, and has a rich, volcanic soil that feeds apple trees year after year. Stemilt has SweeTango trees as old as four years. This apple is going to get better and better with each year that the tree matures!
095734.name: Apple Bag Sweetango 3 Lb

096044.description: Pears are special, and they know it. Shapelier than apples, with a flavor that is truly unique, pears have a profile all their own. You'd think that the fact that people more readily reach for an apple or banana would pierce pear pride; on the contrary, this only serves to further puff up the massive egos of pears... and no pears have a bigger ego than our Jumbo Korean Shingo Pears. Our Korean Pears are extra large and very round, earning them the nickname "Apple Pear"-a name they feel is an affront to their distinctive pearness. They have the thinnest skin of any pear variety, meaning you don't have to peel them to enjoy them-just slice and eat! They are also superbly crisp, amazingly juicy, and really sweet- with just a touch of tang (in contrast to the buttery profile of other pears). This tang makes Korean Shingo Pears the perfect partner for a variety of creamy cheeses. Korean growers purposely cultivate fewer Shingo Pears per branch, and each one is fitted with its own little "jacket" while still connected to the tree. Aside from the obvious fashion benefit, these jackets ensure thin, smooth, perfect skin. Korean Shingos are picked when fully mature, but before they are fully ripe, at which time they experience a second fitting-this time with special "socks." Their socks-along with the Pears' firmness at harvest-help to reduce bruising, and to maintain that shapely figure during transport. Whether you attribute it to vanity or just to really tasty, well-cultivated fruit, our Korean Shingo Pears provide an impressive eating experience. These beautiful, arrogant Pears are available for a limited time at $1.99 each. 12.01. 15
096044.name: Pear Each Korean Shingo

096529.description: ¿ Growing Area: San Joaquin Valley, Central California Origin / History: Flat peaches are also known as "peento" peaches. This word is derived from the Chinese word for peach, "pan tao." Peaches originated in China thousands of years ago and originally all peaches were white flesh. A popular legend claims that the flat peach was developed for an ancient Chinese emperor who loved peaches but wanted to avoid getting peach juice in his beard. Flat peaches are conveniently bite-sized all the way around.
096529.name: Peach Saturn 19 Oz

097398.description: Good things have been considered "peachy" almost as long as peaches have been around-which, according to "peach-ologists," is the latter part of the Stone Age. (Note: it is probably just a coincidence that peaches are considered a "stone" fruit.) Nevertheless, it's no coincidence that this adjective indicates a state of excellence. Have you ever tasted a ripe peach? Sinking your teeth into that velvety skin to behold the perfect balance between sweet and tart with just a tad of acidity is simply¿ peachy. And so are the Yellow Peaches we're now selling in our stores. These are grown for us in California's fertile Central Valley. Each piece of fruit packs plenty of peachy punch, and we're selling each piece individually, allowing you to buy as many (or as few) as you like, and eliminating extra packaging. Peachy! Come pick up any number of our Yellow Peaches. No matter how many you buy, our price remains the same: 69¢ each.
097398.name: Peach Yellow Each

098659.description: Among the best parts of summer, in our humble opinion, are stone fruits. Peaches and plums, nectarines and apricots, and all of the variations and combinations of these, can turn an ordinary day into a spectacular one. This is no exaggeration. We have this experience daily at this time of year. One of our favorite modern stone fruit families are the Plumcots¿. These plum-apricot hybrids come in for too-few weeks each summer, and leave us wanting more. Throughout their short season, multiple varieties of Plumcots¿ will make an appearance on our shelves-each for a limited window of time. It's challenging to predict exactly which varieties we'll have on a given day-you might find red-skinned, red-fleshed Plumcots¿, green-skinned, yellow-fleshed Plumcots¿, or purple-skinned, orange-fleshed Plumcots¿. They're all a little different, but they're all bursting with vibrant flavors. If stone fruits are your thing, but you haven't yet discovered the Plumcot¿, now's your chance. We're selling them in a one pound package for $2.99 in East Coast stores and $2.79 in West Coast stores, throughout the season..
098659.name: Plumcots 1 Lb
098659.title: Plumcots™

166061.description: The smooth, buttery texture of a ripe avocado is pretty irresistible to us. We think the avocado is one of nature's most perfect foods. Native to Mexico and Central America, and referred to as "alligator pears" by some earlier in their history, they're technically berries containing a single seed, and classified as flowering plants. Botanical distinctions aside, we find that they're among the more versatile fruits in our produce section, which is among the reasons we proudly carry Trader Joe's Organic Avocados in convenient, four-count, mesh bags. And for our stores serviced out of our Minooka, Hartford, Nazareth, Virginia, and Daytona warehouses, these Organic Avocados are now Totally Ripe! We take the extra step of pre-ripening these Avocados at the distribution center, so that by the time they reach your store, they're ripe and ready to slice and serve, and only a day or so away from being soft and ready to mash for guacamole or avocado toast. Amazing! Organic Avocados (4 Count) [Tolleson, Fontana, Stockton, Lacey, & Irving Stores] Organic Totally Ripe Avocados (4 Count) [Minooka, Hartford, Nazareth, Virginia, & Daytona Stores]
166061.name: A-Avocado Bag Org Hass 4Ct

052373.description: ¿ What it is: A flavorful herb, also known as Chinese Parsley. The citrusy flavor of cilantro is a must in many ethnic cuisines. It is a part of the coriander plant. Cilantro has a distinctive, pungent earthy taste, similar to a blend of lemon and sage. Cilantro is one of the richest herbal sources for vitamin K, and is a good source of minerals. Where it's grown: USA, Mexico, and Canada What do I do with it?: Combine with garlic and lime juice for a quick marinade, or garlic, chili pepper, avocado and diced tomato to make a guacamole. Add to chicken or vegetable soup. A note: cooking diminishes flavor; add leaves to cooked dishes just before serving.
052373.name: Herb Cilantro Bunch

052374.description: ¿ What it is: In thyme for the holiday cooking craze, we've got bunches and bunches of herbs - Parsley to be exact. This fresh-flavored herb is commonly used as a flavoring and garnish. It's a storehouse of nutrients, such as vitamins A and C, and brightens flavors in a dish. It adds balance to savory dishes the way a little lemon juice can make something just taste better. Where it's grown: California What do I do with it?: Parsley pairs well with chicken, eggplant, eggs, fish, game, lentils, mushrooms, mussels, pasta, peas, potatoes, poultry, rice, seafood, tomatoes, zucchini, lemon. Use the stalks to enrich the flavor of soup. And let's not forget chimichurri, a South American condiment similar to pesto. Once you're done enjoying your holiday feast chew a sprig. Chewing parsley will help with bad breath from food odors such as garlic. It also aids in digestion. Our Story¿ Where it's grown: California
052374.name: Herb Parsley Bunch

024455.description: While we hate to elevate one species above any others, facts are facts: salmon seems to be our customers' favorite fish. And why shouldn't it be? It's rich, "meaty," and generally mild; even non-fish-eaters will sometimes make exceptions for salmon. Which we're, of course, thrilled about, because we love salmon, too. In fact, we love it so much, that we recently redesigned the packaging on several of our salmon SKUs so that the fish is that much fresher when it reaches your table. Now packaged in aseptic, vacuum-sealed packaging, Trader Joe's BBQ Cut Fresh Atlantic Salmon fillets are from salmon that have been carefully raised in some of the world's most pristine salmon farms, at the foot of the Atlantic Ocean in northern Norway. The salmon are raised with care by experienced fish farmers and never given antibiotics in their feed, which you'll find at some fish farms. Norway's frigid waters make for tender, buttery, and well-marbled salmon-after all, fish need fat to keep warm! Thanks to their extra thick, skin-on "BBQ Cut," these Fresh Atlantic Salmon fillets can really take the heat and are ideal for grilling, pan-searing, roasting, baking, or poaching. They're great to have on hand for protein- and-omega-rich dinners in a hurry. Simply brush the fish with a bit of olive oil or butter, sprinkle it with salt and pepper (or our Salmon Rub Seasoning Blend [sku 75289]) and cook as desired. Depending on how fancy you want to get here, dinner can be ready in as little as 15 minutes. BBQ Cut Fresh Atlantic Salmon
024455.name: Bbq Cut Salmon
024455.title: Bbq Cut Fresh Atlantic Salmon Fillets

015669.description: ¿ Growing area: Leamington, Canada; Brushco, Colorado; and Guanajuato, México
015669.name: A-Tomatoes On The Vine 20 Oz

026370.name: R-Salad Champs Elysees 7 Oz
026370.title: Champs Elysees Green Leaf Lettuce, Frisee, Radicchio And Carrots

030312.description: Whoever gave Sugar Snap Peas their name was really onto something. What better way could there be to describe the sweet, satisfying pop of flavor that these pods provide? Trader Joe's Sugar Snap Peas, in particular, have an altogether pleasing crispness to them, making them a delectable textural element when added to salads, stir fries, or seafood pastas. They're even excellent when raw, as part of an elaborate crudités spread or even just idle snacking with some Buttermilk Ranch Dressing [sku 74462] for dipping. Botanically speaking, Sugar Snap Peas are a cross between English peas and snow peas, which explains their best-of-both-worlds combo of crisp texture and delicately sweet flavor. In need of quick side dish? Sugar Snap Peas are ready just like that. Give them a brief sauté with some olive oil and sliced garlic, or even just microwave them in the bag they came in for two minutes or so. Easy! You'll find them with our other refrigerated produce- we recommend that you refrigerate them at home, too, so they'll retain their fresh, toothsome texture. Sugar Snap Peas
030312.name: Peas Sugar Snap 12 Oz
030312.title: Sugar Snap Peas

031774.name: Broccoli Florets 12 Oz
031774.title: Broccoli Florets Washed And Ready To Use Microwaveable Bag

032039.description: "Thin-skinned" isn't generally seen as a sought-after quality-unless you're talking about Yellow Squash. Its thin skin makes this summer squash ideal for slicing into ribbons and tossing with lemon juice, halved Organic Mixed Medley Cherry Tomatoes [sku 50214], and a few spoonfuls of TJ's Basil Pesto Sauce [sku 75825]. Beneath that bright yellow, thin-skinned exterior is slightly seedy, tender flesh that develops an ever-so-faint vegetal sweetness when roasted or sautéed, and holds up nicely when sliced into planks, drizzled with Organic Extra Virgin Garlic Flavored Olive Oil [sku 96177], and charred on the grill. Yellow Squash makes for a tasty, lower- carb stand-in for pasta when spiralized and tossed with Rosatella Pasta Sauce [sku 76262], as well. Because "peak season" changes depending on the growing region and season, we offer Yellow Squash from California as well as Mexico to ensure we can provide top-notch quality and flavor throughout the year. Regardless of where its grown, you're sure to enjoy the incredible value we offer on one-pound packages of Trader Joe's Yellow Squash. You'll find them in our refrigerators, every day. Yellow Squash
032039.name: R-Squash Yellow 1 Lb
032039.title: Yellow Squash

032227.name: Salad Spring Mix 5 Oz
032227.title: Spring Mix Baby Lettuces And Greens

032603.description: For all the talk about "super" foods and "super" greens in particular, there's one that routinely gets left out of the conversation. Spinach. Spinach may not be hip or trendy, but it's a stalwart standby that always lives up to expectations. Cultivated stateside since the early 19th century, spinach had been a European staple for a thousand years before that. It was in the 20th century that spinach first got its "superfood" status - from a comic strip character, no less! And while it was silly when Popeye's muscles suddenly bulged after eating a can of spinach, there was also, in fact, some truth to that story. At Trader Joe's, we have fresh Organic Baby Spinach that definitely passes the Popeye test - and without the can, thankfully. It's loaded with nutrients, tastes great and is good for you any way you decide to enjoy it. In a salad with blue cheese and candied walnuts, in a hearty homemade soup, blended into a smoothie (use a powerful blender), or sautéed with a touch of olive oil and garlic, our Organic Baby Spinach will not disappoint. It's pre-washed and ready to eat, making it an effortless choice to include in your meal planning. Now that's super. Organic Baby Spinach
032603.name: R-Salad Baby Spinach Org 6 Oz
032603.title: Organic Baby Spinach

032605.name: R-Salad Spring Mix Org 5 Oz
032605.title: Organic Spring Mix Ready To Eat Blend Of Organic Mixed Baby Lettuces And Greens

033180.description: Because of the way they're eaten and prepared, tomatoes are legally defined in the United States as vegetables when, botanically, they are fruit (see U.S. Supreme Court, Nix v. Hedden, 1893 - we're not making this up). We should be clear that the Supreme Court only got involved in the fruit v. vegetable debate due to a squabble over the Tarriff Act of 1883, not because they were concerned whether folks were slicing their tomatoes for salads or eating them out of hand like apples. In any case, we think they might have made a different decision if they'd been presented with Trader Joe's Organic Sugar Plum Tomatoes. These little morsels are in the cherry tomato family, but rather than being round, they're more oblong in shape. They're sweet, juicy, and delicious - just the kind of thing you'll want to pop into your mouth, like a grape, which happens to be a fruit. We'd rest our case there, but there's more to say! Organic Sugar Plum Tomatoes are super in salads (toss them with Butter Lettuce [sku 94470] and Persian Cucumbers [sku 70625]), make it easy to make a creative Caprese salad (just skewer them onto toothpicks with basil and Fresh Mozzarella Pearls [sku 76317]), and perfect on pizza. Organic Sugar Plum Tomatoes
033180.name: A-Tomatoes Grape Sugar Plum Or
033180.title: Organic Sugar Plum Grape Tomatoes

033516.description: When one tomato equals more! First you look - evaluating how rich the red and identifying any oddities. Then you touch - squeezing to ensure the perfect level of firmness (resistant to pressure but not completely unresponsive). Finally, you smell - inhaling rich, earthy sweetness at the stem. For some, picking the perfect tomato is as enjoyable as eating it, and packaging prohibits a proper sensory exploration necessary for selection. For them, we've set the Roma loose and are now selling each extra large tomato for just 29¢! We've released the Roma (also known as "plum") because it is a tomato variety of renowned versatility and durability. With less water content and more pulp than other tomato varieties, Roma break down beautifully into sauces or pastes, are an ideal candidate for canning, and sun or oven-dry brilliantly. Plus, because they hold their shape well and have minimal seeds, Roma are the perfect tomatoes to slice for salads, sandwiches or pizza toppings. Pick up a Roma Tomato today for just 29¢ and get more (choice = quality = value)!
033516.name: A-Tomatoes Roma Each

037786.description: Let's get right to the heart of it, shall we? Simply put, hearts of romaine are the most desirable part of the lettuce. Maybe it's the crunch. Maybe it's the easy-going, ever-so-slightly bitter flavor. Maybe it's the fact, with, Trader Joe's Romaine Hearts, all the work has been done. With no dark, outer leaves to trim away, you can use the whole heart, and simply enjoy the fruits of this verdant, versatile vegetable. Romaine, the modern descendant of the oldest of all lettuce types, adds a delightful, crunchy texture to mixed green salads. In fact, it's the lettuce of choice for a Caesar, Niçoise, or Cobb salad-a triple threat, if we've ever seen one. Romaine leaves bring excellent crunch to a burger or sandwich, and are an excellent option for using as a wrap or lettuce cup. Did you know? Romaine Hearts can even be grilled! Wash the whole Heart, then split it in half and brush with olive oil, grill just until char marks appear, then sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve with or without salad dressing. Now that's what we call Heart-warming! Romaine Hearts
037786.name: R-Romaine Hearts

044168.description: No mere garnish, and not exactly the same thing as scallions, Green Onions can be used to flavor all kinds of things. Let's start in the middle, with the scallion thing. Green Onions do in fact look like scallions to the untrained eye (e.g., our eyes until we learned this), except scallions haven't developed a bulb at all. Green Onions have. It's a subtle difference, but a difference nonetheless. Both scallions and Green Onions are white onions, harvested quite young, that feature long, straight, edible, green leaves and mild onion flavor. That mild onion flavor complements so many different foods. Add chopped green onions - leaves and bulbs together - to soups, stews, and sauces. Blend them into burgers and meatloaf. Or lightly salt them, char on your grill, and serve with fresh lime wedges and a dash of Chile Lime Seasoning - this way, they make excellent partners to steak, carne asada, grilled chicken, or grilled salmon. Of course, you can use Trader Joe's Green Onions as garnish. Just remember they're the kind of garnish you actually want to eat. We're selling each six ounce package of Green Onions for 99¢, a price that will make you want to eat them often. You'll find them in our refrigerated produce case.
044168.name: Green Onions 6 Oz

050066.description: Trader Joe's Organic Herb Salad Mix includes a variety of fresh, Organic greens and vibrant Herbs. Red & green oak leaf, tango, lolla rosa, and butter lettuces are mixed in with red & green chard, mizuna, arugula, radicchio, spinach, kale, and frisee. Cilantro, parsley, and dill add some herby verve, helping to set this Salad Mix apart with its unique combination tastes and textures.* Not only have we selected and trimmed the greens and Herbs for you, we have also triple washed them. This means you just need to open the bag, pour it in a bowl, and add your own accoutrements, as desired. The options are almost endless, but you might start with some halved TJ's Organic Mini Heirloom Tomatoes [sku 91008], sliced Organic Persian Cucumbers [sku 91838], and a drizzle of our Organic Italian Dressing [sku 67698]. Fresh and delicious! *Note: Exact ingredients may vary from time to time, since we only include the freshest available greens and herbs. Organics Herb Salad Mix
050066.name: R-Salad Herb Org 5 Oz
050066.title: Organic Herb Salad Mix

050482.name: Salad Sorrento 5 Oz
050482.title: Sorrento Blend Baby Arugula, Spinach And Lettuces

051475.description: Did you know that we Americans consume more carrots than any other people in the world? It's true. On average, each of us consumes 11.5 pounds of these robust root veggies a year. Can you even imagine how those numbers would increase if more people knew they could get carrots in (almost) all the colors of the rainbow? We're on a mission to make that happen, one carrot at a time, with Trader Joe's and the Organic Carrots of Many Colors. A little history¿ until a few hundred years ago, carrots were most common in myriad colors. The Dutch combined a yellow carrot with a red one and came up with orange, their national color. These new carrots took hold and became the standard by which other carrots are judged. These days, the colorful originals are making a comeback, and while we're big fans of orange carrots, we also have a strong affinity for the Organic Carrots of Many Colors. Every two pound bag is filled with a random assortment of yellow, cream/white, red, and of course orange carrots. They all taste like carrots - no surprise there - but their color really pops on a plate. Slice these vibrant taproots into spears, present them on a tray, and serve them with your favorite dip - we humbly recommend our Onion Dip Mix as the dip for the job. Or toss them with olive oil, salt & pepper and roast them in a 400º oven for about 20 minutes - their hues will subdue when cooked, but their naturally sweet flavor will really shine and complement your entrée. We're selling each two pound bag for $1.99, a price that will complement your holiday season budget.
051475.name: Carrots Many Colors Org 2 Lb
051475.title: Organic Carrots Of Many Colors
