We also loved the unparalleled price - $3.99 per pound. y g, NATIONAL PRODUCE OPPORTUNITY BUY
051816.name: Tomato Villagio San Marza 1 Lb

052105.description: Cruciferous vegetables from the family Brassicaceae of the species oleracea have become increasingly popular with our customers. In plain English, we're talking about Kale, Brussels Sprouts, Broccoli, Green Cabbage & Red Cabbage. Individually, these plants possess plentiful nutrients and character. When chopped together, however, they present colorful texture, crunch and plenty of culinary potential. Tossed raw, they make a mighty salad. Quickly sautéed, steamed, roasted or creamed, they become a striking side. We've also discovered that somewhere in between-tossed raw with hot dressing-makes them equally remarkable. While they will wilt slightly, they retain their signature crunch and incredible colors. We like them with a warm mixture of our Fat Free Sesame Vinaigrette and Toasted Sesame Oil-it brings out the inherently nutty flavors of these rich greens. Cruciferous Crunch Collection of Chopped Kale, Brussels Sprouts, Broccoli and Green Cabbage & red Cabbage is a true Trader Joe's exclusive, which of course means the value is second to none. We're selling each 10-ounce bag for $1.99 on the West Coast and $2.29 in other regions.
052105.name: R-Salad Cruciferous Crunch 10 Oz
052105.title: Cruciferous Crunch Collection

053681.description: We have a contingent of beet fans who've celebrated our Steamed and Peeled Baby Beets [sku 72774] since the moment they were first introduced. However, there's a certain type of beet fan-a hardcore beet enthusiast, one might say-who still wants more. For those who revel in the pleasure and versatility of raw, round, red roots, we've got good news: Trader Joe's Organic Beets have arrived! There's a good deal of beauty in these beets, starting with their appearance-scarlet bulbs, hand harvested and trimmed in the fields. They are rinsed and gently tumbled over brush rollers to remove the dirt-no synthetic fertilizers or pesticides to wash away, here! One more rinse and the beets are bagged by hand and shipped to our warehouses. Once they land in your hands, you'll discover the amazing culinary flexibility of these earthy, slightly sweet gems. Fresh beets can be prepared in almost any way imaginable: Bake them. Boil them. Grill them, or steam them. Leave them raw and grate, or shred them into salads. Use a mandoline to make large, thin slices that you can oven roast for a colorful alternative to potato chips. Use them in baked goods, stir-frys, smoothies, and just about anything else your brain and hands can cook up. Beat the bushes all you like, but you won't find trimmed and bagged raw beets elsewhere-certainly not at our special price of $1.49 for each one-pound bag. (That's the West Coast price. The price on the East Coast, and in the Midwest and Southeast is $1.69.) Yay, beets! 10.06. 14
053681.name: Beets Fresh Org 1 Lb
053681.title: Organic Beets

054126.description: A popular legend says that after the king of Peru gifted a new tomato variety to the king of Naples in the late eighteenth century, it was planted near the base of Mt. Vesuvius in the rich volcanic soils of Villagio Marzano sul Sarno. These were the forerunners of today's "San Marzano" tomatoes (supposedly), but it's hard to know what's really true-especially when one considers that Peru had no kingdom (or king!) two hundred years ago. That truth may be lost to the past, but the taste of Trader Joe's Heavenly Villagio Marzano® Tomatoes is a truth that is right here before us. With an oblong shape and vaguely pointed ends-these tomatoes are a miniature version of the original San Marzano variety. The deep red fruit has smooth skin that yields a pleasant 'pop' when bitten. Inside, there is more flesh than seeds, and a flavor that is slightly sweet, and not too acidic. Such a "heavenly" profile comes, not from the volcanic soils of the Campania region of Italy, but rather from hothouses located in the U.S. and Canada. The small size of our Heavenly Villagio Marzanos® makes them perfect for snacking. Sliced in half, they add juicy charm to a green salad. Diced and simmered with olive oil, garlic and basil, they live up to their heritage as the best of the best sauce tomatoes. One of the happiest verifiable truths of all is that our hothouse harvest of Trader Joe's Heavenly Villagio Marzano Tomatoes is ongoing and unlimited (unlike the brief, two month harvest of San Marzanos in Italy). In other words, they're available year-round! Packaged in a reclosable, recyclable plastic bag (that uses 65% less plastic than a clamshell), ten-ounces of these terrific tomatoes are in our stores every single day, for $2.79. 4.01.1 5
054126.name: A-Tomatoes Heavenly Villagio Marzano 10Oz
054126.title: Tomatoes Villagio Marzano 10Oz

054163.description: An exotic delicacy iconic to izakaya (Japanese tapas/appetizers/bar food), Shishito Peppers have become a ubiquitous and fashionable finger food of late. Here's why: Shishito Peppers are enormously delicious and a bit daring, couldn't be simpler to prepare, are famously finger-friendly, and make perfect appetizers. Native to Japan (perhaps via Portugal, some speculate), the slender, green peppers have delicate skin and a slightly pleated surface that makes for a fresh crunch raw or a tender bite cooked. They have a whisper of grassy and peppery flavor, with a faint note of citrus. And-here's the kicker-some (approximately one in ten) have a real kick! So popping peppers is a bit roulette-y: mild, mild, mild, POW!... The hit of heat and suspense are addicting. Minimal prep is the key to highlighting their bright flavor. Simply heat oil (olive or sesame) in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat, and cook the peppers, turning occasionally, until they begin to blister on all sides. Sprinkle with a bit of sea salt-they are ready to enjoy! They are also wonderful grilled or deep fried, and partnered with a Soyaki-style sauce or Sriracha cream for dipping. They are ideal appetizers. They can also be tossed on top of pizzas or served alongside steaks. We've even seen them served as a cocktail garnish. Is it possible to propel the popularity of these peppers further? We think our price of $1.99-$2.29 for each six- ounce package of Trader Joe's Shishito Peppers will prove so. 1.16.1 5
054163.name: Peppers Shishito 6 Oz
054163.title: Shishito Peppers

055241.description: When the weather gets colder, salad isn't always the food that comes to mind. However, we've got a brand new seasonal salad that might change your idea of what constitutes cold-weather food. It's A Complete Salad, featur- ing Kale & Hemp Seeds. The foundation of this Salad is tender, baby Kale and crunchy Hemp Seeds-but if that were all, we'd have a hard time justifying the "Complete" in the title. Red and white radicchio leaves supplement the Kale to form the base. Slivered almonds partner with the Hemp Seeds for extra crunch. Parmesan cheese brings savory notes, while chewy, chopped dates lend a caramelly sweetness. All these flavors round it out, but it's the inclusion of a bright, Lemon Vinaigrette that really makes it Complete. Aside from the fact that this is just a really good tasting salad, it's also full of nutrients. One serving (one-fourth of the package) contains 7 grams of protein, and 3 grams of fiber. This salad is also an excellent source of vita- mins, notably vitamin A and vitamin C. And of course, the Hemp Seeds bring their Omega-3 fatty acids to the salad bowl. This triple-washed, Complete Salad with Kale & Hemp Seeds is completely ready to eat. Everything you need for a winter boost is inside the 13 ounce bag. Now that you've contemplated it-complete that thought by pick- ing up a bag for $3.99 on the West Coast, and $4.49 elsewhere (East Coast, Midwest, and Southeast). 11.30. 15
055241.name: Salad Complete Kale Hemp 13 Oz

055283.description: Sweet potatoes are light brown on the outside and orange on the inside, right? Not always, apparently. While every sweet-potato fry you encounter may indeed be vivid orange, we've gotten our hands on fields full of California- and North Carolina-grown Murasaki Sweet Potatoes that will challenge your perception of these terrific tubers. Murasaki Sweet Potatoes are dark purple on the outside, and cream colored on the inside. Eye-catching! When you cut them open, your expectations simply don't match up with what you're seeing. They look like a russet, so they should taste like a russet, right? Nope. They're sweet, through and through, with just a hint of chestnut flavor. They're a bit fluffy (again, like a russet) and a little less moist than traditional sweet potatoes and yams, but if you're a sweet potato fan, these will definitely satisfy that craving. They are the same oblong-with-slightly-pointed-ends shape as more traditional varieties, if that helps you make the Murasaki leap. And they look so cool on a plate when they come out of the oven. Serve them with butter for a savory presentation, or go all the way sweet with a drizzle of maple syrup or honey. We're selling Murasaki Sweet Potatoes in a three-pound bag for $3.99, while we can keep them in stock. You'll find them in our produce section. 10.05. 15
055283.name: Potato Sweet Murasaki 3 Lb
055283.title: Murasaki Sweet Potatoes

055386.description: Kits are king. They contain everything you need to get something done. Sewing kit? Mend a sweater. Shaving kit? Shave your face. First Aid kit? Fix the cut you got from shaving your face. What about a Salad kit? How about: Eat a salad. We call our Broccoli & Kale Slaw a Complete Kit, because it has everything you'll need to make a fresh, cru- ciferous salad. We've done the hard work for you, shredding broccoli stalks, kale and radicchio to create the crunchy slaw base. Our Kit also includes sweetened dried red sour cherries and blueberries for some sweet and chewy contrast. Roasted sunflower seeds and roasted slivered almonds add a nutty crunch. The final touch is our Sweet & Creamy Slaw Dressing that makes the Kit-and your salad-complete. Each part-the dressing, the nuts, and the fruit-is packaged separately inside the larger bag so you have con- trol as you put it all together. Divide it into smaller portions for several side salads to compliment your grilled burgers or BBQ'd ribs. Or add chicken or fish and turn this Broccoli & Kale Slaw Kit into an entrée for three. You get the whole 11-ounce cruciferous 'kit and caboodle' (minus the caboodle) for $2.49 on the West Coast, and $2.99 on the East Coast and in the Midwest and Southeast. 9.05.1 5
055386.name: R-Salad Complete Sweet Kale & Broccoli Slaw 11 Oz
055386.title: Broccoli & Kale Slaw

055482.description: As with the word "quinoa," the word "jicama" is sometimes mispronounced. It's not kwin-Oh-ah, it's keen- WAH. Likewise, it's not juh-KAI-ma, it's HICK-a-muh. Now, that we've got that out of the way¿ Also called the "yam bean," (much easier to pronounce), jicama is native to Central and South America. It was originally cultivated by all major Mesoamerican civilizations. This root vegetable is shaped like an overgrown flat onion. It has papery, brown skin, which hides beneath it, crisp, white flesh. The Jicama's bulky size and odd shape make preparing it a cumbersome ordeal. This got us thinking: What if we took care of the painful prep stage for you? We presumed that if we did, more people would become eager fans of this refreshing, underutilized vegetable. So, we did. We peeled the skin and cut the flesh into ready-to-serve sticks. The mild, sweet-starchy flavor of jicama (sometimes described as a mix between pear flesh and potato flesh) makes the perfect blank canvas for dips-especially shaped like sticks, as these are. The wonderful crunch makes a great addition to fresh salsas and salads-just chop our sticks into smaller, bite-sized pieces. Jicama also works well cooked into stir-frys and soups. We're offering each 9.5-ounce container of Jicama Sticks for just $2.69, every day. ("Sticks" is pronounced STIX, just in case you were wondering.) 9.11.1 5
055482.name: Cut Veg Jicama Sticks 9.5 Oz

055824.description: Slaw is simple-but it's not simple to prepare. Whether you choose to chop, grate, or shred your cabbage, a lot of effort is required. That's why we're introducing Trader Joe's Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots-your simple slaw starter kit. It's a fresh mix of Green Cabbage, Red Cabbage, and Orange Carrots-all three certified Organic. They're also triple washed, which means you can also take "washing" off the list of things you'll have to do to have some slaw. This bag is ready shreddy to top tacos, supplement salads, and fortify your favorite stews and soups. For a super quick, slaw side salad, whisk together 1/4 cup of Carolina Gold BBQ Sauce [sku 51438], 1/4 cup TJ's Organic Mayonnaise [sku 60932], and 2 TBSP TJ's Organic Apple Cider Vinegar [sku 24472]-then toss with the entire bag of our Organic Shredded Cabbage and Carrots. (Recipe on the package.) You can even quick-pickle these Shredded veggies for a fast and fresh Curtido (that's Mexican slaw). Just make a brine by dissolving 3 Tbsp. apple cider vinegar, 2 tsp. sugar, and 1 tsp. kosher salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Toss with TJ's Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots and refrigerate at least one hour before serving. (If you're up for a little chopping, add white onion and/or jalapeno as desired.) We're selling each nine ounce bag of Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots for $1.99. Find it in our refrigerated produce case. 03.15. 16
055824.name: Cole Slaw Organic 9 Oz
055824.title: Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage With Carrots

056211.description: Asked to describe his new squash, the accidental farmer (insurance officer by trade) mused that it was "smooth as butter and sweet as a nut." Henceforth, the cross between a gooseneck squash and (probably) a Hubbard was coined the "Butternut Squash," or so the story goes. Fast forward some seventy years-asked to describe this inspired, new cut of the coveted Cucurbita, the third-generation, Salinas Valley farming family mused that "it zigs and it zags." Or so our story starts for Butternut Squash Zig-Zags. Intent on injecting fresh, creative energy to the cooking of vegetables, these pioneers dedicated years of intensive research and development to the unique cut. Shaped somewhere between fusilli and ribbon candy, in appearance alone these Zig-Zags have a gosh-those-look-fun-to-eat character. Contributing to that captivation, especially from the cook's perspective, is the fact that Butternut Zig-Zags have been cut, washed, and are ready to use. Fancifully shaped, approachably prepared, Butternut Squash Zig-Zags can be sautéed or roasted (with butter and sage or a squeeze of lime and fresh cilantro as seasoning), to give a classic side fresh energy. They can also be tossed into soups, stir-fries, or salads, or substituted for pasta. How about zig-zag cut butternut squash fries- yes! They are even poised to be crafted into something sweet-add apples and caramel to start. Like all of our product stories, the moral of the Butternut Squash Zig-Zags cuts straight to great value. Each 12 ounce package (serves about four) of our fresh-cut and ready-to-use Butternut Squash Zig-Zags is $2.99. 04.05. 16
056211.name: Cut Butternut Squash Zags 12Oz
056211.title: Butternut Squash Zig-Zags

057285.description: Did you know that we Americans consume more carrots than any other people in the world? On average, each of us consumes 11.5 pounds of these robust roots a year. Can you even imagine how those numbers would in- crease if more people knew they could get carrots in (almost) all the colors of the rainbow? We're on a mission to make that happen, one carrot at a time, with Trader Joe's Les Petites Carrots of Many Colors. A little history¿ until a few hundred years ago, carrots were most common in myriad colors. The Dutch com- bined a yellow carrot with a red one and came up with orange, their national color. These new carrots took hold and became the standard by which other carrots are judged. These days, the colorful originals are making a comeback, and joining our full-size Organic Carrots of Many Colors [51475] this season are Les Petites Carrots of Many Colors, miniature versions of these colorful veggies. Every 16 ounce bag contains an assortment of colors, which will vary, including orange, yellow, white, purple, and red. The carrots themselves are about 4.75 to 5.5 inches long, peeled, trimmed of foliage, and ready to use. Les Petites Carrots of Many Colors can go directly from their bag to a roasting pan with your holiday roast - turkey, beef, ham, or a veggie roast all play nicely with carrots, and the color of these really makes them pop when presented center of table. They make impressive crudités, served with dips, cheese, or charcuterie. Follow the recipe on the package for a thyme-tested presentation that you can prep in moments, and roast to readiness in about 20 minutes. We're selling each 16 ounce bag for $3.99. 10.31. 16
057285.name: Petite Carrots Many Colors 1Lb
057285.title: Les Petites Carrots Of Many Colors

058006.description: "Onion, luminous flask, your beauty formed petal by petal..." -Pablo Neruda, Ode to the Onion It would be difficult to overstate just how important onions are to global cuisine. Nearly every culinary tradition the world over relies on onions in some form or another, and they often serve as the very bedrock of flavor that dishes are built upon. Noted for their sweetness, Vidalia Onions are a particularly essential allium, which is why we're proud to offer them in convenient, two-pound bags during the spring and summer months. While our valiant Vidalias can be used in any application that calls for an onion, they're particularly great for roasting, caramelizing, and quick-pickling-all of which will accentuate their natural sweetness. Raw, they're excellent for topping sandwiches, burgers, and hot dogs, and make an awesome ingredient for salads, salsas, and skewers. For an easy, out-of-this-world confit, try cooking them low and slow in a skillet with butter, sugar, and a touch of red wine until they reach a super dark, golden brown. Vidalia Onions
058006.name: Onions Vidalia 2Lb
058006.title: Vidalia Onions

058463.description: Deserts, cacti, cowboys, and the Grand Canyon are all emblematic of the southwestern United States. Another distinguishing feature? The food. And we do love food. The fare you'll often find in this corner of the country is Mexican food with a twist: spicy, vibrant, and tasty. We've taken these familiar flavors and reimagined them as a salad. Trader Joe's Southwestern Chopped Salad, to be exact. Our Southwestern Chopped Salad is an homage to the bright, spicy, flavorful dishes of its namesake region- and it's a complete salad kit, so everything you need is right in the bag! Green cabbage, carrots, and radish have been chopped into small pieces and then mixed with romaine lettuce-and just the right amount of green onions and cilantro. Also included in the bag are pepitas, tortilla strips, cotija cheese, and a spicy avocado dressing-which gets its spiciness from poblano chiles. Simply put all ingredients in a bowl, toss, and enjoy the crunchy, delicious result. This Southwestern Salad is perfect as a side salad with a dinner of Chicken Verde Enchiladas [sku 58292]. Grill up Carne Asada [sku 75977] or Pollo Asado [sku 81293] and place on top for some added protein. Or, toss it up and have a bowl for lunch-and save the rest for later! And we always advise adding some fresh slices of avocado. We're selling each 13.6-ounce bag of Trader Joe's Southwestern Chopped Salad for $2.99 (WC, TX) or $3.29 (EC, MW, SE). You'll find it with our other bagged salads. 03.29. 17
058463.name: R-Salad Complete Southwestern Chopped 13.6 Oz
058463.title: Southwestern Chopped Salad Kit

058614.description: It's summer, and the last thing you want to do is heat the house. But of course, you still have to eat. Salads, then, are quite possibly the season's perfect food. In the world of salad, there are seemingly endless choices, so how do you choose? Why not go with something new, something intriguing, something whose name sounds a bit like you're talking about a hip clergy member? Yes, friends, that would be Trader Joe's Kohlrabi Salad Blend. Kohlrabi is a relative of cabbage (its name derives from the German word for cabbage, actually) that's often mistaken for a root vegetable, though it does grow above ground. We've combined this mild, slightly sweet-tasting green with shrredded kale, golden beets, and red cabbage. These veggies, grown in California (in springtime, the cabbage is sourced from Arizona as well), come together to become a veritable superhero of a salad mix, and one you'll only find at Trader Joe's. Toss the Kohlrabi Salad Blend with your favorite dressing, or break the cardinal rule of summer and actually cook - it's delicious sautéed in olive oil with a bit of garlic and a sprinkling of sea salt, and only requires a few minutes on the stovetop. We're selling each 10 ounce bag of Trader Joe's Kohlrabi Salad Blend for $2.49, a delicious price. You'll find it in our refrigerated produce section with the other bagged salads. 07.26. 17
058614.name: Salad Kohlrabi Blend 10 Oz
058614.title: Kohlrabi Blend A Crispy Crunch Blend Of Kohlrabi, Red Cabbage, Kale And Beets

059496.description: ¿ Growing area: Mexico and Arizona in the winter months and grown in Salinas Valley, California in the summer months.
059496.name: Broccoli Bunch Organic Each

059793.description: Did you know that we Americans consume more carrots than any other people in the world? On average, each one of us consumes 11.5 pounds of these robust roots a year. Can you imagine how those numbers would increase if more people knew they could get carrots in (almost) all the colors of the rainbow? We're on a mission to make that happen, one carrot at a time, with Trader Joe's Cut & Peeled Organic Carrots of Many Colors. A little history: until a few hundred years ago, it was common to find carrots in a myriad of colors. Orange wasn't the default hue. That all changed, however, when the Dutch combined a yellow carrot with a red carrot and came up with an orange carrot-orange being their national color. These new carrots took over, quickly became the standard by which other carrots were judged. But guess what? The rainbow is back, baby! We already offer non-organic Les Petite Carrots of Many Colors [sku 57285] and whole Organic Carrots of Many Colors [51475], and now, for your snacking convenience, we bring you Cut & Peeled Organic Carrots of Many Colors, a.k.a "baby cut" Organic Carrots of Many Colors. In each bag, you'll find an assortment of orange, yellow, white, and purple snack-sized carrots, each color offering a slightly different flavor profile. Looking for a slightly sweeter carrot? Go for a purple carrot. A mildly nutty carrot? Try a white one. Cut & Peeled Organic Carrots of Many Colors are ideal for snacking and make a impressive crudités, served with dips, cheese, or charcuterie. We're selling each 12-ounce bag for $1.99 ($2.29 in our Midwest, Southeast, and East Coast stores). Look for them in our refrigerated produce section.
059793.name: Carrots Cut Org Mny Clrs 12Oz
059793.title: Organic Cut And Peeled Carrots Of Many Colors

061353.description: In 2015, we released our very first complete salad kit that wasn't actually a "salad." Our Broccoli & Kale Slaw Kit [sku 55386] is, well, slaw (in the general sense of the word). And it's been a hit ever since. Trader Joe's Tahini, Pepita & Apricot Slaw Kit is our next foray into slaw kits, and it's a slaw kit that truly takes slaw kits to the next level. This recipe was dreamed up by one of our Buyers, who wanted to introduce a unique flavor profile to our se- lection of complete salad kits. A blend of shredded rainbow carrots, broccoli stalks, green cabbage, and kale comprises the "slaw" part of this Slaw. But it's the good stuff-the ingredients from which the Slaw got its name-that take this from an ordinary slaw into something profoundly delicious. Pepitas, chopped sun-dried apricots, and a creamy tahini orange dressing make this truly one-of-a-kind. Such a vibrant Slaw Kit allows for quick-and tasty-weekday meal prep. It's as easy as adding a piece of grilled salmon, Grilled Chicken Strips [sku 64873], or Falafel [sku 93935]. Serve it as a side dish to a larger meal, or toss a crunchy addition into sandwiches, wraps, or tacos. Yes, Trader Joe's Tahini, Pepita & Apricot Slaw Kit is innovative; and, yes, Trader Joe's Tahini, Pepita & Apricot Slaw Kit is a value. Innovation and value are two of our favorite things, after all. You'll find each 14.25-ounce bag for $3.99, available for a limited time. 12.18. 17
061353.name: Salad Complete Tahini Slaw
061353.title: Tahini, Pepita & Apricot Slaw Kit

061844.description: Rainbows are beautiful, but they're fleeting. That might sound defeatist of us, but it's true: they're here one minute and gone the next. While we're grateful for the glimpses of rainbows we do get, we're even more grateful for the newest, permanent rainbow found in our stores: Cal-Organic® Farms Organic Rainbow Radishes. Each package of Organic Rainbow Radishes contains about half a rainbow's worth of reddish, radish-y hues. There's no blue or green in the bunch, but you'll find beautiful shades of pink and purple, as well as a few white radishes thrown in for merry measure. Grown in fertile California soil, the brightly colored bulbs are harvested and hand- trimmed, so they come ready-to-go. They're firm, crunchy, and spicy-just like radishes should be- but not quite as spicy as their traditional, red radish counterparts. This might seem obvious, but there really isn't anything else in each bag of Cal-Organic® Farms Organic Rainbow Radishes except organically grown radishes. With this blank (yet colorful) slate, you have so many vibrant possibilities before you. Serve them raw, pickled, or roasted. Slice them up and add them to salads, sandwiches, soups, or tacos. Add them to a crudité plate alongside some hummus dip. Or, make radish chips by lining a baking sheet with thin Rainbow Radish slices, drizzling them with olive oil, sprinkling them with sea salt, and baking them at 400ºF for 12-15 minutes. Each 12-ounce bag of Cal-Organic® Farms Organic Rainbow Radishes is $2.99, every day. Somewhere over the Rainbow (in the produce section of your local Trader Joe's), is where you'll find them¿ 10.15. 18
061844.name: R-Radish Of Many Colors Org 12Oz
061844.title: Organic Radishes Of Many Colors Trimmed

061855.description: You may be familiar with Caesar Salad's origin story; back in 1924, or so the story goes, chef Caesar Cardini was about to close his restaurant in Tijuana, Mexico for the night when a hungry customer asked for a salad. Nearly out of ingredients, Caesar whipped together what he had, and the now-classic Caesar Salad was born. As we quickly approach the Caesar Salad's 100th anniversary (where has the time gone?), the question is raised: how does one properly render tribute to such a sovereign of salads? How does one hail such a monarch of mixed greens? We came, we saw, we stepped up our game with Trader Joe's Organic Caesar Salad Kit. It's the classic crunchy, creamy, garlicky, and (most importantly) delicious Caesar Salad you know and love, ex- cept this time, it's all organic. In other words, each bag contains crisp, fresh-chopped leaves of organic Roamine lettuce, tasty shreds of organic parmesan cheese, splendidly seasoned organic croutons, and a rich, peppery salad dressing made entirely with organic ingredients. All you have to do is make like chef Caesar and mix them all together, and your conquest of dinner is complete. Like a certain other Caesar we can think of, you may be surprised at just how protean this salad can be-no need to confine it to just a side. Simply add some grilled steak, chicken, or shrimp, and you have a full-fledged entrée. Or, if you're feeling a little more adventurous, using this Caesar Salad as a basis for a flavorful wrap or as the topping to a turkey or salmon burger can turn a plebian sandwich experience into a full-fledged triumph. No matter how you use it, it's a value that even an emperor could appreciate: we're selling each 12 oz. bag for only $3.99, every day. You'll find them in the refrigerated case, with our other bagged salads. 05.21. 18
061855.name: R-Salad Complete Organic Caesar 12 Oz
061855.title: Organic Caesar Salad Kit

062016.description: With colorful ingredients, a rustic mélange of textures, and bright, fresh flavors, Trader Joe's Organic Mediterranean Style Salad Kit is the ne plus ultra of summery salads. Cool romaine lettuce, shredded broccoli stalks and crisp radicchio form the sturdy base of this Salad, while celery, seasoned flatbread strips, and roasted chickpeas add major crunch. This collection of cool, crisp, and crunchy components is rounded out with tender dried tomatoes and crumbled feta cheese, and made complete with a packet of dressing that's fantastic in its own right: herby notes of basil and oregano and savory garlic, all swimming in a blend of extra virgin olive oil and tangy red wine vinegar. And did we mention this complete Salad Kit is completely organic? A veritable summer vacation in a bag, just toss this Organic Salad Kit with diced organic chicken and fluffy couscous-it's easy to imagine sailing the blue-green waters of the Aegean with each crunchy, refreshing bite. We're offering 12.95 ounce bags of Trader Joe's Organic Mediterranean Style Salad Kit for $3.99 each. At a dollar less than retails we've seen elsewhere, it's an incredible value on organic produce that you'll only find at your neighborhood Trader Joe's. 05.21. 18
062016.name: R-Salad Mediterranean Chopped Org
062016.title: Organic Mediterranean Style Salad Kit

062810.description: Chances are, you enjoy a bell pepper from our produce section from time to time. We sell red, orange, yellow, and green, of course. Now, we're selling a new variety that is unique & beautiful in appearance, with a name that predicts just how much you'll like it¿ Enjoya Peppers, supplied by 4 Earth¿ Farms, start off green. As they grow, they turn red and develop vibrant, yellow-orange striations. The first plant with this intriguing appearance was discovered growing naturally in Est, Holland. The lucky botanist excitedly set to work with a team to cultivate this fresh, visually captivating variety. And, as you might guess, there's much more to enjoy than just the look of these Peppers¿ Enjoya are crisp & firm, with slightly denser walls than more common bell pepper varieties. They are sweetly aromatic, with a flavor that is equally sweet-almost fruit-like. This combination of looks & taste means Enjoya Peppers are ideal to kick up any recipe in which you'd use a pepper. Their color adds panache to any platter of raw vegetables. Slice them in rings to top your pizza; or make it a large dice to toss in a green salad. One of our favorite things to do is cut off the cap of a whole Enjoya, clean out the insides, and fill it with seasoned & browned TJ's All Natural Ground Turkey [sku 51125], mixed with our Riced Cauliflower [sku 55922]. Top it with cheese and bake it in the oven until lightly roasted and heated through, for a filling, flavorful, colorful meal. Each 12-ounce package of 4 Earth¿ Farms Enjoya contains 2 Peppers for $3.79. They're available Febrauary through November for you to enjoy-a again & again¿ while-a the season-a lasts-a. 04.01 .18 FEB. - NOV.
062810.name: R-Peppers Enjoya 2Ct

062883.description: Ah, potatoes. Those starchy, stalwart building blocks of life-or, at the very least, those starchy, stalwart building blocks of cuisines all the world over. And while Russets are easily the most commonly consumed potato in the U.S., it's worth noting that these tubers aren't always outfitted in earth tones-there are purple potatoes, red potatoes, white potatoes, yellow potatoes¿ and so many more. Lucky for you and your taste spuds, er, taste buds, Trader Joe's Petite Potato Medley proudly showcases specimens from the full spud spectrum-a feast for the eyes and the appetite. Within each adorable bag of these two-to-three-bite 'taters, you'll find a Medley of gold, red, and purple potatoes. They're organically grown right here in the U.S., and they're ready for any & all applications. Toss them in a little sea salt & olive oil, then roast them with rosemary. Chop them up with peppers and onions for the base of a breakfast skillet. Top them with your favorite shredded cheese and melt them in the microwave. The world is your potato-let your imagination run wild. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Petite Potato Medley
062883.name: A-Potato Medley Petite Organic 1.5 Lb
062883.title: Organic Petite Potato Medley

063250.description: Remember when "salad in a bag" was more or less some Romaine, a few croutons, and a Caesar-ish dressing? Don't get us wrong; we love Caesar Salad (and we have a great Caesar Salad Kit). We also love expanding our palates and discovering new ways to enjoy a bowl of greens & things. Trader Joe's Yellow Curry Chopped Salad Kit is an excellent expression of this desire, available in a bag at your neighborhood TJ's. This Complete Salad Kit begins with a blend of chopped Romaine, crunchy red & green cabbages, carrot slivers, and a sprinkling of green onion slices. But this Salad, like so many others, is less about the greens, and more about the toppings and the dressing that adorn those greens. Here, we've included crunchy naan chips (think pita chips, but made with naan bread), cashew pieces, and golden raisins. Crunchy, chewy, and delicious, all the way through. The dressing? It's a salad-making revelation, this Yellow Curry Ginger Lime Vinaigrette. You may wonder if all those flavors really go together. Spoiler alert: they do! The flavors are so fresh, so new, so¿ now! And speaking of now, now would be a great time for you to scoot on over to your neighborhood Trader Joe's and grab yourself a bag (or four) of this Yellow Curry Chopped Salad Kit. Your palate will thank you. We're selling each 13 ounce bag for $3.99, every day. You'll find it in the refrigerated produce case with our other salad kits. 08.27. 18 AUG. - Jan.
063250.name: R-Yellow Curry Chopped Salad Kit
063250.title: Yellow Curry Chopped Salad Indian Inspired Salad With Naan Chips, Cashews, Golden Raisins & Yellow Curry Ginger Lime Vinaigrette

063278.description: As purveyors of fine foods, we often receive the question, "what's the difference between haricots verts and regular old green beans?" Truth be told, haricots verts are simply a French variety of green beans that have been bred to be longer and thinner than normal, and tend to be picked a little earlier in the season than their American cousins. This slighter silhouette does create a rather significant difference in firmness and texture, which has given haricots a reputation for refinement. Trader Joe's Organic Haricots Verts, grown for us in the rich, volcanic soils of Guatemala, exemplify why: they're crisp, tender, fresh, and ready to be cooked to your specifications. Excellent for adding a nice crunch to salads and stir fries, superb for steaming and serving as a simple and elegant side, these Organic Haricots Verts are a legend among legumes. With their fresh taste and snappy texture, we find a light hand in preparation is best: just a few minutes in a steamer or in the skillet will bring out their flavor without sacrificing that satisfying crunch. We're selling 12-ounce bags of Trader Joe's Organic Haricots Verts for the stellar price of $3.29*, every day. Look for them with our refrigerated produce. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Haricots Verts
063278.name: R-Beans Green Haricots Verts Organic 12 Oz
063278.title: Organic Haricots Verts Green Beans Trimmed

063491.description: As grilling season rapidly approaches, you may be imagining the steaks, ribs, and chicken that'll be hitting the barbie¿ but as much as backyard BBQs are about the meats, they're also about the sides-and coleslaw is compulsory! Accordingly, Trader Joe's has created an Organic Coleslaw Kit including all you need to whip up a fresh, classic salad that has surprisingly many uses beyond being just a BBQ side dish. Our Organic Coleslaw is a mix of chopped organic green cabbage, chopped organic red cabbage, and shredded carrots. This fresh, crisp base is triple-washed and ready to be tossed with our organic dressing (included and packaged separately). It's a classic slaw dressing that's creamy and slightly sweet-made with organic expeller pressed soybean oil and organic cider vinegar. Organic egg yolks contribute creaminess, while garlic, dehydrated onion, sea salt and black pepper bring a savory factor. Some organic cane sugar and organic lemon juice add just the right amount of sweet/tangy balance. Mix it up in a minute, then scoop it next to your grilled Spatchcocked Lemon Rosemary Chicken [sku 56660]. Sidle it up to our All Natural Crate Free Pork Loin Baby Back Ribs [sku 63397] brushed with plenty of TJ's Organic Kansas City Style BBQ Sauce [sku 63486]. Replace the sauerkraut on your Reuben sandwich to make a "Rachel." Our Organic Coleslaw is ideal for fish tacos and also makes a great sub for lettuce on grilled burgers. However you use it, you'll find Trader Joe's Organic Coleslaw Kit is just what your meal needs. You'll also find it to be an excellent value at $2.69 for each 10-ounce bag. Find it in our Produce section.
063491.name: R-Organic Coleslaw Kit

065311.description: People who love kale, love it for its earthy, green flavor and tender-chewy texture. They also love it for the variety of vitamins and minerals it supplies. But not all people love the fibrous stems that are often present, even in pre- cut, packaged kale. Those woody stems stick out in an otherwise pleasantly crunchy green salad. They can also make your green smoothie significantly less than smooth. For these reasons, we sought out a kale supplier who could bring us the best of kale, minus the unpleasant stems. And we found it in Earth Greens® Organic Green Kale. Grown organically in California and Arizona, this Kale already comes out of the fields with fewer stems than typical mature kale. Then it's trimmed and coarsely chopped to eliminate any large stem pieces that may still remain. The result is an excellent eating experience-whether your kale is boiled in a soup, sautéed and served with pasta, blended in a smoothie, or eaten fresh in a green salad. (Incidentally, this Kale is also triple-washed and ready-to-use, which is another plus!) Want to know another plus? We're selling each 10-ounce bag of Earth Green® Organic Green Kale for $2.69 on the West Coast and $3.49 on the East Coast. (That higher price stems from coast-to-coast transport.)
065311.name: R-Greens Kale Organic Shredded
065311.title: Organic Shredded Kale

065977.description: Here's a little fruit to sweeten what remains of summer: Mini Sweet Peppers. Yes, peppers are considered fruit. These colorful gems, grown on North American farms, measure about 2.5 inches long and look like miniature bell peppers. They taste like them, too-but even sweeter and crunchier. This means they are ideal for adding to salads. And their firm, smooth skin stands up pretty well on the grill. Imagine roasted red, yellow and orange Mini Peppers spicing up your taco bar next to some grilled Premium Choice Angus Flank Steak [sku 56218]. Of course, by "spicing up" we mean with color, not heat. These seedless Peppers have been cultivated to be sweet, not hot-so everyone can enjoy them. Dip them in hummus, stuff them with cheese and bake them, or munch them right out of the bag. You'll find so many uses for these Mini Sweet Peppers, and you can have plenty on hand at our sweet price of $2.99 for each 16-ounce package in the West (Texas included) and $3.79 each in the East, the South, & the Midwest.
065977.name: A-Peppers Mini Sweet 1Lb
065977.title: Sweet Mini Peppers

066293.description: What do you need to make the perfect summer salad? Fresh, peppery greens? Aromatic herbs? Zesty, citrus flavors? Some resoundingly delicious crunch? How about a salad that ticks all those boxes? Trader Joe's Lemony Arugula Basil Salad Kit gives you all the tools necessary to create a superlatively summer-y salad, complete with leafy arugula, shredded Parmesan cheese, crunchy carrots and roasted almonds, and a stunningly citric, wholly herbaceous, basil lemon vinaigrette dressing. With mere seconds of preparation (simply toss the salad with the included packet of vinaigrette), this Kit produces a dinner-ready salad that goes exceptionally well with summer fare, including barbecue, pastas, or fresh-from-the-oven Pizza Margherita [sku 68308]. Every bite is remarkably balanced, from the familiar pepperiness of the arugula to the sweetness and crunchy texture of the shaved carrots and almonds, to the aromatic, pesto-like quality of the zesty basil lemon vinaigrette. For a superior summer entrée, try pairing a plate of this Lemony Arugula Salad with a topping of freshly grilled chicken, salmon, or steak. While supplies last, we're selling 9.75-ounce bags of Trader Joe's Lemony Arugula Basil Salad Kit for $3.99*. Look for them in our refrigerators, with our other bagged salad kits. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Lemony Arugula Basil Salad Kit
066293.name: R-Arugula Lemon Basil Complete Salad Kit
066293.title: Lemony Arugula Basil Salad Kit

067024.description: ¿ What it is: An assortment of edible winter squash, including Golden Acorn, White Acorn, Delicata and Carnival Squash, all wonderfully priced at $0.99! Where it's grown: Hudsonville, MI What do I do with it?: Peel and dice, or cut into slices along the natural ribs. Toss with oils, spices or herbs. Cooked squash may be pureed and added to soups, stews, risotto, cakes or other baked goods. Stuff and bake halves with meats, cheese, grains or other vegetables. You may also use as a decorative centerpiece or serving dish for your upcoming Thanksgiving feast! Why the tasting panel loved it: These smaller winter squash are perfect for baking or roasting, and can be served with our without the skin! Squash acorns are easy to prepare. Halve the acorn and scoop the seeds out. Season to taste, and roast at 400 degrees, or until tender. And if you want to put your culinary skills to test, try the receipt below: Quinoa and Veggie Stuffed Acorn Squash Ingredients: 1 cup of cooked quinoa 3 acorn squash (golden or white) 1 cucumber, diced 1 carrot, diced 1/4 cup of cilantro leaves, chopped 2 green onions, chopped 1/4 cup of a better quality balsamic vinegar 2 tablespoons of olive oil (better quality) 1 teaspoon ground cumin Salt and Pepper to taste Directions: Combine all of the ingredients and refrigerate for at least one hour. Squash: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Line your roasting pan with foil or a baking sheet. Set aside. Slice the squash in half and remove the seeds and clean out the loose flesh. Drizzle with olive oil, salt and pepper. Place skin side down and roast for 30 minutes or until fork tender. Remove and let cool on the counter. Stuff with the filling and serve. Drizzle with additional balsamic if necessary. Adjust spices. Serve at room temperature.
067024.name: A-Squash Carnival
067024.title: Squash Carnival Opp Buy

068709.description: First cultivated over 7,000 years ago in mainland China, soybeans have become an institution in their own right, providing a near-inexhaustible list of culinary, agricultural, industrial, and pharmaceutical applications in modern society. For our money, though, we treasure soybeans' simplest application, Edamame, most of all. With just a quick blanch in salted, boiling water, soybeans can become a suprisingly satisfying starter or snack, as evidenced by Trader Joe's Edamame with Sea Salt, a quick and convenient way to enjoy Edamame anytime. Trader Joe's Edamame with Sea Salt comes pre-cooked and pre-seasoned with a fine sprinkling of sea salt, meaning they're ready to be eaten right out of the package - just squeeze the beans from the pod directly into your mouth and enjoy their light, nutty, salty and slightly sweet flavor. And since they're so simple, that means you can customize them any way you choose: add a bit of spice via the addition of hot sauce or wasabi, shake them up with some Everything But the Bagel Seasoning [sku 59137], or even add to the sweetness with some Turbinado Raw Cane Sugar [sku 97210]. Convenient, flexible, and at $2.99* for a nine-ounce pouch, Trader Joe's Edamame with Sea Salt may not represent everything the soybean can do, but it certainly shows how easy and delicious they can be. Look for it with our other refrigerated produce. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Edamame with Sea Salt
068709.name: R-Shelled Edamame

070309.description: Trader Joe's Complete Salad Kits provide a great opportunity to explore the flavors of regional cuisines, from Thailand, to the Southwestern United States, to Greece. A Za'atar Tango Salad Kit finds its inspiration in the cuisine of the eastern-most Mediterranean region. Tender, curly, red & green oak lettuces form the base, along with baby green tango, with its frilly leaves and longer stems that are ideal for catching and delivering salad toppings. And this Kit's toppings really bring the flavors! A separate packet includes sweetened diced dates, toasted sesame seeds, and salted pistachio pieces. It also contains flatbread strips that have been amped up with a zingy za'atar seasoning that incorporates parsley, thyme, onion powder, garlic powder, lemon oil, sesame oil, cumin oil, and rice hulls for some extra crunch. All these elements benefit from some balance, which is where the cucumber yogurt dressing comes in. It's creamy, cool, and an excellent complement for the savory flavors and crunchy textures. You can find the 9.25-ounce A Za'atar Tango Salad Kit in that region of our store we like to call "the refrigerated produce case." *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. A Za'atar Tango Salad Kit
070309.name: Salad Complete Za'Atar Tango
070309.title: A Za'Atar Tango Salad Kit

070500.name: A-Tomatoes Cherry On The Vine Opp Buy 12 Oz
070500.title: A-Tomatoes Cherry On The Vine 12 Oz

072160.description: Our "regionally grown" program is back for its third consecutive year for the Midwest. With some new additions to the mix, we've hand-picked some of the best in loose produce. These items will be available as long as the local growing seasons lasts, which is typically heaviest in July and August. Our customers love "local" or "regional" produce, and we're excited to bring it back by popular demand. In addition to having satisfied customers, buying local also¿ o Supports local economies and keeps local farms thriving. o Reduces the use of fuels and helps protect the environment by reducing carbon footprint. o Offers fresher produce, along with a much more competitive price! o Preserves the economic diversity of our communities and the special character of our neighborhoods. Yellow Squash SKU# 95353 Pack 35 $.79 retail Growing Area: IL/OH Eggplant SKU# 72160 Pack 18 $1.79 retail Growing Area: MI/IL/OH/MN (MW stores) NC/ SC/ GA (SE stores)
072160.name: Eggplant Each

072567.description: When we set out to create one our all-in-one salad kits, sometimes it comes down to simply testing out a theory. For example: just on a conceptual level alone, the mild, lightly grassy flavor and remarkably creamy texture of avocado should make it a natural companion to the savory, herby sensations of a classic ranch dressing. We put that theory into practice with Trader Joe's Avocado Ranch Salad Kit, by compiling a collection of fresh, crisp, shredded leafy greens and veggies, savory, grated Cheddar, and crunchy, lightly salted corn chips to act as a canvas for a captivaingly creamy ranch dressing made with a base of buttermilk and avocados. As it turns out, that theory was delightfully, deliciously correct. Don't you just love the scientific method? Like all our salad kits, this Avocado Ranch is a super quick and convenient way to add a side salad to practically any meal. It's a proven winner with pizza, a beauty with barbecue, and a certified sensation, even with something as simple as a sandwich. Or, if you'd prefer it as an entrée, just pop your favorite protein on top, an voilà-you've got a whole meal on your hands. We find it works especially well with our frozen Grilled Chicken Strips [sku 75767], pan-seared salmon, or stir-fried, well-seasoned Organic 3-Grain Tempeh [sku 99125]. Avocado Ranch Salad Kit
072567.name: R-Salad Complete Avocado Ranch
072567.title: Avocado Ranch Salad Kit

072774.description: Beat poets wrote about new understandings of the human condition. Trader Joe's Fearless Flyer writers write about beets. They're vibrant and nutritious and people just love them. Is there any bad news about beets? Well, maybe prep time, if you're in a hurry; but you don't have to worry about that if you're talking about Trader Joe's Steamed & Peeled Baby Beets. True to their name, these babies are peeled and cooked - steamed in a sealed pouch, specifically, to retain their starry nutritional profile - ready to enjoy right out of the package. There is only one ingredient inside every package; baby beets from the Normandy region of France, where the rich soils and cool summertime temperatures combine to produce ideal growing conditions for sweet and tender beets. Beets are terrific in salads, and if you want to enjoy them warm, simply heat them in the microwave (heating instructions are on the package) and add them to a mélange of other veggies, soups or stews. We're selling each eight ounce package of Trader Joe's Steamed & Peeled Baby Beets from France, for the excellent, everyday price of $2.29. You'll find them in our refrigerated produce section.
072774.name: Beets Baby Steamed 8 Oz

072861.name: R-Corn On The Cob Wild Violet 4Pk Nj Local

073036.description: You'd be forgiven for thinking that cauliflower is a monochromatic veggie, but quite the opposite is true. In addition to its relatively ubiquitous off-white color, cauliflower also comes in bright, royal purples, warm, muted oranges, and, when hybridized with broccoli, lush, lime greens. We've assembled all four in Trader Joe's Cauliflower of Many Colors, a multi-hued collection of cauliflower florets that are pre-cut, pre-washed, and ready to use in any number of culinary situations. Grown in Gautemala, these Many-Colored florets are as versatile as they are vibrant. They're mild and slightly nutty in flavor, with a texture that ranges from crunchy to crisp to tender, depending on how you prepare them. They can be served raw, right out of the bag, with hummus or ranch for a satisfying snack, or they can be steamed, stir-fried, or sautéed, for a quick and easy side. We might like them most of all when they're roasted with a bit of olive oil, salt & pepper, and sliced garlic, and then finished with a sprinkling of Parmesan. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Cauliflower of Many Colors
073036.name: R-Cauliflower Of Many Colors 16Oz

073111.description: A staple of salads, stir-fries, and curries the world over, baby corn's crisp texture and naturally sweet flavor make it a smart addition to all kinds of dishes - fresh baby corn, even more so. That's why we leapt at the opportunity to bring these six-ounce bags of fresh Trader Joe's Baby Corn to our produce section. Firm and crisp, but with a tender, snappy bite that lets you taste every teeny tiny kernel, these pre-washed and ready-to- use Baby cobs are as versatile as they are adorable. When we say all kinds of dishes can be improved with a bit of Baby Corn, we mean it: they can be roughly chopped and added to pasta primavera sauce, sautéed whole with savory, spicy noodles, or even given a light dusting of seasoned flour, fried, and served alongside a plate of barbecue. Their satisfying snap and delicate sweetness also make them a treat when served raw or as a dipping vehicle for your favorite creamy dip, too. Not to get too corny about it, but if you ask us, Trader Joe's Baby Corn has a bright future ahead of it. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Baby Corn
073111.name: R-Baby Corn 6Oz

073199.description: When it comes time to cook, it's easy to get so wrapped up in the entrée or protein portion of the meal that you forget to include some greens on the plate. That's precisely why we like to keep one of our pre-chopped, ready- to-cook vegetable blends on hand, like our new Trader Joe's Ready Veggies. Made with a medley of broccoli florets, Brussels sprouts, red cabbage, kale, carrots, and snow pea pods, these Veggies are Ready and raring to add a pop of flavor and variety of textures to any meal-all it takes is a few minutes in the skillet, wok, oven, or even microwave. Equally able in last-minute dinner or pre-planned meal prep situations, these Ready Veggies are almost endlessly versatile. They can be enjoyed as simply as you'd like, sautéed in olive oil with just a bit of salt and pepper, or mixed in with all manner of seasonings and sauces. To add delightfully fresh flavor, tender texture, hearty nutrition, and a nice, multi-hued visual appeal to all kinds of dishes, these Veggies are at the Ready! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Ready Veggies
073199.name: R-Ready Veggies

073314.description: People often turn to salads for delicate flavors. But there's no rule that says a salad can't contain bold flavors. In fact, if there were such a rule, Trader Joe's BBQ & Black Pepper Toscano Chopped Salad would be the ultimate rule-breaker! This is a complete salad kit, containing everything you need to construct a crisp, fresh-and particularly bold- salad. The base includes green and red cabbages, combined with shredded carrots, broccoli, and kale. Such confident vegetable crunchiness is complemented by even more crunch, conveyed by cornbread croutons. The addition of aged, Black Pepper Toscano Cheese (packaged separately) brings another kind of boldness to this Salad-a rich and nutty flavor, with a touch of cracked black pepper heat. The final stroke of bold is delivered in the BBQ sweet onion dressing. Its molasses notes pair exceptionally well with the flavor of the Black Pepper Cheese, and the rest of the dressing profile (including mustard, white wine vinegar, onion, garlic, and chili powder) provides the finishing touch for this un-shy salad. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. BBQ & Black Pepper Toscano Chopped Salad
073314.name: R-Bbq Toscano Complete Chopped Salad
073314.title: Bbq & Black Pepper Toscano Chopped Salad

074174.description: Like many fantastic fermented foods, miso has a remarkably rich depth of flavor. We mean that quite literally- its complex mix of savory, salty, umami, and, in many varieties, sweet, simply demands to be remarked upon. What's even more remarkable is how well those complexly interwoven flavors interact with other flavors and textures, as is ably demonstrated in Trader Joe's Miso Crunch Chopped Salad Kit. Each bag contains a mix of shredded cabbage, kale, and carrots, to which our supplier adds a packet of crispy chow mein noodles, cashews, and sesame seeds, then ties it all together with a tangy, nutty, just-so-slightly caramel-y sesame miso dressing. While the flavors of miso may be curiously complex, putting together this summer-seasonal Salad Kit is exceedingly simple: all it takes on your end is to toss all ingredients together in a bowl until well mixed, and serve. Once ready, it can be enjoyed as a side salad, entrée, or base for a veggie bowl. We find it tends to play well off of proteins that already have a bit of sweetness or spice to them, like glazed chicken wings, grilled shrimp skewers, or Pork Gyoza [sku 10162] with plenty of Sriracha [sku 50828]. Miso Crunch Chopped Salad Kit
074174.name: R-Salad Complete Crispy Chow Mein Miso

074768.description: You've put Mexican-style street corn in a salad kit, Trader Joe's? Well, not exactly. But our new Elote Chopped Salad Kit is packed with ingredients that evoke the flavors of this creamy, crunchy classic in every bite. Really. It begins with a mixed veggie base that includes chopped green & red cabbage, green leaf lettuce, carrots, kale, green onion, and of course, crispy, dried, sweet corn kernels. We add cornbread crumbles, seasoned with smoked paprika, to add even more crunch and a little bit of heat; crumbled cotija cheese delivers creamy flavor and adds a soft texture to the mix. The real magic here lies in the creamy, elote-inspired dressing that's a little tart and a little sweet, with hints of jalapeño and lime. Tossed together, you won't think you're eating elote from a street vendor, but you will feel that same energy in every forkful of greens. Add your favorite protein (we like chicken or shrimp) and a sliced avocado to make this a complete meal. Grab a corn tortilla and heat it ever so slightly, then fill it with this satisfying mix-a taco to remember, for sure! If you're entertaining a crowd, spoon some into Elote Corn Chip Dippers [sku 60564] and serve as bite-sized appetizers. Elote Chopped Salad Kit
074768.name: R-Salad Complete Elote Chopped
074768.title: Elote Chopped Salad Kit

075172.description: Cabbage is widely eaten and celebrated around the world. Why not? It's fat-free, cholesterol-free, low in calo- ries, high in vitamins K & C, and rich in fiber. It's also extremely flexible in the kitchen. You can steam it, boil it, braise it, bake it, roast it, microwave it, stir-fry it, and even pickle it-not to mention shredding it, raw. Now through March 16, Trader Joe's Green Cabbage Heads are here to help you celebrate the healthfulness and culinary versatility of this cruciferous cabeza. How will you prepare it? Here's an inspirational headcount of the best cabbage cuisine from around the globe: Fermented cabbage is the basis for German Sauerkraut, as well as Korea's national dish, Kimchi. Russia's national dish is Golubtsy, which consists of cabbage rolls stuffed with beef and rice, simmered in tomato sauce. The Irish mash their beloved potatoes together with cabbage for Colcannon (traditionally served November 1st), while Irish-Americans pair cabbage with Corned Beef to honor St. Patrick. Dutch Koolsla (cabbage salad) has been variously adapted in the Americas. It's served alongside Fried Chicken in the U.S., atop Mexican Fish Tacos, and as a condiment for Salvadorian Papusas. Still, some are put off by the cole's "stinky" reputation. Let us get ahead of that bad PR: While it may be pun- gent when overcooked, cabbage is delicately nutty and sweet when cooked just enough. And when raw, cab- bage has a pleasant crunch with just a slight bitterness. Our Green Cabbage Heads are $0.99 each on the West Coast, $1.69 each on the East Coast, and $1.99 each in the Midwest & Southeast.
075172.name: Cabbage Head Green Each

076869.description: Aptly enough for its emerald-evoking name, Trader Joe's Little Gem Lettuce may just be the new crown jewel of our Produce section. The result of cross-breeding between romaine and butter varietals, Little Gem has all the crisp, satisfying bite of romaine, with the tenderness and mild, sweet flavor of butter lettuce. This best-of- both-worlds combo makes it a real rarity among leafy greens-a hidden Gem, if you will-and opens it up to a remarkably wide range of uses within the kitchen. As it turns out, a Little Gem goes a long way! As a salad green, its toothsome texture and delicate flavor interact wonderfully with all kinds of dressings: try it with a creamy blue cheese, a light and nimble vinaigrette, or our herby and aromatic Green Goddess [sku 59991]. In fact, Little Gem leaves are so fit for holding onto various dressings and sauces, that we also recommend using them as a vehicle for appetizer dips, hummus, or tapenades. They're hearty enough to act as lettuce cups and wraps for various proteins, and durable enough to be halved and grilled on the barbecue (a little char brings out their sweetness even more). Each bag comes with three heads of Lettuce-in other words, these Little Gems are one great big value. Little Gem Lettuce
076869.name: R- Lettuce Gem Little
076869.title: Little Gem Lettuce

077284.name: R- Salad Red Butter Org 6 Oz
077284.title: Organic Red Butter Lettuce

077760.name: R-Cabbage Head Red Each Nj Local

077768.description: We are a nation of broccoli lovers. We are also the world's third most prodigious broccoli-growing nation. Why do we eat so much broccoli? Our decidedly unscientific research has yielded two answers: it tastes great and it's good for us. Really good for us. As in, very high in vitamin C, a good source of vitamin A, and packed with goodness. We could cite study after study that speak to the health benefits of eating broccoli, but we'll leave that piece of it to you and the internet. For us, taste is paramount, topping only "ease of preparation" on our list of why we gravitate to certain foods. So if this great-tasting, good-for-us food requires almost no work on our part, we're in! Heck, we'll eat even more! Trader Joe's Organic Broccoli Florets make us want to eat Broccoli at every meal. They're that easy to use. Washed, cut, and trimmed to perfection, they're recipe-ready. Shake them out of the bag for a vegetable platter, blanch a bunch in boiling water on the stove or steam them in the microwave - in the bag, even! Toss with olive oil and roast them in the oven or char them in a grill basket over an open flame. When vegetables are this easy to prepare, it's just so easy - and delicious - to get all the veggies you could ever need into your diet. We're selling each 12 ounce bag of Trader Joe's Organic Broccoli Florets for $2.79, every day. You'll find them in our refrigerated produce case.
077768.name: Broccoli Florets Organic 12 Oz
077768.title: Organic Broccoli Florets

077922.description: Imagine, for a moment, that it's a busy weeknight, and you're on dinner duty. You have a protein all picked out, maybe a standby starch at the ready, but you're still in need of a leafy green. Wouldn't it be nice to have some veggies prepped for a quick sauté or stir-fry? Wouldn't it be even better if those veggies offered a variety of flavors and textures, even before being sauced? Well, we've got some excellent news for you: Trader Joe's Stir Fry Veggie Blend has arrived! Pre-washed, pre-chopped, and ready-to-go for the pan, skillet, or wok, our Stir Fry Veggie Blend features a well-balanced mix of broccoli florets, napa cabbage, bok choy, and snow peas. They only take a minute or two of stir-frying to take on a delicately crisp, al dente texture, and are particularly suited for pairing with nutty, spicy, or even sweet flavors-like what you'll find in our Organic Toasted Sesame Oil [sku 65636], Green Dragon Hot Sauce [sku 54861], and Soyaki [sku 78555], respectively. And since they're so affordable and easy to prepare, you have a little more room in your schedule and budget to get a little more fancy with your protein-how about some White Miso [sku 73814]-glazed salmon, or Thai Peanut Satay [sku 77247]-braised tofu, perhaps? Stir Fry Veggie Blend
077922.name: R-Stir Fry Blend
077922.title: Stir Fry Veggie Blend

078918.description: Satisfyingly crisp and crunchy, and with a mild, every-so-slightly herby flavor, celery seems like it was designed for dipping. When cut into bite-sized pieces, especially, celery makes a natural, fantastically dunkable vehicle for dips and sauces of all kinds, be they sweet, savory, or spicy. Which makes these conveniently pre-washed and pre-sliced Taylor Farms® Celery Bites an indispensable asset when constructing crudités plates and hors d'oeuvres platters, or even when you're just in need of an alternative to crackers or chips for a simple, standalone snack. Try these ideally-sized-for-dipping Celery Bites with your favorite hummus, a bit of our Buttermilk Ranch Dressing [sku 74462], your favorite nut butter, or some warm and bubbly Artichoke & Jalapeño Dip [sku 54698]. They're a capable companion to buffalo wings (or our Buffalo Style Chicken Poppers [sku 61202]), and any other spicier fare, where they'll serve as a texturally-complementary palate cleanser. And for a fun, kid-friedly appetizer or snack, spread them with a bit of Organic Creamy Peanut Butter [sku 53441] (or your favorite non- peanut alternative) and dot them with Organic Thompson Seedless Raisins [sku 15503] to make a multitude of miniature ants on a log. Taylor Farms® Celery Bites
078918.name: R-Celery Bites Cut 8Oz

079111.description: Combining the congenial crunch of cruciferous veggies like cabbage, kale, Brussels sprouts, and radicchio, with zesty, mango-forward flavors inspired by Thai cuisine, Trader Joe's Sweet Chili Mango Salad Kit gives you everything you need to serve a super tasty salad for your next meal-besides, we suppose, a salad bowl and some tongs. Inside each all-in-one Kit, you'll find the aforementioned blend of crisp, shredded veggies, crunchy roasted sunflower seeds, toasted quinoa, dried bits of mango, and a Thai-style sweet and spicy vinaigrette. With just a quick toss of these ingredients, you'll instantly have a Salad with tangy, tropical flavors and layers of complementary textures in every bite. Equally excellent as a side as it is a main (particularly when topped with your favorite protein), we find that this vegan Salad Kit's constituent Sweet Chili Mango flavors are especially suited for serving alongside fare like spring rolls, stir-fries, and aromatic curries. That said, we also find that its spicy and fruity aspects make it an apt choice for incorporating into seafood tacos, a base for a Tempeh [sku 99125] bowl, or using as a topping on a Turkey Burger [sku 96937]. Sweet Chili Mango Salad Kit
079111.name: R - Salad Complete Sweet Chili

079710.name: R-Lettuce Baby Crispy Green Leaf
079710.title: Little Leaf Farms Baby Crispy Green Leaf

080220.name: A-Tomato Cherry On The Vine Red Royal

090319.name: Beans Green Trim & Clean 1Lb
090319.title: Trimmed And Cleaned Green Beans Microwavable Bag

090741.description: Mirepoix is simply a ready-to-use blend of some basic ingredients-carrots, onions, & celery-just about every cook uses. Here, these three common ingredients have been washed, peeled, and-most importantly-chopped into a ready-to-use size, layered, and packaged in a recyclable, see-through tub. All that prep work¿ done. Just think about all the extra time you'll have to focus on your culinary creations (or finishing that long-neglected novel) with these ingredients at the ready. Many cooks swear by Mirepoix as the essential start to soups, casseroles, and roasting meats. This combo can also be a key player in things like sauces, stuffing, and stir-frys. We swear by our price of $2.99 for each 14.5-ounce tub of Trader Joe's Mirepoix. Look for the colorfully layered container in our refrigerated produce section.
090741.name: Mirepoix Mix 14.5 Oz

091767.description: These "butternut pumpkins"-as they're known down under-would make pretty funny looking jack-o-lan- terns¿ but they're not used for that. What they are used for-all around the world-is healthy, holiday fare. Butternut Squashes (as we call them) are pear-shaped, with a trunk-like top and bulbous bottoms. Their outer skin is tan, progressing to a deeper orange color as the fruit ripens. Inside, the flesh is bright orange. When cooked, Butternuts becomes tender and soft and have a nutty, moderately sweet flavor. If you know squashes, then you know that most varieties are very versatile when it comes to preparation. The Butternut is no exception. Enjoy it baked, steamed, sautéed, roasted, even micro-waved. With this particular squash's length, you might try grilling it, as is popular in South Africa. Slice it lengthwise, brush it with oil, sprinkle with some nutmeg and cinnamon, and put it cut side down on the grill. The interesting shape also makes for a nice presentation when stuffed and baked. Fill it with a green, like kale or spinach, and some cheese, like shaved Parmesan or crumbled feta. Last thing¿ though the name implies otherwise, we don't recommend spreading any of our Nut Butters on this Squash. Each Trader Joe's Butternut Squash is $1.79 on the West Coast, and $1.99 elsewhere.
091767.name: A-Butternut Sqaush Each
091767.title: Squash Butternut Each

092238.description: "Eat your vegetables." It's easy enough to do in theory, but in practice, what with the time it takes to wash and chop said veggies, that's not always the case. That's where Trader Joe's Shredded Green Cabbage comes in. Packaged into a manageable, recipe-friendly portion and (more importantly) washed and ready to use, this bag of fresh, crunchy Cabbage is the ace up your sleeve when it comes to increasing your veggie intake. How to use it? The options are nearly endless-and we're not just talking corned beef (though it's great for that, too!). Draw out its faint sweetness by featuring Shredded Green Cabbage in a soup with Mirepoix [sku 90741], Organic Diced & Fire Roasted Tomatoes [sku 99069], and Organic Great Northern Beans [sku 97720]; or stir frying it with Bulgogi Beef Fried Rice with Kimchi [sku 67480]. Highlight its mild, slightly bitter nature when raw in a slaw, as a side dish or piled atop Carnitas [sku 77697] tacos for complementary crunch. Or, grab a few bags and experiment! Available every day in the refrigerators at your neighborhood Trader Joe's, it's an incredible value that will leave your appetite satiated and your wallet flush. Shredded Green Cabbage
092238.name: Cabbage Green Shred 10Oz Bag
092238.title: Shredded Green Cabbage

094499.description: We'd like to extol the many virtues of Trader Joe's Organic English Cucumbers. These are long, thin cucumbers with very few seeds and thin skins. Unlike most commercially cultivated cucumbers, these are not waxed, so you can eat the skin - you'll want to give them a quick wash, of course. Because of the scarcity of seeds, this variety is easier on the stomach and less bitter than other cucumbers - this has led some to call these "burpless" cukes. Really. Can't make this stuff up, folks. We get a lot of questions about why they're shrink-wrapped, and it's directly related to the 'cukes being "not waxed." Once harvested, these Organic English Cucumbers have to travel to get to your neighborhood Trader Joe's, and their unwaxed nature leaves them vulnerable to the elements. The shrink-wrap keeps them safe, and ensures consistent quality when you get them home. Speaking of when you get them home, you can use Organic English Cucumbers anywhere you'd use any other type of cucumbers - in a salad, as a healthy snack, stuffed into a pita sandwich with hummus and tomatoes, blended with tomatoes into a cool, refreshing gazpacho, or double up the cukey goodness by dipping them in our Tzatziki Dip [sku 20405]. We're selling them for $2.49 each - a price that will leave you feeling cool as a cucumber. You'll find them in our fresh produce section.
094499.name: Cucumbers English Org Each
094499.title: Organic English Cucumber

We've hand-picked some of the best in loose produce, which will be available as long as the local growing seasons lasts (typically heaviest in July and August). Our customers love "local" or "regional" loose produce, and we're excited to introduce it to your area, based on the success we've had in other regions! In addition to having satisfied customers, buying local also¿ o Supports local economies and keeps local farms thriving. o Reduces the use of fuels and helps protect the environment by reducing carbon footprint. o Offers fresher produce, along with a much more competitive price! o Preserves the economic diversity of our communities and the special character of our neighborhoods. Yellow Squash SKU# 95353 Pack 45 $.59 retail Growing Area: WA

095446.description: Growing Area: Mexico and Guatemala Product Info: Trader Joe's Haricots Verts have been switched to a larger, more convenient size for our customers. This product is washed, dried and hand packed for freshness and quality. It is trimmed and ready to use, and can be microwaved, steamed or boiled directly in their extended shelf life bag. Taste: When cooked, Haricots Verts are tender with a slightly sweet flavor. Nutritional Benefits: Haricots Verts are fat free and cholesterol free, and are a good source of fiber and Vitamin A. Uses: This product is completely washed and ready to use. Microwave in the bag and toss with a bit of butter, salt and pepper. Or steam and let cool, then toss in a salad with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Feeling more adventurous? Heat 2 Tbsp olive oil or butter in a sauce pan and add the beans. Stir, and then add ¿ cup toasted slivered almonds and a squeeze of lemon. Salt and pepper to taste, and serve hot. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin01/12/2011 page 38 of 44 Confidential
095446.name: Beans Grn Haricots Verts 12 Oz
095446.title: Haricot Verts Green Beans Trimmed

095449.description: Growing Area: Mexico and Guatemala. Product Info: Baby zucchini has a thin edible skin, dark green with pale green-yellowish streaks. Taste: Raw baby zucchini is slightly bitter, but has a mild, nutty flavor when cooked. Nutritional Benefits: Baby zucchini is a good source of dietary fiber, Vitamins A and C. Uses: This product is completely washed and ready to microwave in the bag or steam on the stove. One of the most versatile of the squashes, baby zucchini can be braised, stir-fried, steamed, microwaved, stuffed, sautéed, pureed, fried or eaten raw. Toss with a little olive oil, salt and pepper and grill for a nutty, fresh flavor. Slice and add to pasta dishes and salads to add flavor and fiber without adding a lot of calories. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin01/12/2011 page 37 of 44 Confidential
095449.name: Squash Zucchini Baby 12 Oz

095748.description: ¿ Growing area: Castroville & Coachella, California Product Info: Fennel is composed of a white or pale green bulb from which closely superimposed stalks are arranged. The stalks are topped with feathery green leaves near which flowers grow and produce fennel seeds. The bulb, stalk, leaves and seeds are all edible. Fennel belongs to the Umbellifereae family and is closely related to parsley, carrots, dill and coriander. Fennel is an excellent source of vitamin C. fennel is a good source of fiber, calcium, and iron. Taste: Fennel has a crisp refreshing licorice taste when raw. When cooked, it has a mild, sweet flavor. Uses: Healthy sautéed fennel and onions make a wonderful side dish. Combine sliced fennel with avocados and oranges for a delightful salad. Braised fennel is a wonderful complement to scallops. Next time you are looking for a new way to adorn your sandwiches, consider adding sliced fennel in addition to the traditional toppings of lettuce and tomato. Top thinly sliced fennel with plain yogurt and mint leaves. Fennel is a match made in Heaven when served with salmon. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin11/10/2010 page 59 of 61 Confidential
095748.name: Fennel (Sweet Anise) 20 Oz

095882.description: ¿ Growing area: Our Tri-Color Bell Peppers are grown in Mexico in certified organic greenhouses. Product Info: Greenhouse-grown bell peppers are large, and are a blocky bell shape. They are typically between 7-9 ounces in weight. All sweet bell peppers grown in greenhouses reach a mature size green, and then ripen to red, yellow or orange depending on the variety. Taste: Refreshingly crunchy and sweet, with slight differences between the colors. Uses: Any color of bell peppers is perfect for eating fresh on its own, or added to salads or veggie trays with dip. Cooked, they are excellent stuffed, grilled on the BBQ, or lightly fried in Tempura batter. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin02/03/2011 page 46 of 46 Confidential
095882.name: Peppers Bell Tricolor Org 3 Pk
095882.title: Organic Tri-Color Bell Peppers

095969.description: Thought to be native to Europe and parts of Asia, English Peas as we know them were named as such thanks to the extensive work done to breed new varieties in England during the 17th century. Fast forward to present day: Trader Joe's English Peas are grown in Guatemala, where the rich, volcanic soil and equatorial microclimate provide the ideal growing conditions for year-round English Pea enjoyment. Unlike their snap and snow pea cousins, English Peas are encased in fibrous pods which must be removed before proper pea preparation can take place. Harvested when young and tender, our plump, bright green English Peas are shelled by hand to remove the pod and eliminate any mechanical damage, and then conveniently portioned in 10-ounce, microwaveable bags. Whether you serve them raw in grain salads, stirred into pasta or soups, or puréed in dips, you'll get fresh, slightly sweet pea flavor, tender, toothy texture, and best of all, no shelling required on your part. Each ten ounce bag of Trader Joe's English Peas is $3.49. Find them with our refrigerated produce.
095969.name: Peas English Shelled 10 Oz

096382.description: ¿ Growing area: Grown in the USA, Mexico, and Canada, these diced yellow onions are available fresh year round. Product Info: Cut into just-right-for-cooking size, these diced yellow onions come ready-to-use and save prep and cutting time in the kitchen, not to mention tears! Taste: When raw, yellow onions have a zesty and tangy flavor with a strong after-taste. Popularly, these onions are cooked into many different kinds of dishes, and have a sweet and tangy flavor when cooked. Uses: Onions are one of the most commonly used ingredients for cooking throughout the world. They can be used in dishes as simple as a rice pilaf, or combined with carrots, celery, and water to make a delicious and healthy vegetable stock that can be used in soups and stews.
096382.name: Cut Onions Yellow Diced 8 Oz
096382.title: Diced Yellow Onion

096410.description: ¿ Growing area: Ventura County, California Product Info: Kale is a form of wild cabbage in which the central leaves do not form a head. It's said to have originated in the European Mediterranean prior to the Middle Ages. Kale's hardly leaves resisted frost damage, making it a staple for winter cooking when most vegetables were unavailable. Kale is known for its nutritional density, while being rich in vitamins A, C, Minerals, Calcium, Fiber and Protein. Furthermore, Kale is a great source of beta-carotene and lutein. Taste: Kale has a mellow cabbage flavor with a slight crunchy texture. Uses: Kale pairs well with a variety of sauces and spices, but stands on it own when cooked with a bit of olive oil, salt and pepper. Sauté with garlic and lemon or add it to soups and pastas too!
096410.name: Greens Kale 10 Oz

096423.description: ¿ Growing area: Northern Baja California, Mexico and USA Product Info: Trader Joe's Organic Sugar Snap Peas are ready to eat, but you can also microwave them in the bag. Simply cut the corner and microwave for 2-3 minutes or until desired level of doneness. Taste: The tender, light green seeds are sweet, encased in crisp outer pods. Uses: Stir-fry, salads, crudité trays¿endless possibilities as a refreshing snack or side! Trader Joe's Company Bulletin05/25/2011 page 40 of 44 Confidential
096423.name: Peas Sugar Snap Org 10 Oz

097266.description: A great appetizer should whet the palate and get your taste buds in tune for the meal ahead.
