By that metric, chips and salsa may just be one of the best appetizers in the history of the form. From the initial crunch of the chip, to the zesty thrill of the salsa, all the way to how perfectly their combination sets you up for the savory, spicy meal ahead, chips and salsa have it all. Of the many chips that we offer, one sticks out in our minds as being particularly well suited to the aforementioned appetizer partnership: Trader Joe's Quinoa and Black Bean Infused Tortilla Chips. The mix of red Quinoa and robust Black Beans included in the base recipe of these white corn Tortilla Chips lends them a pleasant, earthy nuttiness that plays particularly well with the tangy notes of salsa. Their hexagon shape allows for optimal grip when dealing with more formidable dips, such as Organic Chunky Homestyle Guacamole [sku 71498] or Organic Vegan Nacho Dip [sku 73435]. Be sure to keep a bag of these gluten free, kosher-certified Tortilla Chips on hand for an exemplary standalone snack, or as an excellent starter for tacos, or tamales, or Beef Birria [sku 72620]¿ Quinoa and Black Bean Infused Tortilla Chips
097266.name: A-Tomatoes On The Vine Org 16 Oz

097997.description: ¿ About the Grower: Our growers have been in business for over 35 years. They are located in the #1 Sweet Potato producing counties in the US! Growing area: Nashville, North Carolina. The growing area is a 120-mile radius which includes Nash, Edgecombe, Johnston, Wake and Wilson counties. Product Info: The sweet, orange-colored root vegetable that is often thought of as a yam in the United States is actually a sweet potato. Yams purchased in the United States are almost always sweet potatoes. Look for sweet potatoes that are firm and do not have bruises, soft spots or cracks. Store in a cool dry place and do not refrigerate, as cold temperatures alter the flavor and shorten the shelf life of the yam. Taste: Sweet and wholesome, with a rich nutty flavor. Uses: Sweet Potatoes are an extremely versatile vegetable. They can be baked, roasted, fried, grilled, boiled, mashed or grated. Make Sweet Potato biscuits, stuffing, soup, pie, casserole. Or you can sweeten them by baking and adding a little butter or maple syrup, and topping them off with some brown sugar! Nutritional Benefits: Some refer to Sweet Potatoes as a super food because of their nutritional value. They are very low in Saturated Fat, Cholesterol and Sodium, and an excellent source of Potassium, Fiber, Vitamin B6 and Vitamin C. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin3/28/2012 page 44 of 45 Confidential
097997.name: Potato Sweet Each
097997.title: Sweet Potato

098082.description: ¿ Growing area: Ventura County, CA Product Info: Lacinato kale, also known as Tuscan or Dinosaur Kale, is a member of the same family as cauliflower, broccoli and collard greens. The Lacinato variety has dark blue-green leaves, with an ridged texture (like dinosaur skin!). Like all kales, Trader Joe's Lacinato Kale is nutrient-dense, packed with vitamin C, calcium, fiber, antioxidants and beta-carotene. Taste: Trader Joe's Lacinato Kale has a slightly sweeter and more delicate flavor than curly green kale. Uses: Saute, boil or braise and then serve as-is, or incorporate into soups, stews, or any recipe that calls for greens. Kale pairs well with a variety of sauces and spices. Get creative! Toss the Kale with oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake in the oven for some delicious Kale chips that will be the talk of the town! Why the tasting panel loved it: Trader Joe's Lacinato Kale is a nutrient-dense, quick- cooking AND great-tasting green that is cut, washed and ready to use! It's a convenient and healthy side dish for a busy weeknight meal.
098082.name: R-Greens Kale Tuscan Org 10 Oz
098082.title: Organic Tuscan Kale

098088.name: R-Salad Power To The Greens Org 5 Oz
098088.title: Organic Power To The Greens Ready To Eat Blend Of Organic Greens Baby Kale, Baby Red Chard, Baby Spinach, Baby Collard Greens, Baby Mizuna & Frisee

098253.description: ¿ Growing area: Ventura County, CA Product Info: A member of the cabbage family, Trader Joe's Baby Shanghai Bok Choy has uniform light green and tender stalks and leaves. Pre-washed and ready to go, this product takes the hassle out of cleaning and chopping full-size Bok Choy. Taste: Trader Joe's Baby Shanghai Bok Choy is sweet, crispy and tender. The flavor is milder than white Bok Choy and the stems are softer. Uses: Trader Joe's Baby Shanghai Bok Choy is delicious in soups and stir-fries, braised whole, sautéed or eaten raw. Pair with any protein and stir fry with a bit of garlic, ginger and your favorite sauce for a healthy and delicious meal. Its miniature size makes for a unique garnish as well! Why the tasting panel loved it: Aside from the pre-washed convenience, the panel especially loved the sweet flavor and tender texture of this particular bok choy variety. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin6/27/2012 page 38 of 39 Confidential
098253.name: Bok Choy Shanghai Baby 6.3 Oz
098253.title: Baby Shanghai Bok Choy

098356.description: Our "regionally grown" program is back for its third consecutive year for the Midwest. With some new additions to the mix, we've hand-picked some of the best in loose produce. These items will be available as long as the local growing seasons lasts, which is typically heaviest in July and August. Our customers love "local" or "regional" produce, and we're excited to bring it back by popular demand. In addition to having satisfied customers, buying local also¿ o Supports local economies and keeps local farms thriving. o Reduces the use of fuels and helps protect the environment by reducing carbon footprint. o Offers fresher produce, along with a much more competitive price! o Preserves the economic diversity of our communities and the special character of our neighborhoods. Yellow Squash SKU# 95353 Pack 35 $.79 retail Growing Area: IL/OH Eggplant SKU# 72160 Pack 18 $1.79 retail Growing Area: MI/IL/OH/MN (MW stores) NC/ SC/ GA (SE stores)
098356.name: Regional Eggplant Graffiti Ea

099045.description: ¿ Growing area: Coachella & San Joaquin Valley, CA and Mexico Product Info: Trader Joe's Green Bell Peppers have glossy skin and thick, crunchy walls, sturdy enough for any dip you desire. Each plant is put in the ground at the same age, giving you a consistently sized pepper every time. Taste: Semi-sweet with a robust vegetable taste. Slightly more bitter than red or orange bell peppers. Uses: Trader Joe's Green Bell Peppers are extremely versatile. They can be baked, roasted, fried, grilled, boiled or stuffed¿ For a simple yet hearty dinner recipe, cook wild rice and sauté chicken with a bit of garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper. Stuff the peppers with the chicken and wild rice, brush with olive oil and bake at 350°F for 25 minutes. Dinner is served! Nutritional Benefits: Green Bell Peppers have no Saturated Fat, Cholesterol or Sodium. They are an excellent source of Potassium, Fiber, Vitamin B6 and Vitamin C. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin5/15/2013 page 37 of 37 Confidential
099045.name: Pepper Bell Green Each

001026.description: One bite, two bites, three bites, four - you and your guests will be asking for more. Each eight-ounce box of Trader Joe's Pastry Bites, contains twelve pieces of buttery puff pastry that delivers the perfect balance between a soft, yet crisp and flaky dough. It holds the creamy feta and cream cheese and is topped with caramelized onions for the ultimate melt-in-your-mouth worthy, sweet n' salty concoction. Pastry Bites are something you can eat with beer or wine, or before an entree of a salad, steak, chicken or fish, or of course they're well paired on a tray with a round of other bite-sized appetizers like Parmesan Pastry Pups [sku 99272], Spizzico di Pizza [sku 86919], Mini Chicken Tacos [sku 83110], Party Size Mini Meatballs [sku 77262], and the list goes on in our not-so-mini selection of appetizers. Use toothpicks or mini-forks, but we suggest using your fingers - they taste better that way, trust us. They're Pastry Bites, so just pick it up and Bite. That simple. You'll find twelve, small Trader Joe's Pastry Bites with feta cheese and caramelized onions in each 8.5-ounce box for $4.99* in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Pastry Bites
001026.name: Pastry Bites Feta & Onion
001026.title: Pastry Bites Feta Cheese & Caramelized Onions

038028.description: Trader Joe's Spanakopita are prepared from a traditional recipe handed down from a Greek family. California- grown spinach is sautéed with onions and herbs and mixed into a creamy ricotta and feta cheese blend, then hand-folded into fillo dough triangles. When baked, the fillo becomes light and flaky and the flavors of the spinach, herbs and cheese marry. Even though each crisp/tender pastry triangle is loaded to the angles with robust cheesy filling, it isn't overly rich. In fact, the feta and ricotta deliver a tangy sourness that embraces the mineral-rich spinach. The result is an elegant finger food that's a hit with everyone who tries it. It's ideal party fare, and can make a lovely light meal when accompanied by salad. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Spanakopita
038028.name: Spanakopita W/Spinach & Cheese

046189.description: The star of your next dim sum snacking spread for friends and family or an appetizer enjoyed during a night in without reaching for the yellow pages to find the nearest Chinese delivery. Trader Joe's Chicken Shu Mai is just part of our dynasty of exotic options currently filling our freezers with the goal to be filling your stomach in the near future. Each dumpling is a smooth and tender, wheat flour dough enrobing a savory poultry filling. Traditional ingredients come together to fashion this chicken, carrot, green onion, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, and white pepper sweet and salty Shu Mai interior. But wait, there's more! We also toss in a packet of an umami, tangy soy sauce that when dipped into, unleashes even more flavor into each bite of our Chicken Shu Mai. With 18 dumplings per package - and at only $2.99* a box - these make a great option to serve alongside stir-fry with your favorite veggies or pick up one of our other dim sum dishes to pair it with - maybe TJ's Shrimp Thai Gyoza [sku 47944] or our Chicken Fried Rice [sku 33251]. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Chicken Shu Mai
046189.name: Chicken Shu Mai

050209.description: Trader Joe's Breaded Mozzarella Cheese Sticks begin with part skim mozzarella cheese from Wisconsin. This family owned cheese company specifically uses rbst free cheese for our sticks. We developed a panko breading seasoned with garlic that bakes up in less than 10 minutes. There just enough breading that doesn't overpower the cheese. We are selling 16 oz. bag of Trader Joe's Breaded Mozzarella Sticks for $3.99.
050209.name: Breaded Mozz Cheese Sticks
050209.title: Breaded Mozzarella Cheese Sticks

050378.description: Perhaps you've heard of those edible bird's nests that are a delicacy in parts of Asia. Aside from being cost prohibitive (they can be up to $3,000 per pound!), and also being difficult to procure in the States, the idea of eating an actual nest constructed by birds is not all that palatable to most eaters outside those cultures. But what about the idea of "nests" made of vegetables? Trader Joe's Vegetable Bird's Nests are indeed popular wtihin the Customer culture of TJ's. We've offered them since 2003! Vegetable Bird's Nests are a combination of julienned onions and carrots with chopped kale that have been loosely woven together and then fried in tempura batter. Once you reheat these fully cooked Nests from frozen (in the conventional oven or with a quick re-fry in oil), you'll have an artistic appetizer to pair with other Asian flavors. Enjoy their crisp crunch and dip them in the included, soy-based sauce if you like! Find them in our freezers every day. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Vegetable Bird's Nests
050378.name: Vegetable Bird'S Nests

061202.description: Trader Joe's Buffalo Style Chicken Poppers combine all the flavors associated with buffalo style chicken wings for a poppin' appetizer you can bake & serve any time you like. Grilled and diced white meat chicken is mixed with cream cheese, fontina, Cheddar, and Monterey Jack-along with a hot cayenne pepper sauce-to create the tender, cheesy, spicy filling. That filling is folded into layers of delicate fillo dough then battered before it's finally fried to a perfectly crisp bite. This method produces an at- home appetizer that reheats from frozen spectacularly well in your oven and ends up as flaky and satisfying as similar apps you'd find at your favorite local haunts. But, you'll only find this particular version at Trader Joe's! The 11.5-ounce package of Buffalo Style Chicken Poppers is in our freezers, every day. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Buffalo Style Chicken Poppers
061202.name: Buffalo Style Chicken Poppers

061534.description: We've sold a couple different versions of Vegetable Samosas over the years [skus 71098, 54731], and in our continuing effort to find the "golden samosa" (a term we made up to describe the ultimate triangular savory- stuffed pastry), we've partnered with a Canadian supplier to refine our samosas offering once again¿ Our new Mini Vegetable Samosas are two-bite sized, three-sided pastries with a crisp exterior made from a special Phyllo-type dough that creates a multilayered, flaky package for the filling. Speaking of the filling, each triangle is packed corner-to-corner with a curry-like mixture of peas, carrots, potatoes, lentils, onions, and Indian spices. In fact, the filling is 50% of the recipe (versus about 35% in other brands). The vegetables are tender & mildly spicy, filling your mouth with warm flavors redolent of the Indian subcontinent. Beyond their great taste, it's also worth noting that compared to our previous version (Handcrafted Vegetable Samosas, sku 54731] the nutritional profile of these Samosas is significantly improved. One serving (4 pieces/80g) has 160 calories (vs. 240 cal), 7g fat (vs. 12g), 260mg sodium (vs. 480mg), and 20g carbs (vs. 28g). Of course, we're not trying to take the angle that Trader Joe's Mini Vegetable Samosas are a health food-but it's good to know that when you're enjoying them as a snack or among a spread of appetizers, you're getting food that's thoughtfully made. We also think the price is rather thoughtful (if we do say so ourselves)¿ Each 8.5-ounce box of 12 Mini Vegetable Samosas is $3.49. Find them in our freezers. 5.21.1 8
061534.name: Samosas Vegetable
061534.title: Mini Vegetable Samosas

065293.description: If you've been shopping with us for a while, you know that we can't resist a good kaizen opportunity. At Trader Joe's, Kaizen is a way of life (we even capitalize it in sentences¿). So when our previous TJ's Mac and Cheese Bites vendor could no longer produce the product for us, we took it as not only an opportunity to source a new supplier, but to improve the product, as well. In the years following their 2010 debut, Trader Joe's Mac & Cheese Bites [sku 95140] made their way onto many a media outlet and food blogger's lists of favorite frozen appetizers. ("Top 10 TJ's Apps of All-Time," "13 Party Foods You'll For Sure Want to Marry," "We Literally Wept When We Tried These Five Cheesy Foods¿"-okay, we're exaggerating, but you get the idea.). Point is, there has always been much to love about these bite-sized, breaded balls of actual Mac and Cheese. Now, with our new and improved Trader Joe's Mac and Cheese Bites, there's even more to love. For starters, they're cheesier than ever, featuring a blend of Cheddar, Havarti, Swiss, & Gouda-a.k.a. the exact same blend you'll find in our famed TJ's Diner Mac N' Cheese [sku 03655]-plus Cream Cheese, Monterey Jack, & Pecorino Romano for good measure. They also feature a thinner, crispier panko-style breading this time, which only further highlights the real star of these bites: the Mac and the Cheese, of course! Whether you serve them at a party or warm them individually as a snack, Trader Joe's Mac and Cheese Bites can be ready in just around twenty minutes¿so what are you waiting for? Head to your local TJ's today, where we're selling 10-ounce boxes (that's about ten Bites ) for $3.99.
065293.name: Mac & Cheese Bites
065293.title: Mac And Cheese Bites

068797.description: Life is full of surprises. Meatballs can be, too. Take, for example, Trader Joe's Olive Stuffed Chicken Bites. These neat little balls of meat-chicken, to be specific-are about 50% boneless, skinless, chicken leg meat, bound together by potato and panko breadcrumbs. They're seasoned with garlic, coriander and salt & pepper. What's the surprise? We hate to give it away, but in the interest of expedience, we'll tell: it's a pimento-stuffed Manzanillo olive from Spain, seated in the center like a well-set gem! While the olive may be seriously unexpected, we think the whole profile of this savory appetizer is a revelation. Sink your teeth into one of these chicken meatballs and you'll first experience the crisp exterior, giving way to the tender, meaty insides, and finally that briny, green-olive center. But, don't be surprised when you find that these Olive Stuffed Chicken Bites are only offered during the holiday season. Find them in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Olive Chicken Bites
068797.name: Olive Chicken Bites Breaded Dark Meat Chicken Bites With A Whole Stuffed Manzanilla Olive (Product Descriptor) __________________ Product Descriptor Should Be No Smaller Than 1/3 The Height Of Olive Chicken Bites

073567.description: If you are one of the many customers who love our sweet Trader Joe's Portuguese Custard Tarts [sku 69352]- and there are many-then you're also going to love the fish version! Before you start second-guessing our judgment, hear us out... Trader Joe's Bacalhau Tartelettes (Bacalhau means "cod" in Portuguese), are made by the same supplier who makes our pasteles de nata. These pasteles de bacalhau have an all-butter laminated crust that holds a creamy filling made with bechamel, egg yolks, diced potato, and salted cod. These flavors are enhanced by onion and garlic, with additional hints of nutmeg and piri piri chilis. Our Bacalhau Tartelettes may not be what you'd choose at breakfast with your coffee, but they certainly fit in quite well as a handy, bite-sized appetizer. Give them a squeeze of fresh lemon, then pair them with other TJ's app-favorites-plus some chilled, Portuguese wine, such as Espiral Rosé [sku 97395], or Espiral Vinho Verde [sku 47536]. Portuguese Bacalhau Tartelettes
073567.name: Tartelettes Portuguese Bacalhau
073567.title: Portuguese Bacalhau Tartlettes

073996.description: We're becoming prolific pickle-ifiers, having already pickled popcorn, chips, hummus, mustard, jalapeños- and of course, cucumbers, in a variety of shapes and brines. What's left to pickle? Always loving alliteration, we poked around, contem-plating pickled peaches, peas, potatoes, pistachios, prunes, pollock, Pad Thai, pretzels, peppermints, and pudding... None proved praiseworthy. (Luckily, these were just postulations and ponderings.) Finally, we considered pups. With persnickety pleasure, we put pups through their paces. Not only did they pass our production probes, but they also passed our panel! If it's not already obvious, we're proud to present Trader Joe's Perfectly Pickled Pups. But pickled hot dogs, you say? Our Perfectly Pickled Pups are so much more. Parroting the format of our successful Parmesan Pastry Pups [sku 99272], we begin with Mini Uncured Beef Franks. These teeny wieners are infused with dill-pickle flavor, by way of popular brining ingredients such as sea salt, sugar, onion, garlic, vinegar, and dill weed. The pickle-flavored Pups are then coated in a mixure of batter and breadcrumbs that's seasoned with even more particularly pickley ingredients. The results (once you procure them from the store and prepare them in your air fryer or conventional oven) are these savory, couple-bite-sized treats that are crispy on the outside, tender and beefy on the inside, and perspicuously pickle-flavored. The only pending postulation is: what will Trader Joe's pickle next?! Perfectly Pickled Pups
073996.name: Perfectly Pickled Pups

075530.description: What look like mini calzones, taste like cheese pizza, and eat like some of the tastiest hors d'oeuvres around? New Trader Joe's Panzerotti Pizza Bites, that's what! Made for us in Southern Italy by a supplier who specializes in this very appetizer, these two-to-three-bite-sized, lightly fried Pizza pockets take the concept of "after-school pizza rolls" and elevates it to flavorful new heights! Picture this: each Trader Joe's Panzerotti Pizza Bite begins with a pleasantly chewy, half-moon-shaped pouch of pizza dough, which gets subsequently stuffed with a melty, mozzarella cheese blend and bold Italian tomato sauce, then quick-fried in vegetable oil. Simple? Yes. Simply irresistable? Also yes. Just heat them from frozen (we're talking 12 minutes in a conventional oven, 8-10 minutes in an air fryer, or 1-2 minutes in a microwave here, folks-minimal effort), and you've got one delicious appetizer or snack on your hands... or rather, you've got several delicious Panzerotti Pizza Bites in your hands! Panzerotti Pizza Bites
075530.name: Pizza Bites Panzerotti
075530.title: Panzerotti Pizza Bites

075557.description: When in Wisconsin, one eats as the Wisconsites do. And often, that means taking a soft, chewy, and surprisingly squeaky bite of a cheese curd. A natural product of the cheese-making process, cheese curds are typically made from bits of extremely unaged Cheddar, and can be found fresh, fried, and served over salads on bar menus and at ball parks across the Badger State. Squarely fitting in the "fried" variation of this regional fave, Trader Joe's Breaded Cheddar Cheese Curds are proudly made with Wisconsin Cheddar, coated with a savory-seasoned batter, and fried to tasty, textural perfection. As any cheese-appreciating Wisconsite will tell you, a proper cheese curd should make a squeaking sensation between your teeth as you bite into it-a feeling not dissimilar from the texture of fried halloumi or bread cheese. We're happy to report that our Cheese Curds most certainly have that squeak, plus the captivating crunch of their crispy, Breaded exterior. Easily prepared in the oven or air fryer, they can be enjoyed on their own as a quick snack, with your favorite dipping sauce as an appetizer, or paired with a pint of your favorite lager or ale. You'll find Trader Joe's Breaded Cheddar Cheese Curds chilling in our freezers. Breaded Cheddar Cheese Curds
075557.name: Cheese Curds Breaded Cheddar
075557.title: Breaded Cheddar Cheese Curds

077452.description: There's a whole wide world of appetizers out there; some are creamy and cheesy, some are crispy and crunchy, and some are hot and spicy. And some, like Trader Joe's Jalapeño & Cream Cheese Crispy Wontons, manage to be all of those at once-and more! They're made with a marvelously rich mix of tangy cream cheese, savory Parmesan, and diced jalapeño, which is then wrapped in a wonton skin and fried until bubbly and golden brown. A little like a mix between a rangoon and jalapeño popper, every bite of these captivatingly Crispy Wontons is superbly savory, pleasantly spicy, and most of all, totally satisfying. No need to bring out the deep fryer or heat a whole pot of oil, either: these Wontons go from frozen to crispy and delicious in just about 10 minutes in a conventional oven, or a little more than half that in an air fryer. Once cooked, they're ready to be served for all kinds of occasions: try them as an easy starter for a quick stir- fry dinner, an hors d'oeuvre for a cocktail night with friends, or as a super flavorful snack when folks for over for the big game. Wherever and whenever you have them, just be sure to pair them with a bit of our Sweet Chili Sauce [sku 91113], for dipping. Jalapeño & Cream Cheese Crispy Wontons
077452.name: Wontons Jalapeno Cream Cheese
077452.title: Jalapeño & Cream Cheese Crispy Wontons

086919.description: Roughly translated from Italian, "Spizzico di Pizza" means "Little Bites of Pizza," which is exactly what we're serving up here with Trader Joe's Spizzico di Pizza-mini, appetizer-sized pizzas (about 2.5" in diameter), topped with tomato sauce & a blend of Mozzarella, Cheddar, Swiss, & Parmesan cheeses! Ready to go from freezer-to-table in under 15 minutes, TJ's Spizzico di Pizza are a clear kid-favorite, especially in the after-school snack category. But if you're angling for something more adult, by all means, add accoutrements! TJ's Red Chili Pepper Flakes [sku 18909], TJ's Organic Oregano [sku 18906], TJ's Organic Cilantro [sku 45683], TJ's Anchovy Fillets [sku 75287], Citterio® Pancetta [94608] TJ's Sliced Prosciutto [sku 98861]... The pizza-pie-in-the-sky is the limit! We're selling each 9.5-ounce box of Trader Joe's Spizzico de Pizza for $2.99*, every day. Find them in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Spizzico di Pizza
086919.name: Spizzico Di Pizza

094778.description: Trader Joe's Pork Shu Mai are little dumplings as known as dim sum. Their outer layer is a traditional dumpling/wonton skin filled with pork and Chinese-style seasonings. Terrific appetizers or a quick snack. Just microwave in less than 3 minutes. We are selling an 9 oz. box of 9 Trader Joe's Pork Shu Mai for $2.99.
094778.name: Pork Shu Mai

097981.description: Samosas take many shapes, but are most commonly triangular, flaky-pastry snacks filled with a savory filling. Thought to have originated in Central Asia more than a thousand years ago, these days samosas are usually associated with Indian cuisine. And that's exactly the culinary tradition from which Trader Joe's Mini Chicken Tikka Samosas take their inspiration. Our Mini Chicken Tikka Samosas are crisp, flaky pastry, in the traditional triangular shape, that are filled with chicken, vegetables and Indian curry spices - perhaps not surprisingly, the filling does taste quite like Chicken Tikka Masala. They have a moderate amount of heat - our "chili pepper" chart on the box indicates a medium heat level - and are excellent for dipping in chutneys or yogurt-based sauces. Making a romantic dinner for two for Valentine's Day? These Mini Samosas can certainly help you turn up the heat. You'll find 8.5 ounce boxes of Mini Chicken Tikka Samosas in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Mini Chicken Tikka Samosas
097981.name: Mini Chicken Tikka Samosas Product Of Canada Chicken, Vegetables And Indian Spices Wrapped In Crisp, Flaky Pastry

062839.description: It's often said that the best baguettes in the world are made in France. There are a few theories as two why: some argue that it's a tendency for higher gluten content, some point to a mastery of fermentation techniques, others tie it to various intangible qualities of local ingredients. Whatever the cause, it's all academic unless you have the chance to visit France. But that got us thinking: why not bring France to our freezers? Thus, we bring to you Trader Joe's Mini French Baguettes, a collection of six compact, individual baguettes, made especially for us by a French bakery, which are baked to about 80% doneness, then frozen for you to finish at home. And that means one thing in particular: ineffably French, perfectly baked Baguettes, fresh from your very own oven. Once fully cooked from your oven (simply place them directly on the oven rack, from frozen, at 400°F for about six minutes), these Baguettes can be enjoyed in any way you would if they came from a boulangerie on the banks of the Seine: cut them into hunks and enjoy with a bowl of soup, tear into pieces and dip into a flavorful olive oil, even split them horizontally for an elegantly elevated sandwich. We're selling each 9.5-ounce package of six Mini French Baguettes for $3.99*, every day - which is considerably less expensive than airfare to Paris, last time we checked. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Mini French Baguettes
062839.name: Frozen Baguettes Mini French
062839.title: Mini French Baguettes

064355.description: In the 18th century, wheat flour was scarce in Brazil. Across the country, the climate was largely inhospitable to domestic wheat cultivation, and what little was shipped in from Europe mostly ended up in the hands of wealthy European settlers. Enslaved Brazilians of African descent soon discovered that the locally-grown cassava root could be processed into a starch (which we now commonly call tapioca) and made into a delicious, airy, totally wheat-free bread. Years later, bakers added cheese, and the recipe flourished across the continent. But it's the original pao de queijo (as its known in Brazil) that's most famous throughout the world, and it's also what inspired Trader Joe's Brazilian Style Cheese Bread. Made with tapioca flour and parmesan cheese, our frozen, easy-to-bake Cheese Bread is a true delight: Crispy on the outside, light, airy, and chewy on the inside, with pockets of cheese to provide some extra flavor and texture. Pao de queijo is often eaten for breakfast in Brazil, but we find our Cheese Bread makes a great starter, side, or anytime snack. And since it's made with tapioca flour instead of wheat, it's also totally gluten free. Maravilhoso! We're selling eleven ounce boxes of Trader Joe's Brazilian Style Cheese Bread for $3.99*, every day. Look for them in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Brazilian Style Cheese Bread
064355.name: Brazilian Style Cheese Bread With Tapioca Flour

010142.description: Quiche tends to have a reputation for being a highfalutin, complicated piece of haute cuisine among the general public, but its formulation is actually quite simple: a rich, buttery crust filled with fluffy eggs, and other tasty fillings. We've always thought that this simple, savory-pie construction is one of its greatest strengths. Trader Joe's Broccoli & Cheddar Cheese Quiche definitely plays to this strength-but don't think for a minute that "simple construction" means anything less than delicious! This one begins with a flaky, wheat-flour crust, shaped like a fluted pie shell. Inside that shell is a fluffy mixture of eggs, with both mild & sharp Cheddar cheeses, plus pieces of Broccoli. Savory (and simple) seasonings support these flavors, including onions, garlic, salt & black pepper. Keeping with the theme, it couldn't be much simpler to prepare this Broccoli & Cheddar Cheese Quiche. Cook it from frozen for 3 minutes in your microwave, or 20-25 minutes in your 400°F conventional oven. Let it rest for 1-2 minutes, and your Quiche is hot (and haute!) and ready to enjoy. It's the ideal size for an individual breakfast. Or slice it in half and pair with Trader Joe's Fully Cooked Uncured Bacon [sku 86483], and A Fruitful Medley [sku 54991] for a fast and delicious brunch for two! Broccoli & Cheddar Quiche
010142.name: Broccoli & Cheddar Quiche
010142.title: Broccoli & Cheddar Cheese Quiche

019967.description: Human beings have been enjoying waffles, in one form or another, since at least the 12th century. We've taken the traditional waffle and transformed it into something more. Please welcome, Trader Joe's Gluten Free Waffles. It contains sweet rice flour and brown rice flour that is, as promised, free of gluten. And, since we like you, we've added a little bit of fruit juice blend so it can taste good too. After a quick spin through the toaster, these circular Waffles emerge crisped and golden, while maintaining a delightfully soft interior. Their toasty aroma brings out subtle sweet flavors, well paired with creamy butter and maple syrup. Of course, waffle enjoyment doesn't need to be boxed into breakfast time. Toaster Waffles are excellent with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a drizzle of the sweet sauce of your choice-may we suggest warming up Trader Joe's Raspberry Preserves [sku 87805] for drizzling? You'll find eight Gluten Free Toaster Waffles inside each 11-ounce box. Find them in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Gluten Free Toaster Waffles
019967.name: Gluten Free Waffles
019967.title: Gluten Free Toaster Waffles

020106.description: When you open the box of Trader Joe's Blueberry Waffles, the aroma of blueberry fills the room. These Waffles are made with blueberry flavored bits, along with natural blueberry flavoring to deliver the utmost blueberry- on-blueberry experience. When toasted, they take on a wonderfully crisp exterior and chewy interior, much like waffles you'd make from scratch, at a fraction of the time. Looking for a new way to enjoy Blueberry Waffles? Try toasting them, then sandwiching a scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream [sku 45883] in between. You could even drizzle that with Maple Syrup [sku 04892]. They're also great for a quick, handheld breakfast to-go or, if you have more time on your hands, they make an excellent companion next to Apple Smoked Bacon [sku 74911], and your favorite eggy creations. Oh, yes. We're selling each 11-ounce box of eight Blueberry Waffles for the incredible price of $1.99*, the same price we've had since 2009! They're in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current Blueberry Waffles
020106.name: Trader Joe'S Naturally Flavored Blueberry Waffles

036084.description: Trader Joe's Potato Pancakes, A.K.A. latkes, are made for us according to an old, Eastern European recipe that uses only the best quality ingredients. And they're fully cooked, so all you have to do is reheat & eat! While we find that the air fryer is the quickest method (just 5 to 6 minutes), yielding the crispest exterior, our Potato Pancakes are equally yummy prepared in a skillet on the stovetop, or in a conventional oven. Latkes are, of course, a Hanukkah tradition, but they're not just for holidays. We enjoy our kosher-certified Potato Pancakes at breakfast, dinner or anytime in between. Give them a try as a side with your favorite delicatessen delicacy, or as the foundation for a fantastic smoked salmon Benedict. Go old school and top them with sour cream and apple sauce, or feel free to think outside the box and melt a bit of shredded cheese over them as they fry. Potato Pancakes (Latkes)
036084.name: Latkes Potato Pancakes

055970.description: The Lorraine region in northeastern France is associated with numerous notable cuisines. Potato stew, smoked bacon, macarons, and madeleines all have roots of origin, or development in Lorraine-but what first comes to mind is their most famous dish, the quiche. While this region's namesake quiche contains bacon, we sought a meatless version-still hoping to convey the richness of flavor that comes with the original. To do so, we traveled to the source (of course!) and found French bakers with the traditional knowledge & skills needed to create Trader Joe's Mixed Mushrooms & Spinach Quiche. The crust is made with wheat flour and real butter. The savory custard center consists of eggs, crème fraiche, and Emmental Swiss, with chopped spinach, and a blend of White Button & Oyster mushrooms. Just the right amount of salt, and nutmeg (that not-so-secret, secret ingredient) help delicately balance all the flavors. The umami of the mushrooms, combined with the rich custard makes for a wonderfully satisfying meal (no bacon required)-and one with 12g of protein and just 420 calories per serving. (That's the entire 6.17-ounce Quiche!) Add a simple side salad of Champs Elysees greens [sku 26370], and a glass of Révélation Chardonnay [sku 97161], and you might as well be having lunch at a Metz café. It'll cost you much less, though. We're selling the 6.17-ounce box containing Trader Joe's Mixed Mushroom & Spinach Quiche for $2.49, everyday. Find it in our freezers. 04.16. 18
055970.name: Spinach & Mushroom Quiche
055970.title: Mixed Mushroom & Spinach Quiche

058674.description: The origin of the French word quiche is unknown, but it kind of sounds like "kiss," as in: "Please give me a quiche." That's good enough for us. So, what would make a quiche worthy of such a comparison? In our opinion, the quiche would have to be so good it keeps you coming back for more. Trader Joe's Quiche Lorraine is exactly that good. While we already sell a frozen Broccoli and Cheddar Quiche, and a Spinach and Mushroom Quiche, we've yet to provide our customers with the classic from Lorraine, France. The reason for our delay has had to do with¿ ham. You see, Quiche Lorraine must not only have a perfectly flaky, savory, buttery crust-it must also have plenty of ham. The trouble is, most quality bakeries that can produce a high-quality pastry, are not USDA approved; which means, they can only include 3% ham, or less. Not good enough! After a diligent search, our developers finally found the right supplier in San Francisco. The Quiche Lorraine they make for us has a superb pastry crust, and contains about 20% uncured ham. The ham is matched with Swiss cheese, both of which are presented in a soft egg custard made from a short list of simple ingredients. The Quiche is fully cooked, so you need only heat it and serve, either hot or room temperature. Serve it for breakfast with fresh fruit, or for lunch with fresh greens. It feeds four, unless you cut it into smaller pieces and serve it as an hors d'oeuvre. So versatile! So quiche-able. If you find lips are starting to quiver, hurry to Trader Joe's. We'll gladly give you a quiche (Quiche Lorraine, that is), and that for only $5.49. 02.27. 17
058674.name: Quiche Lorraine

062899.description: A recent review of our frozen products revealed that while we had a sizeable number of breakfast options available for customers, they skewed to the light and fluffy (read: carb-tastic), such as waffles, pancakes, and croissants. And while there's nothing wrong with waffles, pancakes, or croissants, we felt there was an opportunity to bring in some lower carb, higher protein offerings to round out the set. To fill this gap and bolster your breakfasts, we are excited to welcome Trader Joe's Egg Frittata with Swiss Cheese & Cauliflower to our frozen case! Made with a hearty base of 41% egg and 25% Swiss cheese, Trader Joe's Egg Frittata has a fluffy texture that belies its protein-packed ingredient list. Earthy cauliflower, fried onions, and the aforementioned cheese create the classic, belly-warming breakfast profile: craveably savory and utterly delicious. To amp up the protein content, our supplier uses egg whites, whole eggs, and whey protein concentrate-add it all up, and you get about 12 grams of protein and 15% of your daily calcium needs, at just 5 grams of carbs per fully-cooked Frittata! To achieve peak Frittata perfection, simply reheat in the microwave or bake to your heart's (and your schedule's) content. Its plump disc shape makes it just the right size for an egg sandwich on a TJ's British Muffin [sku 14626/90558], with a slice of Unexpected Cheddar [sku 96923], Fully Cooked Bacon [sku 86483], and a squirt of Sriracha Sauce [sku 96923]. Or use two TJ's Hashbrowns [sku 96923] in place of the muffin for a crunchier, brunchier composition. On the other hand, if you're going for a lower carb concoction, set one of these Frittatas atop a bed of crisp salad greens dressed in vinaigrette, and you've got a satisfying meal on your hands, with hardly any fuss. Seek out similar Frittatas elsewhere, and you'll find that artificial ingredients abound. We're offering 4.94-ounce boxes of two Trader Joe's Egg Frittata with Swiss Cheese & Cauliflower for $2.99-a value that's sure to have you waking up on the right side of the bed. Find them in our freezers. 05.06. 19
062899.name: Egg Frittata

065428.description: Sometimes unforeseen circumstances yield in fortuitous results. Such is the case with Trader Joe's Brioche French Toast! Our original French Toast [sku 29269] supplier decided to exit the custardy-toasted-bread business, so we sought a new one. While we were at it, we thought we'd also re-imagine the recipe. Our new supplier starts with brioche-baked in-house with lots of butter and egg. This means they're using the freshest bread possible. They rest the loaves for 48 hours, then slice it extra thick before soaking each one in a bath of whole eggs, whole milk, and sugar, with just the right amount of natural cinnamon and vanilla flavors. The slices are then griddled and finally blast frozen¿ until you heat and eat with your favorite French toast topping! We're selling each 12.2-ounce box of Brioche French Toast (four slices) for $3.49*. Find it every day in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Brioche French Toast
065428.name: French Toast Brioche
065428.title: Brioche French Toast

065467.description: Trader Joe's 8 Mini Croissants are ready-to-bake, frozen croissants from the same supplier who makes our popular 4 Chocolate Croissants [sku 91087], and our 4 Almond Croissants [sku 98265]. After Customers expressed dissatisfaction with our previous freezer-to-oven croissants [8 Mini Croissants, sku 60329], we decided to go back to the source of our other favored freezer pastries. The new Croissants still do not require proofing-but they now have a flavor profile more consistent with our other offerings. All you need to do is place the frozen Croissants on a lightly greased baking sheet in a cold oven and turn it to 350°F. Less than 30 minutes later, you'll have fresh-baked, golden-brown Croissants with fantastically flaky texture, and pure butter flavor! We're selling the 12-ounce box of 8 Mini Croissants for $4.49*. Find them every day in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. 8 Mini Croissants
065467.name: Croissants 8 Mini Ready To Bake
065467.title: 8 Mini Croissants

066390.description: Belgium is known the world over for its fine chocolate, vast array of beer, and of course, its delightful waffles. In fact, they even have two different styles of waffles for the discerning connoisuer: the Leige waffle, a sugar- coated, sticky treat with rounded edges, and the Brussels waffle (what we call a Belgian waffle here in the United States), rectangular shaped with crisp edges and a fluffy interior. Huge fans of the latter style that we are, we went straight to the source to bring in our latest Belgian waffle offering. Please welcome Brussels Waffles, Baked in Belgium by Avieta! These Brussels Waffles check off all the boxes when it comes to waffley perfection. After a quick spin through the toaster, these rectangular Waffles emerge crisped and golden, while maintaining a delightfully soft interior. Their toasty aroma offers notes of vanilla, while their sweet, malty flavor begs to be paired with creamy butter and maple syrup. Of course, waffle enjoyment doesn't need to be boxed into breakfast time. Brussels Waffles are excellent with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a drizzle of the sweet sauce of your choice-may we suggest warming up Trader Joe's Raspberry Preserves [sku 87805] for serving? You'll find six Waffles inside each 8.5-ounce box of Brussels Waffles, Baked in Belgium by Avieta. Find them in our freezers for $2.99-that's a waffle lot less than the $4.99 (and higher!) prices we've seen elsewhere. 05.06 .19
066390.name: Waffles Avieta Belgium

070642.description: A long-favored fixture of winter festivals in the Netherlands, poffertjes are light, puffy, miniature pancakes that are traditionally served with a bit of butter and powdered sugar. They're typically made from a simple recipe of sweet, yeasted batter, but require a highly specialized skillet called a poffertjespan to attain their perfectly snackable, one-or-two-bite size. In the spirit of foodie festivity, and in recognition of the fact that most of us don't have a spare poffertjespan lying around, we proudly offer Trader Joe's Maple Flavored Poffertjes as an effortless option for breakfasts, brunches, or even just sweet, simply snacking. Light, puffy, and perfectly sized to pop in your mouth, our frozen Poffertjes are flavored with rich maple sugar to give each bite the feeling of a pancake covered in maple syrup, and take less than a minute to heat a serving in the microwave. Like the traditional Dutch treat they were inspired by, they can be topped with melted butter and a sprinkling of powdered sugar, or accompanied by your favorite fruit preserves (or even a quick drizzle of more maple syrup) to match your mood. Portionable enough to be enjoyed as a quick snack, sweet enough to be enjoyed as a dessert, we particularly enjoy our Maple Flavored Poffertjes when served as a side for bigger breakfast situations. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Maple Flavored Poffertjes
070642.name: Pancake Maple Puffs
070642.title: Maple Poffertjes

070784.description: Popularized by fast food joints and coffee shops worldwide, the breakfast sandwich is a marvel of simple, scrumptious engineering: just bread, meat, cheese, and egg, in one compact, elegantly easy-to-eat package. Of course, even the best designs can do with a bit of streamlining now and then. That's where Trader Joe's Eggwich Sandwich comes in. This ingenious twist on a classic formula starts with an old-fashioned base of turkey sausage topped with American cheese, but replaces the bread with two soft-yet-sturdy scrambled egg patties, creating a breakfast sandwich experience that's packed with protein, lighter on carbs, and has everything you need to start your day off on a decidedly delicious note. Each Eggwich comes fully cooked and ready to reheat from frozen, which only takes about two minutes in the microwave. Once heated through (and given a moment to cool), the cheese becomes marvelously melty, the turkey sausage takes on a crisp, yet yielding, texture, and the egg patties become fantastically fluffy, while still maintaining enough structure to act as handholds. If that weren't enough, every Eggwich is consciously crafted to contain a whopping sixteen grams of protein, but only three grams of carbohydrates. Now that's a golden ratio, if we've ever heard of one. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Eggwich Sandwich
070784.name: Eggwiches Turkey Sausage
070784.title: Eggwich Breadless Breakfast Sandwich

073475.description: Take a stroll through our freezer case, and you'll find fantastic, frozen bake-at-home pastry offerings that will positively improve your morning, any day of the week. If you need proof, look no further than our 4 Chocolate Croissants [sku 91087] and 4 Almond Croissants [sku 98265] - they've been filling our home kitchens (and tummies) with the alluring aroma and taste of fresh baked goods, for years. But sometimes, we just can't handle the proof! For situations like these, we're introducing our latest creation, Trader Joe's 4 Cheese Pastry Rolls. Much like our 8 Mini Croissants [sku 65467], these Rolls don't require advance planning to proof them the night before. In fact, day or night, whether you're making the entire box, or just one, our Pastry Rolls can go straight from the freezer, onto a baking sheet, and into a cold oven. There's no preheating required - set your oven to 400°F when you put the Rolls in and they're ready to eat in under half an hour. Once baked, each sweet cream cheese-filled Roll becomes crisp and flaky; exceptional for an elegant brunch at home or an exemplary on-the-go breakfast. Pair with a café con leche or a cup of Irish Breakfast Black Tea [sku 83548] to really bring those delectable bakery vibes to you. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Cheese Pastry Rolls
073475.name: 4 Cheese Pastry Rolls

074741.description: What's the difference between a pancake and a griddle cake? In certain parts of the world, the two are more or less synonymous. But when and where they do differ, it's largely a matter of height: while a typical pancake tends to be rather thin, griddle cakes are usually considerably thicker, with a springier, slightly chewier texture that's comparable to a Crumpet [sku 14622]. That certainly fits the bill for our frozen, fully-cooked, and ready- to-heat Trader Joe's Dutch Griddle Cakes. They're made for us by a supplier in the Netherlands, who crafts each Cake to a luxuriously lofty stature, creating an altogether elevated breakfast option. The best part? These sweet, tasty Griddle Cakes take only a few minutes in the oven or toaster-or mere seconds in the microwave-before they're ready to be topped with a pat of butter, a swirl of Organic Maple Syrup [sku 89792], and a generous dollop of whipped cream. Grab a few Griddle Cakes (each package contains eight) for a great brunch or breakfast entrée, or just one as a sweet side with some Shredded Hash Browns [sku 96969], bacon, and eggs. Dutch Griddle Cakes
074741.name: Pancakes Dutch Griddle Cakes

075233.description: Starting your morning with a bowl of fruit is a sure-fire way to make your day that much brighter (and sweeter, and tangier-depending on the fruit, of course). That's why we're such big fans of Trader Joe's Mango Blueberry Chia Bowl. Made with an ingredient deck that's exclusively fruit, fruit juice, chia seeds, and water, each bowl starts with a base of tangy mango purée that's been mixed with coconut cream, passion fruit juice, and black chia seeds. Together, the sweet and tropical notes of the mango and passionfruit play perfectly off of the plush silkiness of the coconut cream and satisfying chewiness of the chia seeds. And when you combine that with the clean and simple flavors of the included whole blueberries and diced mango, you've got one magnificent morning on your hands. And since all the puréeing, chopping, and mixing has been done for you already, all you need to do to enjoy our frozen Mango Blueberry Chia Bowl is to let it thaw-either overnight in the fridge, for about an hour and a half at room temperature, or by heating in the microwave for a little more than a minute. It makes an excellent (not to mention effortless) weekday breakfast option, especially when topped with something crunchy, like chopped nuts, a full-flavored granola, or our very own Organic Unsweetened Coconut Chips [sku 57070]. Try bringing a Bowl to work or school, letting it thaw on your commute, and enjoying as a sweet morning treat. Mango Blueberry Chia Bowl
075233.name: Bowl Mango Blueberry Chia
075233.title: Mango Blueberry Chia Bowl

075558.description: For something so seemingly simple, waffles have a whole lot of history behind them. A culinary and etymological descendant of the wafer, the treat that would eventually become the waffle showed up in Northern Europe in the 12th century as a kind of sweeter, more secular version of communion wafers used in Catholic mass. By the 15th century, dedicated waffle irons became commonplace across the continent (especially in Belgium, perhaps unsurprisingly), and waffles began to take on their recognizable, checkerboard-esque appearance. And now, we're delighted to keep the nearly millenium-long history of waffles going by welcoming Trader Joe's Whole Grain Waffles to our frozen waffle offerings. Made for us in Belgium, with hearty whole wheat flour, and containing an impressive 30g of whole grains in every serving, Trader Joe's Whole Grain Waffles take only a few minutes in the toaster or conventional oven before they're captivatingly crisp on the outside, and delightfully warm and chewy on the inside. We find that with their savory flavor profile and expertly tuned texture, there's really no wrong way to go when choosing toppings. Try them with your favorite syrup, a pat of Organic Salted Butter [sku 39302], fresh cut fruit, and/or whipped cream. If you're truly going big on breakfast, you might even try a scoop of Speculoos Cookie Butter Ice Cream [sku 55340]. Whole Grain Waffles
075558.name: Waffles Whole Grain
075558.title: Whole Grain Waffles

076185.description: It's true what the say: breakfast really is the most important meal of the day. But that doesn't mean it has to be the most labor-intensive. In fact, with Trader Joe's Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes, the only thing separating you from a stack of scrumptious, home-style, bite-sized Pancakes is a minute or two in the microwave. That means you have all the more time to focus on what might be the most important part of such an important meal: what, exactly, you'll choose to top them with! With their subtly savory, from-scratch taste, our Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes are a natural fit with our Organic Vermont Maple Syrup [sku 66402] or Organic Maple Agave Syrup Blend [sku 99105]. That's hardly where we'd stop, however: hot from the microwave, these Organic Pancakes are especially delicious with a pat of melty butter, a cool dollop of whipped cream (or Coconut Whipped Topping [sku 58113], for that matter), or even a scoop of ice cream. And we simply adore them with sliced strawberries, sweet fruit preserves, or a nice spread of Speculoos Cookie Butter [sku 96761]. Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes
076185.name: Pancakes Silver Dollar Organic
076185.title: Organic Silver Dollar Pancakes

083177.description: Trader Joe's Steel Cut Oatmeal comes in a box of two individual servings, each with 150 calories and five grams of protein. When frozen, each serving looks a bit like a thick, oatmeal-colored hockey puck. When you're enjoying a fluffy bowl of steel cut oatmeal three minutes or so after the craving hits, you may feel a bit puckish yourself. This Oatmeal is an unpretentious combination of oats, water, maple syrup, brown sugar, and salt. It has some sweetness, but it's not too sweet (seven grams of sugar per serving); probably very similar to what you'd make if you started from scratch. Of course, you don't have to start from scratch, because we took care of that for you. We do things like that. You know, to make your life easier. It's fun. You know what else is fun? Our price of $1.79 for each 16 ounce box of two servings. Because really, where else can you get two complete servings of a hearty, nourishing breakfast for less than two bucks? In pucks? You'll find this frozen Steel Cut Oatmeal in our freezers¿ go figure.
083177.name: Steel Cut Oatmeal

091087.description: Like their carb cousins the brioche and Danish pastry, croissants belong to a family of baked goods collectively referred to as viennoiseries, baked goods made with yeast-leavened, laminated dough that's enriched with eggs, butter, or milk. They first arrived in France by way of Austria in the late 1800's, and are now ubiquitous in French bakery culture, their glossy, flaky crust and tender crumb a mainstay of breakfast and snacktime. While flavor variations run the gamut from sweet to savory, the pain au chocolat, or chocolate croissant, is the preferred variation of many a pastry connoisseur-this is just one of the many reasons why Trader Joe's Chocolate Croissants have become a mainstay of our frozen cases. Made with creamy butter and filled with rich, semisweet Belgian chocolate, Trader Joe's Chocolate Croissants bring high-end bakery quality to your home kitchen with minimal effort. Remove them from the package and let them proof overnight (just as a French bakery would); in the morning you'll find the Croissants have nearly tripled in size! Brush with an egg wash, then bake 20-25 minutes until the Croissants are a deep golden brown. Let them rest for 10 minutes (distract yourself by brewing a pot of TJ's French Vanilla Coffee [sku 51484]), and then prepare to delight in the gooey melted Chocolate and warm, flaky Croissant dough. Yummmmm. Each 12-ounce box contains four ready-to-proof-and-bake Chocolate Croissants, so you can bake a bunch for brunch, or savor them one by one as a weekday breakfast or snack. You'll find them in the freezer cases at your neighborhood Trader Joe's, for $4.49 per box.
091087.name: Croissants 4 Chocolate
091087.title: 4 Chocolate Croissants

094769.description: Trader Joe's Hashbrowns are made from potatoes grown in Idaho. The potatoes are fully cooked. Just heat in a skillet or bake in the oven. We are selling each 22.5 oz. box of 10 Trader Joe's Hashbrowns for $1.99.
094769.name: Hash Browns
094769.title: Hashbrowns

096969.description: Trader Joe's Shredded Hash browns cook up light and crispy and are the perfect accompaniment to a breakfast that starts your day off right! We are selling each 20 oz. bag Trader Joe's Shredded Hash browns for $1.69.
096969.name: Shredded Hash Browns
096969.title: Shredded Potato Hash Browns

097002.description: When we think of pancakes, we think of home. And we sympathize with those who may have a gluten or dairy allergy, who can't enjoy regular pancakes. Now, we've opened our doors, and freezers, to welcome Trader Joe's Gluten & Dairy Free Homestyle Pancakes, so that more of our customers can feel much closer to home. These hot cakes are called Homestyle Pancakes because they taste like your mom made them with her bare hands and special touches. Seriously, when you warm them up, they are soft, fluffy, and a little sweet too. When you're ready to crack this box open, we recommend using a toaster. Remove the wrapper and place frozen Pancake in the toaster. Set cook time to the highest setting (select "frozen" if your toaster has that feature). Then, sit and watch the magic happen - you know they're ready when the middle is warm. The toaster is the fastest and tastiest way, trust us. It will make the outside a little crispy and the inside soft, fluffy, and leaving you wanting more. When the cakes are freshly hot, slide some butter on the top and drizzle maple syrup, jelly, peanut butter, strawberries n' whip... the list is almost endless. Welcome home Gluten & Dairy Free Homestyle Pancakes in a 16-ounce box with 12 pancakes. You'll find it in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Gluten & Dairy Free Homestyle Pancakes
097002.name: Gluten Free Pancakes
097002.title: Gluten & Diary Free Homestyle Pancakes

098265.description: Getting right to the point, and throwing modesty out the window, Trader Joe's 4 Almond Croissants are extraordinary. We thought it would be a bit presumptuous to put "extraordinary" on the label, though we think you'll agree that they're extraordinary on every level. To begin, while they require a soupçon of forethought, they're super-simple. Just remove from the package, place on a baking sheet and thaw overnight. They'll rise as they thaw - for the uninitiated, this is "proofing." When you wake in the morning, simply bake them in your oven for about 20 minutes. The dough is buttery and bakes to a crispy-on-the-outside, flaky-chewy on the inside finish. They're filled with sweet almond paste and topped with almond flakes. In other words, if you're an almond lover, you're in for a real treat! Freshly baked almond croissants of this quality might cost you $5-$6 each in a bakery. Or you could order a mail order version and spend a week's salary (only kind of joking). Or you could buy a box of 4 Almond Croissants at Trader Joe's for about what you'd pay for a single bakery croissant. You'll find them in our freezers. 4 Almond Croissants
098265.name: Croissants 4 Almond
098265.title: 4 Almond Croissants

099385.description: These handmade blintzes were developed using a traditional Jewish recipe. The delicate crepes are filled with a blend of Farmers cheese with a hint of vanilla. These crepes will crisp up nicely in about 5-6 minutes in a skillet with just a little butter. They are great by themselves with a little powdered sugar but even better when topped with fresh berries, fruit preserves or chutney. The crepes are certified KSA Kosher for the upcoming holidays. We are selling a 13.5 oz. package of (6 crepes) Trader Joe's - CHEESE BLINTZES for $3.99
099385.name: Cheese Blintzes

001070.description: We love dessert. No sense in denying it, we're dessert-aholics. As you can imagine, then, we're always looking for desserts that will excite our very finicky tastebuds. Boy have we found it. Trader Joe's Chocolate Lava Cakes are individual chocolate cakes filled with a rich, creamy chocolate ganache. Sounds good, doesn't it? Now imagine that decadent chocolate cake warm, with ganache flowing from the center with each bite. We promise, it really is as good as it sounds. Even better, Trader Joe's Chocolate Lava Cakes are a snap to prepare: just microwave for less than a minute and you're good to go! (Cooking instructions for a conventional oven are on the package.) For an extra special treat, serve with whipped cream and fresh berries. Oh, we almost forgot the best part. Our Chocolate Lava Cakes are only $2.99* for a package of two cakes. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Chocolate Lava Cakes
001070.name: Chocolate Lava Cakes

031185.description: When it's time for dessert, we think cheesecake is particularly appropriate for pretty much any occasion or time of year. It's versatile, delicious, and in the case of Trader Joe's New York Style Cheesecake, it couldn't be simpler - just thaw and serve. New York-style cheesecakes use a cream cheese base, also incorporating sour cream and a graham cracker crust. As a bonus, sour cream makes the cheesecake more resilient to completely freezing, that's why we can just thaw ours in 1-2 hours at room temperature. Its creamy, smooth consistency and rich traditional cheesecake flavor make it a winner no matter how you slice it - we recommend using a cake slicer, but, hey, whatever works for you. Serve it just as it is or pair it with warm strawberries, blueberries, and a dollop of whipped cream for an extra- special dessert treat. Each 30-ounce NY Deli Style Cheesecake is $6.99*. You'll find it in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. New York Deli Style Cheesecake
031185.name: Ny Deli-Style Cheesecake
031185.title: New York Deli Style Cheesecake

051534.description: When we think of bread pudding, we think of comfort food, pure and simple. But historically, bread pudding was primarily a way to avoid wasting stale bread - combine that stale loaf with some milk, sugar, and butter, and suddenly what would have been discarded has become something delightfully delicious. Comfort food, even. Trader Joe's Pumpkin Bread Pudding is a brilliant example of comfort food. With a thick, custard-like consistency and the certain flavor of pumpkin pie and all its warm, savory spices, Pumpkin Bread Pudding is a terrific dessert to have on hand for Pumpkin Season parties and gatherings. Because it's fully cooked, its preparation is simple - defrost and serve, or warm in the oven to enhance the flavors even further. We imagine the early iterations of bread pudding didn't have the benefit of a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a dollop of whipped cream - we highly recommend either (or both!) to provide the finishing touch here. Had early pudding provocateurs pondered pumpkin, they, too, would have utilized this sweet fruit in their frugal concoction. We're sure of it. We're also sure ours is a great value. We're selling each 20 ounce package of Pumpkin Bread Pudding for $3.99. You'll find it in our freezers.
051534.name: Pumpkin Bread Pudding

051604.description: Long, long before they became "the rage," our Buyers had been scouting the macaron situation in the city that made them famous in the first place: Paris. So, when the tide began to swell, we were well into a macaron renaissance here at Trader Joe's. To create authentic macarons, we turned to our partners in France, where macarons have been celebrated since that "other" Renaissance. This pâtisserie has famously mastered the macaronage technique. In fact, they've transformed it into a roboticized science. It's uncanny, really, how they've managed to fashion a treat that so marvelously mimics the hand-made experience. The airy and slightly crisp, slightly chewy, almond-and-egg-white-based meringue cookies have a mesmerizing bite. And their vibrant fillings, ranging from jam to buttercream, are sincerely satisfying. Trader Joe's A Dozen Macarons Variés features six vivacious flavors: Apricot, Coconut, Fig, Salted Caramel, Lemon, and Pistachio. With two Macarons of each flavor in a box, the assortment presents beautifully, resembling the appearance of a Macaron display in a Paris pâtisserie or a local, upscale bake shop. Unlike the macarons you'd find in either of those two places, however, A Dozen Macarons Variés are crafted using colors derived exclusively from natural sources, without artificial flavoring, and are about three times less expensive-$4.99 for a 4.2-ounce box of 12 Macarons. Mais oui. Yes. Yes, indeed.
051604.name: Macarons Assorted
051604.title: A Dozen Macarons Variés

052942.description: Famously high maintenance, Macarons (mak-ah-ROHNS)-featuring two, soft merinque-esque cookies (simultaneously chewy on the inside and crispy on the outside) that sandwich a like-flavored filling-enchanted the dessert scene in the early second millennium. As only Trader Joe's can, we fed the fashion by making these stylish sweets unbelievably approachable, both in preparation (they're pre-made so you just defrost and voilà) and price (each box of 12 French Macarons is $4.99). Of course, we also made them remarkably delicious. We work with a French Bakery that is very well versed in these almond-based biscuits. 6 Chocolate, with rich chocolate filling, and 6 Vanilla, with creamy, vanilla bean-flecked filling are featured in our French Macarons. As perfect for big celebrations as they are a sweet bite on any night (or afternoon), these cookies are best when allowed to rest at room temperature for about 30 minutes. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. 6 Chocolate and 6 Vanilla French Macarons
052942.name: Chocolate & Vanilla Macarons
052942.title: Macarons Chocolate & Vanilla

059064.description: Some folks seem to get a kick out of reminding the rest of us that "life can't always be peaches & cream" when things don't go our way. While we can appreciate a healthy dose of realism here and there, we'd like to challenge these Negative Nancies: why can't life always be peaches & cream, hmm? As long as you have a stack of Trader Joe's Peaches & Cream Tartes in your freezer, we say it can be. To craft our Peaches & Cream Tarte, we take a buttery, flaky crust, spread a layer of sweet cream cheese on top, fill it with sugared peaches, and carefully fold in its edges. This Tarte-building is all done by hand, so it's free-form and unrefined-just how we like it. We bake each Tarte to sunny perfection-glistening orange in the center; golden brown at the edges-so that by the time it makes its way to you, all you have to do is heat it up. Unlike some frozen, fully-baked desserts, you can warm our Peaches & Cream Tarte in the oven or the microwave-just follow the instructions on the package. We recommend keeping a Peaches & Cream Tarte or two in your freezer at all times so that you're never caught unprepared for unexpected dinner guests, impromptu tea parties, and/or last-minute potlucks. Serve each warm slice with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream [sku 78576], and your dining companions will surely be wowed. A Tarte like this would easily sell for $11.99 and up in a fine pâtisserie. Lucky for you, we have such a great relationship with our Canadian supplier that we are able to offer each 16.9-ounce Peaches & Cream Tarte (that's over a pound of sweet, peachy goodness!) for $4.99. You'll find it in our freezer cases. 06.05. 17
059064.name: Peaches & Cream Tarte

060577.description: We are positively bananas for our Trader Joe's Gone Bananas [sku 95341], and you can bet that our customers are, too. In fact, those chocolate-covered banana slices are one of our best-selling frozen treats of all time, which got us thinking: what other frozen fruit frontiers can we explore? What other tropical treats could be lying in wait, yearning to be covered in candy? The answer, it turns out, took us down to the strawberry fields of North- ern Thailand, where we found our next gastronomic goody to go ga-ga for: Trader Joe's Gone Berry Crazy Chocolate Covered Strawberry Slices. Though the concept is simple, the results are decadent: juicy, delicious Thai strawberries are sliced in half and enrobed in luxuriously dark chocolate, then flash frozen. No preparation required - in fact, we discourage you from even letting them defrost too much, lest you miss out on their snappy, snackable texture. Simply open the box and enjoy as many slices as you care to - which, of course, may or may not end up being the whole box. While we're sure you'll flip your lid for these strawberries on their own, they also make great company for other desserts. We recommend dropping a few onto a sundae, or using them as delectable decorations on top of an ice cream cake. And we can't overlook their appeal as a quick dessert solution for an impromptu romantic date, especially when paired with a glass of Cecilia Beretta Spumante Rose [sku 59097]. Just like their banana brethren, you'll find Trader Joe's Gone Berry Crazy Chocolate Covered Strawberry Slices in our freezers. We're selling each 5.3 oz. box for $2.29. Now that's something to go crazy for. 05.21. 18
060577.name: Gone Berry Crazy Dark Chocolate Strawberry Pieces
060577.title: Gone Berry Crazy!

069630.description: It's always hard to say good bye to an iconic item, and our original Lemon Bars [sku 93415] certainly fit that bill. But when our original supplier informed us they could no longer produce those Bars, we took it as an opportunity for a real kaizen. We reached out to another of our trusted suppliers and asked if they could make us a version that had all the same zesty, sweet, and tart flavors, the same soft, buttery-textured shortbread and silky, smooth lemon layer - but none of the gelatin that left the last version inaccessible to vegetarians. They came back with a tray of lemon bars so superbly true to form that we knew they were going to be an instant classic. Fittingly enough, we decided to call them Trader Joe's 12 Classic Lemon Bars. Our favorite thing about these Bars is their bite. The delicate texture of the soft, creamy lemon layer instantly gives way to the dense, deliciously crumbly shortbread base, giving you all the satisfaction of a sweet custard and a rich, buttery biscuit all at the same time. Of course, we also love that they're super easy to prepare; simply defrost them at room temperature for about an hour before serving. And we can't forget that they're a remarkable value, too: each 10.6-ounce box sells for $4.49*, every day. There's so many things to love about our new, vegetarian, kosher (dairy) Classic Lemon Bars, we really could go on, but that might be time better spent enjoying a Bar with a nice cup of coffee. Mmm - Classic. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. 12 Classic Lemon Bars
069630.name: Lemon Bars

073998.description: Since its creation in Taiwan in the 1980s, boba has become a genuinely global phenomenon-and if you're lucky enough to live near a boba shop, you'll know exactly why. Simultaneously sweet, refreshing, and texturally satisfying, a typical sip of a boba drink starts with the cool rush of iced, sweetened, and often fabulously flavored milk (or a comparable non-dairy beverage) and ends on a delightfully chewy note, courtesy of the tapioca pearls (A.K.A. boba) that mingle at the bottom of the cup. It's a taste-texture combo that serves as an ideal anytime treat, especially when combined with a savory snack. And now, thanks to Trader Joe's Instant Boba Kit, it can be enjoyed from the comforts of your very own home. For right about the same price you'd pay for a single boba drink at a café, each Boba Kit contains four pouches of tapioca pearls flavored with rich brown sugar, which take only a minute in the microwave to heat up. From there, it's just a matter of mixing into a glass of your preferred milk or non-dairy alternative, adding ice, and enjoying. Why, we've even included a wide-gauge paper straw to go along with each pouch to make sure you can capture a few boba with every sip. For an unbeatable savory-sweet combo, we recommend pairing a tall, icy glass with a basket of crispy Gluten Free Breaded Chicken Breast Nuggets [sku 52805]. Instant Boba Kit
073998.name: Boba Kit Instant
073998.title: Instant Boba Kit

076715.description: If you've followed our Pie Crusts over the years (and we mean this in the most old-school way-they don't have a Facebook page or Twitter account) you may have noticed that they've gone from fridge to freezer over time. Customer feedback told us this made more sense, and your feedback also made us realize we had them packaged pretty poorly. We think we've finally gotten them right. It's the same great recipe it's always been, using real butter that you can taste. Only now, rather than being folded and ultimately prone to cracking and breakage, we've rolled the dough, so the crusts are easy to roll out into your pie plate. It works like a charm. And it couldn't be easier. Just take a crust out of the box, let it thaw, roll it out into a pie plate, fill and bake. It's larger than the average supermarket pie crust-you can either make a bigger pie or trim and use the excess for decorating-a quickly cut "leaf " or "apple" looks pretty darn impressive atop your pie. The crust is flaky, crispy, and light, and it bakes to perfection every time. (Our little secret: for perfectly browned crust, brush with milk or a whisked egg just before baking.) Each 22-ounce box of Trader Joe's Pie Crusts (2 Crusts) is $3.99*, every day. You'll find it in our freezer case. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Pie Crusts
076715.name: Pie Crusts

077295.description: Just between us, dear reader: you work hard. You do! You clearly care about the kind of food you eat and feed to your loved ones. If you don't mind us saying so, you deserve something sweet and delicious. Honestly, you deserve to treat yourself to a Trader Joe's Lemon Ginger Cheesecake. With everything you do, you should absolutely take the time to savor every bite of this Cheesecake's tantalizingly tart cream cheese base, flavored with lemon curd and actual bits of lemon peel, as well as its dense, crumbly, gingersnap crust. Lemon Ginger Cheesecake is an excellent dessert option for bringing along to cookouts, serving to friends at the end of weekend brunches, or simply enjoying as an anytime reward for being the kind of dedicated, determined person you are. "Now, now," you might be saying, "surely, such a rich and decadent Cheesecake comes with an equally extravagant price tag." While that's an utterly understandable sentiment, each seven- inch-diameter, 30-ounce Trader Joe's Lemon Ginger Cheesecake sells for about the same price you'd pay - or less! - for a single slice of cheesecake at a bakery or restaurant, making it an eminently affordable indulgence. Stop by your Trader Joe's freezer section to pick one up while supplies last. You deserve it! Lemon Ginger Cheesecake
077295.name: Cheesecake Lemon Ginger
077295.title: Lemon Ginger Cheesecake

078547.description: Two summers back, we brought the proverbial boba shop home with the introduction of our everyday Instant Boba Kit [sku 73998], and it's remained a hot ticket in our freezers ever since. So much so, in fact, that when approached by a Taiwanese supplier with an opportunity to offer a limited-time, more Tropical-tasting Boba Kit, we lept at the chance! You'll be leaping, too, as soon as you get your hands on a Trader Joe's Tropical Green Tea Instant Boba Kit. For about the same price you'd pay for a single boba drink at a café, our Tropical Green Tea Boba Kit contains four pouches of vegan, gluten-free, tapioca pearls in a sweet, passion fruit & mango-flavored green tea syrup, plus four wide-gauge paper straws to help you capture some of said pearls in every sip. The Boba pearls only take a minute in the microwave to heat up; from there, it's just a matter of placing them into the bottom of a glass, adding ice, and pouring in your beverage of choice, like milk, green tea, coconut beverage, or even just cold water-anything goes! Then sit back, take a sip, and enjoy the sweet, refreshing, texturally satisfying ride. Tropical Green Tea Instant Boba Kit
078547.name: Boba Kit Tropical Green Tea
078547.title: Tropical Green Tea Instant Boba Kit

090874.description: The ancient Greeks believed that if a man tossed an apple to a woman, he was proposing marriage. If she caught it, she accepted. In these modern times, we've updated primitive traditions. Today, you can toss a box of Trader Joe's Apple Blossoms®. Apple Blossoms® are individual pastries filled with sweet, cooked apples and topped with a tasty bit of cinnamon crumble. They're like little apple pies, with the crust folded over to look like a blossom. They're made in the Niagara Fruit Belt of Canada with a variety of apples called Northern Spy, which have the firm texture of a Granny Smith, and the sweetness of a Macintosh. If you've been thinking about popping the question to that special someone, you might try tossing a box of Blossoms - they'll cost you a lot less than a ring, and they taste better, too! It's a great way to determine whether or not your "special someone" has taste as great as yours. We're selling each eight-ounce box of two, fully-baked Apple Blossoms® for $2.29*. You'll find them in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Apple Blossoms®
090874.name: Apple Blossoms

095341.description: This product was developed in Thailand specifically for Trader Joe's. The ripe bananas are hand sliced, then dipped in a rich dark chocolate coating. These are bite- size pieces so you can eat as many as you like and save the rest for later. These bites are a great snack item or can be served as a garnish on a scoop of our rich vanilla ice cream. We are selling an 8 oz. box of Trader Joe's GONE BANANAS!....one bite at a time! $1.99 Trader Joe's Company Bulletin02/16/2011 page 33 of 38 Confidential
095341.name: Gone Bananas Dark Chocolate Banana Slices
095341.title: Gone Bananas!

001206.description: Despite their name, not all shrimp are shrimpy. Since they vary in size and they're generally sold per pound, shrimp are labeled with a number range that indicates approximately how many shrimp per 16-ounce package. This pound bag of what we're calling "Medium Shrimp" contains 70 to 110 farm-raised, peeled, deveined, tail- off shrimp. We think this is an ideal size for shrimp cocktail, dipped in our Seafood Cocktail Sauce [sku 18757]. What makes these Shrimp even more ideal is the fact that they are already cooked. You can quickly thaw them under running water in just 5 to 7 minutes. They're ready in no time to top your green salad or grace your party platter. The 16-ounce bag of Trader Joe's Cooked Medium Shrimp is conveniently available every day in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Cooked Medium Shrimp
001206.name: Medium Cooked Shrimp
001206.title: Cooked Shrimp Medium Peeled.Deveined.Tail-Off. Shrimp Count 70-110

001290.description: There is only one species of swordfish, Xiphias gladius, found roaming the temperate and tropical seas across the world. We get ours harvested from the waters around Southeast Asia from Singaporean fisherpersons. A versatile fillet, yet flavorful on its own, Trader Joe's Swordfish Steaks are something we've proudly had swimming the vast seas of our frozen section for nearly two decades. Our Swordfish Steaks are moist and flavorful with a slightly sweet toothsome taste. Swordfish does have a moderately high oil content, but not quite like salmon or mackerel.
