The ivory-pinkish-sometimes-orange hue is accompanied by a whorling pattern throughout the fillet covered by a smooth skin. All of this comes together to deliver a firm, meaty texture that is a pleasure to enjoy. Swordfish typically grow between 50 and 200 pounds, and while you can buy as much as you'd like, we're selling our Swordfish Steaks daily in our freezers for $8.99* a pound. So grab a few fillets and grill, bake, sear, or roast your way to Pacific Pisces paradise. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Swordfish Steaks
001290.name: Swordfish Steaks

001327.description: Be it in pastas, pizzas, tacos, salads, or soups, Shrimp make for a great protein addition. The only trouble is, they're not always the most convenient crustacean to prepare: there's the peeling, the deveining, and, of course, the actual cooking. Sometimes, you just want to have Shrimp at the ready without all the fuss. That's where Trader Joe's Large (50 -70 ct.) Cooked Shrimp come in. Our supplier has done all the work for you, all that's needed on your end is to thaw them out. Perfectly proportioned for topping your favorite foodstuff or incorporating into meal prep, these Shrimp sit right in between our Medium (70-110 ct.) [sku 01206] and our Jumbo (31-40 ct.) [sku 01370]. Not too small, and not too hefty, each Large Shrimp is approximately one-single-bite-sized. Since they're already cooked, your options are wide open. For the minimalists out there, you can serve them cold, mere moments after thawing them, as part of the easiest shrimp cocktail you've ever made. For those with a little more time (but who don't care for the extra peeling/deveining steps), heat them up with a little butter, garlic, and white wine, and you've just skipped to the chase for a delicious scampi. "Large Shrimp" may sound like an oxy moron, but for us, it's just another convenient, everyday value. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Large (50-70 ct.) Cooked Shrimp
001327.name: Large Cooked Shrimp 50-70 Ct
001327.title: Cooked Shrimp Large

001428.description: Coho salmon (Oncorhynchus kisutch), also known as "Silver Salmon" or "White Salmon" are known for their incredible versatility because of their delicate, mild-salmon flavor and moderately fatty, reddish-orange meat that flakes nicely. Our Silver Coho Salmon fillets are harvested in the clean, crisp waters of the Bristol Bay of Alaska during the peak summer months. Promptly filleted, flash-frozen and vacuum-packaged, the freshness of the full-flavored fillets is preserved. Each salmon fillet can be thawed and cooked by grilling, broiling, baking or smoking. With mild flavor and medium flake, Coho Salmon welcomes marinades (sesame and ginger, chile and lime) and sauces (creamy lemon-dill, garlic and Dijon). *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Silver Coho Salmon Deboned Skinless
001428.name: Coho Salmon Fillets
001428.title: Salmon Coho Fillets

009500.description: Trader Joe's Seafood Blend is a catch. This straightforward mixture of raw shrimp, calamari rings and bay scallops makes it easy to get cooking without having to fish out a bunch of different ingredients. Simply toss the bag in a skillet with oil (and garlic) and saute for up to three minutes (or until shrimp and scallops are opaque and calamari rings are firm). The next steps depend on your desires-seafood salad, seafood scampi, seafood rice skillet, cioppino (fisherman's stew), or... the sea's the limit. You can even make ceviche with it, if you want to be fresh! Trader Joe's Seafood Blend will hook you. Find it in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Seafood Blend
009500.name: Seafood Blend

035881.description: If you cod conjure up a perfect, lightly breaded fillet of fish, what would you picture? If you're a fan of the TJ's frozen food aisle, we'll bet you're picturing our Oven Ready Breaded Cod Fillets... Right? We don't blame you. Sure, there are other fish in the sea, but this TJ's classic is a winner every time. Trader Joe's Oven Ready Breaded Cod Fillets contain only wild-caught cod, from pristine Alaskan waters. Within hours of being caught, the cod is processed aboard the ship (a factory trawler) and frozen-at-sea, then sent to shore, where they're breaded, seasoned, par-cooked, and packaged. By the time these Fillets make their way to you, all you need to do is finish cooking them in your oven for about 18 - 22 minutes at 400°F. Serve them with a squeeze of lemon, a side of "chips" (a.k.a. fries), and some TJ's Tartar Sauce [sku 38108]. Make them the star of a "fried" fish taco. We're selling each 16-ounce box of TJ's Breaded Cod Fillets for $7.49.* Find it in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Oven Ready Breaded Cod Fillets
035881.name: Breaded Cod Fillets

036879.description: Tilapia's origins can be traced to the Nile River and the ancient Egyptians. Also enjoyed by the ancient Greeks, it is thought that Aristotle gave the fish its name, Tilapia Niloticus, or fish of the Nile. These days, Tilapia is becoming more and more popular throughout the United States, where this mild white fish now ranks as the fourth most eaten seafood (behind shrimp, salmon, and canned tuna). We have farm raised Tilapia Fillets that were frozen immediately after harvest to ensure freshness. The fillets are white, firm and moist - there is nothing added to the fish. Because of their mild, delicate taste, Tilapia Fillets can be used in recipes calling for snapper, sole, flounder, sea bass, or orange roughy. Wonderful poached, broiled, grilled, baked, steamed, or fried, and thin enough that they cook quickly no matter how you prepare them, Tilapia Fillets are delicious, versatile, and available at your neighborhood Trader Joe's at a great price. You'll find them in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Tilapia Fillets
036879.name: Tilapia Fillets

050162.description: -Farm raised in Thailand -BAP Certified Farms-Best Aquaculture Practices which includes highest quality of integrity of the feed, ecosystem impacts, local economy and sustainability. Audited by third party surveyors! -Naturally low in fat. -No Chemicals. -Deveined, Raw with the tail on!
050162.name: Raw Shrimp 21-30 Ct
050162.title: Raw Shrimp Peeled & Deveined, Tail On 21 To 30 Shrimp Per Pound

050509.description: Wild-caught in the frigid coastal waters of Hokkaido, Japan, Trader Joe's Sea Scallops are among the absolute best of the offerings you'll find within our frozen seafood selection. Once harvested, our supplier processes and freezes them within hours to ensure only the highest quality for each Scallop. They contain no additives of any kind, and have a naturally umami-rich, yet delicately sweet, flavor profile to complement their firm, toothsome, and slightly meaty texture. So, how best to prep these Sea Scallops? We recommend keeping it nice and simple: after letting them thaw, preferably in the refrigerator overnight, pat them dry and season them with just a bit of salt and pepper. After that, it's just a matter of giving them a quick pan-sear with butter and lemon juice, a few minutes under the broiler with garlic and olive oil, or just enough time on the grill, threaded through skewers, until opaque on both sides. Of course, if you're in the mood for something more complex, they also make a great protein for topping a creamy pasta dish, accompanying a citrus-y salad, or incorporating into a seafood stew. Sea Scallops
050509.name: Sea Scallops

057733.description: Since Trader Joe's Customers love our shrimp offerings-and our other seafood "burgers" are popular-we thought it was about time to create Trader Joe's Shrimp Seafood Burgers. Generally speaking, "burgers" made from shrimp are unique. We've only seen them in restaurants. Ours are made of 70% farm-raised, Pacific White Shrimp and 23% wild-caught Pollock, held together with rice flour and sunflower oil. They are seasoned with garlic powder, dried basil, salt, and black pepper, which makes for juicy and delicious Seafood Burgers-whether you grill, bake, or pan fry them. And each one of these 90 calorie patties (there are 4 per box) delivers 13g of protein. That's not shrimpy! We're selling each 12.8-ounce box of Shrimp Seafood Burgers for $6.99.* Find them in our freezers. *Prices may change. Please check QIL to confirm most up-to-date price before creating signage. Shrimp Seafood Burgers
057733.name: Shrimp Burgers

058803.description: Dream of a vacation on a nice beautiful day, the sky is blue, and the weather is perfectly warm. You're probably wearing a Hawaiian shirt sitting on a beach chair surrounded by coconuts, pineapples, and lovely waters. A one-way ticket to Trader Joe's, for a lot less cash, will bring you a little closer to that vacation experience in the form of Trader Joe's Coconut Shrimp. We use large, peeled shrimp lightly breaded and coated with organic coconut shreds, the signature of a tropical vacation. (unlike most commercially available coconut, the organic coconut here has not been bleached). The recipe includes a touch of sugar for sweetness and a bit of pineapple flavor for tartness. Serve them with Seafood Cocktail Sauce [sku 18757] or Tartar Sauce [sku 38108] for dipping. They can be presented on a platter at a casual gathering or passed among your guests as hors d'oeuvres at a more formal occasion. For crispiest results, bake in a 450 degree conventional oven for about ten minutes. These treats areas close as your neighborhood Trader Joe's we're selling each 12-ounce box of approximately 16 Coconut Shrimp for $5.99*. They're in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current Coconut Shrimp
058803.name: Coconut Shrimp

063404.description: The Portuguese introduced tempura to Japan nearly 400 years ago. Unfortunately, there was a shortage in oil production when it was introduced. Since tempura relies heavily on oil, it was initially offered as just a snack. It wasn't until the Meji period (1868-1912) when oil production increased that tempura became more prominent in Japanese culture and cuisine. Trader Joe's Tempura Shrimp is our contribution to the history of tempura. The elongated Shrimp are peeled, properly cleaned, and generously coated with tempura batter consisting of water, flour, and tapioca starch. The Tempura Shrimp is then fried to help create a crispy, flaky profile. And, it even comes with a delicious Soy Dipping Sauce. Add this Shrimp to a basket of other battered Trader Joe's fish with a round of dipping sauces to create a fun meal your family will love! You'll find each 16-ounce box (containing about 10 Shrimp) every day in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Shrimp Tempura
063404.name: Tempura Shrimp W/Dipping Sauce

069340.description: While fresh salmon is often preferred, it can be a challenge to have that fresh fillet on hand and ready to cook when you and your family are ready to eat it. Thankfully, a properly prepared frozen salmon fillet can be just as enjoyable to eat. We currently stock a couple different varieties from the Pacific in our freezers, and now we're adding one from a different ocean to our selection: Farm Raised Atlantic Salmon Fillets. This Atlantic Salmon is Farm Raised in the icy cold, pristine waters off the coast of Northern Norway. It's deboned and quick-frozen shortly after being harvested to provide the "freshest" frozen fish possible. The skin is left on, which is convenient if you want to grill it. Each, approximately four-ounce, Fillet possesses medium- firm flesh with large flakes and a mild flavor. That means our frozen Atlantic Salmon is excellent just about any way you want to prepare it: grilled, baked, broiled, or fried. See package for helpful prep instructions. Find 16-ounce (one-pound), re-sealable packages of four Trader Joe's Farm Raised Atlantic Salmon Fillets in our freezers, every day. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Farm Raised Atlantic Salmon Fillets
069340.name: Salmon Atlantic Fillets
069340.title: Atlantic Salmon Fillets Skin-On, Boneless, Medium Firm Texture, Mild Flavor Farm Raised

069341.description: Branzino (aka European Sea Bass) is a popular fish in Italy and other Mediterranean countries, in part, because it is so plentiful in the Mediterranean Sea. But its popularity may be due, even more so, to its character as a light, flaky, and sweet, white fish. Trader Joe's Branzino Fillets make European Sea Bass easily accessible. Our Fillets are farm-raised in Turkey-a method that helps prevent over-fishing of this popular progeny of Poseidon. Our one-pound freezer pack contains four fillets that have been deboned-a convenient format you're not likely to find elsewhere. The skin, however, is left on because this fish is traditionally prepared whole. With the application of olive oil and proper cooking, the delicate skin becomes pleasantly crisp; a nice contrast to the flaky fish. Speaking of prep, you can either thaw these Branzino Fillets overnight in the fridge, or more quickly in a sealed bag placed in a bowl of cold water on the counter for 30 minutes. Once thawed, you have numerous cooking options, including: baking, broiling, grilling (wrapped in foil), or pan frying. Detailed directions are on the package. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Branzino Fillets - European Sea Bass
069341.name: Branzino European Seabass Fillets
069341.title: Branzino Fillets European Sea Bass

070359.description: We've been looking to develop some convenient seafood meal solutions to add to our freezers. Knowing how much our customers love Trader Joe's Wild Uncooked Argentinian Red Shrimp [sku 71696], we decided to start there, then spice it up-quite literally! These Red Shrimp are wild caught in the icy cold waters off the coast of Argentina. This variety is red even before it's cooked and known for its lobster-like qualities-such as a sweet- sea taste, and a meaty texture. We add ginger-garlic butter that has a hint of honey, along with some spiciness from chili flakes and cayenne. Then we bump the heat up another notch with a Togarashi Style Seasoning. In Japanese, Togarashi literally refers to the genus Capsicum, including bell peppers, jalapenos, etc. Our particular blend has a chili powder base with orange peel, black & white sesame seeds, poppy seeds, szechuan pepper, and nori seaweed. Zesty! After thawing in the refrigerator, these flavorful Argentinian Red Shrimp cook in minutes on the stovetop or in a conventional oven. Make it a full meal with a side of Vegetable Fried Rice [sku 52148] and dinner is done! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Argentinian Red Shrimp with Ginger Garlic Butter & Togarashi Style Seasoning
070359.name: Shrimp Raw Argentinian Red W Ginger Garlic Butter
070359.title: Argentinian Red Shrimp With Ginger Garlic Butter

070360.description: Have you ever wondered why salmon and citrus seem to go so perfectly hand in hand? We certainly have, and as it turns out, there's a few reasons why. Part of it has to do with amines, the naturally occuring chemicals in fish meat responsible for what we call that "fishy" smell. When those make contact with an acid, like lemon juice, it causes a chemical reaction that converts them to amine salts, which have no smell, thus neutralizing any "fishy" aromas. In a relatively fatty fish like salmon, that citric acid also cuts through the fat and help the other flavors sing. Which is precisely why we've paired beautifully center-cut filets of Atlantic salmon with pre- prepped pats of lemon and herb butter in Trader Joe's Atlantic Salmon with Lemon Herb Butter, to show that all this technical talk isn't just theoretical - it's downright delicious. Uncommonly convenient and quick-cooking, each boneless filet takes just 10-15 minutes in the oven at 400°F to go from thawed to flawlessly flaky and flavorful. As the filet cooks, the Lemon Herb Butter melts over the Salmon, infusing it with flavors of zesty citrus, aromatic herbs, and - lest we forget - rich, creamy butter, which also serves to help crisp up the skin underneath. All in all, it creates an exceptionally tasty protein that can easily become a full-fledged meal with the simple addition of some rice, roasted veggies, or a salad. And top of all that, each seven-ounce filet of Atlantic Salmon with Lemon Herb Butter sells for the stellar retail of $4.99*. Look for them in our freezers, amongst our other frozen seafood. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Atlantic Salmon with Lemon Herb Butter
070360.name: Salmon Atlantic With Lemon Herb Butter
070360.title: Atlantic Salmon With Lemon Herb Butter

071651.description: When creating a gluten free version of a typically gluten-ful dish, the element that's most important-and, usually, the most challenging-to get correct is the texture. So we take it quite seriously when we tell you that every bite of Trader Joe's Gluten Free Breaded Shrimp starts with the same satisfying crunch from the exterior coating, and ends with the same tender, toothsome interior as you'd expect from gluten-based breaded shrimp. What's the secret? Our supplier, a specialist in seafood snacks like this, applies an especially light and crispy coating made mostly from coconut flour and tapioca starch to each shrimp before lightly frying. They arrive in our freezers fully cooked, meaning all you need to do on your end is just give them a few minutes in the frying pan, oven, or air fryer before enjoying. We particularly like them as a protein for Baja-style tacos, surf 'n' turf burritos, or a fun and flavorful rice bowl with steamed veggies and a bit of Sriracha [sku 50828]. They also make a delicious snack in their own right, espeically when dunked in or drizzled with a mixture of mayo and Sweet Chili Sauce [sku 91113]. Gluten Free Breaded Shrimp
071651.name: Shrimp Gluten Free Breaded
071651.title: Gluten Free Breaded Shrimp

071696.description: Wild caught in the icy cold waters off the southern coast of Argentina, in a region known as Patagonia, our Wild Caught Uncooked Argentinian Red Shrimp are, well - quite the catch. They are well known for their red hue (when raw and cooked), their quick cooking (nearly half the time as other shrimp), and their lobster- like qualities (sweet-sea taste, and meaty texture). Already peeled and deveined, these Uncooked Argentinian Red Shrimp are ready to get cooking. They are great to create a classic scampi, stir fry, jambalaya, lettuce wrap, enchilada, citrus & avocado salad... In other words, our Wild Caught Uncooked Argentinian Red Shrimp are a home freezer mainstay. Find them in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Wild Uncooked Argentinian Red Shrimp
071696.name: Red Argentinian Shrimp
071696.title: Wild Raw Argentinian Red Shrimp

073707.description: Every now and then, we introduce something so exciting, so enchanting , so ebulliently electrifying, that we can't help but become its biggest cheerleader. That's certainly the case for Trader Joe's Shrimp Boom Bah, a sweet, spicy, and satisfyingly crispy dish that's just as fun to eat as it is to say. (Go ahead, give it a try!) Each package contains a collection of shelled, tail-off shrimp that's been coated in a savory-seasoned batter. Once cooked (either in your oven, air fryer, or deep fryer) and combined with the included sweet and spicy sauce, every bite bursts with a complementary combo of flavors and textures thrilling enough to make you shout, "Rah! Rah! Rah!" With its fun, flashy flavors and remarkable ease of preparation (the Shrimp only take about twelve minutes to cook in the oven or air fryer), Trader Joe's Shrimp Boom Bah is a total game-changer. Equally delicious as an appetizer as it is an entrée, it can be enjoyed totally on its own, either tossed in the sauce or served alongside it for dipping, as the protein in a quick rice bowl, or as the filling for super delicious lettuce wraps. And if all that weren't enough, it's a tremendous value, too. Because if there's one thing that will really make us cheer, it's getting more Boom for your buck. Shrimp Boom Bah
073707.name: Shrimp Boom Bah

074969.description: Panko is also known as Japanese breadcrumbs. These crumbs are coarser than the breadcrumbs you might be used to cooking with, and they create a lighter, crunchier texture when used as a breading for fried foods. Tilapia is a mild whitefish with sweet flavor and fine, flaky texture. Put these two very simple ingredients together and the result is simply delicious! Trader Joe's Panko Breaded Tilapia Fillets are flaky, mild, a little sweet and very crunchy. They're a great dinner entrée with a sweet fruit salsa. They also make fabulous fish & chips. You can bake them in a conventional or toaster oven, but we don't recommend microwave cooking. Each 16-ounce box contains about four fillets. They're in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Panko Breaded Tilapia Fillets
074969.name: Trader Joe'S Panko Breaded Tilapia Fillets

093417.description: A little batter, a lot of fish! Crispy, Trader Joe's Battered Fish Nuggets are lightly coated, briefly cooked in canola oil, and flash frozen, ready to oven bake for just about 15 to 18 minutes. The Nuggets are Alaska Pollock fish, a marine fish species of the cod family Gadidae. It's high in protein, about 12g per serving, and the white flesh is super juicy, moist, and flaky in texture. Fish Nuggets are perfect for fish tacos, just add a couple in Organic Flour and Corn Tortillas [sku 92402], topped with Green Shredded Cabbage [sku 92238], and Cilantro Salad Dressing [sku 36420] with a squeeze of lime. This would also be a great addition to a variety basket of battered Trader Joe's fish and chips, like Battered Halibut [sku 01237], Coconut Shrimp [sku 58803], and Handsome Cut Potato Fries [sku 96143] with Seafood Cocktail Sauce [sku 18757] and Tartar Sauce [sku 38108]. Trader Joe's Battered Fish Nuggets are an easy, convenient meal that even the kids will love for an after-school snack, lunch or even dinner with a side of ketchup and you're done. You'll find each 16-ounce box (containing about 16 pieces), every day in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Battered Fish Nuggets
093417.name: Battered Fish Nuggets

094461.description: Mahi Mahi are known for their mild, slightly sweet, delicate flavor which perfectly complements its firm, meaty texture. Trader Joe's Mahi Mahi burgers are slightly seasoned. They are high in protein and low in fat. Just grill, pan fry or bake. We are selling a 12.8 oz box (4-3.2 oz. patties) of Trader Joe's Mahi Mahi Burgers for $4.99. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin05/26/2010 page 36 of 41 Confidential
094461.name: Mahi Mahi Burgers
094461.title: Mahi-Mahi Burger

096766.description: Sometimes a burger is just a burger, and sometimes it's so much more. Trader Joe's Premium Salmon Burgers most definitely fall into the "so much more" category. What makes them so special? They're made with wild pink salmon fished from the icy cold waters of Alaska. The fish are fully skinned and deboned, then gently seasoned with such goodies as mirepoix-the classic combination of carrots, celery and onions-and sea salt. They are formed into patties and quick frozen-this locks in moisture and super salmon flavor, resulting in a truly sensational, mild-tasting (read: never fishy), flaky burger. You don't even need to thaw them; you can grill them from frozen with excellent results. No grill? No problem. Cook them in the oven or on the stovetop with equal ease. Serve them on buns with all the traditional burger accouterments, crumbled over a garden salad, or as center-of-the-plate for a protein-packed repast. We're selling each 12.8-ounce box of four, individually wrapped Premium Salmon Burgers for $6.49, a great value, every day.
096766.name: Premium Salmon Burgers

098541.description: You may have seen Langostinos referred to as "Langostino lobsters" on menus or in advertisements, and, if you've ever seen one, you may have noticed that they resemble a cross between a lobster and a shrimp in appearance. Biologically, they're actually more closely related to crabs than either of those two, but culinarily, they taste something like a cross between all three. Our wild caught Langostino Tails, for instance, have a light, slightly buttery taste, reminiscent of both lobster tail and crab claw meat, and a soft texture that's similar to sautéed shrimp. But enough about their similarities to other shellfish, here's what makes them stand out on their own: these delightfully savory seafood morsels are practically made for throwing into rich pastas and bisques, as their natural butteriness is particularly fit for playing off of smooth and creamy textures. With a per-pound count of 80-100, they're also perfectly bite-sized for appetizers, especially with a bit of Seafood Cocktail Sauce [sku 18757] or melted Roasted Garlic & Herb Butter Spread [sku 63145]. And if that weren't enough, at $12.99* for a one-pound bag, Trader Joe's Langostino Tails are just about one of the best deals on Langostino that you'll find in a grocery store - most fish markets tend to price them in $16-$20 per pound region. Keep an eye out for them in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Langostino Tails
098541.name: Langostino Tails

010912.description: Some foods are as loaded with history as they are with flavor. Strawberries are among this group. Did you know that references to strawberries go back more than 2,000 years? Or that American colonists first observed & wrote about wild-growing strawberry plants as early as the 16th century? Oh, and then there's the impossible-to-dispute fact that Strawberries are among the most flavorful berries in the universe. Yup, the universe. They're positively bursting with flavor. And Vitamin C. Trader Joe's Strawberries are particularly flavorful, especially for frozen strawberries. Maybe it's the climate they grown in. Perhaps it's all the love they've received from TJ's Customer ever since they first debuted in our freezers, way back in 1995.. Or maybe it's the fact that they're picked at peak ripeness, then immediately flash- frozen to lock in their flavor. Most likely, though, it's a combination of all of these fortuitous factors that make our frozen Strawberries so tantalizingly delicious. Try them as a topping for oatmeal, yogurt, or ice cream. Serve them up with cream & sugar. Use them in a smoothie or a strawberry daquiri. Or of course, if strawberry shortcake is on your menu¿ We're selling each 12-ounce bag of frozen Strawberries for $1.99*, every day. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Strawberries
010912.name: Fzn Strawberries
010912.title: Trader Joe'S Strawberries

012373.description: Trader Joe's Fancy Berry Medley are frozen, but they are indeed fresh. Our supplier uses a special method called Individual Quick-Freezing (IQF), a method of freezing that individually freezes the produce. So, instead of getting a huge clump of berries in a bag, we get separate berries. To do this, they are quickly frozen within hours of harvest, guaranteeing the freshest, high-quality of blueberries, blackberries, and raspberries possible. We like using TJ's Fancy Berry Medley because it's convenient. Keep them frozen until ready to use. They offer a little less stress about having to eat them right away, picking the right batch or waiting until the right season. Hey, you also don't have to buy Blueberries, Blackberries, and Raspberries separately - that can easily add up to ten bucks! We're selling each 16-ounce bag of Trader Joe's Fancy Berry Medley for just $2.99 every day, in our frozen aisle. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Fancy Berry Medley
012373.name: Fancy Berry Medley

012530.description: Some interesting information about blueberries¿ over the years, demand for blueberries was always pretty steady. In the early 2000's, however, several studies began to show the healthful benefits of the natural anti- oxidants found in blueberries, and demand skyrocketed. As demand began to outstrip supply, prices went up. And up. And up. Because we buy so many frozen Blueberries and we secure our orders pretty far in advance, we've been able to lock in costs that keep our prices more down to earth than what you'll find in most markets. Oh, and they're vibrant-tasting berries to boot! These are the best berries to use in blueberry muffins - we think using frozen Blueberries actually makes the muffins more moist and delicious than they are with fresh berries. Of course, you can just enjoy them in a bowl, or in pancakes, too. They're delicious over ice cream or mixed into yogurt. And our buying power and tough negotiating means that we're offering them at a delicious price-$1.99 for a 12-ounce bag. You'll find them in our freezers.
012530.name: Fzn Blueberries

016141.description: Trader Joe's Organic Wild Blueberries are smaller, juicier and sweeter than their cultivated cousins. Normally, that would be enough to seal their appeal, but the news only gets better. These berries are individually quick frozen, which makes them very easy to use - just shake out what you need and save the rest for another time. As organic berries, they're grown and processed according to strict guidelines using no chemical pesticides. Finally, blueberries are well known for their abundant antioxidants. Yay, antioxidants! On their own, in pancakes or smoothies, baked in muffins or breads and over ice cream. Really, we can't think of anywhere Organic Wild Blueberries wouldn't taste great. These potent little pretties are from the current crop - they're harvested in Canada and frozen quickly after harvest, so they're about as fresh as it gets¿ for frozen. We've negotiated a terrific price on these baby blues, and from what we've seen, our price of $2.99 for a 12-ounce bag is the lowest everyday price you're going to find anywhere for berries of this quality.
016141.name: Fzn Organic Wild Blueberries
016141.title: Trader Joe'S Organic Wild Blueberries Organic Wild Blueberries

026368.description: Even before they were first domesticated in the 4th century C.E., raspberries were long considered a divine culinary gift. Their species name, Rubus idaeus, even comes from an ancient Greek origination myth, where the nymph Ida accidentally pricked her finger on the raspberry's brambles, coloring the fruit a vibrant blood red before presenting it to an infant Zeus. While we can't attest to any mythical origin, Trader Joe's Organic Raspberries are grown and harvested in Chile, and are so ripe, juicy, and delightfully full-flavored, that you might swear they were touched by a nature spirit, too. Organically grown and flash-frozen at the peak of ripeness, these Raspberries are a great way to keep berries on hand when raspberries aren't in season, or when you don't want to worry about them going bad in your fridge. They're easily thawed out for quick snacking, baking, or topping on sweet treats, and they're even useful when frozen: toss a couple still-frozen berries into your blender when making smoothies, for example. Delicious, convenient, and a remarkable value at $3.69* for a 12-ounce bag, you can find Trader Joe's Organic Raspberries in our freezer case, every day of the year - whether raspberries are in season or not. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Raspberries
026368.name: Fzn Organic Raspberries

030592.description: Trader Joe's Raspberries are grown and flash-frozen at the peak of ripeness, these Raspberries are a great way to keep berries on hand when raspberries aren't in season, or when you don't want to worry about them going bad in your fridge. Easily thaw them out to release their ripe, juicy, and delightfully full-flavored presence for quick snacking, baking, or topping on sweet treats with just a kiss of cream. Top a cheesecake or Chocolate Lava Cakes [sku 01070], sprinkle a few in a fruit salad, or crush them for an ice cream topping. These sweet- tart berries are even useful when frozen: toss a couple still-frozen berries into your blender when making smoothies, for example. Delicious, convenient, and a remarkable value at $2.49* for a 12-ounce bag, you can find Trader Joe's Raspberries in our freezer case, every day of the year - whether raspberries are in season or not. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Raspberries
030592.name: Fzn Raspberries
030592.title: Iqf Red Raspberries

050473.description: Mangoes are the world's number one consumed fruit. As many as 41 species of 1,100 varieties are known to exist throughout the world. We use the Kent variety which is grown in Peru and Ecuador. We have a limited amount of product available. We are selling each 16 oz. bag of Trader Joe's Organic Mango for $2.29.
050473.name: Trader Joe'S Organic Mango Chunks

054044.description: It may be that the only negative thing about fresh, ripe, summertime fruits is that you can't get them in the off-season. Sweet cherries are among the best of the summer fruit crop, but once their short season is over, it's a long wait until the fresh crop is available again. Wouldn't it be great if you could satisfy your cherry cravings, even in the middle of winter? Trader Joe's Dark Sweet Cherries, thanks to the phenomenon that is the freezer, are here to help you do just that. These are deep-mahogany-red cherries grown in Michigan and Washington state-two locations where the climate and rich soil produce superior fruit. They are carefully handpicked at their peak sweetness, washed, pitted, and individually quick-frozen within hours of harvest to preserve their "just picked" flavor. (Full disclosure: It's always possible that you'll find a cherry with a pit, despite our supplier's best efforts.) Enjoy Dark Sweet Cherries in yogurt, muffins and quick breads, or thawed, right out of the bowl as a healthful snack. Craving a cherry smoothie? Doesn't a Dark Sweet Cherry smoothie sound great? We're selling each sixteen-ounce (one-pound) bag for $3.69, every day. That sounds pretty great, too. You'll find them in our freezers. 1.29.1 5
054044.name: Cherries Dark Sweet Pitted
054044.title: Trader Joe'S Pitted Dark Sweet Cherries

055437.description: Given a choice, fresh is always better than frozen. (Except for popsicles. Fresh popsicles always end up a little too juicy.) Frozen treats aside, who wouldn't rather enjoy a ripe piece of fresh-picked fruit than one that's had all its moisture turned to ice? Unfortunately, a little thing called "seasons" gets in the way. What if we told you, you could have your frozen peaches and enjoy them too? It's true! This small miracle comes in the form of Trader Joe's Freestone Peach Slices. The same farmers who provide our famous four-pound boxes of Peaches [sku 93401] in the peak-season, now provide that same high quality fruit year-round. Our sup- plier not only grows the peaches, but also picks, sorts, peels, and freezes them-all on the same day as harvest. This is how they deliver frozen Peaches like none you've ever tasted. They certainly are like none our Tasting Panel ever tasted. The Panel was surprised by the tiny amount of excess moisture present in the thawed fruit. They were also wowed by the vibrant color, firm texture, and sweet, peachy flavor. While most frozen fruit is only good for baking (where appearance and flavor can be disguised), these Peach Slices are enjoyable when simply thawed and eaten, piece-by-piece. And just think: Now there's nothing to stop you from mixing up a batch of Peach Sangria in the dead of winter. You'll just need a bottle of La Granja Cava [sku 51348], and some frozen Freestone Peach Slices¿ no ice cubes required! This incredible, everyday-of-the-year value is now available only from Trader Joe's in sixteen-ounce (one- pound) bags for just $3.49. 8.27.1 5
055437.name: California Freestone Peach Slices

056417.description: The Açaí trend shows no signs of slowing down - and why should it? Its complex, rich-tart berry flavor, with subtle hints of cacao, is refreshingly irresistible. As people look to eat healthier on the go, cafes and juiceries have devoted entire sections of their menus to energizing smoothies and filling breakfast bowls made with this brilliant berry of the Amazon. These menu offerings, however, are often packed with sugar, and always expensive. So we set out to find an appetizing yet affordable option for açaí, and came up with our Unsweetened Organic Açaí Purée Packets. Each package contains four convenient, single-serve packets of Unsweetened Organic Açaí Purée. You can add one to a smoothie or blend with Greek yogurt. Boost your post-workout hydration and mix a packet with coconut water. Blend a packet with banana and coconut milk to create a creamy base for an açaí bowl and add whatever toppings your heart desires - berries and granola, peaches and toasted flax, pumpkin seeds and coconut chips - you're only limited by your imagination (and seasonal topping availability, of course). Other açaí purée packets out in the market (some of which are sweetened!) sell for a whopping $5.99 and up. We're selling four-3.52 oz. packets of Unsweetened Organic Açaí Purée for $4.49, everyday. For a hearty açaí bowl: Run one frozen açaí packet under running water for five seconds to thaw and break into pieces. Tear the corner of the packet and squeeze contents into blender, along with sliced banana and coconut milk. Blend until desired consistency is reached (you want the mixture thick enough to be scoopable, but not so thick that it gets stuck in your blender). Pour mixture into a bowl and top with sliced berries and coconut cranberry granola. Add a drizzle of honey and almond butter for nutty sweetness, if desired. 10.10. 16
056417.name: Organic Acai Puree
056417.title: Unsweetened Organic Açaí Puree Packets

075603.description: Smoothie DIYers, start your blenders! Trader Joe's Fruits & Greens Smoothie Blend is ready to rev up your morning routine and add some en-smoothie-asm to your day! This Blend contains a bounty of frozen Fruits- tart blueberries, refreshing dragon fruit, and super sweet bananas and strawberries-that deliver a totally tasty smoothie base. Oh-so-conveniently, it also contains Greens, spinach and kale, to be specific, for an added nutrient boost. Add a cup of Fruits & Greens Smoothie Blend to a blender with ¿ cup of water, juice, dairy, or non-dairy beverage of your choice, and blend until smooth. This Blend doesn't contain any added sugar, so you could add a tablespoon of Multi-Floral and Clover Honey [SKU 30296], if you'd like. Bulk it up with your favorite protein powder or a scoop of Greek yogurt for some added protein. Or if sipping isn't your style, how about a Fruits & Greens take on an breakfast bowl? Simply blend with 1/2 cup liquid, serve in a bowl, and top with fresh fruit, Organic Chia Seeds [SKU 54256], and nuts. Fruits & Greens Smoothie Blend
075603.name: Fruits & Greens Smoothie Blend

081780.description: Trader Joe's Wild Boreal Blueberries are little blue gems grown without pesticides in Quebec's Boreal region. The Boreal (also called Boréalie) is a collection of protected lands across Canada, united by an effort to preserve the beauty and ecology of the land. Fruit grown in the Quebec Boreal thrives on the healthy soil and unique climate of the region, and the sweet-tart flavor of these Wild Blueberries is unmatched. Studies have shown that Wild Blueberries have higher antioxidant levels than other berries, including raspberries, blackberries, strawberries, and cranberries. We're in favor of any health benefits they might provide, but honestly, we're most concerned with how they taste. Trader Joe's Wild Boreal Blueberries come out winners there, too - wild blueberries are known for being smaller, juicier, and sweeter than their cultivated cousins. Try these in everything from breads and muffins to smoothies and ice cream. Go wild! You'll find each 16-ounce bag of Wild Boreal Blueberries, every day in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Wild Boreal Blueberries
081780.name: Trader Joe'S Wild Boreal Blueberries Wild Blueberries

097001.description: Trader Joe's Organic Blueberries are about as versatile and convenient as berries can be. They're firm, ripe berries, harvested at just the right time to ensure its highest quality. These sun-ripened Berries are full of sweet, delectable flavor and are a delicious way to get your fiber. They're individually quick frozen and ready for snacking right out of the bag - if you like eating frozen fruit (and we do). In this frozen state they're also excellent in smoothies, and if you add them to a fruit salad while they're still frozen, they'll help keep the whole thing cool. They thaw quickly - they're small, after all - so you can add the Berries to your yogurt or cereal straight from the freezer and they'll soften up in no time. If baking is your talent, having a bag of Organic Blueberries in the freezer means you won't have to rush out and buy fresh fruit to accomplish the task - smart, right? You'll find each 12-ounce bag of Trader Joe's Organic Blueberries in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Blueberries
097001.name: Fzn Org Blueberries
097001.title: Organic Blueberries

001293.description: Hot tamales have been floating around Mesoamerica as early as 8,000-5,000 BC and Trader Joe's Beef Tamales have been floating around our freezers since 1993, bringing our shoppers that south-of-the-border taste without that south-of-the-border boarding pass. Created as an easily portable food to be used for hunting trips, large group travel, and a food source for armies, the tamale was considered sacred; a food of the gods. While we don't use our Beef Tamales to feed militaries or sponsor hunting trips, we do believe we have created a tasty tamale fit for the gods - or at least the average shopper. We've been happily serving this Central American dish in traditional fashion from the get-go: handcrafted and wrapped in corn husks. However, we go the extra step to seal and freeze our Beef Tamales directly after preparation so you can enjoy the rich and savory corn masa flavors in full-effect at any time you wish. Packed with hearty veg, juicy beef, and a touch of heat from the chile-garlic seasoning blend and jalapeños makes for a savory and flavorful filling. Ready to prepare, without any need for thawing, by either a quick zap in the microwave or a slower steam on the stove makes handcrafted tamales obtainable in as short as 3-4 minutes! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing.
001293.name: Beef Tamales

001294.description: Hot tamales have been floating around Mesoamerica as early as 8,000-5,000 BC and Trader Joe's Chicken & Cheese Tamales have been floating around our freezers since 1993, bringing our shoppers that south-of-the- border taste without that south-of-the-border boarding pass. Created as an easily portable food to be used for hunting trips, large group travel, and a food source for armies, the tamale was considered sacred; a food of the gods. While we don't use our Chicken & Cheese Tamales to feed militaries or sponsor hunting trips, we do believe we have created a tasty tamale fit for the gods - or at least the average shopper. We've been happily serving this Central American dish in traditional fashion from the get-go: handcrafted and wrapped in corn husks. However, we go the extra step to seal and freeze our Chicken & Cheese Tamales directly after preparation so you can enjoy the rich and savory corn masa flavors in full- effect at any time you wish. Our handcrafted Chicken & Cheese Tamales can be prepared in just 3-4 minutes in the microwave, or, for a slower steam, can be steamed on the stove in just 20-30 minutes! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing.
001294.name: Chicken & Cheese Tamales

003655.description: Joe's Diner Four Cheese Mac & Cheese really does taste like you made it yourself - some have said even better. It starts with carefully cooked elbow macaroni. The semolina, smile-shaped pasta is bathed in an ooey-gooey- and-oh-so-creamy sauce that showcases a generous amount of four shredded cheeses - Cheddar, Havarti, Gouda, and Swiss. Smoothed with milk and butter, the cheeses melt to blanket the elbows beautifully - though, a quick stir can seriously spread the gooey-d-ness. Whether you heat in the microwave (about 5 minutes) or bake it in the oven (about 25 minutes), our Mac 'n Cheese easily becomes the kind of cozy dish that leaves you feeling satisfied and happy. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Mac 'n Cheese
003655.name: Joe'S Diner Mac & Cheese
003655.title: Joe'S Diner Mac 'N Cheese

003663.description: According to culinary historians, gyoza ("jiaozi" in Mandarin) were invented by the Chinese. It's rumored that the potsticker came to be when a Chinese chef walked away from the stove while gyoza were boiling, the water boiled off, and the stuffed dumplings stuck to the wok. The crisped side proved to be quite pleasing. We love good food stories as much as we love good dumplings, so once upon a time, we developed our very own Chicken Gyoza Potstickers. These crescent-shaped dumplings are made from wheat flour wrappers that enfold a flavorful filling of chicken, cabbage and onion, seasoned with soy sauce, sesame seed oil and ginger powder. Already fully cooked, our Chicken Gyoza Potstickers easily fulfill your preparation preference - steam, pan fry, microwave, or add to soup. Our favorite method is to heat oil in a pan (or wok); place the potstickers in the hot pan, bottom side down (creases up), and cook over medium-high until browned and crisped; (optional: carefully turn to brown each side); throw a little water into the pan and cover to steam the dumplings off the pan (take care to not add too much water, as the dough can start to come undone). Serve hot with our Gyoza Dipping Sauce [sku 84399] or place atop a bed of greens and dress with simple soy-sesame vinaigrette. Chicken Gyoza Potstickers
003663.name: Chicken Gyoza Potstickers

008450.description: Hot tamales have been floating around Mesoamerica as early as 8,000-5,000 BC and Trader Joe's Cheese & Green Chile Tamales have been floating around our freezers since 1994, bringing our shoppers that south-of- the-border taste without that south-of-the-border boarding pass. Created as an easily portable food to be used for hunting trips, large group travel, and a food source for armies, the tamale was considered sacred; a food of the gods. While we don't use our Cheese & Green Chile Tamales to feed militaries or sponsor hunting trips, we do believe we have created a tasty tamale fit for the gods - or at least the average shopper. We've been happily serving this Central American dish in traditional fashion from the get-go: handcrafted and wrapped in corn husks. However, we go the extra step to seal and freeze our Cheese & Green Chile Tamales directly after preparation so you can enjoy the rich and savory corn masa flavors in full-effect at any time you wish. Our handcrafted Cheese & Green Chile Tamales can be prepared in just 3-4 minutes in the microwave, or, for a slower steam, can be steamed on the stove in just 20-30 minutes! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Cheese & Green Chile Tamales
008450.name: Cheese & Green Chile Tamales

031890.description: Gnocchi alla Sorrentina (Sorrento style) is a simple, elegant combination of fluffy, chewy and silky tomato sauce with mozzarella cheese. The sauce is understated with a bright tomato freshness that beautifully highlights the durum wheat semolina and potato based dumplings. In the bag, the gnocchi come accompanied by frozen discs of sauce (featuring inclusions of mozzarella). Whether on the stove top or in the microwave, it heats together in under ten minutes. Pair it with green salad or a side of roasted asparagus for a convenient and enviable meal. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Gnocchi alla Sorrentina
031890.name: Gnocchi Alla Sorrentina

033700.description: Risotto comes from the Italian word "riso", which means "rice" in English. Now, you can't talk about risotto without mentioning its main ingredient, which is rice of course. Since the introduction of the grain, rice farming has been a major part of life for many Italian families. Trader Joe's Mushroom Risotto is imported from Italy and made by one of the best. The dish is authentic, creamy, savory, and extremely delicious! The "riso" is parcooked and combined with cream, slices of mushroom, onion, garlic, and extra Porcini mushroom seasoning. For a complete Italian dinner, light some candles, dim the lights and offer Trader Joe's Mushroom Risotto with a side of Focaccia Bread [sku 64435] and Balsamic Vinegar [sku 58036] or Italian President's Reserve [sku 30090] for dipping. Make the Risotto the star on the table as a main entree with your favorite protein and Caesar Salad [sku 05161]. Make your way to the freezers to enjoy this 16-ounce taste of Italy. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Mushroom Risotto
033700.name: Mushroom Risotto

034043.description: Though some dispute exists as to the exact time of its invention, we can generally trace the origins of Chow Mein (from the Mandarain ch'ao mien, roughly translating to "fried noodles") to the southeastern Chinese city of Taishan, sometime in the mid-19th century. From there, Chow Mein's popularity flourished around the globe, as each new region that it spread to began adapting it for their own local tastes. Trader Joe's Chicken Chow Mein, for instance, is about as classic an example of the American Chinese cuisine version as you can get: nice, soft wheat noodles, firm chunks of colorful and crispy veggies, and tender cuts of chicken breast, all covered in a savory, seasoned soy sauce. With just a few minutes of prep, Trader Joe's Chicken Chow Mein provides all the familiar, fun flavor of takeout Chow Mein at a fraction of the price. And since each 20 ounce bag creates three servings, the value goes even further. We recommend having it as part of a family-style feast of American Chinese cuisine favorites, like our Mildly Sweet & Spicy Beef & Broccoli [sku 54448] and a steaming bowl of our Vegetable Fried Rice [sku 52148]. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Chicken Chow Mein
034043.name: Chicken Chow Mein
034043.title: Trader Joe'S Chicken Chilaquiles Rojos

036260.description: After a brief (though longer than we would have liked) hiatus, Trader Joe's Shepherd's Pie is back and - truly - better than ever. When faced with the fact that we would be out of stock on this perennial favorite for a longish period of time, we took the opportunity to make some minor improvements that we think made a major impact on the quality and flavor of the product. So while we didn't want it to be out of stock, we do think it was worth the wait. Be it the English, Scottish, Irish or American version, Shepherd's Pie always consists of some kind of meat, vegetables and a crust of savory mashed potatoes. Though it dates back at least 150 years, there is much argument as to the origins of this dish. There's no arguing, though, that it's the ultimate comfort food. Our version lives up to that standard. Inside, beef, corn, peas, carrots, and green beans are combined with a savory gravy. On top, creamy mashed potatoes (way creamier than the previous incarnation). One of our favorite things about the previous version of this product was its nutritional profile. We're pleased to report that even with all the improvements we were able to make, Trader Joe's Shepherd's Pie still comes in at a mere 170 calories per serving (2 servings per container), with only three grams of fat. When you taste it, you'll really understand just how impressive this is. Also impressive? The price. We're selling each 16 ounce package of Shepherd's Pie for $4.49. Such a deal! You'll find it in our freezers. 01.30. 17
036260.name: Shepherd'S Pie Entrée
036260.title: Beef Shepherd'S Pie

041423.description: Picture yourself in the heart of Rome, just inland from the Tyrrhenian Sea, enjoying a ceremonious table-side preparation of an aromatic plate of fettuccine Alfredo. Preparing this dish table-side was an integral part of the experience at the restaurant where this entrée was created in the mid 20th century. Now picture yourself, in the heart of your home, having just created the same dish in minutes with a fraction of the travel expenses. Trader Joe's makes this dream a reality with our Trader Joe's Fettuccine Alfredo! Imported, high quality Italian ingredients bring that Roman freshness right to our freezers. Wheat and egg fettuccine bathed in a mixture of fresh butter, cheese, and cream is a classic delight for any shopper. Available every day for $3.99*, each 16-ounce package of Trader Joe's Fettuccine Alfredo can be enjoyed as is or made even more decadent with additions such as our Italian Style Meatballs [sku 44919] or TJ's Just Chicken [sku 43020]. Travel to Italy or bring it home with you any night of the week with our Fettuccine Alfredo! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Fettuccine Alfredo
041423.name: Fettuccine Alfredo

047944.description: Trader Joe's Thai Shrimp Gyoza is our Thai take on this classic dumpling usually associated with Chinese and Japanese cultures. Traditional fare of the Yangtze River area of Northern China, these "jiaozi", or gyoza, are handmade in Thailand. With a Thai inspired blend of spices, this shrimp gyoza is a great neighbor in our freezers to the more traditional chicken and pork varieties. Ready after just a few minutes of sautéing in a skillet (or wok), these gyoza are an easy answer to the need for a simple appetizer. Trader Joe's Thai Shrimp Gyoza are the perfect building blocks to a main course. Create a base of rice or a bed of greens for your gyoza and hit them with TJ's Green Dragon Hot Sauce [sku 58461] or take the traditional Chinese route and drop them into our Vegetable Broth Soup [sku 21509] and you'll be on your way down the Silk Road of Shrimp Gyoza Greatness. We're selling each 16-ounce package of Trader Joe's Thai Shrimp Gyoza for $4.99*, every day. Find them in our freezers today for a dish bound to give you some Asian-sensation-inspiration tonight! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Thai Shrimp Gyoza
047944.name: Thai Shrimp Gyoza

047945.description: According to culinary historians, gyoza ("jiaozi" in Mandarin) were invented by the Chinese. We love good food fusions as much as we love good dumplings, so we developed our very own Thai Vegetable Gyoza. These crescent-shaped dumplings are made from wheat flour wrappers that enfold a flavorfully pungent filling of white cabbage, carrot, chive, white radish, onion - plus a dash of ginger, garlic and soy sauce. Already fully cooked, our Thai Vegetable Gyoza easily fulfill your preparation preference - steam, pan fry, microwave, or add to soup. Our favorite method is to heat oil in a pan (or wok); place the potstickers in the hot pan, bottom side down (creases up), and cook over medium-high until browned and crisped; (optional: carefully turn to brown each side); throw a little water into the pan and cover to steam the dumplings off the pan (take care to not add too much water, as the dough can start to come undone). Serve hot with our Gyoza Dipping Sauce [sku 84399] or place atop a bed of greens and dress with simple soy-sesame vinaigrette. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Thai Vegetable Gyoza
047945.name: Thai Vegetable Gyoza

049669.description: Some claim that the history of risotto can be traced as far back as the 14th century; others place it somewhere in the mid-19th century. What we know for sure is that the modern, short-grain rice varieties that are now so directly associated with risotto weren't developed until the early 20th century. Of course, none of this is terribly surprising, as the evolution of food is one of our absolute favorite subjects. When we set out to develop an Asparagus Risotto, we went straight to the country with which this dish is most closely associated - Italy. Our supplier uses short grain rice and vibrantly green cuts of asparagus, along with cream, butter, and hard Italian cheese. This is an indulgent-tasting entrée, for sure, but the nutrition profile isn't quite as indulgent as you might expect - you can thank the inherent creaminess of the short grain rice for that! It's easy to prepare in a skillet or microwave - either way, it goes from freezer to table in about five minutes or so. Trader Joe's Asparagus Risotto is made exclusively for us, so you'll find it only in our freezers. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Asparagus Risotto
049669.name: Asparagus Risotto

050469.description: Linguine with Pesto and Tomatoes brings this classic dish home. It's made for us in Italy, using linguine, fresh pesto sauce, extra virgin olive oil and cherry tomatoes. It's a timeless Italian dinner that's ready in no time at all. We are selling a 16 oz bag of Trader Giotto's Linguine with Pesto and Tomatoes for $2.99.
050469.name: Linguine With Pesto & Tomatoes

051287.description: "Cakes" are fried up in pans all over the world with great vigor and variation. The French have their slender crêpes-the Italians, their eggy frittatas. Then, there's that good ol' American flapjack. Beyond these more familiar versions, we've found the world to offer stacks of ethnic "pan-cake" varieties-all of them worth a bite (or three). Our Scallion Pancake (Pa jeon) brings one such Asian variety to the table. Pa jeon is not your Grandma's pancake (unless your Granny is Korean). Traditionally, the recipe calls for spring onions, eggs, flour and soy sauce. This mixture has a batter-like consistency before cooking and a crispy, golden texture after being fried in the pan. Trader Joe's Pa jeon-made exclusively for us in South Korea-is even better! We use only unbleached wheat flour. We've also complimented the scallions with onions, leeks, carrots, and king oyster mushrooms, for a flavorful vegetarian cake. The 14.1-ounce bag of four pancakes can be found in our frozen section for $3.49. Warm them up in the oven straight from the freezer, or thaw them overnight and pan-fry them with a spot of your favorite oil until they are golden and crisp. You'll find that our Scallion Pancake is equally well re- ceived whether served as an appetizer, or as an anytime snack. Pancakes: They're not just for breakfast anymore!
051287.name: Pancakes Scallion (Pa Jeon)
051287.title: Scallion Pancakes (Pa Jeon)

051530.description: Sometimes, it's good to eat old food. Mind you, we're not talking about food that's been stashed and forgotten for weeks in the back of the fridge. Think recipes with rich and storied histories. Trader Joe's Vegetable Biryani with Vegetable Dumplings is based on a traditional South Asian recipe that's been celebrated in the Indian region for five centuries. And, it's made with ingredients that have been enjoyed for thousands of years! Traditional Biryani is Basmati rice, steamed separately and layered with vegetables and/or meat that have been pan-fried with an intricate blend of aromatic, dry spices. Once combined, the mixture is finished in the oven. Because we like you, we've undertaken this multi-step cooking process for you- leaving just two things for you to do: heat and eat! Our Biryani is 100% vegetarian, including the tender "kofta" or dumplings, which provide a textural contrast to the firm rice and veggies. As is customary, we've thrown in some sweet raisins and sliced cashews. This diverse blend of traditional ingredients yields an exciting exploration into the flavors and textures of South Asia. For $2.49, the 10-ounce package easily serves as a full meal for one per- son. Otherwise, you might share it as a side dish, accompanied by green curry, yogurt chutney, and Trader Joe's Tandoori Naan Bread!
051530.name: Vegetable Biryani W/Dumplings
051530.title: Vegetable Biryani With Vegetable Dumplings

051959.description: There's shepherd's pie and mince pie and kidney pie. Brits, it seems, really love their savory pies, filled with meat and gravy and some kind of veg. As it happens, we love them, too! A few years ago we introduced our own versions of some of our favorites, and they proved to be smashing success stories. Until, that is, we had to find a new supplier to make them for us. This search led to a savory pie "drought," and it was a very sad time indeed. Thankfully, that drought has passed, and we've once again entered a time of abundance, with the now-available Trader Joe's Steak & Stout Pie. Like their predecessors, these are individually sized pies made with all butter pastry that's filled with hearty chunks of tender beef in a stout-based gravy that's seasoned with traditional herbs and spices. The beef is joined by generous amounts of gold potatoes, carrots, onions, celery, and mushrooms. Like we said, this is comfort food at its most comforting. The Pies are fully cooked and frozen; they bake up to a golden brown, and the flavors are warm, savory, and satisfying. Add a simple green salad and dinner is served. (Note: while the box shows instructions for both conventional and microwave cooking options, we definitely prefer the conventional oven method, especially if you're dreaming of that golden brown crust.) We're selling each 20 ounce box - containing two Steak & Stout Pies - for $6.49, every day. You'll find them in our freezer case. 01.30. 17
051959.name: Steak & Stout Pies

052941.description: The combination of meat pieces ("tikka") in a creamy sauce with savory spices ("masala") is an Indian-style dish that is popular in restaurants around the world-especially in the U.K. where some say it originated. Trader Joe's carries a few different versions of Tikka Masala, including Paneer Tikka Masala [sku 99143], and Chicken Tikka Masala [sku 98912]. But, while our pieces of chicken or cheese cooked in Indian curry may keep carnivores and vegetarians grinning, the vegan who craves Indian food has had little reason to smile¿ until now¿ Determined not to discriminate against discriminating palates of any determination, we cooked up Trader Joe's Vegan Tikka Masala. (Truthfully, it's probably less about the need to curb any kind of vegan discrimination, and more about the earnest desire to share our delicious Masala with all.) One of our Indian suppliers, located in New Jersey, has been making Trader Joe's Masala for years. The difference this time is that they've used soy protein in place of chicken or cheese. This "meatless meat" (developed by a Taiwanese supplier), comes so close to lamb in its texture, you may find it hard to tell the difference. It's bathed in a spicy (but not too hot), tomato and coconut-milk sauce that is expertly flavored with onions, garlic, cashews, and spices, and presented on a bed of cumin-flavored Basmati rice. Just heat (in the microwave or conventional oven) and eat (in your mouth). We believe this 9.5-ounce vegan entrée is an incredible value at $3.49-proving once again that the only two things against which Trader Joe's will ever discriminate are: low quality and high prices. Find this and a host of other values (vegan and otherwise) everyday in our freezer case. 2.05.1 5
052941.name: Vegan Tikka Masala With Cumin Rice

053022.description: Northern Italy lays claim to the invention of gnocchi, the pillowy potato dumplings coveted for their cozy bite, and Gorgonzola, the beloved, soft, blue-veined cheese with nutty aroma. Trader Joe's lays claim to Gnocchi al Gorgonzola, which marries these beautiful creations to make an inviting, delicious dish. Gnocchi al Gorgonzola is easy to prepare on the stovetop or in the microwave, and is ready in about 7 minutes. Let's take a minute to appreciate that incredible ease of preparation for what might otherwise be a rather involved dish-one minute later-wow, right? We enjoy Gnocchi al Gorgonzola served simply, with a couple cracks of black pepper over the top. We also enjoy embellishing it with cherry tomatoes and broccoli florets or crumbled walnuts. Center of the plate or on the side, Gnocchi al Gorgonzola shines. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Gnocchi al Gorgonzola
053022.name: Gnocchi Al Gorgonzola

054034.description: It's disconcerting that at any given moment, bombs are going off somewhere in the world. Fortunately, not all bombs are destructive. Modern chefs have created umami bombs. Umami-oo-MA-mee-is the "fifth taste" (after sweet, salty, sour, and bitter...), and it's been used for ages, though not officially identified until the early twentieth century. When dropped in the mouth, umami bombs detonate comforting, savory flavors. Trader Ming's Shiitake Mushroom Chicken is our latest comestible bomb, and it's been artfully calibrated to bring peace to your palate. Chunks of soy-sauce marinated, dark-meat chicken combine with Shiitake mushrooms, edamame (soy beans), and green beans. It's all sautéed (during heating) in a ginger soy sauce. Chicken, mushrooms, and soy-each one rich in glutamates-explode with umami, devastating your tongue with nuclear pleasure. That's a good thing. Even more "devastating," is the simple prep. Sauce and veggies come frozen in two separate packets; the chicken, loose in the larger package. Defrost the sauce packet in a bowl of hot water while you thaw the chicken and veggies for two to three minutes in the microwave. With a spot of cooking oil, sauté it all together in a large fry pan or wok for five to six minutes and you'll have a satisfying meal to keep the peace among hungry family- members. Serve it with Trader Joe's frozen, fully cooked Organic Brown Rice [sku 53036]. Everyone knows that food brings people together. While it may seem unlikely that real bombs will cease anytime soon, we like to imagine that if worldwide harmony were to breakout, Trader Ming's Shiitake Mushroom Chicken would be the perfect bomb to drop at the peace potluck. Add this 22-ounce umami bomb to your dinner arsenal for only $4.99. Find it in our freezers. 3.19.1 5
054034.name: Shiitake Mushroom Chicken

054073.description: You might say Greeks know how to eat. The tragic poet Euripides, who lived almost 500 years before Christ, said: "When a man's stomach is full it makes no difference whether he is rich or poor." While this philosophy has undoubtedly led to Greece's modern-day financial woes, there is also little doubt it has led to some of history's greatest tastes. Traveling the Balkan Peninsula in recent months, we've explored the culinary landscape to discover some landmark foods that aren't readily available elsewhere. Trader Joe's 5 Cheese Greek Spiral is an item we've developed there based on a savory pie from the region of Kozani. The Kichi Kozani is a long, thin filo pastry that's been stuffed with cheese and coiled to resemble a snail's shell or gathered length of rope. This pie's filling is traditionally a blend of feta and some kind of harder cheese. We don't presume to improve upon cultural food traditions as rich and deep as that of Greece¿ but then again, we are Trader Joe's. Going with our gut, we wanted more kinds of cheese for more-cheesy flavor. We settled on a blend of five: gouda, kasseri, kefalotyri, semi-hard cheese, and blue cheese. This combination of cow's-, sheep's-, and goat's-milk cheeses wrapped in filo is baked (by you) in a 375ºF oven until golden-crisp on top and melty-good inside. Made for us near Thessaloniki (not too far from where the Kichi Kozani originates) our fourteen-ounce, 5 Cheese Greek Spiral is now as close to you as the Trader Joe's freezer case. It's also conveniently priced at $3.99 so no man (or woman) will have to go into debt to fill his stomach with this pleasing pie. 6.10.1 5
054073.name: 5 Cheese Greek Spiral

054448.description: In 2011 we introduced Trader Ming's Szechuan Style Spicy Beef & Broccoli [sku 95000]. To create our own ver- sion of the famous Southwestern Chinese dish, we brought together tender strips of beef and lightly blanched broccoli florets, mixing them together in a traditional sauce flavored by red chile garlic puree, soy sauce, vinegar, more garlic, ginger, more red chilies (crushed), and cayenne pepper. Four years later, we're reintroducing this dish as Trader Ming's Mildly Sweet & Spicy Beef & Broccoli. The difference? We took a hard look at the recipe and realized we could significantly reduce the amount of salt and sugar without compromising the great flavor. We brought the sodium down from the whopping 1390 mg that is was (!) to a mere 630 mg. That's a 55% reduction in sodium. We also significantly reduced the sugar, taking it down from 52 g to 27 g-a 48% reduction. Everything else is nearly identical¿ the wonderful contrast of the tender beef; the subtle crunch of the broccoli; the zesty zing of the chile-garlic sauce; and the overall balance of mild sweetness with just a little bit of heat. Serve it with our Fully Cooked Brown Rice [sku 77409] and it can satisfy up to three hungry people. Get creative and wrap it in a tortilla for a spicy-sweet burrito, or serve it on a bed of greens for a unique salad. The sauce, the broccoli, and the beef are still packaged separately to maintain their integrity, and the entire meal can be ready in about ten minutes. Our "new" Mildly Sweet & Spicy Beef & Broccoli with lower sodium, and less sugar is just $6.99. Find it in our freezers! 9.01.1 5
054448.name: Beef & Broccoli Entrée
054448.title: Mildly Sweet & Spicy Beef & Broccoli

054988.description: Soup goes in a bowl or in a cup-unless, of course, you are a fan of Xiao Long Bao. Then, your soup goes in a dumpling. Trader Joe's Steamed Chicken Soup Dumplings are a wonder to behold, both for their display of Chinese food innovation, and for their incredibly comforting flavor profile. This concept originates in the Jiangnan region of southeastern China, where Shanghai is situated. Xiao Long Bao are essentially soup dumplings, but instead of dumplings that go in the soup (though you can still certainly make this happen), the soup actually goes inside these dumplings. Our expert Chinese dumpling supplier forms their wheat flour dumpling dough with a specially formulated proprietary production method that seals each dumpling, allowing them to hold the maximum amount of savory broth-broth made from ingredients includ- ing chicken, onion, green onion, soy sauce, and ginger. Once the soup is wrapped in the dough and sealed (Bao means "wrapped" in Chinese), it is steamed until fully cooked (Xiao Long refers to a traditional Chinese bamboo steamer). Lastly, our dumplings are put into microwave-safe packages and frozen so we can deliver them to you. To enjoy, you simply cut the corner of the bag and microwave for 1 to 2 minutes. Let your Dumplings sit for at least another minute before removing from microwave. The insides will be very hot, so be careful! We suggest placing a hot Soup Dumpling on a deep Chinese soup spoon and nibbling a little hole in the side to let the soup run out before enjoying soup and dumpling together. You get six large Chicken Soup Dumplings in each six ounce package for $2.99. With Trader Joe's, the soup's not only on-it's IN! ¿ in our Dumplings and in our freezers, everyday. 10.14. 15
054988.name: Soup Dumplings Chicken
054988.title: Steamed Chicken Soup Dumplings

055239.description: What could possibly get you into the holiday spirit more than savory, Asian-inspired dumplings? Why, savory- spicy Asian-inspired dumplings in colorful wrappers, of course! Following this unimpeachable logic, Trader Joe's Sriracha Seafood Potstickers with Shrimp & Crab are sure to amplify your holiday happiness. Our supplier in Thailand handcrafts these delicate dumplings using wrappers that have been colored with beet juice and spinach, so the red and green hues are rich and deep to complement the flavors within. Inside, they've stuffed shrimp, crab, mung bean noodles, and water chestnuts, and seasoned the stuffing with everyone's favor- ite hot sauce, sriracha. The spicy-tangy-slightly-sweet sriracha makes these Potstickers different from any others we've tasted, and heightens their appeal as holiday handhelds. Add our Sweet Chili Sauce [sku 91113], and enhance the flavors even further. It's also worth noting that these Sriracha Seafood Potstickers are excellent in broth, allowing you to create a quick, simple, and delicious soup course that will impress the eyes and the taste buds. Also impressive is our price of $3.99 for each 7.6 ounce package of 12 Sriracha Seafood Potstickers. You'll find them in our freezers. 11.23 .15
055239.name: Sriracha Seafood Potstickers

055248.description: Trader Joe's has been exploring the food-riches of the Greek Isles for a while now, but only in the last year have we really begun to sink our teeth into their wealth of savory pies. Following in the recent footsteps of our 5 Cheese Greek Spiral [sku 54073], and our Tomato Tiropita Triangles [sku 54481], our latest pita is a traditional "pie" you may have heard of, even if you've never traveled to Greece. But, we did travel to Greece for this Spana- kopita, where we engaged some Athenian bakers to make this authentic Greek pastry for us (and for you). It's essentially a spinach pie... but the genius is in the details. Our Greek pie-makers start with their own filo dough, machine-cut to size and hand assembled into pies with a filling of three cheeses (feta, mizithra, and a grating cheese), spinach, onion, leek, olive oil, dill, parsley, salt and pepper. The loaded disc is then pre-cut into wedges that will puff up when you bake them at home. Once you do bake this pie (in the provided ovenable tray at 350ºF for about a half-hour), you'll have yourself a crisp, buttery pastry with a delectable filling. Our Spanakopita makes a great snack anytime, and it can also serve as a light meal when paired with a fresh sal- ad of tomatoes, olives, and greens, and lightly dressed with 100% Greek Olive Oil and Lemon Juice [sku 54483]). We would still recommend you visit Greece, but if it's going to be a while, we would also suggest you visit Trader Joe's (much nearer) for a taste of our Greek Spanakopita to get you in the mood. The authentic, 14-ounce, fro- zen snack is only $3.99. Find it in our freezers. 10.07. 15
055248.name: Spanakopita Greek Spinach And Cheese Pie
055248.title: Greek Spanakopita

055571.description: When your fingers first pinch the outside wrapper of a spring roll, the texture is the tell. Soggy sides foreshadow watered-down filling. Crisp sides-that crackle with your touch-hold the promise of a big, balanced, boastful bite. Chasing down this crispy-fried-roll dim sum ideal, we partnered with Asian cuisine experts (who immigrated to New York from Taiwan to pursue their passion for food) to create Trader Joe's Chicken Spring Rolls. Having perfected the technique of eliminating excess water in their fillings, the wrappers on their rolls (now ours) stay exceptionally crisp. Lest you think we exaggerate, they've quantified the amount of moisture- between 35% to 40%-that they manage to extract from the vegetables. Even more important than the well-managed moisture are the vibrant flavors expressed in the hearty filling. Based on the popular Taiwanese "3 Cup Chicken" dish, our Chicken Spring Rolls feature chunks of white meat chicken, cabbage, carrots, and green onion that are cooked in hot woks with plentiful basil, garlic, and ginger. Simmered with soy sauce, sesame oil, rice wine, and chili paste, the flavor only intensifies. The finished filling is carefully tucked into a wheat flour wrapper and deep-fried to make a thin, light, crisp shell. Bake in the oven (20-25 minutes), or fry on the stove top (5-10 minutes) until the outside wrapper is golden and tellingly crispy. Serve with our Sweet Chili Sauce [sku 91113] or Satay Peanut Sauce [sku 91369] for dipping. We're selling each nine ounce package of five Chicken Spring Rolls for $3.99. 04.18. 16
055571.name: Chicken Spring Rolls

055739.description: While dining at a famous New England seafood restaurant, one of the leaders of our buying team ordered an appetizer that was so good, she took a photo and sent it to the head of our frozen food category with the request to develop a Trader Joe's version. Over the next several weeks, two more leaders independently discovered the same appetizer and made the same request. As if by some unseen food-force, our course was set! Which dish made such an impression? It was essentially battered and fried cauliflower florets in a spicy and sweet sauce. Now, months later, we're excited to introduce Trader Ming's Kung Pao Tempura Cauliflower; an item we expect many more people will be enjoying and sharing with others in the months to come. We found a Southern California vendor who agreed to pursue the development with us. They flew to the East Coast to experience the dish themselves, and even brought back samples for testing. As it often goes with these things, the road to product perfection was long and arduous. It was a challenge to get the batter to cook up crispy, due to the moisture released from the frozen cauliflower during baking. It was also a challenge to get the sauce right-spicy, but not too much heat, balanced with just the right amount of sweetness. Even so, hard work and perseverance led to our success! Trader Ming's Kung Pao Tempura Cauliflower has all the best qualities of the original version, with the added bonus that you can enjoy it at home. We're selling each 24 ounce bag of Kung Pao Tempura Cauliflower for $4.99. That's about six cups of cauli- flower-much more than you'd get for that price if you ordered it in that New England seafood restaurant. 03.21. 16
055739.name: Kung Pao Tempura Cauliflower

055840.description: The original paella, known as paella valenciana, is an age-old, one-pan dish that traditionally includes rabbit (or chicken) and snails, cooked together with beans (three kinds), and saffron-seasoned, white rice. Over time, this one-pan dish has evolved to include a variety of different ingredients. Probably the most popular version worldwide (and the second most popular in Spain) is paella de marisco, after which we've patterned Trader Joe's Seafood Paella. Though not Valencian (or Spanish), our supplier isn't far from paella's origins. They are located about 1,400 miles away, on the northwestern coast of France-perfectly positioned for assembling Seafood Paella. We took advantage of their ocean expertise, loading up this Paella with 32% Seafood, including shrimp, calamari rings, and mussels. In place of beans, we include peas, fried onions, and a trio of peppers-red, yellow, and green. The seafood and veggies are nestled into sunny-yellow, short-grain, white rice that derives its color from naturally available ingredients (namely turmeric and saffron). All the flavors are woven together by our very own paella spice mix, which includes paprika, saffron, garlic, onion, and chili pepper. There's a lot of preparation that goes into making paella from scratch, but thankfully, with our Seafood Paella, you barely have to move a mussel (or shrimp or squid). Just empty the contents of the 16 ounce freezer bag into a large pan and stir gently until the shrimp is opaque and the rice is warmed through. You'll save hours of stirring with Trader Joe's Seafood Paella; and at $4.99, you'll also save on clams. 03.07. 16
055840.name: Seafood Paella

056006.description: Spring. A versatile word with many meanings. It can refer to a place where water emerges from an underground source, or a coil in a mattress. You can walk with a spring in your step or enjoy springtime weather. Or, a brilliant idea can spring from your mind.
