011134.description: Trader Joe's 50% Less Salt Dry Roasted & Salted Pistachios currently sit near the top of our must-have snack list. We especially love that these tender, green-ish nuts are roasted and salted in their shells; some days, those little shells are the only thing standing in the way of us inhaling the entire bag in one sitting! Second, we love that, as their name implies, they contain 50% less salt than our regular Dry Roasted & Salted Pistachios [sku 07998] - 80mg vs. 160mg per serving, to be exact. Finally, even though they have half the salt, they're still delightfully delicious, and a great value, too. We're selling each 16-ounce bag for $6.99, every day, a tasty price you'll find only at your neighborhood Trader Joe's.
011134.name: 50% Less Salt Dry Rs Pistachios
011134.title: *50% Less Salt Roasted & Salted Pistachios *50% Less Salt Than Trader Joe'S Regular Roasted And Salted Pistachios. Sodium Has Been Reduced From 150Mg To 70Mg Per Serving. See Back Panel For Information On Fat And Other Nutrients.

012269.description: Almonds are hands-down the most popular nut in our stores. And why shouldn't they be? They're high in mono-unsaturated (aka "good") fats and their protein and fiber content make them a satiating snack that's easily eaten on the go. And with their slightly sweet, nutty flavor and considerably crunchy texture, they are undeniably delicious. And with Trader Joe's Raw Sliced Almonds, these wondrous flavors can now be easily implemented into tons of baking recipes and snack mixes. We offer an impressive array of flavors, cuts and serving sizes to meet the needs of every almond enjoyer, from plain to cinnamon, Thai lime to rosemary and everything in between. With that in mind, we are delighted to introduce you to Trader Joe's Raw Sliced Almonds, a delightful addition to our almond armada. Inside the bag you'll find nonpareil almonds grown in California's Central Valley. This variety sets the industry standard for quality, thanks to its mild sweetness and attractive appearance. After harvesting, we simply slice, package, and stock the Raw Sliced Almonds you see before you. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Raw Sliced Almonds
012269.name: Raw Sliced Almonds

016126.description: Back in the old days, people used to soak raw peanuts in water to remove those thin, red skins before they roasted them. The residual moisture would interact with the oil during roasting and cause little bubbles or "blisters" to form on the outside of the nuts. Instead of being unwelcome, these serendipitous blisters added texture-ultimately creating a unique peanut snack. Trader Joe's Old Fashioned Blister Peanuts harken back to these original "blistereds," as they were once called. While water is no longer required to remove peanut skins (there are new technologies for that) our supplier still blanches extra large Virginia peanuts in hot water before roasting them in peanut oil and adding salt. The finished nuts are crisp, bubbly, and extra crunchy-a super swell snack if we ever did see one! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Old Fashioned Blister Peanuts
016126.name: Old Fashioned Blister Peanuts Salt

037883.description: Botanically, what we call cashews are seeds, found inside a drupe, at the end of a pseudocarp, or accessory fruit, known as the cashew apple. But really, who's thinking of botany when there are cashews to eat? In culinary circles, cashews are nuts, and since our interest in food is primarily focused on the myriad ways in which we can eat it, within the four walls of Trader Joe's, cashews will indeed be nuts. Trader Joe's Roasted & Unsalted Whole Cashews are harvested from dwarf cashew trees growing in tropical, equatorial climes, roasted to an ideal crispness in rice bran oil, and seasoned with salt. They make super snacks, are an awesome additions to a trail mix, and a delicious addition to a chicken and veggie stir fry. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Roasted & Salted Whole Cashews
037883.name: Trader Joe'S Nuts Roasted & Salted Whole Cashews

037884.description: Botanically, what we call cashews are seeds, found inside a drupe, at the end of a pseudocarp, or accessory fruit, known as the cashew apple. But really, who's thinking of botany when there are cashews to eat? In culinary circles, cashews are nuts, and since our interest in food is primarily focused on the myriad ways in which we can eat it, within the four walls (and within the confines of the Fearless Flyer in all its myriad forms) of Trader Joe's, cashews will heretofore and forevermore be nuts. Trader Joe's 50% Less Salt Roasted & Salted Whole Cashews are just what the bag claims. They're harvested from dwarf cashew trees, roasted to an ideal crispness in rice bran oil, and seasoned with half the salt used in our regular roasted and salted cashews - 60mg per serving or less, instead of 120mg. They're super snacks, brilliant for baking, awesome additions to a trail mix, and a smart way to boost your smoothie. Add them to hot or cold breakfast cereal. Stir fry them with chicken and veggies. Can you tell we're fully-ticketed passengers on Cashew Cruises? We're selling 50% Less Salt Roasted & Salted Cashews in 16 ounce bags for $7.99 each, every day - that's a nutty value, for sure! You'll find them in our nut & dried fruit section.
037884.name: 50% Less Salt Rs Whole Cashews
037884.title: Cashew Whole 1/2 Salt

037885.description: Botanically, what we call cashews are seeds, found inside a drupe, at the end of a pseudocarp, or accessory fruit, known as the cashew apple. But really, who's thinking of botany when there are cashews to eat? In culinary circles, cashews are nuts, and since our interest in food is primarily focused on the myriad ways in which we can eat it, within the four walls of Trader Joe's, cashews will indeed be nuts. Trader Joe's Roasted & Salted Whole Cashews are harvested from dwarf cashew trees growing in tropical, equatorial climes and roasted to an ideal crispness in rice bran oil. They make super snacks, are an awesome additions to rice dishes, curries or salads. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Roasted & Unsalted Whole Cashews
037885.name: Roasted Unsalted Whole Cashews
037885.title: Cashew Whole Rns

037886.description: Botanically, what we call cashews are in fact seeds, found inside a drupe, at the end of a pseudocarp, or accessory fruit, known as the cashew apple. But really, who's thinking of botany when there are cashews to eat? In culinary circles, cashews are nuts, and since our interest in food is primarily focused on the myriad ways in which we can eat it, within the four walls (and within the confines of the Fearless Flyer in all its myriad forms) of Trader Joe's, cashews will heretofore and forevermore be nuts. Trader Joe's Raw Whole Cashews are just what the bag claims - and, perhaps most imporantly, they're only what the bag claims.. They're harvested from dwarf cashew trees, then shelled and lightly steamed, but never roasted or salted. In addition to making super snacks, they also make for great building blocks for vegan cuisine - a whole host of dairy-free cheese and cream substitutes start by soaking raw cashews in water overnight, then blending with a few other savory ingredients. But first and foremost, they supply a whole lot of that uniquely nutty (isn't that much better than saying "uniquely drupe-y?") cashew flavor, for not a whole lot of money. Look for 16-ounce bags of Trader Joe's Raw Cashews in your neighborhood Trader Joe's nuts & dried fruit section. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Raw Whole Cashews
037886.name: Whole Cashews Unroasted Unsalted
037886.title: Raw Whole Cashews

038863.description: Pine nuts have been part of the diet in some Asian and European cultures for thousands of years, dating back to the Paleolithic era. They are grown around the world, in climates that are friendly to the various species of pine trees from which they come. Trader Joe's Raw Pignolias (Pine Nuts) are from pinus sibirica (Siberian Pine) in Russia*, growing at altitudes between 3,000 and 7,000 feet above sea level. These trees can take 40-50 years to mature and produce pinecones, and the pine nuts grow within those cones. The Pine Nuts themselves take about two years to mature. This is not a crop for the impatient! Pignolias are famous for their important role in Italian pesto. They're also used in baking (Pignoli cookies!) and their distinctive flavor is a welcome addition to pasta, poultry, pizzas, and salads. In this Raw state, they're somewhat soft, with just a bit of bite. Lightly toasted, they'll deliver even richer flavor and good crunch. We're selling each eight ounce bag of Raw Pignolias (Pine Nuts) for $5.99 - that's $2 less than they were the last time we advertised them, way back in 2014. You'll find them in our nut & dried fruit section. (After opening, store the nuts in the fridge or freezer in an airtight container-they'll stay fresh longer that way.) *Note that our packaging notes Product of Korea, Russia and Vietnam. The 2017 crop is from Russia - subsequent crops may also come from Korea and/or Vietnam.
038863.name: Raw Pine Nuts
038863.title: Trader Joe'S Nuts Raw** Pignolias (Pine Nuts)

047384.description: The story of the sunflower, or Healianthus Annuus, is almost as interesting as the story of the sun itself. (Okay, fine, that's a reach, but let's go with it.) The wild sunflower was first domesticated by Native Americans, who used sunflower seeds in a variety of applications, but true commercialization of the plant took place in Russia and surrounding territory. By the early part of the 19th century, Russia had some 2 million acres of farmland just covered in sunflowers. Doesn't that sound like a beautiful sight? And think of all those delicious seeds! Sounds pretty sunny for a country known for unforgiving winters... But we digress. Trader Joe's Roasted & Unsalted Sunflower Seeds are removed from the plant only when they're ready, then shelled and lightly roasted in a bit of-yup!-sunflower oil. While we also offer a salted version in our stores, we don't add salt to this one, which makes it a perfect option for sweeter applications, like getting added to your favorite TJ's granola or baked into bars. Salt or no salt, you can still take these babies out to the ballgame any time you like! We're selling each one- pound bag for $2.29,* every day. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Roasted & Unsalted Sunflower Seeds
047384.name: Roasted & Unsalted Sunflower Seeds

050515.description: A classic favorite of the in-between-meals snack variety that can be enjoyed during all seasons for all appetites, Trader Joe's Raw Cashew Pieces deliver that wonderfully smooth, creamy texture that makes our shoppers go nuts. Great for a simple snacking sesh while on the go or for an array of exotic cuisines, our Raw Cashew Pieces are looking to weasel their way into your next shopping list. Harvested from the dwarf cashew tree from suppliers in India, Vietnam, and Brazil, our Raw Cashew Pieces begin their life as a seed dangling from the underside of the cashew apple. While in the United States, we don't care much for the cashew apple, we do lust for those lovely, snackable seeds attached. In culinary circles, we skip the formalities, disregard botany, and just call these little guys nuts and not seeds. After breaking the cashews out of their shelled prison, we halve the nutritious nut into smaller pieces, and then seal that freshly shelled light, earthy flavor in a resealable bag, leaving them ready to snack on whenever you wish. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Raw Cashew Pieces
050515.name: Cashew Pieces Unroasted Unsalted
050515.title: Raw Cashew Pieces

051511.description: We're nuts about the Thai Lime & Chili flavor profile! The heat from the piquant chilies glows when accented with the delicate, citrus-y essence emanating from the leaves of the Thai Lime tree. This lively flavor combination easily embraces the rich, meatiness of nuts. Our Thai Lime & Chili Cashews already beckon the bold and the beer drinkers. This got us thinking, what if we combined this winning flavor phenomenon with our most popular nut, namely almonds? Naturally, we had to try it. The vibrant, finger-licking, Thai Lime & Chili flavoring met the nutty, creamy, sweetness of almonds like they were great old friends, happily reunited. We think it really works! Made for us in Thailand, Trader Joe's Thai Lime & Chili Almonds are quintessential snacking nuts, great with beer and other bubbly drinks. We've also found that when chopped, they are a fun topping for salads, vegetables or a variety of rice dishes. Since we are as nuts about good value as we are about Thai Lime & Chili Almonds, we're selling each 12 ounce bag for $5.99.
051511.name: Thai Lime & Chili Almonds

051799.description: What makes you smile? Much of the world smiles for pistachios. In China, pistachios are called "happy nuts." In Iran, they're actually called "smiling nuts." These grinning green seeds make us smile, too, and that's why we're offering Trader Joe's Salt & Pepper Pistachios. Approximately 98% of U.S. pistachios are grown in California, including ours, which come from the San Joaquin Valley. The saltiness comes from sea salt. The pepperiness comes from Malabar Black Pepper that is sourced from the Malabar hills of Southern India. This exotic peppercorn is noted for its robust flavor with fragrant notes of pine and citrus and a sharp heat. The so-called "grin" on each pistachio is a result of dehiscence, which the natural process by which the shell on a mature fruit splits partway open. With this split comes an audible "pop" that is said to bring good luck to whomever is around to hear it. Since our Salt and Pepper Pistachios are already harvested, it's simply too late for you to hear that pop. But, keep smiling-you can still feel lucky that our 13-ounce package of these premium, peppery pistachios is only $7.49. You don't have to be nuts for this to make you smile!
051799.name: Salt And Pepper Pistachios

051934.description: One ingredient: walnuts. And while the label makes it sound like there is only one purpose for this single ingredient - baking - you can use Trader Joe's Raw California Walnut Baking Pieces for whatever walnut needs you may have. Our Raw California Walnut Baking Pieces begin their culinary journey as little walnuts harvested about an hour north of Sacramento. They are grown and processed by a fourth generation family farm and are steam pasteurized, but otherwise raw walnuts. This makes them perfect for baking around the holidays or a nutty addition to a cool salad in the summertime. Trader Joe's Raw California Walnut Baking Pieces can also bring a nutritious twist to all that baking you're going to be doing! Not only are walnuts high in flavor and a pleasantly smooth texture, but they are high in antioxidants and omega-3 fatty acids, too. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Raw California Walnut Baking Pieces
051934.name: Raw Walnut Baking Pieces

052168.name: Pignolia Dry Roasted Pine Nuts
052168.title: Trader Joe'S Dry Toasted Pignolias Pine Nuts

054048.description: Medieval marriages were rarely motivated by love. More often, they were the union of two people from different clans, arranged by powerful parents for geopolitical gain. If the kids were lucky, love might blossom, and that matrimonial match-though undertaken with mixed motives-could result in true romance. Being matchmakers in victuals (rather than nuptials), and with our undeniable soft spot for the romantic, Trader Joe's introduces Truffle Marcona Almonds-a fusion of two European, blue-blood comestibles that is likely to invoke feelings of love all across the map. Like most Marconas, ours are grown on the Mediterranean coast of Spain. This "Queen of Almonds" is wider and rounder than standard California almonds, with a sweeter, more delicate flavor. We batch-roast them in expeller-pressed sunflower oil to impart a soft, buttery flavor, and slight crunch. Along that same coastline- just further north and east-highly prized Italian Black Summer Truffles are unearthed. (A recent auction at Sotheby's saw one such titanic tuber fetching $50,000.) Our European supplier mixes dried black truffle flakes and truffle oil with salt that's been sun-dried on the Italian coast. This Black Truffle Sea Salt is sprinkled over our Marconas, balancing their rich almond flavor with a pleasantly pungent aroma and earthy taste. The gains here are not geopolitical, but culinary. How much should one pay to attend this royal wedding? Marcona-Truffle matrimony could fetch top-dollar- given the caliber of ingredients and the unique flavor pairing. But, Trader Joe's is no Sotheby's. We may vow to bring our customers products in which they can luxuriate-but never at a premium. These Almonds are no exception to our rule. By the power vested in us, this six-ounce bag of Truffle Marcona Almonds is value- priced at just $6.49. You may kiss¿ us. 12.17. 14
054048.name: Trader Joe'S Nuts Roasted & Salted Truffle Marcona Almonds

055581.description: Pecans have the distinction of being the only major species of nut tree known to be native to North America (our vast continent still produces about 95% of the world's pecans). Known to have grown in the wild as early as the 16th century, pecans were a trading commodity, and part of the diet of Native American tribes along the eastern seaboard of what is now the United States. Pecan trees were first cultivated by American colonists in the mid-18th century, and within a few years, they featured prominently in the gardens of both George Washington and Thomas Jefferson. An auspicious beginning, to be sure. Fast forward to the early 21st century (that's now), and you only need to go as far as your neighborhood Trader Joe's to find Unsalted Dry Toasted Pecan Pieces in abundance - shelled, cleaned, and ready to enjoy. We've gone ahead and given these Pecan Pieces a flash of heat to achieve their final dry toasted form. These are rich, buttery tasting nuts that are excellent for eating out of hand, just the right size to be included in baked goods and recipes like stir frys, and a delightful addition to many of our baking mixes! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Unsalted Dry Toasted Pecan Pieces
055581.name: Unsalted Dry Roasted Pecan Pcs
055581.title: Unsalted Dry Toasted Pecan Pieces

055583.description: Almonds are hands-down the most popular nut in our stores. In response to this popularity, we offer an impressive array of flavors, cuts and serving sizes to meet the needs of every enjoyer of almonds, from plain to Thai Lime [sku 51511] to Mesquite Smoke Seasoned [sku 98895] and everything in between. For customers in need of almonds for baking or decorative purposes, we even offer Trader Joe's Unsalted Dry Toasted Slivered Almonds: delicious, savory, full-flavored almonds sliced into perfect matchstick slivers. Made using the same, Central California-grown Almonds that we sell whole, our supplier takes the extra step of dry toasting these Almonds to crunchy perfection, heating them up just enough to make them pliable for slicing without shattering, then cuts them into thin, aesthetically pleasing slivers. It's almost impossible to cut almonds into slivers this regular and uniform at home, using regular kitchen tools, which makes our Slivered Almonds all the more convenient. That's all the more important, considering that their shape not only looks great when placed atop a cookie, bowl of oatmeal, or salad, but also nicely accentuates their texture and flavor. Whether you're using them for their visual, culinary, or simple snacking qualities, Trader Joe's Unsalted Dry Toasted Slivered Almonds are tasty, convenient, and a great value - which is exactly why we've kept them on the shelf for over 15 years. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Unsalted Dry Toasted Slivered Almonds
055583.name: Unsalt Dry Toasted Slivered Almond
055583.title: Unsalted Dry Toasted Slivered Almonds

058702.description: Almonds are hands-down the most popular nut in our stores. And why shouldn't they be? They're high in mono-unsaturated (aka "good") fats, vitamin E and magnesium. Their protein and fiber content make them a satiating snack that's easily eaten on the go. And with their slightly sweet, nutty flavor and considerably crunchy texture, they are undeniably delicious. We offer an impressive array of flavors, cuts and serving sizes to meet the needs of every enjoyer of almonds, from plain to cinnamon, Thai lime to rosemary and everything in between. With that in mind, we are delighted to introduce the newest addition to our almond armada, Trader Joe's Organic Raw Almonds. Inside the bag you'll find Nonpareil almonds grown in California's Central Valley. This variety sets the industry standard for quality, thanks to its mild sweetness and attractive appearance. And they are organically grown, to boot! Throw a scoop of Organic Raw Almonds into trail mix. Chop them and sprinkle on top of salad or into your favorite chocolate chip cookie recipe. Or simply eat them by the handful for a fresh, crunchy snack. We're selling 12-ounce bags of Organic Raw Almonds for $7.99, everyday. 12.05. 16
058702.name: Org Raw Almonds Nonpareil
058702.title: Trader Joe'S Organic Raw* Almonds

058827.description: A classic favorite of the in-between-meals snack variety that can be enjoyed during all seasons for all appetites, Trader Joe's Organic Dry Roasted & Salted Cashews delivers that wonderfully smooth, creamy texture that makes our shoppers go nuts. Great for a simple snacking sesh while on the go or for an array of exotic cuisines, our Organic Dry Roasted & Salted Cashews are looking to weasel their way into your next shopping list. Harvested from the dwarf cashew tree from suppliers in India, Vietnam, and Brazil, our Organic Dry Roasted & Salted Cashews begin their life as a seed dangling from the underside of the cashew apple. While in the United States, we don't care much for the cashew apple, we do lust for those lovely, snackable seeds attached. In culinary circles, we skip the formalities, disregard botany, and just call these little guys nuts. After breaking the cashews out of their shelled prison, we roast our Organic Dry Roasted & Salted Cashews without oil, bringing out that wonderfully smooth quality of the nut and enhance their naturally sweet, earthy flavor. To wrap up the preparation, the cashews are hit with a salty sprinkle of sodium and then we seal that freshly roasted flavor in a resealable bag, ready to snack on whenever you wish. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Dry Roasted & Salted Cashews
058827.name: Org Dry Roasted Salted Cashews
058827.title: Organic Dry Roasted & Salted Cashews

059856.description: A classic favorite of the in-between-meals snack variety that can be enjoyed during all seasons for all appetites, Trader Joe's Roasted Not So Salty Cashew Pieces deliver that wonderfully smooth, creamy texture that makes our shoppers go nuts. Great for a simple snacking sesh while on the go or for an array of exotic cuisines, our Roasted Not So Salty Cashew Pieces are looking to weasel their way onto your next shopping list. Harvested from the dwarf cashew tree from suppliers in Thailand, Vietnam, and India , our Roasted Not So Salty Cashew Pieces begin their life technically as a seed dangling from the underside of the cashew apple. While in the United States, we don't care much for the cashew apple, we do lust for the lovely, snackable seeds attached. In culinary circles, we skip the formalities, disregard botany, and just call these little guys nuts and not seeds. After breaking the cashews out of their shelled prison, we halve the nutritious nut into smaller pieces, roasted in rice bran oil, and splashed with a little sodium for seasoning. Finally, we seal that freshly shelled earthy, roasted flavor in a resealable bag, leaving them ready to snack on whenever you wish. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Roasted Not So Salty Cashew Pieces
059856.name: Low Sodium Roasted Cashew Pieces
059856.title: Cashew Pieces 1/2 Salt

060389.description: The lime-chile combination is quite typical of Thai cuisine¿ think Tom Yum Soup, which is what initially inspired our buyer, way back in about 2008. With the flavors of this traditional dish in mind, our intrepid foodie was awaiting a flight in a Thai airport when she noticed a nutty snack with a lime-chile-lemongrass flavor blend. Immediately hooked on the combination, she set about developing a version to offer at Trader Joe's. The tasting panel was equally enamored, and Thai Lime & Chili Cashews quickly became a TJ's staple. You could say, then, that this story goes from soup to nuts. Every batch of Trader Joe's Thai Lime & Chili Cashews begins with a particular variety of lime, singular to Thailand, that has an almost perfume-y flavor. The cashews are, of course, crunchy; slices of tiny red and green chiles add a burst of flavor and a good deal of heat; and the vibrant, almost-otherworldly flavor of lemongrass rounds out the picture. We're pretty sure the grocer down the street doesn't have snacks like this one - or stories like this one, either! We're selling each 16 ounce bag of Trader Joe's Thai Lime & Chili Cashews for the storied price of $7.99.
060389.name: Thai Lime & Chili Cashews

063991.description: With their unique, buttery, mildly nutty flavor, cashews are really enjoyable when simply roasted with a little salt. In addition to selling them this way, Trader Joe's has also capitalized on their fantastic flavor by using cashews as a base for a variety of seasonings, including our Coconut Cashews [sku 51127], Sesame Honey Cashews [sku 57068], and Thai Lime Cashews [sku 60389]. Now, we're adding Trader Joe's Chile & Garlic Cashews to this list. Whole cashews are roasted and dusted with a seasoning that includes chile powder, garlic powder, onion powder, and salt. There's also little bit of lime powder and cane sugar to provide hints of acid and sweetness in contrast with the plentiful savoriness. Of course, Chile & Garlic Cashews are excellent eaten out of hand or next to your favorite fizzy beverage- but this flavor profile in particular also works well in recipes. Add it to your homemade stir-frys, or even TJ's Asian-inspired dishes, like our Mandarin Orange Chicken [sku 66563]. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Chile & Garlic Cashews
063991.name: Chile Garlic Cashew
063991.title: Chile & Garlic Cashews

065114.description: Trader Joe's offers fine, fresh nuts for a wide variety of tastes. These Organic Dry Roasted & Unsalted Cashews fit right into the mix¿ We located a supplier in India that uses high-grade cashews, known for their size and quality. The Cashews are harvested from various organic farms in the Kerala region of India (southern-most part of the country). Next, they go through a four-step process, which includes: roasting (with no oils), shelling, peeling, and finally, grading. Minus salt, what you experience is that fantastic, roasted-cashew flavor-sweet and almost buttery, with a lively crunch. We're selling each one-pound bag of Trader Joe's Organic Dry Roasted & Unsalted Cashews for $8.99, every day. Find them in the nuts section-among our raw, salted, and conventional cashews. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Dry Roasted & Unsalted Cashews
065114.name: Cashew Dry Rns Org
065114.title: Trader Joe'S Organic Dry Roasted & Unsalted Cashews

065666.description: Under ordinary circumstances, pistachios are among our favorite nuts. (Of course, pistachios are techincally seeds, not nuts-but who calls them that?) Anyhow, when circumstances veer from the ordinary-say, when someone dusts those rich, flavorful pistachios with garlic & onion, they become quite nearly irresistible. Irresistible is exactly how we'll describe Trader Joe's Garlic & Onion Pistachios. These are California-grown, in-shell pistachios, dry roasted and dusted with a robust blend of garlic, onion, and sea salt. Some folks like to pop whole pistachios into their mouths, shell and all, to make sure they get all the flavor. Other folks prefer to remove the shell first. We make no judgements, other than the only proper pistachio proclamation¿ yum! Find the 13-ounce bag of kosher certified Garlic & Onion Pistachios in our nuts section, every day. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Garlic and Onion Pistachios
065666.name: Pistachio Garlic & Onion
065666.title: Garlic & Onion Pistachios

073689.description: The allure of buffalo-style provisions captivate heat enthusiasts and chicken wing aficionados alike-and with good reason! They offer an irresistibly lip-smacking, fiery tang, courtesy of a combination of zesty vinegar and intense red pepper-and because Trader Joe's customers love a good kick, we've brought the newest addition of this punchy profile to our shelves, in the form of Trader Joe's Buffalo Style Seasoned Almonds. These Almonds are California-grown and dry roasted, then coated in a zippy, Buffalo Style seasoning that makes for a splendidly spicy snack. And while traditional Buffalo-style fare requires the companion of a napkin, our Buffalo Style seasoning bursts with boldness from a blend of powdered vinegar, red pepper, sea salt, garlic, capsicum, paprika, and cream-leaving your hands sauce-free and your taste buds sufficiently satiated. Thanks to our Buffalo Style Seasoned Almonds' convenient, resealable bag, you can bring the heat wherever you go-take a bag on a hike, a road trip, or your next picnic. Spice up your next charcuterie board, or pair with an ice-cold can of Simpler Times Lager [sku 92188] on a hot day. Whenever the craving for piquant flavor strikes, reach for a handful of Trader Joe's Buffalo Style Seasoned Almonds for a blissful bite of spice! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Buffalo Style Seasoned Almonds
073689.name: Almond Buffalo Style
073689.title: Buffalo Style Seasoned Almonds

074181.description: First brought from Spain to California in the 1700s, almonds are now California's top agricultural export, covering more than half a million acres in the lush San Joaquin, Fresno and Sacramento valleys. And it's no wonder they're the top nut-they're packed with protein and perfect for adding a mild nuttiness to any dish. Some culinary creations, however, might be overwhelmed by the heartiness of whole almonds. For these more delicate dishes, we recommend Trader Joe's Unsalted Dry Toasted Sliced Almonds. They're Califor- nia-grown, thinly sliced, and a perfect crowning ingredient at an even-more-perfect price-we're selling each eight-ounce bag for $3.49, every day. You'll find them with our other nut & dried fruit products.
074181.name: Unsalted Dry Toasted Sliced Almond
074181.title: Unsaltedâ Dry Toasted Sliced Almonds

076294.description: Ah, the almighty almond. While technically not a nut in a strictly scientific sense (botanically, it's actually considered a drupe, in the same family as plums and cherries), it's undoubtedly earned its multitude of spaces upon the shelves of our nut section. Our newest almond-powered addition to said section, Trader Joe's Garlic & Black Pepper Almonds, deftly demonstrates why: by adding just a simple suite of savory seasonings (black pepper, sea salt, and dehydrated garlic and onion), these crunchy, well-roasted Almonds take on a whole new dimension of flavor, offering alluring, allium aromatics and a subtle, yet satisfying, level of spice. An ideal addition to any cheese plate, charcuterie board, or cocktail party snack table, Trader Joe's Garlic & Black Pepper Almonds also make a superb snack for simply enjoying by the handful, anytime you might feel peckish. Enjoy them as a movie snack, a treat for the whole table at a board game night, or as a crunchy companion to an ice-cold beer. We find their simple, savory profile and delectably crunchy texture also make them a great choice for including in custom snack mixes: try combining them your other favorite seasoned nuts (botanically accurate or not), or, for a real curveball, with our Oven-Baked Cheese Bites [sku 57243]. Garlic & Black Pepper Almonds
076294.name: Almonds Black Pepper & Garlic
076294.title: Garlic & Black Pepper Almonds

077876.description: There's a reason ranch dressing is consistently named one of the top condiments in the country: as it turns out, you can pretty much never go wrong combining creamy textures with savory, aromatic herbs. Of course, this being Trader Joe's, we simply can't help ourselves from putting an axiom like that to the test-this time, in the form of Trader Joe's Ranch Seasoned Cashews. They're made with crunchy roasted cashews dusted with a classic Ranch-style seasoning blend that includes garlic powder, onion powder, and even powdered sour cream and buttermilk. In addition to being a reliably fantastic anytime snack, our Ranch Seasoned Cashews also make an excellent inclusion in cheese plates, where their pronounced pop of herby flavor provides a great contrast to creamy Bries, tangy Bleus, and sharp Cheddars. Bring them along on hikes, long car rides, and sporting events for a bit of delicious diversion. We find that their Ranch-rich, slightly salty profile also makes them especially apt for enjoying alongside an ice-cold beer or a refreshingly fruity mocktail. Ranch Seasoned Cashews
077876.name: Cashew Ranch Seasoned
077876.title: Ranch Seasoned Cashews

080175.name: Imperial Nuts Cashews Halves & Pieces Salted

080176.name: Imperial Cashews Halves & Pieces Lightly Salted

090035.name: Macadamias Dry Roasted & Unsalted See Nutrition Information For Total Fat & Saturated Fat Content

090083.description: True Marcona Almonds are grown only on the Mediterranean coast of Spain. They're shorter and flatter than California almonds, with a distinctive flavor and a light, crunchy texture. We've taken that flavor profile a step up by adding whole dried rosemary to the mix. The nuts are roasted in expeller pressed sunflower oil, dusted with sea salt and sprinkled with whole rosemary. They're a real treat. You can use them in recipes (just the thought of Green Beans Rosemary Marcona Amandine makes us smile), present them as an hors d'oeuvre or eat them right out of the bag. They're excellent with a glass of crisp white wine - perhaps a Sauvignon Blanc or Côtes du Rhône. We've found them to be quite difficult to resist; you may want to err on the side of caution and have several bags on hand in case of emergencies. And napkins. You'll need napkins. Trust us on this one. Marcona Almonds tend to be expensive, but at Trader Joe's, we have them at a great price. We're selling Marcona Almonds with Rosemary in six ounce bags for the terrific everyday price of $5.99* each. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Marcona Almonds with Rosemary
090083.name: Marcona Almonds With Rosemary
090083.title: Roasted & Salted Rosemary Marcona Almonds

091148.description: Would you like a handful of cashews? If so, you might want to pick up Trader Joe's Just a Handful of 50% Less Salt Roasted & Salted Whole Cashews. It's a mouthful to say. And each 1.2-ounce serving is just about a Handful to eat (also several mouths-ful to eat, if we're being thorough). This is convenient because people love cashews. And people especially love cashews when they're fresh tasting-which is what these Cashews are when you open each little bag! They have been roasted in rice bran oil and left whole. We asked our supplier to salt them less-50% less than our regular Roasted & Salted Whole Cashews [sku 37883], to be precise. Thus, in each handful you get that classic, mildly nutty, buttery flavor with a hint-of-sweetness, along with just 60mg of sodium instead of 120mg. Every day you'll find the 15.6-ounce package containing 13 single-serving bags every day in our nut aisle. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Just a Handful of 50% Less Salt Roasted & Salted Whole Cashews
091148.name: Just A Handful 50% Less Salt Cashew
091148.title: Just A Handful Of 50% Less Salt Roasted & Salted Whole Cashews

091920.description: With a mild climate, rich soil, and abundant sunshine, it should be no surprise that California's Central Valley is an ideal place to grow a large chunk of the world's premium almonds. And while we never stop short of sourcing premium products, it should be no surprise that Trader Joe's Just a Handful of Raw Almonds are from the beautiful and agriculturally bountiful Central Valley. Trader Joe's Just a Handful of Raw Almonds are of the supreme grade, nonpareil variety. French for "no equal", nonpareil almonds are incomparable to other almond varieties because of their high kernel weight, ease of blanching (removing the shell and skin), and cutting. Additionally, our Raw Almonds have more than just a crunchy flavorful snack hiding under their shells! Trader Joe's Just a Handful of Raw Almonds are teeming with terrific dietary benefits such as heart-healthy unsaturated fats, fiber, protein; and minerals such as calcium, iron, and potassium in every serving! With one ingredient per individually sealed package, one ingredient is all you need to get these nutrition and versatile culinary benefits, so snag a bag today. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Just a Handful of Raw Almonds
091920.name: Just A Handful Of Raw Almonds

094333.description: Trader Joe's Walnut Halves & Pieces are an excellent choice for snacking or baking. Each one-pound bag is filled with variously sized pieces of Raw California Walnuts that have been grown, harvested, and processed just north of Sacramento by fourth-generation farmers. The processing includes steam-treating-a method required by law to help eliminate the presence of harmful bacteria in uncooked nuts. You can enjoy these Walnuts straight from the bag. Our Walnut Halves & Pieces are also ready to bake into your homemade banana bread or muffins. For a unique treatment, lightly toast them and toss in the food processor with fresh garlic, basil, olive oil, and Parmesan to create a walnut pesto for your favorite pasta! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Raw California Walnut Halves & Pieces
094333.name: Raw Walnut Halves & Pieces
094333.title: Walnut Halves And Pieces

094763.description: Fun fact: Did you know that the hazelnut is the official state nut of Oregon? Actually, let's start that line of thought over - did you know that there's such a thing as an official state nut? Delightfully, there are, and Oregon's happens to be the hazelnut, which only makes sense: Oregon's climate is actually quite suited to producing bright, slightly sweet, and exceptionally tasty hazelnuts - the very kind you'll find in a bag of Trader Joe's Dry Roasted & Unsalted Oregon Hazelnuts. While they're known primarily for their use in candies, desserts, and chocolatey spreads, hazelnuts are more versatile than they're usually given credit for. Their soft, yielding texture and naturally hearty flavor make them a great asset for savory dishes like pestos, salads, and stuffings, too. And since these Hazelnuts in particular are dry roasted but not salted, they're a great blank slate for use in whatever culinary scheme you may have going. You can halve them and sauté them with your favorite greens, crush them and use them to create a super flavorful crust for pork or fish. The sky's the limit! And at $6.99 for a 16-ounce bag, you can afford to be even more adventurous with how you use them. That might be the most fun fact of all. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Dry Roasted & Unsalted Oregon Hazelnuts
094763.name: Dry Rns Oregon Hazelnuts
094763.title: Dry Roasted & Unsalted Oregon Hazelnuts

096368.description: These Fancy-grade nuts come from a family-owned company in Texas that's been harvesting pecans from their 12,000 acres of pecan trees for nearly half a century. There are so many ways to include our Pecans in your plans¿ Put them in a pecan pie made with one of our frozen Crusts. Add nutty crunch to your green salad. Give your stuffing a textural boost. Our Raw Pecan Halves are also wonderfully snack-able when simply roasted in the oven with sugar, salt, and cinnamon. Yes, Pe-can! *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Raw Pecan Halves
096368.name: Raw Pecan Halves

098684.description: Though the Pistachio tree originated thousands of years ago in the Middle East, early production in the U.S. didn't begin until the 1930's, when a determined botanist journeyed to Iran and brought cuttings back to California's Central Valley. The fertile soil, dry climate, and moderate winters of the Southwest proved to be ideal conditions for pistachio-growing. The name kind of gives it away, but Trader Joe's Dry Roasted & Salted Pistachio Nutmeats are roasted "dry," without any added oil, then salted while they're still warm. We start with only the freshest nuts, so the roasting really brings out their pistachio flavor, then the salt enhances it just enough to make the Nutmeats utterly craveable. Whether you eat your Halves & Pieces as a simple snack or add them to salads & such, you'll find our price pretty craveable, too-we're selling eight-ounce bags for $5.99* each, everyday. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Dry Roasted & Salted Pistachio Nutmeats Halves & Pieces
098684.name: Dry Rs Pistachio Nutmeats Pieces
098684.title: Dry Roasted & Salted Pistachio Nutmeats Halves And Pieces

098895.description: ¿ You all know that famous brand of Hickory Smoked Almonds¿well forget about them. Introducing, Trader Joe's Mesquite Smoked Seasoned Almonds. Trader Joe's Mesquite Smoked Seasoned Almonds are addictive. Unlike that overly- salty (and with lots of artificial ingredients) aforementioned brand, Trader Joe's Mesquite Smoked Seasoned Almonds are the perfect balance of mesquite smoke, savory spices and a touch of salt, atop crunchy roasted almonds. You're going to love them! Trader Joe's Mesquite Smoked Seasoned Almonds are $5.99 for a 1 lb bag.
098895.name: Mesquite Smoked Seasoned Almonds

074393.name: La Vieille Ferme Cotes Du Ventoux Rose 1.5L

053279.name: Org Red Wine & Olive Oil Vngrt

063353.description: After a recent review of our shelf-stable dressing offerings, we concluded that it was time for a Trader Joe's dressing revolution of sorts. Sure, we have some great options, but we realized that we've had more or less the same salad dressings on our shelves for years and years. It was time for some updating. And that's just what we've done. One of three in a lineup of new dressings is Trader Joe's Organic Toasted Sesame Dressing. Inspired by Asia's best-selling bottled salad dressing, this dressing is thick, slightly sweet, and packed with plenty of umami- goodness. It's made with organic sunflower oil, organic soy sauce, organic white vinegar, and, of course, organic toasted sesame oil, which has been cold-pressed and cold-filtered to maintain its deep, roasted sesame profile. We also add whole black sesame seeds to deepen that sesame flavor, and a pinch of organic brown sugar to sweeten the deal. Trader Joe's Organic Toasted Sesame Dressing is perfect in salads, slaws, sandwiches, and wraps. It pairs well with roasted veggies or cold pasta dishes, and it makes a marvelous marinade for meat of all types. Now that's versatility. We're selling Organic Toasted Sesame Dressing in a 12-fluid ounce bottle for $3.49, a terrific everyday price for this organic dressing of distinction. You'll find it in our grocery aisle.
063353.name: Dressing Toasted Sesame Organic
063353.title: Organic Toasted Sesame Dressing

067698.description: We're always scanning our shelves for new items to enhance our offerings. Recently, we recognized we were in need of a good old "house" Italian dressing. Trader Joe's Organic Italian Dressing is definitely a welcome addition to our "house." Our inspiration was that dressing you find in those restaurants where you get never- ending salad and breadsticks. Of course, we went the extra mile by sourcing all organic ingredients and making the recipe our very own. Organic soybean oil and white vinegar pair up with organic Romano cheese and organic egg to create a creamy feel and tangy taste. Then a host of organic seasonings, such as garlic powder, black pepper, red bell peppers, oregano, basil, and tarragon add more zest and flavor. You'll find that it brings your greens to life and also works well in a pasta salad. This dressing even doubles as a marinade for chicken or seafood! We're selling each 12 fluid-ounce bottle of Trader Joe's Organic Italian Dressing for $3.49. Find it in our grocery aisle with the rest of our dressings and condiments. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Organic Italian Dressing
067698.name: Dressing Italian Organic
067698.title: Organic Italian Dressing With Romano Cheese

077302.description: A great salad dressing should accomplish three things: for starters, it shouldn't be too thick-at that point, it's just dip. Second, it should expertly complement your salad ingredients. And third, it should of course, be delicious. We're delighted to report that Trader Joe's French Vinaigrette with Shallots handily meets these salad dressing standards. Sporting a signature tanginess courtesy of red wine vinegar and Dijon mustard, this French Vinaigrette with Shallots offers from-scratch flavor without the hassle that tends to accompany from-scratch preparation. Its subtle, sophisticated flavors and easily poured nature create a classic Paris bistro vibe wherever you splash it-on Little Gem Lettuce [sku 76869], in a marinade for chicken or fish, over of-the-moment veggies (think steamed Artichokes [sku 76894] or grilled Zucchini [sku 20491]), or in a picnic-ready pasta salad. (Give the bottle a good shake prior to use-just like a from-scratch dressing, you won't find gums or thickeners here!) This authentic, made-in-France classic is an astonishing value-and now available on the grocery shelves at your neighborhood Trader Joe's, every day. French Vinaigrette with Shallots
077302.name: Dressing Vinaigrette French
077302.title: French Vinaigrette With Shallots

076917.description: To have a cut, pre-washed bag of greens is a luxury that many cooks today might take for granted. Before such an invention, one had to chop the head, rinse the leaves, rinse them again (and maybe again), and then dry them using either the slow 'air-dry' technique-or far too many paper towels. So¿ let us give thanks for bagged lettuce-specifically Trader Joe's Organic Romaine & Chicory Blend. This Blend pairs crisp leaves of Organic Romaine with two members of the somewhat bitter (in flavor, not attitude) Chicory family-namely frilly, green Organic frisée (also known as curly endive) and sturdy leaves of burgundy-red, white-veined Organic radicchio. Their peppery, slightly spicy notes are pleasantly balanced by cool and crisp Romaine leaves. When combined, this Organic Blend of greens makes for a fast, fresh base for your favorite salad, and lends a thrilling counterpoint of texture when paired with rich, savory foods-think crisp bacon and a poached egg or sautéed Shawarma Chicken Thighs [sku 60667],. For added drama, drizzle them with Balsamic Vinaigrette [sku 72499] and pile atop a Mushroom & Truffle Flatbread Pizza [sku 90538] with abandon. Organic Romaine & Chicory Blend
076917.name: R-Salad Chicory Blend & Romaine Org
076917.title: Organic Romaine & Chicory Blend

005161.description: You may be familiar with Caesar Salad's origin story; back in 1924, or so the story goes, chef Caesar Cardini was about to close his restaurant in Tijuana, Mexico for the night when a hungry customer asked for a salad. Nearly out of ingredients, Caesar whipped together what he had, and the now-classic Caesar Salad was born. Then some 60 years later, Trader Joe's Caesar Salad was born. It's the classic crunchy, garlicky and (most importantly) delicious Caesar Salad, you know and love, all packed ready-to-go on a road trip, in your lunch box, as a side dish or main course. Each bag contains crisp, fresh- chopped leaves of Romine lettuce, tasty shreds of Parmesan cheese, splendidly seasoned croutons, and a rich, peppery salad dressing. All you have to do is make like chef Caesar and mix them all together, and your conquest of dinner is complete. You'll find each 8.5-ounce Caesar Salad in our fresh, refrigerated section, next to our other ready-to-go salads. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Caesar Salad
005161.name: Caesar Salad With Caesar Dressing

006832.description: Hail, Caesar Salad! Since its invention in the 1920s, the Caesar has reigned supreme as a scion of salad- dom - although, full disclosure, it actually gets its name from its reported inventor, chef Caesar Cardini; any similarities to Roman emperors are purely coincidental. And for close to three decades, Trader Joe's Caesar Salad with Chicken has remained a staple of our salad selection. Inspired by the classic recipe, it's made with crisp Romaine lettuce, fresh shreds of Parmesan, crunchy croutons, and tender chunks of chicken breast, with a packet of zesty, creamy, and triumphantly garlicky Caesar dressing included. Once mixed together, this Salad exhibits everything you love about the iconic Caesar profile - the crunch, the rich flavors, the savory notes of garlic and anchovy - all in one conveniently portable package. Perhaps it's the princely air that comes with enjoying such a sumptuous salad in a mundane setting, but even after all these years, it remains one of our favorite lunch salads to bring to work. Keep an eye out for nine ounce packages of Trader Joe's Caesar Salad with Chicken in our refrigerators the next time you're looking to conquer your hunger. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Caesar Salad with Chicken
006832.name: Chicken Caesar Salad
006832.title: Caesar Salad With White Chicken Meat

036732.description: Looking for lunch in all the wrong places? May we point you to the refrigerated section at your neighborhood Trader Joe's? There you'll find salads and soups and wraps and sides. It's a treasure trove of easy to prepare, delicious to eat options that makes great lunches (and dinners, too). One such option is Trader Joe's Mozzarella & Tomato Salad a tempting take on the classic Caprese salad. In addition to fresh tomatoes and petite mozzarella balls, we've included sliced Kalamata olives and toasted pine nuts. All of these flavorful treasures are presented over a bed of mixed greens, and paired with a separate container of balsamic vinaigrette for tossing. In a bowl as a complete meal, as a side for a more substantial meal, or even on a pizza, this Mozzarella & Tomato Salad is delicious and satisfying. It's also a tremendous value at $3.49* for each 8.25-ounce container. Look for it in the land of lunches, our refrigerated case. *$3.99 in East Coast stores
036732.name: Mozzarella & Tomato Salad
036732.title: Mozzarella And Tomato Salad With Balsamic Vinaigrette - Note To Design: Salad Is The Statement Of Identity. It Must Be Bold, Prominent And At Least Half The Height Of The Largest Type Size Used On The Pdp.

050286.description: Trader Joe's Broccoli Slaw and Kale Salad with Chicken combines two great super foods into one powerhouse salad: the ever so popular and full of good stuff leafy green known as kale joins forces with nutrient rich broccoli. The salad is topped with a generous portion of grilled chicken, roasted sunflower seeds for crunch and cranberries for an added sweet note. Top it all off with our creamy sweet and spicy dressing and you have a delicious salad full of healthy goodness. We're selling each 9.3 ounce package of Trader Joe's Broccoli Slaw and Kale Salad for $3.99.
050286.name: Broccoli Slaw & Kale Salad
050286.title: Salad Kale And Broccoli Slaw W/Chicken

055214.description: Our Trader Joe's Baby Spinach & Greens Salad is a vegetarian salad comprised of dried cranberries, crunchy honey toasted pecans and creamy blue cheese over a bed of baby spinach and mixed salad greens. On the side is a packet of raspberry vinaigrette, so you can add as little or as much as you like. It is a simple salad that delivers on flavor and also lends itself to being a great base salad for your favorite protein. We are selling our Gorgonzola & Walnut Salad in a 9oz container for $3.99.
055214.name: Baby Spinach & Greens Salad
055214.title: Baby Spinach And Greens Salad With Bleu Cheese, Candied Pecans & Cranberries With Raspberry Vinaigrette

056077.description: Southwest Salad Our Southwest Salad is built atop a bed of crisp romaine lettuce with shredded green cabbage, black beans, corn, red and green bell peppers and red onion. Accompanied by a container barbeque dressing that's seasoned with onion, garlic and chili powder, this salad is a study of vibrant flavor and texture. Made fresh daily, each eight ounce salad is $3.49. Trader Joe's Company Bulletin02/23/2011 page 39 of 39 Confidential
056077.name: Southwest Salad

057099.description: If you've spent any time in Los Angeles, you are most likely familiar with the fruit cart vendors that colorfully dot the urban landscape. Serving up sliced, tropical fruit smothered in chili powder, salt, and lime juice, these beloved vendors are a must-visit for many Angelinos on a hot, sunny day-and there are many of those days in Los Angeles. Taking our cues from this traditional Mexican-American treat and from the fruit-based slaws you might see in a restaurant served alongside some grilled fish, we give you¿ Trader Joe's Mango Jicama Slaw. Pineapple is perhaps mango's most frequently seen sidekick, but since we like shaking things up a bit, we've swapped out the pineapple in our Slaw for the oft-overlooked, crisp wonder that is jicama-and we're pretty pleased with the results. The sweet, juiciness of the mango is pleasantly offset by the neutral, refreshing crunch of the jicama and green cabbage-and when you factor in the bits of cilantro and the tangy, spicy mango-lime vinaigrette, you've got nothing short of a fiesta in your mouth. Serve Trader Joe's Mango Jicama Slaw as a stand-alone side dish. Enjoy it alongside some grilled salmon or tilapia. Use it in your fish tacos next time you host Taco Tuesday at your place. Explore its place in sandwiches- we happen to think it tastes mighty fine in hot sammie made with TJ's Pulled Pork [sku 93602]¿ We're selling each 12 ounce tub (enough to share¿ if you're good at sharing) of Trader Joe's Mango Jicama Slaw for $4.99-a small price to pay for flavors this bold, and worth every penny. 05.09. 16
057099.name: Mango Jicama Slaw

057400.description: A palette is that thin, flat, roundish piece of wood (with thumb-hole for gripping), dotted with primary hues and smeared with a mingling of pigments-at the ready for the color-loving artist. Over time, this tool becomes art itself, with its blending of colors and build up of impasto strokes. Like the artist's palette (and like our Salad Palette with Mango [sku 57190]), Trader Joe's Salad Palette Tur- key Harvest also begins with a veritable feast of colors-this time autumn shades: pale-green roasted Brussels sprouts; olive-colored roasted sunflower seeds; dark-ruby sweetened dried cranberries; hearty shreds of white turkey breast; and vibrant orange, roasted sweet potatoes. You (The Artist) are invited to mix and mingle, turn and toss all these fresh ingredients, until they're an edible work of art, worthy of your personal palate (as in: 'sense of taste'). All these colors rest on a canvas of greens- namely, kale and baby spinach. Of course, no work of art is complete without a signature; that's our Apple Cider Vinaigrette. Like a well-lit painting on the gallery wall, Trader Joe's Salad Palette Turkey Harvest is something to behold, as it beckons to be consumed. The difference is, once your eyes appreciate this Salad's beauty, you also get to appreciate it from another angle-and that's whatever angle your fork happens to enter your mouth. Each fresh, beautiful, delicious, 10 ounce Salad Palette is $4.99. 09.26. 16
057400.name: Hol Turkey Salad
057400.title: Salad Palette Turkey Harvest

065234.description: Reduced Fat Chinese Chicken Salad Our Reduced Fat Chinese Chicken Salad is built atop a bed of crisp romaine and iceberg lettuce with shredded green cabbage, snow peas, crispy noodles, carrots and sliced grilled chicken. Accompanied by a container of sesame soy dressing that's seasoned with ginger, garlic and onion, this salad is study of vibrant flavor and texture. Made fresh daily, each nine ounce salad is $3.99.
065234.name: Chinese Style Chicken Salad

066452.description: The iconic Waldorf salad was created way back in 1896, by the famed maître d'hotel (dining room manager) at New York's Waldorf-Astoria Hotel. The original recipe included just apples, celery, and mayonnaise, but VERY fortunately for us all, that recipe has since expanded to include other accoutrements, like walnuts, grapes, and sometimes even lettuce. Trader Joe's Waldorf Salad includes all of the above-minus the mayonnaise. That's right: move over, mayo; make way for a far better brown sugar maple dressing instead! We've also added another key ingredient to our version: Grilled White Chicken Meat. Even though the entire salad-with dressing-weighs in at under 500 calories, you'll still be getting plenty of protein (17.5 grams' worth, to be preceise) to tie you over 'til your next meal. Trader Joe's Waldorf Salad with Grilled White Chicken Meat makes a perfect lunch-on-the-go, but if you'd prefer to share, it also makes a beautiful starter before your stay-at-home, romantic dinner for two. But since we're selling each 11.5-ounce salad for $4.99,* it's a bargain either way! Find it with our fresh foods. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Waldorf Salad with Grilled White Chicken Meat
066452.name: Salad Chicken Apple Waldorf

077316.description: We take a great deal of pride in our to-go salads here at Trader Joe's, and in the fact that so many of our customers enjoy them as a regular feature of their lunch breaks. If you ask us, it comes down to a very simple aspect of our salad-selecting philosophy: we only bring in the kinds of salads that we would want to eat on our lunch breaks, too. Trader Joe's Sesame Miso Salad with Salmon is a prime example of this philosophy in action. Inspired by the kinds of salmon-topped entrée salads you might find at a higher-end restaurant, each one starts with a blend of crisp, leafy greens like romaine, frisée, and baby spinach, to which our supplier adds shredded red cabbage and carrots, diced cucumbers, sliced green onions, and well-seasoned, flaky, grilled salmon. They also include a packet of crispy-fried onion pieces for a pop of texture, and a super flavorful sesame miso dressing to tie it all together. Once tossed, this Sesame Miso Salad wth Salmon offers a captivating complex mix of textures and flavors, from the light, leafy elegance of the spring mix, to the tender richness of the salmon, and especially in the combination of umami, spice, and sweetness in the dressing. An excellent option for an easy lunch or dinner, we recommend enjoying this Salad with something sweet and fizzy, like a Sparkling Green Tea with Pineapple Juice Beverage [sku 70308]. And if you happen to enjoy it during dinner hours, a chilled glass of Mbali Chenin Viognier [sku 58887] will make an even more pleasant pairing. Sesame Miso Salad with Salmon
077316.name: Salad Sesame Miso With Salmon
077316.title: Sesame Miso Salad With Salmon

077429.description: People don't always think of Trader Joe's as a "grab-n-go" store, but perhaps they should. For those who have discovered our ready-to-eat salads, last-minute lunch is as easy as a quick trip to your neighborhood store. Made fresh every day, our salads come with a wide variety of veggies, proteins, dressings, and crunchy accoutrements. Trader Joe's Green Goddess Salad fits right into this section, with an attractive collection of textures & flavors. The colorful base is made up of shredded veggies, including romaine lettuce, spinach, red cabbage, and carrots. The Salad is protein-powered by Chicken Thigh Meat that's been seasoned with a blend of savory spices, then Blackened and cut into bite-sized pieces. When you're ready for lunch, simply open the included packet of crispy red rice and add it to the Salad for an impressive, crunchy contrast to the tender Chicken. Then add as much of the Green Goddess Ranch Dressing as you like. The blend of creamy buttermilk, champagne vinegar, tangy lemon, plus a host of herbs (parsley, basil, green onion, and chives), is a divine way to dress this Salad. And don't forget a squeeze of the fresh lime wedge that's included! And if it's dinner time, you'll likely find that Trader Joe's Green Goddess Salad is substantial enough to fill you up... but if you're feeling famished, a side of TJ's Tomato & Parmesan Focaccia [sku 64435] from our "grab-n-go" bakery section will complement this Salad's profile, and ensure you're completely satisfied! Green Goddess Salad with Blackened Chicken Thigh Meat
077429.name: Salad Chicken Green Goddess
077429.title: Green Goddess Salad

078792.description: Hail Caesar! This star of the salad world has conquered our hearts in countless variations, and the latest version to join our ready-to-eat ranks may just be the most exciting yet: Trader Joes Caesar Salad with Salmon! This tasty twist starts by shaking up the classic formula with a base of chopped kale in addition to the customary Romaine, then mixes things up further via the use of crunchy Parmesan cheese crisps instead of croutons. It's finished with a hearty portion of grilled salmon, which, when mixed all together with the included creamy Romano Caesar dressing, creates a marvelous mix of savory flavors and toothsome textures that all combine into one seriously satisfying salad. Ideal for on-the-go lunches and quick & easy, weeknight dinners, our Caesar Salad with Salmon is ready to eat right out of the fridge, and pairs particularly well with a fruity iced tea. We recommend packing it with some fresh fruit and a Sparkling Peach Black Tea [sku 68349] for a complete work lunch or picnic-ready meal. Caesar Salad with Salmon
078792.name: Salad Caesar W/ Salmon
078792.title: Caesar Salad With Salmon

079434.description: When you have a crisp cadre of fresh-cut veggies, paired with a flavorful dressing, who can be against the slaw? In the case of Trader Joe's Crunchy Jicama Slaw, that truly a root-torical question! Our Slaw comes from Mexico, like the original Jicama root itself. Jicama "noodles" make up the base of this salad, with julienned carrots and diced radishes, cucumbers, and red bell peppers. The addition of shelled edamame brings a bit of protein to the party-3g per one-cup serving, to be precise. Inside the 11.5-ounce tub, the Slaw is topped with plenty of leafy, fragrant cilantro. Plus, there's a garnish-ready packet of chopped, dry-roasted peanuts for a finishing, nutty crunch. And no slaw-abiding denizen of TJ's salad-town would expect anything less than the spicy, sesame ginger dressing that comes in a separate packet, ready to add and toss with the veggies-whenever you're ready to eat. On that note, we're ready when you're ready; Trader Joe's Crunchy Jicama Slaw can be found every day in our refrigerators! Crunchy Jicama Slaw
079434.name: Salad Crunchy Jicama Slaw

083579.description: The traditional Greek salad is relatively new by ancient historical standards. It was apparently invented in the 1960s when Athenian restauranteurs skirted a tariff on essential salad items by adding non-taxable feta cheese to an already popular plate of cucumber, olives, onion, bell peppers, and tomato. Tourists ate it up. Literally. Now, tourists of the culinary seas (aka our customers) have been eating up Trader Joe's Classic Greek Salad since 2005-which may not be ancient, but certainly makes this Salad 'classic' by our historical standards! And to this day, it remains a tried & true mix of fresh, Greek-inspired ingredients that harken back to the Athenian original. The base of romaine, with green & red cabbages, is complemented by wedges of cucumber, diced red bell pepper, julienned red onion, pitted kalamata olives, and-of course-feta cheese. A red wine vinaigrette- including dehydrated garlic, and dried herbs (oregano, basil & parsley)-comes in a separate packet, ready to toss with this Salad whenever you're ready to eat it up; which could be today, or whenever you decide to swing by your neighborhood store to pick up a freshly packed, nine-ounce Trader Joe's Classic Greek Salad. Classic Greek Salad
083579.name: Classic Greek Salad

092694.description: Our Pacific Salad with Chicken is our version of a salad that has been a Pasadena favorite for more than 30 years. It is kind of like a Chinese Chicken Salad, but so much better. Grilled chicken breast, toasted almonds, crispy vermicelli rice noodles, and sesame seeds are served over a bed of crisp romaine lettuce. On the side is a container of a dressing that is both sweet and peppery which brings all of the components together. We are selling a 13.25oz container of Trader Joe's Pacific Salad with Chicken for $4.49
092694.name: Pacific Pasadena Salad
092694.title: Salad Crisp Pasadena/Pacific Chicken

094988.description: Trader Joe's Crunchy Slaw w/Chicken The combination of crunchy romaine lettuce, shredded cabbage and carrots, green onion and cilantro gives this slaw a great texture. The slaw contains chunks of all white meat chicken along with zesty peanut dressing. Our crunchy slaw is a tasty alternative to the traditional mayonnaise coleslaws usually found in the market or delis. We are selling a 12 oz. tray of Trader Joe's Crunchy Slaw w/chicken for $3.99 Trader Joe's Company Bulletin11/03/2010 page 49 of 59 Confidential
094988.name: Crunchy Slaw Salad

096155.description: Super Spinach Salad We packed so much into this salad; we are calling it a Super Spinach Salad. Fresh spinach is tossed with shredded carrots, dried cranberries, quinoa, shelled edamame, grape tomatoes, chick peas and pumpkin seeds. On the side is a cup of our fresh carrot miso ginger dressing, so you can add as much, or as little as you want. On the go? Grab one for lunch. Or, try it as a side salad for dinner. We're selling our Super Spinach Salad in a 10 ounce container for $3.99. Look for it in the fresh section.
096155.name: Super Spinach Salad

096285.description: Harvest Salad w/Grilled Chicken Our Harvest Salad starts with a fresh spring lettuce mix of baby green leaf, baby green romaine, arugula, green oak, green chard and frisée. We than add fresh green beans, corn, white cheddar and a hard boiled egg on top We have included a side creamy Dijon dressing, so you can add as much or as little as you want. Try it as a cold lunch on a hot summer day, or serve with an entrée for a complete meal. We're selling our Harvest Salad w/Grilled Chicken Breast in an 11 ounce container for $3.99. Look for it in the fresh section.
096285.name: Harvest Salad
096285.title: Field Fresh Chopped Salad With Grilled Chicken

097436.description: The name of this salad almost says it all..."almost" because Trader Joe's Lemon Chicken & Arugula Salad also includes Moroccan-inspired couscous, red quinoa, parsley, mint, sweet currants, & smoked paprika. The smoky- sweet flavors of the couscous and the currants are ideal partners for the lemon-y chicken and piquant arugula. We tie it all together by including a packet of spicy pimento dressing-add as much or as little as you like. In Morocco, you'd most likely eat a Trader Joe's Lemon Chicken & Arugula Salad with your fingers-it's polite to do so. We won't stop you from doing that here, but if you want to use a fork, by all means, go for(k) it! We're selling this satisfying salad-on-the-go in a 9.2-ounce container for $4.29,* every day. You'll find it in our fresh prepared foods case. *$3.99 in East Coast stores; $4.49 in Texas, Midwest, & Southeast stores *Exact product packaging & appearance will vary regionally
097436.name: Lemon Chicken & Arugula Salad

099050.description: ¿ e word salad is derived from the Latin sal, meaning "salt," which led to salata, meaning "salted things," and de¿ ned dishes of raw vegetables generally dressed with oil, vinegar, and salt-so the name of the dish was ulti- mately de¿ ned by the dressing. ¿ e dressing-and all other ingredients-in Trader Joe's Field Fresh Chopped Salad with Chicken honors this name well. Our Field Fresh Chopped Salad with Chicken is a masterful mélange of ingredients, artistically arranged to create a singular salad experience that satis¿ es for lunch or dinner. A bed of chopped Romaine provides the canvas for this colorful, ¿ avorful mix. Artfully adorned atop the greens you'll ¿ nd grilled chicken breast (chicken is poached in salad available in MW regions), chopped pecans, sweet currants, Israeli couscous, corn, and Asiago cheese (Parmesan cheese in salad available in MW regions). A sweet, creamy basil dressing (in a sealed package) ties all of the ¿ avors together. We think it's appropriate, given the history of the word "salad," that the dressing plays such a prominent part in the presentation of this dish. Enjoy Trader Joe's Chopped Salad with Chicken as lunch for one, or split it into two servings and enjoy it as a side at dinner with a friend. We're selling each 10.7-ounce container for $4.49, every day. You'll ¿ nd it in our refrigerated case.
099050.name: Field Fresh Chopped Salad With Grilled Chicken

021717.description: While we're always reluctant to elevate one species above any others, facts are facts: salmon seems to be our customers' favorite fish. And why shouldn't it be? It's rich, "meaty," and generally mild; even non-fish-eaters will sometimes make exceptions for salmon. Which we're, of course, thrilled about, because we love salmon, too. In fact, we love it so much, that we recently redesigned the packaging on several of our salmon SKUs so that the fish is that much fresher when it reaches your table. Now packaged in aseptic, vacuum-sealed packaging, Trader Joe's Fresh Atlantic Salmon Fillets are from salmon that have been carefully raised in some of the world's most pristine salmon farms, at the foot of the Atlantic Ocean in northern Norway. The salmon are raised with care by experienced fish farmers and never given antibiotics in their feed, which you'll find at some fish farms. Norway's frigid waters make for tender, buttery, and well-marbled salmon. With bones and skin removed, Fresh Atlantic Salmon Fillets are especially ideal for non-grilling preparations, like roasting, baking, or poaching. They're great to have on hand for protein-and-omega-rich dinners in a hurry. Simply brush the fish with a bit of olive oil or butter, sprinkle it with salt and pepper, and cook as desired. Depending on how fancy you want to get here, dinner can be ready in as little as 15 minutes. Fresh Atlantic Salmon
021717.name: Salmon Fillet Skin Off (8/Pk)
021717.title: Fresh Atlantic Salmon Boneless Skinless Fillet

037855.description: While we're always reluctant to elevate one species above any others, facts are facts: salmon seems to be our customers' favorite fish. And why shouldn't it be? It's rich, "meaty," and generally mild; even non-fish-eaters will sometimes make exceptions for salmon. Which we're, of course, thrilled about, because we love salmon, too. In fact, we love it so much, that we recently redesigned the packaging on several of our salmon SKUs so that the fish is that much fresher when it reaches your table. Now packaged in aseptic, vacuum-sealed packaging, Trader Joe's Fresh Atlantic Salmon Fillets are from salmon that have been carefully raised in some of the world's most pristine salmon farms, at the foot of the Atlantic Ocean in northern Norway. The salmon are raised with care by experienced fish farmers and never given antibiotics in their feed, which you'll find at some fish farms. Norway's frigid waters make for tender, buttery, and well-marbled salmon. With bones and skin removed, Fresh Atlantic Salmon Fillets are especially ideal for non-grilling preparations, like roasting, baking, or poaching. They're great to have on hand for protein-and-omega-rich dinners in a hurry. Simply brush the fish with a bit of olive oil or butter, sprinkle it with salt and pepper, and cook as desired. Depending on how fancy you want to get here, dinner can be ready in as little as 15 minutes. Fresh Atlantic Salmon
037855.name: Salmon Fillet Skin On
037855.title: Fresh Atlantic Salmon Boneless Fillet

067232.description: We came upon a great opportunity to offer Fresh Wild Caught Swordfish Steaks to our Trader Joe's Customers on the East Coast for the summer season. Swordfish is meaty and moist with a moderately high fat content (7g per 4 oz. serving), making it a fantastic candidate for grilling. The flavor is mild with a hint of sweetness. Can you imagine a freshly cooked Trader Joe's Swordfish Steak topped with a couple forkfuls of Mango Jicama Slaw [sku 57099]? Or perhaps a spoonful of TJ's Honey Aleppo Sauce [sku 68554]? No need to imagine! Stop by our refrigerated case and pick up a couple Wild Caught Swordfish Steaks to enhance your summer eating experience. Each one-pound package (weight varies a little) is available for $9.99* per pound. *Please check QIL to confirm current pricing. Wild Caught Fresh Swordfish Steaks
067232.name: Swordfish (8/Pk)
067232.title: Wild Caught Swordfish Steaks

068719.description: While we hate to elevate one species above any others, facts are facts: salmon seems to be our customers' favorite fish. And why shouldn't it be? It's rich, "meaty," and generally mild; even non-fish-eaters will sometimes make exceptions for salmon. Which we're, of course, thrilled about, because we love salmon, too. In fact, we love it so much, that we recently resigned the packaging on several of our salmon SKUs so that they're that the fish is that much fresher when it reaches your table. Now packaged in aseptic, vacuum-sealed packaging, Trader Joe's Sockeye Salmon Fillets are from strictly Wild-Caught, premium Alaskan Salmon. The pristine waters off the coast of Alaska are some of the coldest in the world, which means that Alaskan Sockeye Salmon (the state's largest export after oil and natural gas) tastes deliciously clean and pleasantly oily-after all, fish need fat to keep warm! Sockeye Salmon is also appears much deeper in color (quite red, actually) and has a slightly stronger flavor profile that other salmon varieties. Ideal for grilling, pan-searing, roasting, baking, or poaching, Trader Joe's Wild Alaskan Sockeye Salmon Fillets are perfect to have on hand for protein-and-omega-rich dinners in a hurry. Simply brush the fish with a bit of olive oil or butter, sprinkle it with salt and pepper, and cook as desired. Depending on how fancy you want to get here, dinner can be ready in as little as 15 minutes. We known that budgeting your hard-earned bucks can sometimes leave you feeling like you're swimmin' upstream, so we've priced our Wild Alaskan Sockeye Salmon at an incredibly reasonable $11.99 per pound. You'll find these Fillets in our fresh fish section.
068719.name: Salmon Wild
068719.title: Wild Sockeye Salmon

074137.description: Cod is one veritably versatile fish. Firm, yet remarkably flaky in texture, with a mild, delicately sweet flavor profile, it's equally delicious whether its baked, blackened, steamed, or sautéed. In other words, it's precisely the kind of fish you want to have on hand during the spring, when fish fries and seafood boils are just beginning to warm up. That's why, for the season, we're carrying Trader Joe's Cod Fillets, a delicious, all-purpose, wild- caught whitefish option for everything from tangy fish tacos, to creamy seafood chowders, and classic fish and chips. Our Cod Fillets are caught in the wild using longline fishing to help minimize bycatch, and arrive in the package boneless and skinless for ease of cooking. They can be prepared in all kinds of dishes with all levels of complexity, from the sublimely simple (baked with a bit of butter, lemon juice, and crushed Golden Rounds [sku 94889]) to the delightfully complex (glazed in miso paste and broiled until crisp). We particularly like them breaded or beer battered, then fried to a golden brown for an unbeatable fried fish sandwich. Cod Fillets
074137.name: Cod Fillets (8/Pk)
074137.title: Wild Caught Cod Fillets

078215.description: Salmon is far and away the most popular fresh seafood that we carry at Trader Joe's, and it's easy to see why. Nutritious, versatile, and remarkably easy to work with, salmon typically only needs a bit of seasoning before it's ready to be cooked. Over the years, we've received many requests from our customers for pre-seasoned salmon, to make it even easier to go from the fridge to the dinner table. That's precisely why we're introducing Trader Joe's Blackened Salmon to our fresh meat and seafood section. These boneless, skin-on fillets come prepped and ready with a mélange of savory (and slightly spicy) seasonings, including garlic, onion, smoked paprika, chipotle peppers, and demerara sugar on its surface. As it cooks in the pan, oven, broiler, or especially the air fryer, this layer of seasonings creates a flavorful and texturally satifying Blackened outer crust. A sublimely simple entrée option for everything from busy weeknight dinners to meal- prepped work lunches, and beyond, we recommend pairing Trader Joe's Blackened Salmon with a bed of fluffy white rice, a few spears of steamed asparagus, and an oaky, buttery Chardonnay, like our very own Big Churn [sku 56083]. Blackened Salmon
078215.name: Salmon Blackened (8/Pk)
078215.title: Blackened Salmon Seasoned Boneless Fillet

007904.description: Trader Joe's Bruschetta Sauce was first introduced way back in 1993, when bruschetta was still pretty much a novelty in culinary culture. Nearly a quarter of the way through the 21st century, bruschetta (broo-SKEH-tah) is as ubiquitous as white bread, and often just that flavorful. Our Bruschetta Sauce stood above the crowd then, and, now, in a much more crowded room it still stands high above the rest. It has that fresh-from-the-garden taste because its combination of chopped fresh tomatoes, oil, chopped basil, garlic and spices is never cooked. Their flavors do have the opportunity to marinate together, and the result is vibrant and versatile. Serve it on toasted baguette slices, toss it with hot or cold pasta, or spoon it on grilled or roasted chicken or fish. However you choose to enjoy it, we guarantee enjoyment. Every time. Bruschetta Sauce
007904.name: Fresh Bruschetta
007904.title: Bruschetta Sauce

051476.description: Our Trader Joe's Homestyle Salsa Especial Mild has less heat than our Medium version, but retains the same great flavor profile. This salsa has a smooth texture and a unique herb flavor. Serve it with eggs, grilled fish, or Mexican cuisine or just eat it by itself with chips. We are selling our Trader Joe's Homestyle Salsa Especial Mild in a 12 ounce container for $2.99.
051476.name: Homestyle Salsa Especial Mild

054434.description: Many cultures have their "green" sauce. Argentinians have chimichurri. Germans have grüne sosse. Northern Italians have pesto. Indians have pudina chutney. Each of these has its merits, but we think there's something exceptional about Mexican salsa verde that warrants extra-special attention.
